Vidal Books

by Pinksugarsky

Summary

Agatha was looking through instagram, randomly scrolling on a Saturday afternoon when she seen a new bookstore that had recently opened near by. Vidal Books.

“That looks interesting. I wonder if Wanda would go with me.” Agatha said to herself and she sent it to her best-friend with a couple question marks.

Notes

See the end of the work for notes

Chapter 1

Agatha was looking through instagram, randomly scrolling on a Saturday afternoon when she seen a new bookstore that had recently opened near by. Vidal Books.

“That looks interesting. I wonder if Wanda would go with me.” Agatha said to herself and she sent it to her best-friend with a couple question marks.

~across town~

Wanda was on her third date this week with just as many men. This was a coffee date at a small shop he picked. The man across from her was quite attractive but terribly dull. All he could talk about was his job, which was mundane and irritating. He was an accountant.

Her phone buzzed on the table and she glanced at it quickly realizing it was Agatha.

“Another guy?” The man asked in an arrogant tone.

“Wow. If you must know it’s my best-friend.” Wanda said as she shot the man a glare and she picked up the phone.

“Really Wanda, if you can’t focus on a conversation I don’t see this going anywhere.” The man said in a snarky tone.

“I don’t see this going anywhere either. Thanks for the coffee Chad. Don’t call me.” Wanda said as she got up and walked away after collecting her things. She made her way to her car and got in before calling Agatha. The phone rang twice before Agatha picked up.

“Hey, I thought you were on a date.” Agatha said as she leaned back against the couch.

“Dude was a dud. What did you send me? I didn’t get a chance to look at it.”

“A new book store 20 minutes away.” Agatha said hopefully.

Wanda sighed. “You wanna check it out don’t you, you fucking nerd.”

“Of course I do! It’s stunning! Plus books…” Agatha trailed off.

“Fine, I’ll be there in 10. You better look fantastic because I’m not going out with a frump when I got dressed up for a shit ass date.” Wanda said before hanging up the phone.

“Alright see you soon then.” Agatha said sassily to the disconnected phone as she got up and headed to her bedroom. She put on a nice pair of charcoal gray slacks, a deep purple button up, and the matching vest to her pants. She left the top two buttons unbuttoned on her shirt and rolled her sleeves up so her forearms were showing. She grabbed a wide brimmed black hat and set it aside while she did her hair in two braids. She did light make up and grabbed her hat before walking out of her bedroom.

Wanda was sitting on the couch waiting for Agatha. “Well at least you listened and look nice.”

“So do you! Wow, how bad did he fuck up.” Agatha asked as she checked her friend out. Wanda was wearing a nice red dress with a cute small white jacket.

“You actually saved me unintentionally. When you messaged me he asked ‘another guy?’ In an arrogant tone. The whole date left a bad taste in my mouth.” Wanda said as she got up from the couch.

“Let me grab my purse and we can head out.” Agatha said as she walked over to the table next to the door and grabbed her purse.

“You forgot all your rings.” Wanda said as she pointed at her best friend’s hands.

“Leave it to you to hold up a trip to the bookstore.”

“Agatha Harkness, you’d really leave with out all your jewelry?” Wanda teased as she snapped her fingers and Agatha’s jewelry appeared on her hands.

“I could’ve done that.” Agatha said with a grumble.

“How dare someone else use their magical energy on you. Common let’s go.” Wanda said as she opened the door and shooed her best friend out. Wanda shut the door and Agatha pushed her out of the way and locked it.

“I’ll drive.” Agatha said as she pulled her phone out and found the address before they walked over to her car. They got in and Agatha started the car before pulling out of the driveway and heading to the book store. Wanda got on her phone and actually looked at the post Agatha sent her.

“Ooo this place does look stunning.” Wanda said excitedly.

“Right? That’s why I wanted to go.”

“Ohhh the owner is hot too! Just your type.”

“Could be straight.” Agatha dismissed her bestfriend.

“Nope right here, lgbtq+ safe space owned by a lesbian.” Wanda said as she looked at the profile online.

“Don’t… I just want to look. Plus I didn’t see her in the post I sent you so I have no idea what she looks like.” Agatha answered as she continued to drive.

“I’d show you but you always yell at me when I distract you while driving.”

“I don’t need to know what she looks like. We are going for books.” Agatha said in a serious tone.

“You are no fun.” Wanda griped as she looked out the window.

“I know.” Agatha answered with a smirk.

The rest of the drive was in comfortable silence. Agatha smiled brightly as she pulled up in front of the deep forest green book store with the words “Vidal Book’s” in gold leaf painted on the front window and across the top.

“Let’s go.” Wanda said as she climbed out of the car and headed toward the door. Agatha put the car in park and shut it off before grabbing her purse and getting out of the car. Before heading into the store.

“Really you couldn’t wait for me?” Agatha said quietly to herself as she opened the door.

“Welcome to Vidal books, your girlfriend went that way.” A stunning woman with rich brown eyes, sun kissed skin, and long brown hair said from behind the counter.

“Not my girlfriend. Just my annoying best friend. Who has zero patience.” Agatha said as she walked into the store and took all of the books in. “This is stunning.”

“Thank you for the compliment. I put a lot of energy into this store.” The woman said as she surveyed Agatha. “Go ahead and take a look around. There’s a spell book section in the back.” Rio said pointing to where Wanda disappeared to.

“How did.. never mind. Doesn’t matter. Thank you.” Agatha said as she headed toward the back, she could feel the woman’s eyes on her, following her as she made her way to the back of the store.

“Did you see the owner?” Wanda whispered to Agatha who just rolled her eyes.

“Yes, now leave it alone. I want to look at books.” Agatha said as she walked away from her best friend. Agatha looked over the spell books and found one she had never seen before. She plucked it from the shelf and skimmed through it. It had a few rituals and spells she hadn’t heard of and decided to tuck it into her arm before she walked over to the romance section.

She found a few sapphic books that she didn’t own and then walked around the store and checked out the other sections. “Anything I can help you find?” The woman asked Agatha pulling her from her focus.

“Not at this moment in time, I’m just soaking in your beautiful store.” Agatha said as she crouched down and continued reading the titles.

“Alright, I’ll be around if you need me.” The owner said as she walked away. Wanda walked over to Agatha again and looked down at her best friend with a glare.

“What are you doing?” Wanda hissed.

“Looking for books, what are you doing?” Agatha asked as she looked at Wanda pointedly, who glared back at her.

“Are you done or do I need to go occupy myself?” Wanda asked.

“I’m sure there’s a cafe around the corner you can go get a drink at if you are bored?” Agatha asked.

“Fine, I can take a hint. Here buy these for me.” Wanda said handing two books to Agatha.

“Fine, only because I dragged you along. Now shoo ya bother me.” Agatha said as she took the books and waved a hand as if brushing her best friend off. Wanda left the store quickly leaving Agatha alone with the owner.

Agatha found a couple more books and walked over to the counter to set them down. “Find everything you were looking for?” The gorgeous brunette asked as she started ringing the books up.

“Yes, thank you.” Agatha said appreciatively as she watched the woman press a couple buttons on the screen.

“Your total is $85.60.” The owner said with a smile. Agatha’s brow furrowed.

“Surely that isn’t right. I have 6 books here. Each of these are easily $20.”

“Cute customer discount.” The owner flirted.

“How about this, charge me the full amount and the next time I come to visit I won’t bring my best friend.” Agatha offered.

“Only if I get to find out what your name is as well.”

“Agatha Harkness, and yours?”

“Rio Vidal, The Green Witch.” Rio said as she offered her hand to Agatha. Agatha took it, a rush of magical energy surged between them.

“Well that was different.” Agatha said as she took her hand from the woman.

“Interesting.” Rio said as she looked into Agatha’s eyes.

“Now, what’s my actual total.” Agatha said honing her eyes on the woman, challenging her.

“$120 even.” Rio said as she packed the books into a bag

“If I get home and the total is inaccurate I will be coming back and correcting your mistake.” Agatha said as she handed over the cash and took her bag from Rio.

“What if I want you to come back?” Rio flirted.

“Don’t you worry about that. I’ll be back.” Agatha said as she took her receipt from the woman and smiled brightly at her.

“Te Veo Agatha.”

“Have a wonderful day Rio.” Agatha said as she pushed the door open and headed down the street toward the coffee shop. Wanda was walking out carrying two drinks right as Agatha arrived.

“Got you the sweetest, girliest drink they had on the menu Agatha, here ya go.” Wanda said as she handed Agatha the drink.

“Thank you.” Agatha said appreciatively as she took a drink.

“Soo…” Wanda trailed off.

“Soo..” Agatha mocked back.

“Oh come on! She was flirting with you!” Wanda griped.

“Oh I know, next time I come I have to come solo.” Agatha said as she guided Wanda back to the car.

“Oh? And why is that Harkness?” Wanda asked as she opened the passenger side door and got in. Agatha got in and started the car.

“She tried to give me a discount for being cute.” Agatha said as she pulled out of the parking spot.

“How much of a discount?” Wanda pried.

“$35 give or take.” Agatha said honestly.

“Girl what are we doing here? Why are we leaving? Turn the car around right now. You didn’t get her number did you? What’s wrong with you?” Wanda asked as she turned around and looked out the back window.

“I know where she works Wanda, chill.” Agatha said as she turned the corner and headed home.

“But you two would look so good together!” Wanda whined getting ahead of herself.

“Chill Witch Chill.” Agatha said with an irritated tone as she drove home.

Once Agatha was parked she turned and looked at Wanda with a serious face. “Do not ruin this for me.”

“How…”

“I have been your best friend since we were six. If you ruin this for me I will make sure you never get laid again.” Agatha threatened as she turned the car off and took the keys out of the ignition grasping them in her hand firmly.

“I’ll stay away from the bookstore.” Wanda relented, knowing Agatha wasn’t joking. Agatha pulled Wanda’s books out of the bag.

“Thank you. Here’s your two books.” Agatha said as she handed the books over to her bestfriend.

“Let me check to see if she stuck her number in either of these.” Wanda said as she opened the books and shook them out.

“I doubt it.” Agatha said as she watched as nothing fell out of the books.

“Hey, I just wanted to be sure.” Wanda said with a shrug.

“Go home. I’ll see you tomorrow maybe?” Agatha asked.

“I have another date. I’ll text you details in the morning.”

“What’s this one’s name?” Agatha asked.

“I don’t remember right now. I’d have to open bumble.” Wanda said with a shrug.

“I don’t understand how you have the energy for this many dates in one week.”

“Well, Harkness. Some of us don’t want to die alone.” Wanda jabbed.

“Are any of these men witches? Because you will out live them if they aren’t.” Agatha jabbed back.

“Oh that was low.”

“So was yours. Now get outta my car. I wanna go read this new spell book.” Agatha said as she grabbed her drink, purse and her bag of books and got out. Wanda rolled her eyes and got out of the car and followed Agatha to the door.

“What no offer to cook me dinner?” Wanda joked.

“I will literally stab you.” Agatha said as she unlocked her front door and headed inside. Wanda followed suit, intending to annoy. Agatha set her purse down in its designated spot then removed her hat and hung it on a hook by the door. “You know, I clearly remember telling you to go home.”

“What’s the fun in that when I’m already here.” Wanda said as she collapsed on the living room couch.

“You act like we don’t live 2 minutes away from each other.” Agatha said with a sigh as she unbuttoned her vest and shrugged it off. “Spill Maximoff, what’s really bugging you.”

“I’m lonely.” Wanda said honestly.

“Read a book, go for a hike, call me, learn how to be alone, all great options.” Agatha offered.

“Is that why you read so much?” Wanda pried.

“You’ve met my mother.” Agatha answered pointedly, reminding Wanda of the years of abuse and neglect.

“Got it. Alright, I think I will head home now. Enjoy your books.” Wanda said as she walked toward the front door.

“Wanda, I love you.” Agatha said in a moment of vulnerability and honesty.

“Love you too Aggie.” Wanda said with a smile before she ducked out the door. A blast of purple magic flying at her head and hitting the door frame making it splinter. A wicked cackle emanated from outside the door and down the driveway.

“Pain in my ass.” Agatha grumbled under her breath. With a wave of her hand the door frame was fixed and her outfit changed into something comfortable. Agatha grabbed her phone, the drink, all the books and settled down comfortably in the couch. She pulled the four books she got out of the bag.

The one that had captured her interest the most was the dark green spell book with gold filigree on the corners and gold leaf embellishments. The pages were also edged in gold. The longer she looked at the outside of this book the more she realized she didn’t pay enough for it. She dug the receipt out and it was only for 5 books.

“That woman.” Agatha said in a soft but frustrated tone. She sighed and looked at the time on her phone; it was 6:30 p.m. then checked the receipt to see what time the store closed. 6 p.m. and closed on Sunday- Monday. That was frustrating to say the least.

With a sigh Agatha opened the book that she had accidentally borrowed for the next two days to the front page. To find written on the page dead center in neat pretty handwriting that had amassed the whole book Property of Rio Vidal, if found return immediately to 824 Green St. Southview MA. Text or call (666)-333-7777. Agatha’s stomach dropped. She was holding the woman’s personal spell book.

“Who in their right mind would leave this on a shelf for anyone to see and pick up?” Agatha asked as she grabbed her phone and placed her hand over the page so that Wanda couldn’t read the number and took a photo before sending it off. Her phone pinged not even a second later.

Wanda 6:45 p.m : I’ve seen your rings, why are you sending me a photo of your hand?Agatha looked back at the photo and noticed it was just a photo of her hand.

“Now that, is a good protection spell. But why am I able to see through it.” Agatha mused to herself.

Agatha 6:46 p.m : are you settled in for the night?

A minute later Wanda was walking through her front door. “What is going on?” Wanda asked. Agatha held the book up for Wanda to see.

“Can you see this book?” Agatha asked.

“What book….Oh. Oh. No, I can’t. What is it?”

“Her spell personal book.” Agatha answered. Wanda tried to use her magic to undo the spell but all she ended up with was a nose bleed.

“I don’t know why you can see it but I can’t.”

“Come sit. I want to test something.” Agatha said as she patted the couch next to her.

“What are you going to do? Read it to me?” Wanda joked.

“Actually yes. I want to know if you can even hear the words I speak.” Agatha said honestly.

“Okay, I’m game.” Wanda said as she sat down. Agatha opened to the first page and started reading aloud. Two seconds later Wanda was zoned out looking at the wall not even paying attention to Agatha at all. She closed the book quickly and set it aside so she could snap her fingers at Wanda.

“Lost you.” Agatha said pulling her best friend back to reality.

“Dude, that was so peaceful though. Put me back.” Wanda said honestly.

“What?” Agatha asked in a confused tone. As Wanda shook her head trying to clear the fog.

“That is a deep and powerful spell. I felt like I was enveloped in nature. Like I was where I’ve always meant to be.” Wanda said, calmer than Agatha has ever seen her.

“This woman has peaked my interest.” Agatha said as she looked over her best friend.

“I want that spell so I can sleep, fuck I feel so rested. How long were you reading for?” Wanda asked.

“I read two sentences…”

“Okay now I’m actually terrified of this witch.” Wanda said with a wide eyes as she looked at Agatha.

“I’m not, I’m impressed. She had my interest, now she’s got my curiosity.” Agatha said as she used her magic to clear Wanda’s brain fog.

“Thank you. That’s better than any hang over cure I’ve ever had. I was gunna head to the club tonight with Jen and Alice if you wanted to come?”

“I’ve got far more interesting things to do, don’t you think?” Agatha asked while pointing to the invisible book next to her.

“For once… I actually agree. Alright. You have fun with your book.”

“Rio’s book. I’m just borrowing it.” Agatha corrected.

“Have fun with Rio’s book. I’ll text you when I get home from the club.” Wanda said honestly as she got up and headed for the door pausing once her hand was on the knob. “Hey, get some rest tonight. I know how you get when you want to unravel something.”

“I’ll try my best.” Agatha said softly.

“That’s all I can ask.” Wanda said as she walked out the door and shut it softly. Agatha picked up her phone and typed the number in to her contacts on the front page along with the woman’s name. She contemplated what to do next.

Agatha set her phone down and took a moment to read the book some more. She skimped the pages and made mental notes on what she wanted to come back to before she stumbled upon a page with the theme of magical compatibility. Something struck her, the memory of her magic reacting to Rio’s earlier in the day giving her a wicked idea.

She decided she was going to take the reigns for once and flirt back with the stunning brunette. Agatha decided taking a photo with her two middle fingers caressing the crease while her pointer finger and index finger held the book open would be a good start.

Unknown number 7:02 p.m: Missing something?- A Attachment image

Rio’s phone buzzed in her hand as she was looking through new books and future releases to order. Her brow furrowed as she didn’t recognize the number. She clicked on it and realized quickly that it was the attractive ebony haired woman who came into the store with the redhead earlier today. She viewed the image and felt her heart jump into her throat.

“Oh so you’re a tease” Rio mused to herself.

Rio 7:03 p.m: I was wondering when you’d notice. I guess my book wanted to get to know you better.

Agatha chuckled and looked down at the book as she went back to the first page. She stroked along the gold leaf edges and mused to herself. “What’s so special about me.”

Agatha 7:05 p.m: Seems quite enchanted, so when was the last time something like this happened?

Rio sighed as she read the text message. She had a choice to make, be honest with this woman who had caught her attention or lie.

Rio 7:06 p.m: Never. Honestly I was shocked when you put it down in front of me but I figured it would be a great way to see you again.

Agatha read the text and felt herself flush. “Oh so I’m special. Tell me little thing, what did you want to show me?” Agatha asked as she set the book in her lap and willed it into opening, the pages flipped and landed on magical compatibility once again.

“Alright I’ll get back to you in a moment. Let me see what your owner has to say first.” Agatha said as she grabbed her phone and willed a book mark into her hand. She placed the bookmark in the book and then looked at her phone once more.

Agatha 7:08 p.m: I’m sure you’ll want it back sooner rather than later but you are closed for the next two days. Any suggestions on how to remedy this?

A soft chuckle left Rio as she looked at her phone. She read the message a few times before she composed herself.

Rio 7:10 p.m: Are you free tomorrow?

Agatha 7:11 p.m: I might be, but I wanted a little more time to unravel all the secrets this little tomb holds. I mean I could stay up all night reading, but then I’d be too tired to do much tomorrow.

Rio read the text and had to suppress the urge to flirt.

Rio 7:12 p.m: do you want the flirty text or do you want to borrow it for longer?

Agatha 7:12 p.m: I mean if you wanted to keep me up all night you should’ve just offered.

Agatha 7:12 p.m: But now I’m going to spend the night focusing on learning as much as I can from this book. Where would you like to meet up tomorrow so I can return it?

Rio sat shocked in her living room as she stared at her phone. This woman was bold. She felt a magical tug a moment later before her phone went off again.

Agatha 7:15 p.m: did you feel that?

Rio felt so out of her own depth in this moment, most of the time women were falling over their own feet to get her attention. Agatha was something new and refreshing, almost like she was there to challenge her. Another tug pulled on her, this time dragging a feeling of desire out of her.

Rio 7:17 p.m: what are you doing over there?

Rio asked as she felt herself being toyed with. She could feel their magic intertwining in a unique way.

Agatha 7:20 p.m: Learning. Now are you going to answer my question?

Rio 7:20 p.m: I felt something.

Agatha sat in her living room and read the page several times. It seemed that Rio had been learning about magical compatibility but hadn’t learned much about it. To Agatha it seemed like she never found someone her magic was compatible with.

Agatha 7:30 p.m: care to elaborate?

Rio 7:31 p.m: I can feel you tugging on my magic. Like you’re pulling me to you.

Agatha decided she wanted to try something, she tugged harder on the connection they made earlier. Rio felt her whole body flush and her belly fill with desire. She could feel their magical connection strengthening.

Rio 7:32 p.m: pull any harder and I’ll be in your lap.

Agatha 7:32 p.m: is that what you want? If not I can stop.

~
Rio sat in her living room contemplating what to say next. Truthfully she wanted to be in Agatha’s lap, she wanted to know how the woman tasted when she kissed her. Rio decided instead of answering she would try and grasp the thread of magic that connected them and tug back.
~
Agatha felt herself flush, the warmth of Rio’s magic flooding her body. A lesser witch would’ve been overwhelmed almost instantly. Agatha sighed as she felt the magic surge in her body, she closed her eyes and imagined the green witch straddling her lap and weaving her fingers into long brown hair.
~
Rio was sitting on her couch when she felt warmth between her legs and soft touches curling at the nape of her neck. Then she felt goosebumps spread up her leg. Almost like someone slid their hand up her leg, before she felt warmth settle on her hip.
~
Agatha kept her eyes closed as she kept the vision of Rio in her mind. Her hand settled on Rio’s hip and the other woven in her hair. A gentle tug pulled Rio’s face closer so that their noses were touching. Agatha’s lips a breath away from Rio’s.
~
Rio felt a shiver run up her spine as she felt warmth, a soft delicate kiss grazed her lips. As if asking for permission. Rio surged forward to kiss Agatha but she wasn’t there. The connection faltered slightly. Rio calmed herself and waited.
~
Agatha felt Rio surge forward, and the connection wavered. Agatha kept her death grip on the thread of magic not letting Rio break it. She moved forward softly and pressed a kiss to Rio’s lips. Then Agatha faltered, relaxing into the soft kiss causing the thread to snap.

“Fuck!” Agatha said in a frustrated tone as she opened her eyes. She could feel the coil in her stomach, and the warmth from a woman who wasn’t there.

Rio 8:05 p.m: Noon. The book store. Tomorrow.

The text came through a moment later jostling Agatha slightly. She looked at her phone and felt another jolt of arousal corse through her. She was beyond ready for this woman. With all the magical energy coursing through her, she felt bold.

Agatha 8:05 p.m. It’s a date.

Chapter 2: Date part 1

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

~Meanwhile at Rio’s~

Agatha 8:05 p.m. It’s a date.

Rio felt excitement well up in her chest. She needed a plan, and a damn good one at that if she was going to seduce this woman.

“If that kiss was just a figment of our imaginations… Would it be too bold to start with a kiss? No, I’d end up doing something much worse in the store. Can’t have that.” Rio said musing to herself. She wanted nothing more than to teleport to her book. She could feel exactly where it was. But she didn’t want to intrude on Agatha.

“Patience Vidal. Patience.” Rio said trying to stop herself from getting too far ahead. Rio sat on the couch replaying the sensations in her mind. She tried to clear her head but it failed. Agatha Harkness has wormed her way in, and nothing was going to change that.

~

Agatha took a deep breath and exhaled loudly as she got up and grabbed her own spell book and an ink pen. She paced the living room for a few moments before she slumped down on the couch. Opening to a blank page she started writing her findings furiously. She was frustrated physically and mentally.

“I’ve never experienced anything like that in my fucking life.” Agatha grumbled to herself as she wrote every detail she could remember about magical compatibility. Her phone pinged loudly from next to her as she wrote. She ignored it until she had finished writing what she had learned.

Wanda 8:30 p.m: learning anything fun?

Agatha 9:05 p.m: So much. Also I have a date tomorrow at noon at the bookshop with Rio.

Wanda 9:06 p.m: Whaaaaaat!?!?

Wanda 9:06 p.m: details now!

Wanda 9:06 p.m: whyyy did I have to come out with Jen and Alice tonight! I always miss the good shit!

Wanda 9:07 p.m: Agatha answer me!

Agatha 9:08 p.m: Chill. I texted her and we started flirting. I’m returning the book. Simple as that. Enjoy your night.

Agatha was really not in the mood to describe to Wanda what she just experienced. Based off the woman’s texts she had already started drinking.

Wanda 9:09 p.m: okay. Details. Tomorrow.

Agatha put her phone down for a moment and tried to relax. She picked Rio’s book back up and started reading from the very beginning. She absorbed as much knowledge as she could about the woman’s incantations, spells, and rituals. Near the back of Rio’s book she found the spell that masked her book from other witches and humans alike.

“Looks like I found how Wanda couldn’t see you. Let’s see if we can impress your owner tomorrow.” Agatha said as she read the spell.

“De facie evanescant, solum mereantur videre. De facie evanescant, solum mereantur videre. De facie evanescant, solem mereantur videre.” Agatha spoke out in Latin over her book setting her intention. Her book didn’t seem to change for her. Unfortunately for her, the only way to find out was to send a photo to Wanda.

Agatha 11:15 p.m: Testing Attachment Image

Agatha set her phone aside and started reading again while she waited for Wanda to text her back. Agatha got comfortable and continued reading. The book seemed to span forever even if Agatha knew it was impossible.

Wanda 11:25 p.m: Still can’t see it Aggs. In the cab on the wayyy hoome.

“Perfect, the spell worked.”Agatha said as she tucked her phone away. Agatha got up and took the book with her to bed as she shut the lights off and locked her front door. She headed into her bedroom and got undressed and comfortable. Agatha took a moment to plug her phone in and set an alarm before turning on her reading light and climbing into bed.

Agatha sat there and read the spell book until she couldn’t keep her eyes open any longer. Softly closing the book she placed it next to her on her night stand and shut off the light. Her dreams were filled with visions of a woman with long brown hair, sun kissed skin and brown eyes so enrapturing and intense she felt like she was stripped bare.

Agatha’s alarm jostled her awake. She sat up groggily and stretched before shutting her alarms off. A yawn left her as she stood up and made her way to the bathroom. She quickly got into the shower and washed the sleep away, Agatha took her time and pampered herself on this particular morning. After her shower wrapped herself in a fuzzy robe and applied moisturizer and a delecate sweet perfume.

Agatha had to decide what she wanted to wear today as she stood in her bedroom staring at her closet her phone rang. She walked over and grabbed her phone to see it was Wanda.

“What’s up?” Agatha said as she answered the phone.

“Getting ready for my date with Jacob. I’ll text you the address.” Wanda said, sounding far away. Obviously she had Agatha on speaker.

Chapter End Notes

vanish from sight, only let the deserving see is the translation for De facie evanescant, solum mereantur videre.

Thank you for reading! I’m hoping to get chapter 3 posted today as well. Not sure how long this fic is going to be. But I already have 4 chapters planned and more after that.

Chapter 3

“Can I get details about this second location before I decide?” Rio asked as she let Agatha go. The woman sliding off her lap before standing up and stretching.

“Yes. But I’m only going to give yes or no answers.” Agatha said as she held a hand out for Rio to take.

“Okay, is this second location close?”

“No.” Agatha answered as she walked over to the couch in the corner and sat down, making herself comfortable.

“Will other people be there?”

“Yes, most likely.”

“Do we need to change our outfits?”

“No, and even if we did. I could easily handle that.” Agatha said with a flourish of her hand, purple magic sparking at her fingertips.

“I think I seen something in your spell book about clothing.” Rio mentioned as she walked over to the couch and settled next to Agatha so that she was facing her. Knee bent with her shin against Agatha’s thigh with her elbow propped on the back of the couch so she could lean on her hand.

“Illusion magic is one of my many specialties.” Agatha said confidently.

“What are your others?”

“I can bend a feeble mind to my will, or just to tell the truth. I am exemplary at casting most spells and incantations, and I’m a damn good cook when I want to be.”

“Oh really?” Rio said as she waved a hand and cleaned the room of the charcuterie board and wine leaving the tea lights, blanket and cushions.

“Which part interested you the most.” Agatha asked as she placed her hand on Rio’s thigh.

“Mostly the cooking but we can touch back on that at another point in time. Do you think I’ll enjoy this secondary location?”

“Yes.”

“Yep! Those are your choices” Agatha said with a glint of something mischievous in her eyes.

“Good choice darling. Come with me.” Agatha said as she snapped her fingers. Purple magic collected the cushions off the floor and placed them in the chairs they came from. The blanket was folded and the tea lights were grouped together in a pile and shut off. The flowers seemed to vanish completely.

“Where did the flowers go?” Rio asked as she watched everything move around the room of its own accord.

“Those are at home in a vase.” Agatha said as she stood up.

“Okay. You going to tell me where we are going?” Rio asked.

“Nope, that’s a surprise. You’ll probably know when we are close though. Let’s go.” Agatha said as she crouched down grabbed her purse and spell book. “Let me lock up and I’ll be right with you.” Rio said as she let Agatha out the door first. She armed the security system and then shut the door and locked it with her key. Agatha walked over to her car and held the passenger door open for Rio who walked over and got in with a smile.

“Beautiful place.” Rio mumbled as she kicked her shoes off by the door.

“Smells amazing so far.” Rio said as she settled on the barstool.

“Thanks.” Agatha said as she turned back to her cooking. She sliced the baguette in half. She set half aside and cut the other half down the middle then pulled garlic puree and Parmesan cheese from the fridge and butter from the dish on the counter and mixed them together. She spread the mixture on the cut baguette and placed it on a baking sheet before tossing it in the oven.

Rio watched as Agatha pulled spaghetti noodles from the pantry and then dumped them into the boiling water. She reached up and set a timer on the microwave and started stirring things. With a flick of her wrist a cabinet opened and a colander floated into the sink. Rio was in awe of how fluid everything looked. Agatha was so at ease in her own home and kitchen it impressed Rio.

Soon the timer went off and the pasta was drained. Sauce and meat were added to the noodles and mixed together. The garlic bread was pulled from the oven and cut and the salad was removed from the fridge and placed on the counter.

“Italian is fine, please and thank you.”

“Merlot sounds nice.” Rio answered. Agatha pulled the bottle and magicked it open before pouring them each a glass. Agatha handed Rio her glass of wine and then a fork. She made her way around the island and sat down.

“Enjoy.” Agatha said with a smile. They ate in relative silence, not saying much to each other until Rio made it to the main course. Salads were always the same to her. But the spaghetti was phenomenal.

“Why is it so good?” Rio asked after her first bite which cause Agatha to chuckle.

“I made the sauce last summer and preserved. So it’s made from scratch.” Agatha answered.

“Impressive.” Rio said appreciatively as she took a sip of wine.

“I know, but I try to not brag about it much.”

“Why? You’re a very talented woman.” Rio said as she looked at Agatha.

“Set expectations low so you can breeze past them with ease.” Agatha half joked.

“There might be some truth to that.” Rio said before she took another bite of food. They both settled back into eating again, just enjoying the comfortable silence they had.

Once they were finished eating Agatha started taking care of the left overs and cleaning. Rio gladly stepped in and started to help by washing dishes for Agatha.

“Thank you.” Agatha said once the kitchen was cleaned and they were headed toward the living room. Agatha plucked her spell book out of her purse on the way.

“No, thank you. Dinner was amazing.” Rio said as she followed Agatha.

“Do you mind if I go change?” Agatha asked as she looked over Rio, still dressed in her button up and slacks.

“Not at all. Go ahead.” Rio answered as she sat down on the couch.

“No, thank you Agatha. Today has been amazing. Even with all the interruptions.” Rio said as she opened Agatha’s book and they both settled into a comfortable silence reading each other’s books.

Chapter 4

Chapter Notes

Hopefully y’all love this and it was worth the wait!
