You blossomed into one of the most amazing witches I’ve ever had the privilege of meeting.” Rio reassured as she brought a hand up to tuck a strand of hair behind Agatha’s ear.

“Stop being romantic, I’m gunna cry.” Agatha said as tears welled up in her eyes.

“Okay, okay. I’ll take a chill pill on the sappy shit. But seriously. You are amazing.” Rio said before kissing Agatha softly.

“Don’t tell me you bring all your dates here.” Agatha joked trying to dissolve the tension.

“Only hot raven haired goddesses with stunning blue eyes, that fuck like their life depends on it.”

“Hard to believe you’ve met multiple women like that.” Agatha jabbed.

“No, just one.” Rio said softly.

“What did I say about being sappy!” Agatha scolded as she turned her head.

“Sorry. I can’t help but compliment you.” Rio whispered as she kissed Agatha on the cheek.

“I don’t even know what to say to that so I’m just gunna change the subject.” Agatha said before she turned to kiss Rio passionately. Rio gladly accepted the kiss and returned it with as much care and passion as she could muster. They broke apart a moment later with their foreheads pressed together.

“Why did you bring me here Rio?” Agatha asked softly.

“You shared a part of you with me, I figured I could return the favor.” Rio said honestly.

“This is much nicer than my trauma dump earlier.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“Yes, that is true. But I want to know every part of your life, the good and bad. No one is perfect…. And I’m being sappy again. Sorry. I just want to get to know you.” Rio said as she trailed off.

“I want to know the good and bad about you too. Now tell me something bad.” Agatha said as she steeled her gaze at the woman.

“Like my deepest darkest secret? Or like something no one ever wants to hear?” Rio asked.

“Either one.” Agatha said. Rio sighed loudly and turned away from Agatha, as she looked at the fireplace. The wood crackling loudly as Rio debated with herself.

“I’m next in line to take my family’s mantel. Which means, when the current standing entity of death is ready to retire I will take their place. It could be tomorrow, or it could be a thousand years from now.” Rio said honestly, she couldn’t look at Agatha for this even if she wanted to. She took a deep breath and sighed loudly before continuing “If that’s a deal breaker I get it.”

“Why would something that could never happen bother me?” Agatha asked.

“It could happen at any point.” Rio said solemnly.

“So? When you take your place, you don’t die. You live on as death. I assume you’d have to handle business but if I’m still alive you can visit me can’t you?”

“I don’t have any answers.”

“I have faith that we will figure it out if it ever comes to that point.” Agatha said as she leaned forward and rubbed Rio’s back reassuringly.

“You are being sappy now.” Rio said as she shook her head.

“Just giving you a taste of your own medicine.” Agatha said as she tugged on Rio’s arm, encouraging her to come back into Agatha’s arms.

“You’re not freaked out by this?” Rio asked as she settled into Agatha’s embrace.

“Nothing more ironic than a spirit witch dating the embodiment of death. Even if they are in their gestation period.” Agatha reassured softly.

“The universe has a sense of humor. That’s for sure.” Rio said with a chuckle as she kissed Agatha’s neck.

“What do you want to do for the rest of the day?” Agatha asked.

“I should probably take you home, then head home myself.” Rio said sadly.

“Yeah we aren’t doing that.” Agatha said as she pulled Rio in closer.

“But.”

“No, no buts. We are gunna stay right here for a little while, then we will head back to my place and I’ll make us lunch, then if you want to go home you can. But right now. In this moment. I’m going to hold you, and we are going to be just fine.” Agatha said cutting Rio off before she had a chance to complain. Then she placed a soft kiss on Rio’s head as they sat together, simply just enjoying this moment together.

Chapter 6

A few hours later they were back at Agatha’s place relaxing in the living room after eating a late lunch.

“Why didn’t you run?” Rio asked.

“What’s there to run from? Death? She comes for us all.” Agatha said with a shrug.

“You fascinate me Agatha Harkness.” Rio said as she looked at the woman in awe.

“Why?”

“Most people would run the second they knew what I told you.”

“I’m not most people. If anything I know how it feels to be an outcast for something you have no control over. Why would I shy away from you for something that has been decided long before we ever met? You didn’t shy away from me when you found out I was a spirit witch.”

“I don’t know… I just expected you to run.” Rio said honestly.

“It’s gunna take a lot more than that to scare me off.” Agatha said honestly.

“I don’t think I could if I tried.” Rio said with a laugh.

“Probably not.” Agatha answered. They sat comfortably on the couch together for a few moments longer when Agatha’s front door opened.

“Bitch! How fucking dare you ignore me!” Wanda yelled into the house as she walked into the kitchen and opened the fridge. She pulled the spaghetti out of the fridge. She took the lid off the container and tossed it in the microwave to warm it up.

“Hi Wanda, how was work? Did you have a good day?” Agatha yelled from the couch.

“Great! Except the last text I got was from my best friends girlfriend!” There was a small pause as Wanda noticed the flowers in the countertop. “Oh! Hey these are fucking stunning, I would’ve loved to have gotten a photo of them yesterday!” Wanda said sassily.

“I’m your girlfriend?” Rio whispered quietly Agatha shrugged at Rio and made a face that said ‘fuck if I know!’

“My girlfriend?” Agatha yelled back at Wanda who was standing in front of the microwave. The microwave beeped and Wanda took the container out and grabbed a fork before heading toward the living room.

“Yeah, the cute bookstore owner. The one that said you were the best fuck of her life.” Wanda said as she walked into the living room with the food. Shoving a bite into her mouth as she looked up to see Agatha sitting on the couch with a smile on her face and Rio cuddled into her side.

“Oh… you’re still here…” Wanda said though a mouthful of food. She quickly chewed her food before swallowing and glaring at Agatha.

“Oh? So you can notice my car sitting in the driveway this morning but not when you barge in to get yourself food?” Rio jabbed back.

“I was starving! Tunnel vision is a real thing, plus no one said I was observant.” Wanda said as she walked over to the two women, and plopped down in the armchair next to the couch.

“That’s for sure.” Agatha goaded.

“Don’t you start with me! I’m still pissed at you.” Wanda said as she pointed a fork at Agatha.

“Don’t be. She let me send that text, then I distracted her with a little trip somewhere. Blame me.” Rio offered.

“Nah, I’m still gunna blame her.” Wanda said with a wink toward Rio.

“Look, I’m sorry I’ve been distracted. I’ll type up a book for you describing in detail everything but the sex tonight. I promise.”

“Good, because you are fucking killing me! How dare you! I tell you about all my horrible dates and you go on one perfect date and all of a sudden I’m chopped liver?” Wanda asked in an annoyed tone as she shoved another bite of food into her mouth.

“You do realize that you are technically interrupting that date right?” Agatha asked with a chuckrle.

“That’s another thing! How gay do you have to be to make a date longer than eight hours? I’ve never even been on a date that lasted more than four!” Wanda complained.

“About that… women just like spending quality time together. You should give it a shot, you’d be surprised how long a lesbian date lasts.” Rio said honestly.

“Find me a girl and I’ll gladly give it a shot.” Wanda said sarcastically.

“Challenge accepted.” Rio said with a chuckle.

“She can’t be serious can she?” Wanda asked Agatha.

“I’m afraid to say you’ve sealed your own fate. She’s pretty stubborn and very determined when she wants to be” Agatha told Wanda, who was shoveling another bite of spaghetti into her mouth. Wanda just rolled her eyes.

“How could you possibly know that?” Wanda asked after she swallowed her food.

“Because I am. Because I get what I want.” Rio said in a tone that left no room for argument.

“And she’s confident too! You are fucked Harkness.” Wanda said before she stuffed her face with the last bite of spaghetti and got up to take the container back to the kitchen.

“Thanks for dinner!” Wanda said as she walked away. She tossed the container, its lid and the fork she was using in the sink before she walked back out the door. Shutting it loudly on her way out.

“Chaos Witch is an understatement.” Rio said as she watched the front door shut.

“Yeah, but I wouldn’t trade her for the world.” Agatha said as she watched her best friend walk by her front window toward her own home.

“I should probably head home as well, even though I really don’t want to.” Rio said softly.

“We can text, and you can call me. I should probably tackle work emails and clean…” Agatha said as she stood up and helped Rio up as well.

“I will return these on Sunday.” Rio said referring to the clothing she was wearing.

“Your stuff is sitting on the bed folded. It’s not clean but at least it’s folded.” Agatha said as she walked over to her bedroom door and opened it.

“I’m not going in there.” Rio said as she stood firmly in place.

“Afraid you’re going to get distracted again?” Agatha asked with a smirk.

“Afraid? No. Worried that my self control is paper thin and I’ll end up staying the night again…” Rio said as she watched Agatha grab her clothing off the bed and stood there stubbornly.

“Would that be so bad?” Agatha asked.

“No, not at all! But…” Rio fumbled looking for the right words.

“I get it. Sorry.” Agatha said as she walked out to the living room and handed Rio her clothing.

“No, I don’t think you do… but that’s okay.” Rio said as she took the clothing with one arm and then rubbed her eyes trying to find the right words.

“It’s just that I’m so attracted to you, and this is so easy. I’m afraid of how much tomorrow and the rest of this week will suck if I don’t leave now.” Rio said softly as she magicked her book and keys into her hands.

“I feel like it’s going to suck no matter what.” Agatha said honestly.

“I’m going to kiss you one more time and then I’m going back to my apartment with all my plants.” Rio said sadly.

“You better make it two.” Agatha joked as she kissed the woman softly, Rio chuckled as she kissed Agatha back. Agatha brought her hand up to weave into Rio’s hair as she smiled into the kiss before deepening it. A soft moan left Rio as she kissed her passionately.

“Stop playing dirty.” Rio mumbled against Agatha’s lips.

“Never.” Agatha husked out as she tugged softly on Rio’s hair. Another moan slipped out of Rio as Agatha captured her lips again in a passionate kiss. Rio felt her resolve start to crumble slowly.

“Agatha…” Rio groaned out as she broke the kiss.

“Rio…” Agatha trailed off as she started to kiss down the side of her neck.

“I should just teleport home…” Rio said trying to focus.

“Oh? That’s an option?” Agatha teased, knowing it always was but she likes frustrating Rio.

“Right now it is! Goddesses woman!” Rio said in a frustrated tone.

“The only goddess I care about right now is you.” Agatha praised as she pulled Rio closer.

“Seriously. Agatha… I’m too weak for this.” Rio whined.

“I just wanted to get you riled up before I send you home so you wouldn’t forget about me.” Agatha said honestly before stepping back.

“Evil! Pure evil!” Rio complained with a playful glare.

“I thought you knew that.” Agatha said with a chuckle.

“You are so mean.” Rio whined as she huffed and made her way to the front door.

“I know. Be safe. Please let me know when you get home.”

“I will. I promise. Te Veo Agatha.” Rio said as she turned around and gave Agatha another kiss on the lips before she slipped out the door.

Agatha watched from the door as Rio got in her car and pulled out the driveway. Agatha sighed sadly as she brought her phone into her hand and walked over to the couch and sat down to check her emails.

“Junk, junk, junk and more junk. Wow Pepper, not a single email?” Agatha asked as she looked at her phone. Agatha sighed and got up to grab a book from the pile she bought the other day.

“Might as well read something to keep myself busy.” Agatha said as she grabbed one of the books before going back to the couch. She plopped down on the couch and opened the book so she could start reading. The front door slammed back open a moment later and Agatha rolled her eyes.

“And another thing!” Wanda yelled as she walked back into the living room.

“Shut the fucking door Wanda!” Agatha scolded. Wanda paused and turned back around to shut the door. “Thank you.”

“Tell me everything, right now.” Wanda demanded.

“You couldn’t even wait 10 minutes after she left?” Agatha scolded.

“You literally were on a date for over twenty four hours… how did you two not run out of things to talk about?”

“Because we talked about everything… She knows… about my mother…”

“Oh fuck, and she stuck around?” Wanda asked softly, her demeanor changing instantly. She got up from the chair and moved over to the couch to hug Agatha.

“She isn’t afraid of me. She actually knows how this works, and understands how misunderstood spirit witches are.” Agatha explained as she let Wanda wrap her arms around her and hold her close.

“That’s surprising.” Wanda said before she continued. “Mental health check though. You good?”

“I’m great.” Agatha said honestly.

“So where did she take you this morning?” Wanda asked as she let Agatha go and settled next to her.

“Her family’s cabin.” Agatha said vaguely.

“There’s something you aren’t telling me.” Wanda pried.

“It’s not for me to tell. Please respect that. If Rio wants you to know she will tell you.” Agatha explained.

“I can accept that. So tell me. How good was it?” Wanda begged.

“She ate me out. A few times.” Agatha said happily. Wanda sat there quietly for a long moment. Her mouth opening and closing as she tried to collect her thoughts.

“Excuse me?” Wanda said in shock, her brain seeming to malfunction completely.

“Is that not what you were asking about?” Agatha teased.

“I mean we have a few things to cover before we get to the activities last night.. like for example. How did you make your spell book invisible to me?”

“Rio has an incantation in her book I found and tested. It works. Sorry I used you as the confirmation bias.” Agatha said.

“Honestly, I would’ve done the same.” Wanda said with a shrug.

“What do you want to know?” Agatha asked.

“I don’t want to know anything specifically. But! I do want to hear you say. ‘Wanda you were right, she is my type.’ That would be music to my ears.”

“Wanda you were right, she is my type. Also severely helps that we have magical compatibility.” Agatha said honestly.

“What the fuck is that?” Wanda asked in a confused tone.

“Magical compatibility is when your magic reacts with another persons. Intertwining and creating a deep connection. Well from what I’ve learned…”Agatha explained.

“What does it do?” Wanda asked.

“Well.. we’ve been playing with it a little. Right now the best way I can explain it is.. I can feel this tether to her. I can grab it and pull on it, but if I focus I can see the shape of her in my mind. I can reach out and touch her and she can feel it and vise versa.”

“So…” Wanda drawled out thinking about what Agatha said. “You tested it in a dirty way didn’t you?” Wanda asked.

“I mean there’s something about the connection that does lead to arousal.” Agatha explained, then her phone pinged next to her. She grabbed the phone and looked at it.

5:30 p.m: I made it home. Here’s the photo I took before you arrived at the book store yesterday. Attachment Image.

5:31 p.m: thank you, you’ll never guess who’s back here already… I’ll text you soon.

“Here, Rio was kind enough to send me the photo she took of our date before I arrived.” Agatha said handing Wanda the phone. Wanda’s jaw dropped as she looked at the photo.

“This is literally like a scene from a movie. Fuck, she’s romantic.” Wanda lamented.

“You have no idea.” Agatha said with a chuckle.

“So in the span of a weekend, you’ve met what is essentially your magical soulmate, had an amazing first date, got laid, learned a new spell, and got flowers? Fuck you Harkness.” Wanda said as she handed Agatha her phone back.

“Honestly before this past weekend I’d never heard of it before myself.” Agatha clarified.

“I didn’t even think it was possible!” Wanda complained.

“I do wonder what else our connection can do but that’s something we need to work on.” Agatha said with a shrug.

“My brain hurts.” Wanda whined as she rubbed her temples.

“Literally or metaphorically?” Agatha questioned.

“Both.” Wanda stated, with a wave of her hand Agatha eliminated her headache.

“Thank you. Now… We can talk about how good the sex was.” Wanda said with a sigh.

“Phenomenal.” Agatha said honestly.

“I can’t believe you let her eat you out.” Wanda said in a baffled tone.

“Hey…. It’s not that I’ve never allowed women to do it… It’s more that I’ve exhausted them before they got the chance.” Agatha said with a blush.

“I just think it was you were afraid of that deep intimate connection.” Wanda said with a shrug.

“Oh fuck you, no it’s not that. I wasn’t kidding about it when I said I’d fuck them to sleep.” Agatha said with an eye roll.

“I’m inclined to believe you based off the text Rio sent me this morning.” Wanda said softly.

“Anything else you must know?” Agatha asked.

“Nah. Wanna hear about my date with Jacob?” Wanda asked.

“Anything note worthy?”

“Not really, I haven’t dated a woman since college. Maybe I should give it another shot…” Wanda said thoughtfully.

“I mean I know you are attracted to women. You could always give it a shot. Jen and Alice seem pretty happy together. I have Rio… tentatively. So maybe you should come join the rainbow brigade again.” Agatha joked.

“If your girlfriend finds me a date I’ll humor it.” Wanda said with a nudge to her shoulder.

“She’s not my girlfriend…” Agatha said simply because they hadn’t put a label on their relationship yet.

“Yeah, and I didn’t save your life 20 years ago.” Wanda jabbed.

“Pietro helped.” Agatha reminded.

“He did, and he loves you just as much as I do. You’re the sister we always needed. Never forget how loved and wanted you are by us.” Wanda reassured as she patted Agatha’s thigh.

“Why is everyone determined to make me cry today?” Agatha asked as she felt the tears start to well up in her eyes.

“Because we want you to know how loved you are. Fuck Evanora Harkness. She’s a cunt. I would’ve let you drain her and the whole coven if I had known you wouldn’t have caught jail time.” Wanda said as she wrapped her arms around Agatha again in a reassuring hug.

“I didn’t want any of them to die…” Agatha said brokenly, remembering how they all looked as she drained them. She’s thankful that Wanda and Pietro saved her and them.

“And that makes you a far better person than that monster who created you will ever be.” Wanda reassured.

“Thanks. Now can I read my book in peace?” Agatha asked softly. She was feeling emotional and didn’t want to cry. She knew Wanda would make her cry today if she stuck around any longer.

“Yeah, I guess I can go home. I gotta take care of a few things.” Wanda said her tone indicating that she wanted to linger a little longer.

“I’ll be fine. I promise. You know I’ll text you if I break.” Agatha said honestly.

“Promise?” Wanda asked as she got up.

“Promise.” Agatha reassured.

“Have a good night. I’ll see you in the morning.” Wanda said as she walked to the door.

“See you in the morning. Have a great night.” Agatha said as she watched Wanda leave. She sighed and picked her phone back up to text Rio.

Agatha 6:05 p.m: Sorry about that. She’s not used to sharing…

Rio 6:05 p.m: She gone?

Agatha 6:06 p.m: Yes.

A moment later her phone rang, Rio was calling. Agatha smiled as she answered the call. “Miss me already?”

“Yes. But that’s not why I’m calling. I called my mother, and talked to her about today.”

“Oh?” Agatha asked as she got comfortable.

“Yeah. She wants to meet you.” Rio said with a chuckle. “But, that can wait. I also called her to ask about great grandma’s book.” Rio said as she settled on her own couch.

“Really?” Agatha asked hopefully.

“She said she will let you borrow it for as long as you want… after she meets you.” Rio told Agatha.

“I can agree to those terms.” Agatha said softly.

“Isn’t it too soon to meet my mother?” Rio asked.

“I mean I can meet her for the holidays in a few months. I’m not impatient Rio. The spell book isn’t going anywhere.” Agatha responded.

“True but she wanted to meet you next weekend.”

“What did the cabin tell her?” Agatha asked, knowing magical artifacts had away of communicating.

“Lots of things. But mainly, you are it. Great grandma’s magic has made it very known that you are wanted and welcome there.” Rio answered her.

“Good to know. What was the rest?” Agatha pried.

“I may or may not have told her about how your mother reacted to finding out you were a spirit witch.” Rio said honestly.

“And?”

“She seems to think she’s got 20 years of loving you to catch up on immediately.” Rio said with a chuckle.

“Fascinating.” Agatha said before continuing. “I don’t know if I can handle being loved by two Vidal women at once. You’ve almost made my heart explode a few times in the last two days.”

“I think you’ll be just fine Agatha.” Rio said with a chuckle.

“You don’t know that! I could die from being loved too much!” Agatha whined dramatically.

“I doubt it.” Rio said softly.

“Okay, whatever you say darling.” Agatha said with a chuckle.

“I wish I had stayed.” Rio said quietly, as if she was afraid Agatha would hear how vulnerable she felt.

“I wish you had stayed as well. Unfortunately we both have day jobs so that means… We will make it through this week, I promise.” Agatha reassured.

“So I missed family dinner on Saturday… would you want to come with me next week?” Rio asked, changing the subject.

“Tentatively yes. But I have no clue what my work week holds.” Agatha said honestly.

“I’ll accept that. Do you want to stay on the phone or do you want me to text you?” Rio asked.

“I thought you had things you needed to get done.” Agatha joked.

“I mean…” Rio trailed off.

“You already did everything you needed to and miss me now?” Agatha asked.

“Yes! Okay! I feel like a junky. I’ve never met anyone like you.” Rio lamented.

“I miss you too.” Agatha said honestly, and it made Rio’s heart jump into her throat. Agatha was smiling like a teenager. Her heart felt like it was soaring.

“We are so fucked.” Rio said with a smile, Agatha could hear the joy in her tone.

“We are. I’m gunna go get ready for bed and take you with me. We will talk until I get tired.” Agatha said as she got up and started taking care of things around the house before making her way into her bedroom.

“Did you eat dinner?” Rio asked causing Agatha to pause and sigh.

“Did you?” Agatha asked as she turned around and made her way into the kitchen to find something small to eat.

“I had a burger from the diner around the corner from my place.” Rio said as she started moving around her apartment.

“I don’t want to cook.” Agatha said as she opened the fridge and looked for something to eat.

“I’d suggest the left over spaghetti, but someone ate that.” Rio joked.

“I’ll have a salad.” Agatha said as she pulled the bowl out and placed some on a plate before putting it away. She grabbed some dressing, some cold grilled chicken and shredded cheese and added them to the salad before putting everything away.

“Somethings better than nothing.”

“I hate cooking for one, it’s boring so it will have to do.” Agatha said as she sat down at the island and magicked a fork into her hand.

“I can understand that. But you are a fantastic cook.”

“I know, but if you were here I would’ve actually cooked a real meal.” Agatha said as she stabbed at the salad before taking a bite.

“Good to know I’m worth cooking for… Can I ask a personal question?” Rio asked tentatively, like she sounded nervous.

“Yes.”

“What’s your mother’s name?”

“Evanora Harkness.” Agatha said as she grabbed a bite of food.

“I expected more of a fight.” Rio answered.

“Wanda literally called her a cunt to my face today. I’m desensitized. Why did you want it?” Agatha asked.

“Just trying to figure out something.” Rio said as she flipped through something, Agatha could hear papers shuffling.

“Please don’t go hunt my mother down. I will literally never speak to you again. I cannot handle that woman in my life.” Agatha said in a steely tone.

“I wasn’t hunting her down. I would never disrespect you like that. I’m just trying to figure out what you “should” have been.” Rio asked.

“She’s an illusionist witch. Major manipulator, honestly one of the most impressive ones I’ve met. Which is why I have the ability to control a feeble mind.” Agatha with a shrug that Rio couldn’t see before she took another bite.

“That explains many things.” Rio said as she shoved paperwork aside.

“How so?” Agatha asked.

“I’ve met a few illusionists witches…. They always leave a bad taste in my mouth. I see through their glamor.” Rio answered.

“Is that why you say Te Veo?” Agatha asked before she finished eating her salad.

“I see through most, you were a little more difficult to pin down. So in your case it’s less ‘I see you’ and more ‘I desire to see you’ than anything.” Rio explained.

“You’ve stripped me bare, you’ve seen more of me than anyone ever has.” Agatha explained.

“Except Wanda.” Rio amends.

“You’re getting there. Trust me. Now that I’ve eaten, can I get ready for bed?” Agatha questioned, more of a joke than anything.

“I suppose I can let you rest. Te Veo Agatha.” Rio said into the phone as Agatha got up and put her plate in the sink and rinsed the dishes off.

“Good night Rio.” Agatha said before she pulled her phone away and hung up. She washed the dishes that were in her sink and then headed toward her bedroom. She settled into bed and magicked her book into her hand and started reading.

An hour later she plugged her phone in, set her alarms, put her book on the nightstand and laid down to rest. Hoping sleep would take her soon.

Chapter 7

Rio sat in her living room holding her phone. She wanted to call her mom back and talk to her some more but it was getting late.

“Fuck it!” Rio said as she pressed her mom’s contact and hit dial.

“Witchlett it’s late, what is wrong?” A concerned voice asked over the phone.

“Evanora Harkness.” Rio said into her phone, unsure of what her mother would do with the information but she had to tell her mom.

“Oh.” There was a long pause that felt like it stretched on for eons. “The illusionist witch…”

“You know of her?” Rio asked.

“She’s a vain individual, appearances are everything to her. Which explains much of what you told me earlier. I’ve had the unfortunate pleasure of meeting her.”

“Momma, don’t hex her. Agatha wants no connection to her.”

“Oh, Witchlett. The woman is not of my concern, karma comes for us all in the end.”

“Thank you. But seriously. No hexing.” Rio said seriously.

“I promise, I will not hex the woman.” Her mother promised.

“Why did you want to know it so badly in the first place?” Rio asked.

“I needed to know who hurt my future daughter in law. So I can protect her if needed.”

“Momma… we aren’t even officially dating.” Rio whined.

“Rio, mi corazón. She is it. Your magic is intertwined. Nothing is pulling you two apart. I’ve never felt a bond so strong.” Her mother reassured.

“Do you know how insane this sounds?” Rio asked.

“Death always needs a bride. You’ve found yours.”

“About that…” Rio trailed off.

“You told her already?” Her mother asked softly.

“Yes.”

“Everything?”

“Yes.”

“And she didn’t run. More proof I’m right.” Her mother said proudly.

“You are going to be insufferable until you meet her aren’t you?” Rio asked.

“Of course I am. This witchlett has her claws in deep and I cannot wait to see what kind of witch she is.”

“An impressive one, if I’m being honest.” Rio said with a sigh.

“That I believe. Now, my darling girl. You have a book store to run. I have a job to work in the morning, and we have rest to get. Relax, life will work itself out. Goodnight baby.” Her mother reassured softly.

“Goodnight Momma.” Rio said as she hung the phone up.

“She’s totally going to hex her.” Rio said as she shook her head and got up from the couch and headed toward her own bed.

~meanwhile~

Wanda sat in her living room contemplating what she should do. It had been a while since she had hexed Evanora Harkness.
She pulled her phone out and checked the time. It was almost 10 p.m. instead of a hex she decided to do the next best thing and that was to call her brother. It rang once before he picked up.

“Hey sis, what’s up?” Pietro said into the phone.

“I have a request…” Wanda asked into the phone.

“Unfortunately the wicked witch is still alive.” He said into the phone.

“I know. I just want you to check and see if the hex’s I have in place are still active.”

“I can do that, how’s Aggie doing?” He asked referring to Agatha.

“She’s actually great. It’s a bit complicated but she met someone this past weekend.” Wanda answered. There was a long pause on the other end, like his brain was trying to process.

“You actually made me stop moving because I swear you just said Agatha met someone…” Pietro said in a confused tone.

“I mean.. she did.” Wanda said into the phone.

“One second, let me check for you real quick. Leaving my phone here.” Pietro said as he set his phone down. A few moments Wanda heard the phone pick back up.“Everything is in place still.”

“Thank you.” Wanda said with a sigh.

“Are you thinking about casting a new one? She seems pretty miserable already, not that she doesn’t deserve it.”

“Not yet. But if she tries to contact Agatha around Halloween I’ll do something then.” Wanda said, knowing this woman always had a tendency to try and contact Agatha around witchy holidays.

“I can check in on her a couple times a week and see where her mental state is? She seems pretty angry about most of her magic being gone still.”

“Yeah… Agatha doesn’t know about that still.”

“Play stupid games, win stupid prizes.” Pietro said with a shrug that Wanda couldn’t see.

“Thanks for checking for me.”

“So… is Aggies new boo cute?” Pietro asked.

“Stunning honestly. She’s very much Agatha’s type. Plus she owns a book store.”

“Oh Jeeze. So she’s perfect. Book store name?” He asked.

“Vidal Books. Don’t go zipping around right now to check it out.” Wanda said causing her brother to stop.

“Fine, I’ll go tomorrow like a normal human.” He said sadly.

“Thanks. Now, I should get to bed. You probably should too, you’ve got classes to teach tomorrow.” Wanda told her brother.

“I’ll check it out on my lunch break or after work. You know the offer is still on the table for a job right?” He told his sister.

“I’m happy with being a therapist for normal people at the moment. Plus, if I moved over there Agatha would be alone.”

“I know. Alright. I’ll talk to you tomorrow.”

“Night!” Wanda said as she hung the phone up. She sighed and made her way to bed.

—————————

The next morning Agatha woke up feeling refreshed and ready for her work day. She got up, showered, put on her favorite black suit and accessorized with a dark purple tie, her rings, and a pocket chain. She put her hair up in a neat bun and then headed into the kitchen to make breakfast for her and Wanda. Who rushed in the door a few moments after Agatha placed a plate of eggs, bacon and toast on the island for her best-friend.

“Do you ever feel like we are too co-dependent?” Wanda asked as she sat down at the island and started eating.

“You’re co-dependent. I’m just humoring you.” Agatha said with a smirk.

“And I’m just here for breakfast.” Wanda said sarcastically as she sopped up some runny egg yolk with her toast. Agatha took a bite of her bacon as she watched her best friend eat.

“What did you do?” Agatha asked she could see Wanda was being bothered by something.

“What do you mean?” Wanda asked incredulity.

“You didn’t get a lot of sleep, you aren’t being quite as obnoxious as you usually are, and actually opened my front door like a normal human being for once.” Agatha listed off reasons.

“Why are you so fucking observant?!?” Wanda complained.

“It’s my job, now spill.” Agatha said honing in on Wanda.

“I called Pietro last night…”

“Oh? And how is our brother?” Agatha joked.

“He’s fine, still on my case about working for Charles Xavier.” Wanda answered with a shrug, trying to act like that was what was bugging her.

“That’s not it, he always bugs you about that. Tell me, don’t make me call Jen for a truth serum.” Agatha said with a glare.

“I had him check to see if my hex’s on your mother were still in place…” Wanda said as she braced herself ready to deal with a pissed off Agatha.

“And?” Agatha asked as she took a bite of her food.

“You’re not angry I hexed your mother?” Wanda asked.

“You are a chaos witch, but you are also my best friend, so that makes you predictable to me. I knew you had hex’s on her, I’d be more surprised if you told me you didn’t. Now eat breakfast. I don’t want to be late to work.” Agatha said as she finished her coffee and put the cup in the sink. She was still eating her breakfast.

“Yes ma’am.” Wanda said before she finished eating her last few bites of food.

“I’ll see you later. Don’t cause too much chaos today.” Agatha said as Wanda got up and rinsed her plate off.

“Thank you for breakfast and always being such a good friend.” Wanda said as she side hugged Agatha before she rushed out the door.

“You’re welcome!” Agatha yelled as the front door shuts. She shook her head as she cleaned her own plate off and headed to the back to the entryway and grabbed her brief case, wallet, phone and keys. She looked around the house and then turned lights off with her magic before walking out the door and locking it.

“Let’s tackle this day.” Agatha said with a smile as she climbed into her car and started it.

Agatha was a creature of habit, she arrived at work before most, got things in order and made sure things went smoothly. She had a whole team to organize and keep on track on top of her own high profile cases.

“You have court this afternoon Ms. Harkness.” Her secretary said to her as she walked into the office.

“Thank you Tricia, has Mrs. Potts left any messages for me?” Agatha asked the young woman.

“Yes, several. They are all in a sealed envelope on your desk. And before you ask me what they say I was given explicit instructions to not read them. She hand delivered them yesterday afternoon.” Tricia answered her boss.

“Perfect, not looking forward to that. Can you give me 20 minutes to review everything and then I will see what we need to address?” Agatha asked.

“Of course. If you need anything else let me know.” Tricia offered.

“Let me review this stuff from Mrs. Potts.” Agatha said as she walked over to her door and held it open for Tricia who took the hint and went over to her own desk. Agatha shut the door and walked over to her desk and sat down.

Before she did anything Agatha pulled open a tab on her computer and ordered some flowers to be delivered to Vidal Books with a note that said ‘A little something to let My Green Witch know she’s on my mind.’

“Now let’s see the mess we are in.” Agatha said as she pulled the paperwork out. On the top of the page there was a header that read ‘Stark Industries vs Jeffery Davis and Fellowship industries.’

“Not Fellowship! Ugh I fucking hate them so much. Damn it Jeffery.” Agatha grumbled as she read the rest of the document. She noticed a few errors and issues so she started retyping the document, focusing deeply on making sure everything was right before it was sent to the judge.

A knock on her door pulled her from her focus but not enough to look up from her computer. “Come in.” Agatha said as she continued to focus on her work.

“I see you found the lawsuit.” Pepper said as she walked into the office and shut the door behind her.

“Who wrote this?” Agatha said in an irritated tone.

“Travis. He was the only one available.” Pepper said with a slightly irritated tone.

“I could’ve come in yesterday and this would have been immaculate and perfect.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“About that… how did the date go?”

“You want the watered down human version or do you want the witch version?” Agatha asked as she continued to type.

“There’s a difference?” Pepper asked with a chuckle.

“A large one.” Agatha said as she looked up from her computer, actually pausing her work.

“Watered down for now. We can gossip after you win your case this afternoon.” Pepper told her.

“Fantastic. We are super compatible, she’s a green witch, and she’s intelligent, attractive, compassionate and romantic.” Agatha said before she went back to her work.

“Awesome. Think you’ll have that done by noon?” Pepper asked.

“I’ll have it done in an hour and email it to you.”

“And that’s why I fucking love having you around.” Pepper told Agatha.

“And I thought it was because I’m cute.” Agatha joked before she went back to getting work done. Pepper rolled her eyes at Agatha who just chuckled as she continued to write.

“Give ‘em Hell Harkness.” Pepper said as she opened the door and walked out.

An hour later the lawsuit was written up and emailed to Pepper. Agatha took a moment to look through the rest of the paperwork that Pepper put in the folder. At the very bottom of the pile under everything was two life time passes to Stark Botanical Gardens with a sticky note on them that said ‘Just in case you ever leave us.’ In Peppers beautiful script.

“That woman.” Agatha said with an eye roll. She grabbed her phone to check and see if she had any messages.

Rio 9:45 a.m: Good Morning Gorgeous.

Agatha smiled at the text and quickly sent one back.

Agatha 10:05 a.m: Good Morning, how’s my favorite Green Witch?

Agatha then went back to work. She made sure she had everything for court later in the day and made sure that her team was handling things well before she went to visit Pepper in her office.

“Tricia, I have to go see Pepper personally. Then after that I’ll probably head to court. If you need to take the rest of the day off after you can, otherwise I trust you can hold the fort down?” Agatha asked her secretary as she stopped at her desk.

“I’ll hold down the fort. Expect emails.” Tricia said as the phone rang. “Stark Law, you’ve reached the Secretary of Agatha Harkness. How may I assist you?” There was a long pause. “Yes Ma’am she is on her way to your office now.” Tricia said as she waved Agatha off.

Agatha took the stairs up one floor and made her way to Peppers office. Her secretary stood as Agatha walked past his desk and into the office without knocking.

“You rang?” Agatha asked as she sat down in one of Peppers comfy chairs.

“Yes, the lawsuit has been reviewed by a judge and given the green light. We can wrap them up in so much red tape they’ll never see the light of day. Did you find the rest of the paperwork?” Pepper asked.

“By paperwork you mean two lifetime passes to Stark Botanical Gardens?” Agatha asked as she folded her arms and raised an eyebrow.

“Tony noticed how much Rio loved the place. He insisted.” Pepper said with a shrug.

“Pepper…” Agatha drew her name out as a warning.

“Okay, I felt bad for interrupting your date twice. So when I got home and talked to Tony about it he suggested it after checking the gardens cameras.” Pepper relented, telling the truth.

“I appreciate it, Rio will love it. Thank you.”

“You’re welcome, gotta take care of you so I don’t lose you. Now go win that case and head home.” Pepper said with a smile.

“Can do.” Agatha said as she stood up and walked out the door. She waved her hand on the way out and her briefcase appeared out of nowhere. She made her way to the elevator and headed down to the lobby before making her way to her car and heading toward the courthouse.

Once she arrived she saw a flash of green walk out the door. Reporters were surrounding one of her colleagues again. High profile superhero cases were always Jennifer Walter’s to handle first. Agatha made her way up the stairs and into the courthouse feeling sympathy for her co-worker.

“I don’t have time for a press statement today, sorry everyone. I must speak to someone.” Jennifer said as she shoved through the group and made her way back into the courthouse.

“Harkness!” Jenifer yelled after she got back into the building. Agatha turned around and walked over to Jennifer.

“Yes?” Agatha said looking up at the giant green woman.

“I was wondering, are you busy this weekend? I’d like to take you on a date.” Jennifer asked hopefully.

“Uh… I… I’m sorry, I’m actually seeing someone currently.” Agatha said as she looked up at the giantess, she was shocked to say the least.

“I thought you were single.” Jennifer pried.

“I was on Friday last week.” Agatha said honestly.

“Oh. I’m sorry. I hope this doesn’t affect our work relationship. If you two don’t work out, let me know.” Jennifer said to Agatha.

“Don’t worry about it at all, and I’ll keep that in mind. Now I have a case to win, have a lovely day.” Agatha said as she walked away from Jennifer. She cleared her mind and walked into the courtroom and met with her client before sitting down.

Agatha did what she did best and a few hours later the jury came out and announced her client was the winner of the lawsuit. With a satisfied smile she collected her paperwork and stuck it in her briefcase. She grabbed her phone and send a text to Pepper letting her know they had won. Then she seen the text from Rio.

3:45 p.m: I’m yours now? Attachment Image.

The photo was of the flowers and note. Agatha smiled brightly and quickly sent a text off to Rio.

4:00 p.m: Only if you want to be. Just won a case! Hopefully you are having an amazing day.

“Thank you Ms. Harkness.” Her client said to Agatha as she tucked her phone into her breast pocket.

“You’re welcome. Stay out of trouble.” Agatha said as she patted the man on the shoulder and walked out of the courtroom.

“Impressive. I love watching you work.” Jennifer complimented.

“Jennifer.” Agatha said in a neutral tone as she started heading toward the exit.

“So you said you just started dating…” Jenifer said as she followed Agatha.

“If you are going to try and convince me to give you a shot. I’m gunna have to turn into Hardass Harkness.” Agatha said with a sigh she could feel a headache coming on.

“I was just going to ask for the courtesy of one date. See how compatible we are.” Jennifer suggested.

“Jennifer, look I’m sure you are fantastic. But I don’t date individuals with human lifespans. So unless you plan on living upwards of a thousand years, we aren’t compatible.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“Is that really a deal breaker for witches?” Jennifer asked as she followed Agatha down the steps.

“All witches? I can’t speak for them as a whole. For me personally? Yes. Why would I want to spend a tenth of my life time with someone and watch them age and die while I’m still young? It just sounds like heartache.” Agatha answered the green giantess.

“I didn’t think about it like that.” Jennifer said as she relented.

“I do appreciate the drive you have. Don’t get me wrong. But I really like this woman, I don’t want to fuck it up. So thank you for the offer, but no thanks.” Agatha said as she approached her car.

“Thank you for the honesty. Congratulations on your win.” Jennifer said before walking away. Agatha got in her car started it and called Pepper instantly. The phone rang twice before Pepper picked up.

“Congratulations on another win Agatha.”

“Thanks, we might have a problem.” Agatha said into the phone as she pulled out of her parking spot and headed toward the office.

“Oh? What would that be?” Pepper asked, it sounded like she was packing things up for the evening.

“Want to guess who I ran into at the courthouse?” Agatha asked.

“Honestly, I have no clue.” Pepper said after a long pause.

“Jennifer Walter’s.”

“How could that be a problem?” Pepper asked as she continued to pack her things up.

“Because she asked me out on a date. I rejected her. She watched me win the case and then asked again.” Agatha said as she turned the corner.

“Fuck… Do I need to write her up for harassment?” Pepper asked as she sat down, ready to fill out paper work.

“Not yet. I think I got through to her the second time when I told her I don’t date individuals with Human lifespans.” Agatha answered.

“If it happens again tell me immediately.” Pepper requested.

“I will, the only good news here is that she doesn’t actually work in the same office.” Agatha reminded Pepper.

“Are you coming back here? Why don’t you head home? Not much you can do here. I’ve CC’ed you in everything important.” Pepper told her.

“I think I’ll go visit my new favorite book store.” Agatha said as she turned, changing her route.

“Tony did a background check on Rio also… Vidal Books?” Pepper said.

“You are just as nosey as Wanda!” Agatha said in an exasperated tone.

“Hey, just because I’m your boss doesn’t mean I’m not your friend!” Pepper hollered into the phone.

“Careful Pepper, Tony is rubbing off on you.” Agatha jabbed.

“Unfortunately for all of us, it’s too late for that. Now have a good night, I have a husband to get home to.” Pepper said into the phone.

“You as well!” Agatha said as she hit the end call button on her center counsel.

Ten minutes later Agatha was pulling up to the bookstore with a bright smile on her face. She could see that there were a few customers mulling about the store. So she shut the car off and made her way inside. Rio was helping a little girl pick out a book over in the kids corner.

“Do you like dinosaurs or unicorns?” Rio asked the little girl who seemed to be around the age of 8.

“Unicorns!” The little girl said excitedly.

“I think I have the perfect book for you, How to Catch a Unicorn. Why don’t you go sit in that beanbag and read it while I help my other customers.” Rio offered to the little girl as she pulled the book off the shelf and handed it to her.

“Thank you!” The little girl said as she ran over to the beanbag and plopped down. Agatha felt her heart melt at the sight.
Rio stood up and turned around to see Agatha standing next to the counter with a soft smile on her face.

“Agatha!” Rio said excitedly as she rushed over to the woman.

“Hello darling.” Agatha said as she took Rio into her arms and hugged her softly.

“Not that I’m complaining but why are you here?” Rio asked.

“I won my case and got the rest of the day off. So I figured I’d come hang out with you and we could go to dinner to celebrate.” Agatha said with a smile.

“Sounds delightful. Did you read my last text?” Rio asked.

“No, I had something I had to handle after my case. Which I will tell you about at dinner or after your done working, but I’ll check it now.” Agatha said as she reached for her phone in her jackets internal breast pocket.

“I gotta help customers, but please let me know.” Rio said as she let Agatha go and went back to work.

Agatha smiled softly at Rio before she turned and started looking at books. She made her way back to the spell book section and grabbed Rio’s spell book off the shelf and placed it in her lap as she sat down. She pulled her phone out of her pocket and read the text.

Rio 4:02 p.m: Agatha Harkness, I am yours.

Before Agatha even had a chance to react she felt something shift in the book store a moment later and then she seen a flash of gray. “Pietro.” Agatha whispered causing the man to stop in his tracks.

“How the fuck did you know I was here?” Pietro asked.

“Why are you here?” Agatha asked the man.

“Wanda told me about your new boo… I had to see what she looked like.” He said honestly.

“So you traveled across 6 states just to check out my ‘new boo.’?” Agatha questioned.

“Yes.” Pietro answered, zero hesitation. He knew not to pussyfoot around with Agatha.

“You must be Wanda’s twin brother.” Rio said as she walked over to them.

“How does she know that?” Pietro asked Agatha as he pointed at Rio.

“She has immaculate hearing. I assume she heard me say your name.” Agatha answered.

“That and my wards told me someone zipped in here faster than humanly possible.” Rio explained.

“I assume Aggie told you I’m a mutant?” He asked.

“Agatha told me yes. Pietro right? Rio Vidal, pleasure to meet you.” Rio said as she held her hand out for him to take.

“The pleasure is all mine, glad to meet the person who finally convinced Aggie that being forever alone is boring.” Pietro said as he took Rio’s hand and shook it. A quick blur and a tug on Agatha’s hand told her he took a ring off her.

“Put it back.” Agatha said to Pietro.

“Come on!” Pietro said as he took the ring back off Rio’s hand and gave it back to Agatha with a huff.

“Stop acting like a little brother.” Agatha scolded as she slipped her ring back on.

“Fine, you are no fun! I’ll go harass Wanda.” Pietro said before he disappeared.

“Sorry about that. He’s always been a little pickpocket. But he knows better than to take anything off you.” Agatha said with a smile.

“I don’t know if it’s smart of him to try and put things onto me.” Rio said with an eye roll.

“No one ever said he had self preservation. Plus he’s not aware of how powerful you are.” Agatha said to Rio.

“Many aren’t.” Rio said before she turned back around and headed toward the front of the store. Agatha sighed and pulled her phone out to text Wanda.

Agatha 5:02 p.m: Pietro is here.

Wanda 5:03 p.m: Figured that out.

Agatha chuckled and put her phone away before she started reading Rio’s spell book to occupy her time. Agatha was enjoying a moment to herself when she felt a soft tug on their connection. She closed her eyes and tugged back then waited, she heard the bell ring out front and then decided to go back to reading.

An hour later the door was locked and Rio was walking to the back of the store to find Agatha right where she had left her. “Did you read my message?”

“I’m yours Rio Vidal.” Agatha said as she took Rio’s hand and pulled her down onto the couch.

“Good.” Rio said as she leaned forward and gave Agatha a kiss.

“Something interesting happened today though.” Agatha said honestly.

“And what would that be?” Rio asked.

“Are you aware of who ‘She-Hulk’ is?” Agatha asked.

“She’s basically the superhero’s lawyer.”

“In short yes. She’s also technically a co-worker.” Agatha explained.

“Okay, why are you telling me about her?” Rio asked.

“She was leaving the courthouse today and noticed me going in. So she followed me inside and asked me out on a date.” Agatha told Rio.

“And?” Rio asked in a strange tone.

“I rejected her and told her I was seeing someone. Went and won my case, she had decided to stay and watch. Then complimented me and asked again. Under the ruse that she wanted to see if we were compatible.” Agatha explained, Rio audibly huffed. Agatha placed a hand on Rio’s to reassure the woman.

“I had to basically tell her that I don’t date individuals with normal human lifespans for her to get the hint.” Agatha reassured.

“Good, I’m glad she got the hint. If she asks again she’s losing her tongue.” Rio said in an irritated tone.

“Don’t tell me you’re jealous of a giant green woman.” Agatha chided as she reached up and turned Rio’s face toward her.

“I have no right to be, but yes I am.” Rio said honestly, brown eyes full of emotion. Sky blue eyes softened as she looked at Rio.

“I’m yours. I promise. This.” Agatha said as she motioned between the two of them before she tugged softly again. “This isn’t something I’d ever let go of. This is real.”

“Stop, you are going to make me cry.” Rio said quietly.

“I’m serious. Rio, will you be my girlfriend?” Agatha asked, Rio didn’t answer. Instead she launched herself into Agatha’s arms and kissed her passionately while shaking her head yes. They kissed a few more times before breaking apart for air.

“Yes! A million times yes.” Rio said excitedly.

“Good, I was getting worried.” Agatha joked.

“Shut up and kiss me.” Rio said in an irritated tone.

“Your wish is my command.” Agatha murmured against Rio’s lips before she kissed the woman.

Chapter 8

Chapter Notes

This chapter has some heavy themes. I tried to write it as mild and tame as possible but still might be triggering for some.

Thank you guys for reading. It’s only a small section of the fic so hopefully y’all still enjoy it!

Rita Vidal was a woman of her word. She personally would not hex Evanora Harkness. Now… that didn’t mean she couldn’t pay someone to.

The whole workday she contemplated with herself on what kind of hex a woman like Evanora deserved. It truly was a conundrum for her. She had plenty of ideas but couldn’t really land on one she loved. Maybe she would have a talk with Lilia, see what the divination witch had to suggest.

Once she got done working she pulled her phone out and called the older witch.

“Rita! I was expecting your call.” Lilia said into the phone.

“Hello Lilia.”

“There are enough hex’s on that witch to kill a horse. But if you want to add insult to injury just a simple glamor malfunction hex will do just fine.” Lilia said into the phone.

“Is she deserving of it?” Rita asked.

“Give me a moment. Let me look back.” Lilia said as she set her phone down and placed it on speaker.

~

“You wretched child! I should’ve killed you the second you were born! All you’ve ever been is a burden, a thorn in my side and now this! You are undeserving of drawing breath! How dare you!” Evanora scolded as she slapped Agatha across the face.

“Mother please! I love her!” A young Agatha begged.

“First you go running around with those abominable twins! Now this! You have been an utter disappointment since day one! How dare you. I put my blood, sweat, and bone into raising you. Just for you to shame me like this!” Evanora yelled as she slapped her daughter again. Purple magic flared from Agatha in that moment, haulting Evanora’s movements.

“Mother Stop!” Agatha pleaded, fear painting Agatha’s tone.

“You… you’re a…” Evanora started to say but stopped, her anger growing even deeper. Her face twisting into a look of disgust that even Agatha had never seen before. She reached forward and grabbed Agatha by her hair and dragged her out of the house.

“Mother please! Stop!” Agatha pleaded, begging for her mother to let her go. Evanora shot a beacon of blue magic into the air and continued to drag Agatha through the woods.

Suddenly the rest of the coven was there pulling Agatha up by her arms and helping Evanora bind Agatha to a dead rotting tree. They left her there while they discussed her fate.

“She’s a fucking spirit witch.” Evanora spat loudly.

“To protect the coven we must kill her.” One of the other witches said. Fear ran through Agatha, at the realization that her mother truly never loved her.

“She’s young and weak, we can fry her and end this now.” Evanora said to the coven before they walked over to Agatha.

“Mother please! I can be good.” Agatha begged struggling at her restraints tears spilling down her cheeks.

“No you cannot. You are incapable of it. It must be done my child. You cannot live. You are undeserving of life.” Evanora said to her daughter before continuing. “You have been nothing but a problem since the day you were born, today I eliminate that problem.” Evanora said as she blasted Agatha with her magic, the rest of the coven joined in. An agonized scream left Agatha before something shifted. All the magic turned purple and they couldn’t stop it.

“No! No no no no no. Please no!” Agatha begged. She didn’t want to harm anyone. She had no control. Tears were spilling from her eyes as she begged them to stop, her voice raw from screaming. Then she seen a blur of silver and red. Witches were thrown aside as Wanda landed next to Agatha and started untying her bounds.

“Are you okay?” Wanda asked checking Agatha over before Pietro skidded to a stop next to them.

“Are they?” Agatha asked in a scared tone as she looked at the women laying on the forest floor.

“They’re still alive if that’s what you are asking.” Pietro answered, before he crouched down next to Agatha and Wanda. “Are you okay?” He asked.

“No.” Agatha said brokenly, tears running down her face as she shook.

“Let’s get you out of here. Cleaned up and maybe checked out at a hospital.” Wanda said as she helped Agatha stand. Agatha collapsed again, and Pietro sighed softly as he scooped Agatha up into his arms.

“Get her to our place, fast.” Wanda said to her brother.

“Don’t kill anyone. She needs both of us.” Pietro reminded Wanda before he dashed off with a shell shocked Agatha in his arms.

~

Lilia picked up the phone and grumbled. “Whatever horrible thing you come up with, it’s not enough...”

“What?” Rita asked.

“That poor child, was undeserving of the hand she had been dealt.” Lilia said trying to collect her thoughts.

“Lilia focus. Come back to the present.” Rita requested softly.

“Sorry, I am experiencing the rage of a thousand men right now.” Lilia answered.

“What did you see?” Rita asked.

“Something no child should ever experience. She was just a baby. Couldn’t have been more than sixteen and her mother…”

“I know, Rio summarized but I doubt she told me the full story.”

“I doubt she has the full story. Based off what I seen, that’s something someone doesn’t want to talk about or remember.” Lilia said honestly as she rubbed her temples.

“Care to share?” Rita asked.

“No. Just know that every hex she has on her will never be enough. Whatever you come up with won’t undo the damage this woman has done.” Lilia explained, still feeling the fear Agatha felt.

“Is she even worth hexing?” Rita asked.

“Most of her power is gone, due to the siphoning. Her coven is weak but alive, she is too weak to even counter the hex’s the chaos witch has placed on her. I’d argue that she isn’t even worth the energy to hex in the first place.”

“Can you tell me how many hex’s she has on her?” Rita asked.

“Twenty give or take.” Lilia said with a chuckle.

“All running at once?” Rita asked.

“From what I could see yesterday? Yes.”

“At least my future daughter in law made friends with good people.” Rita commented.

“Great people. Now… do we want to know about that for sure?” Lilia asked.

“No, they are intertwined. I know they will end up together.” Rita said firmly.

“You’ve always been intuitive.” Lilia said as she threw a cloth over her crystal ball.

“That’s all the confirmation I’ll ever need.” Rita answered.

“How’s Rio?” Lilia asked changing the subject.

“She’s great! Just opened her book store, got herself a girlfriend, and is thriving.”

“All great things to hear.” Lilia said as she got up and headed over to her fridge to grab a drink. “Now, relax. Everything is exactly how it’s supposed to be.” Lilia reassured.

“Thanks Lilia. Have a great day.” Rita said into the phone.

“You as well.” Lilia responded and then the line went dead.

“Maybe I’ll hex the woman…” Lilia mused to herself as she walked over to her spell book.

~Meanwhile at Vidal Books~

Agatha and Rio were still making out on the couch. Drinking each other in like they were the last drop of water on the planet. Rio broke the kiss to catch her breath and kiss down the side of Agatha’s neck.

“I haven’t eaten since breakfast.” Agatha said with a huff as Rio continued kissing down her neck. She was straddling Agatha’s lap and enjoying every second of it.

“I have something you can eat.” Rio offered in a deep husky tone. Agatha groaned at the thought of tasting Rio again. Her hands on Rio’s hips gripped tighter.

“How close is your place?” Agatha asked, already wanting her mouth on Rio.

“Ten minutes away.” Rio offered.

“Fuck the fancy dinner, let’s go back to your place, order pizza and have sex.” Agatha offered.

“That unfortunately means you have to get off me.” Agatha said with a chuckle.

“Of course, your total is $14 with your discount.” The woman told Agatha. She paid and left a generous tip then went to the other end of the counter to wait for her drink and food. Once everything was done Agatha grabbed it and thanked the woman before making her way to the elevators.

“I see no reason to take this case to trial, it is dismissed. No further action is to be taken.” The judge said before pounding their gavel.

“Oh trust me I learned my lesson. Have a wonderful day.” The young woman said as Agatha packed her things up. After Agatha had collected everything she made her way back to her car. She had a lunch meeting to attend.

“Just like I don’t tell Tony he’s a genius often. He’d be unbearable!” Pepper agreed.

“Thanks for lunch Pepper, I have meetings I have to attend unfortunately.” Agatha explained as she closed her container and stood up. She turned walked over to the door and grasped the handle.

“Wait, one more question before you go.” Pepper said as she stood up.

“Yeah?” Agatha paused to turn and look at Pepper.

“Are you actually happy?” Pepper asked genuinely.

“Happier than I have ever been.” Agatha said as she turned the nob and walked out of the office.

The rest of Agatha’s day was with out much event. She’d check her phone between meetings to see if Rio had texted.

Rio 2:30 p.m: How did the hearing go?

Agatha 2:31 p.m: Fantastic. Sorry I ment to text you earlier but Pepper had to have a lunch meeting with me after the hearing.

Rio 2:31 p.m: Hopefully you didn’t get in trouble because of me.

Agatha 2:32 p.m: No, never. But the gossip has started in the office because I didn’t wear purple today. People are losing their marbles. I have another meeting though. I’ll text you once it’s done.

Agatha sent the message off and then there was a knock on her door.

“Ms. Harkness your 2:45 is here early.” Tricia said.

“Let them in.” Agatha said with a smile as she stood up. Tricia opened the door and then a sight Agatha never wanted to see again was presented in front of her.

“Tricia call security.” Agatha said with an angry venom filled tone.

“Now is that any way to speak to your mother dear?” Evanora Harkness asked her daughter. She tried to step into the office but was blocked by a spell protecting the room.

“I’m surprised your glamor lasted long enough to make it up the stairs and past security. Who were you pretending to be?” Agatha asked, a tone filled with venom and anger.

“That’s of no importance.” Evanora said with a wave of her hand.

“Jeremy Elgolf, Ma’am. Security has been contacted and the floor evacuated.” Tricia said as she walked through the door way and got behind Agatha.

“Unnecessary measures.” Evanora said with a sneer.

“What do you want Evanora?” Agatha asked her tone full of venom.

“Call off the Scarlet Witch. Your girlfriend has done more than enough damage.” Evanora sneered. Agatha started laughing almost hysterically.

“You think that I’m dating Wanda? That’s the funniest thing you’ve ever said to me!” Agatha said after she caught her breath.

“I know she’s the one hexing me! Tell her to stop!” Evanora spat at her daughter, her anger flaring up. Agatha sighed and pressed three fingers to her own chest rubbing them along the sigil there as an attempt to sooth herself.

“Stop with that behavior right this second!” Evanora yelled as she tried to march into the office but hit a purple wall.

“You don’t get to talk to me like that anymore Evanora!” Agatha yelled back at her mother.

“Like hell I don’t! You insolent brat! I demand you fix this!” Evanora yelled at her daughter. Fear surged through Agatha at the sight of her mother so angry. Then a moment later. Agatha felt a surge of magic and then suddenly Rio was standing in her office.

“What’s wrong! Babe are you okay?” Rio asked in a panicked tone.

“Rio! What are you doing here?! Who’s watching the store?” Agatha asked in a panicked tone, focusing on Rio.

“I locked up and put a sign on the door. Are you okay? What is happening?” Rio said as she took Agatha’s hand and soothed her thumb over the back of it.

“Who the fuck is this!” Evanora screamed at the two of them. Tricia was just standing there shocked at the events that were happening.

“I am Agatha’s girlfriend, Rio Vidal, of the Vidal Family. The Green Witch, and it will do you wise to watch your next words.” Rio said as she marched toward the woman and stepped through the doorway. Her power imposing deeply as she glared down at the woman.

“Why would I care who you are child! You are meaningless to me and this conversation.” Evanora waved Rio off but fear was painting her tone.

“Silence! You have caused more grief and pain than you are worth!” Rio yelled at the woman.

“You don’t get to speak to me this way.” Evanora yelled back gaining some confidence.

“You don’t get to speak at all!” Rio said as she made a silencing motion with her hand stealing Evanora’s voice.

“Once you leave this floor your voice will return. I won’t render you mute. Yet. But maybe you should educate yourself on my name before you think about bothering MY girlfriend ever again.” Rio said as she stabbed a finger into Evanora’s chest.

Security finally showed up and grabbed Evanora by the arms and escorted her out. They dragged the woman to the elevator and as soon as it shut Agatha collapsed onto the floor of her office. She was shaking uncontrollably, fear overwhelming her. Rio rushed over to her Agatha and collected her in her arms.

“I’m here. It’s okay. I’m here.” Rio reassured as she pulled Agatha closer.

“How did she… why! Why can’t she just leave me alone!” Agatha asked in a frustrated and broken tone.

“I don’t know. But I’m going to handle it.” Rio said in an annoyed tone.

“Don’t… I can’t live without you. You don’t need jail time.” Agatha whispered as she hid her head in Rio’s neck.

“I’m staying right here until you are okay. You called, I came.” Rio soothed as she rubbed Agatha’s back.

~down in the security office~

“Where is she!?” Pepper screamed as she ripped the door open. She was enraged beyond all reason.

“She’s in the holding room ma’am.” An officer said pointing in the direction of the room.

“Once I am done with her, we need to have a long conversation about response times.” Pepper said with a glare as she walked over to the door and opened it.

“Listen here you monstrous bitch! Do you have any idea how many laws and personal protection orders you just violated? I’m about to make your life an even bigger living hell than Wanda ever did!” Pepper said as she opened the door and glared at the woman sitting in a chair with her hands clasped in magic suppressing gauntlets.

“I just want my suffering to end! Why do I have to suffer! She’s the fucking problem! That vile child stole everything from me! My youth, my power, my life! All she’s ever been is a burden!”

“You are the worst! You have no clue how horrible you really are, always playing the victim just because things don’t go your way! I know you tried to execute her! I know all of the horrible and vile things you did to her! I’ve seen the scars. You have reaped what you’ve sown! You aren’t a victim!” Pepper screamed. She had never wanted to harm someone so badly in her life.

“You know nothing! She’s a vile creature! She’s a spirit witch! All she does is take, take, take!”

“God you are literally the dumbest bitch I have ever met! She cannot steal someone’s powers until she is attacked! You did this to yourself you fucking moron! It’s a self defense mechanism. I’m a fucking human and I know that!” Pepper scolded. She desperately wanted to slap the living hell out of this woman.

“That’s not true! She’s evil!” Evanora screamed back at the woman. Something snapped inside Pepper.

“That’s it. I’m done. I’m having you arrested and booked. Then I’m suing you for emotional damage. You have no sense, and I’m done using my rage in the wrong way.” Pepper said as she walked over to the door and opened it. She quickly slammed the door shut leaving Evanora Harkness in her own idiocy.

Pepper walked over to the phone and dialed 911.

“911 what’s your emergency?”

“Hello, I’m Pepper Potts down at Stark Law. I need two officers trained to transport witches to come and arrest a woman who has trespassed and violated a PPO Against Agatha Harkness.” Pepper said into the phone.

“We will send two officers down as soon as possible.” The woman said into the phone.

“Good. I’ll be waiting. Thank you.” Pepper said into the phone before the operator hung up. Pepper set the phone down on the receiver and turned to look at the man at the desk.

“Once I’m finished with this, your team and I are going to have a very long conversation.” Pepper said as she walked out of the office. Timothy was standing next to the door waiting.

“Timothy, can you please wait for the police for me? I really need to go check on Agatha.” Pepper asked softly.

“I’ll be right here Mrs. Potts. Keep your phone near by I’ll call you when they arrive.”

“Thank you. Tell her staff to go home as well please?” Pepper asked the young man.

“Of course.” Timothy said as Pepper made her way to the elevator.

Chapter End Notes

I’m sorry I had to end this chapter here! But I feared it would be too long. Much love, thank you guys for reading

Chapter 11

Pepper stepped off the elevator and headed straight for Agatha’s office. Tricia was sitting in her chair looking absolutely horrified.

“Tricia. Go home, or down to the therapist’s office to talk about it.” Pepper instructed.

“Thank you ma’am” Tricia said hollowly as she got up and made her way towards the exit.

“I’m here. It’s okay. You are safe.” was what Pepper heard as she opened Agatha’s office door. Rio’s soothing voice calming Agatha on the floor. Pepper slowly walked around the desk to see Agatha curled against Rio, her head nestled into the crux of Rio’s neck. A soothing hand running up and down Agatha’s back as she shook.

“Hey, it’s Pepper.” Pepper said softly as she crouched down. She looked over Agatha before she reached out and placed a gentle hand on Agatha’s shoulder.

“So… Sorry Pepp..” Agatha started to say brokenly.

“No. No apologizing. It’s okay. You’re okay. We are okay. Just breathe. Four counts in, hold for five, exhale for six.” Pepper instructed. Rio was still running her hand along Agatha’s back as the other held one of Agatha’s hands. Agatha listened and started doing the breathing exercise.

“Good, tell me 5 things you can see.” Pepper instructed after Agatha calmed down a little.

“Carpet. Window, You, Rio, shoes.” Agatha answered shakily.

“Good. Four things you can feel or touch.” Pepper guided.

“Rio’s hands, your hand, my rings, my tie.” Agatha responded a little calmer.

“Awesome. Three things you can hear?” Pepper asked.

“Your voice. Rio’s heartbeat, my stupid ass clock!” Agatha said as she was finally starting to calm down. Overwhelming fear had been replaced with irritation.

“And two things you can smell?” Pepper requested.

“Rio’s perfume, Rio’s shampoo.” Agatha answered, feeling more at ease.

“One thing you can taste?” Pepper questioned.

“Bile.” Agatha answered.

“Gross Agatha.” Pepper scolded softly before continuing. “Welcome back.”

“Thank you.” Agatha said weakly. Pepper could feel Rio’s eyes on her. She looked up and locked eyes with the woman holding her friend. Clearly questioning her as to where she got this information.

“When you’re married to Tony Stark, you learn how to handle panic attacks.” Pepper answered.

“Oh.” Rio said softly.

“I still have meetings to attend to.” Agatha said trying to recompose herself, attempting to focus on anything but what just happened.

“No, those are canceled. I’m sending your whole staff home. You just sit right here until you’re ready to get up. Then Rio is gunna take you home and we will figure this all out in the morning. Okay?” Pepper asked softly.

“Yes Pepper.” Agatha said with tears in her eyes, still feeling overwhelmed and broken. Then Peppers phone started ringing. She pulled it out and answered it.

“The police are here.” Is all Pepper needed to hear.

“Thank you, I’ll be right down.” Pepper said into the phone before hanging up. She then turned to look at Rio. “I have to go handle this. You’ve got her, right?”

“I’ve got her, thanks for your help.” Rio said honestly as she held Agatha.

“Any time. I’ll be back up as soon as I can.” Pepper said as she stood back up and left the office. Once the door was shut Agatha turned and pressed a soft kiss to Rio’s neck.

“I’ve got you, I promise.” Rio reassured.

“I know.” Agatha said with a sigh. She was still full of fear, but she knew she was safe in Rio’s arms.

“Give me your hand, I want to try something.” Rio requested. Agatha lifted her hand up and gave it to Rio. Rio took a deep calming breath and then thought about her family’s cabin, the woods that feel so ancient and youthful all at once. Things that used to calm her the most as a child, then she slid Agatha’s hand under her shirt and pressed it against the sigil. A wave of calm and joy flooded through Agatha.

“Woah!” Agatha said before a giggle erupted from her chest. She felt so much calmer.

“Good. Keep your hand there.” Rio told Agatha as she closed her eyes and thought about the first time she seen Agatha. How instantly smitten she was with the woman. Then she moved onto the feelings that have been growing over the last few days. Every moment that made her heart soar when she was with Agatha.

“What are you thinking about?” Agatha asked quietly, her stomach was in knots and her heart felt like it was going to explode because it was so full of love.

“You.” Rio said honestly before she placed a soft kiss to Agatha’s forehead.

“Horrible.” Agatha joked trying to lighten the mood.

“I know right? How could someone so amazing make me feel like this? I’ll never know.” Rio said truthfully.

“Stop, I’ll cry again.” Agatha said softly.

“I don’t want that. I just want you to know how you make me feel.” Rio said as she kissed Agatha’s forehead again.

“How did you get to me you’ve never been here before.” Agatha asked, trying to connect the dots.

“I don’t know what you did on your end, but one moment I’m standing in my empty book store waiting for a text back from you. The next I’m feeling every ounce of dread and anxiety there is on the planet. You must’ve touched your sigil because I could feel you tugging so hard on it, it was like you were yanking on a lifeline for someone to pull you out of some hole. After the second tug I magicked the bookstore closed and just let you pull me to you. Your magic brought me here.” Rio explained to Agatha as she continued to sooth her hand over Agatha’s back.

“Sorry.” Agatha apologized.

“You called. I came. I will always come to you when you call for me.” Rio explained softly.

“Thank you.” Agatha whispered as she removed her hand from under Rio’s shirt.

“You never have to fear that woman ever again. I’m here, Pepper is digging her heels in deep, and I don’t even want to think about what Wanda is going to do.” Rio said with a shudder. Agatha’s eyes went wide at the realization that her best friend had no clue what was happening.

“Fuck.” Agatha whispered in a tone Rio had never heard before.

“What?” Rio asked softly.

“She’s in the building today…. I think… is it Wednesday?” Agatha asked trying to collect her thoughts.

“Yes.”

“Shit. Shit. shit. shit. I need my phone.” Agatha said in a slightly panicked voice. Rio reached up and grabbed it off the desk and handed it to her. Shaky hands tried their best to unlock the phone. Agatha finally got it open on the third attempt. She had several missed calls from Wanda; She hit the missed call and it started ringing.

“Can I please kill her now?” Wanda asked into the phone, Agatha could hear the rage in her best friend’s voice.

“As your lawyer I don’t advise that. As your best friend, she’s not worth it.” Agatha said into the phone, feeling absolutely exhausted.

“Are you in your office?” Wanda asked, Agatha could hear Wanda’s voice soften, trying to calm down for her friend.

“Yes.”

“Be there in five.” Wanda said into the phone and then hung up.

“What does Wanda do?” Rio asked.

“She’s a floating therapist for Stark Industries. She travels from building to building all week. Wednesday’s she’s here.”

“Good to know.” Rio said as she pulled Agatha closer to her.

“Magic takes the path of least resistance” Agatha said honestly as she leaned against Rio a little more and sighed. They sat there for a long moment before Agatha groaned loudly. “My ass hurts.”

“So does mine, but I’m staying right here until you want me to get up.” Rio reassured.

“I want to get up.” Agatha said as she tried to pull away from Rio who gave her some resistance but finally let her go. She got up quickly before helping Rio up. As they were holding hands from the assist up Wanda walked in.

“How did you get here so fast?” Wanda asked looking over at Rio.

“Goddesses is that a loaded question.” Agatha said as she started packing all her things up and started shutting everything off.

“I’ll explain later, wanna help me get her home?” Rio asked softly, knowing Agatha was fragile right now.

“Did you drive here?” Wanda asked as she walked over to Agatha and took her into her arms. She hugged Agatha like they’d done this a million times before. Wanda was holding Agatha’s head softly with one hand while the other rubbed up and down her back. It felt so strange for Rio, she wasn’t jealous about it. She actually could feel how comforted Agatha felt by Wanda.

“No. I was dragged/teleported here.” Rio explained which caused Wanda to look at her with a raised eyebrow.

“It’s a long story.” Agatha said as she pulled away from Wanda and turned to grab Rio’s hand before saying. “We will explain later. I just want to go home.”

“I have to go back down and finish my shift. The only reason I knew anything was because Tricia was a little horrified and asked to speak to me personally.” Wanda said honestly.

“Tricia! Is she okay?” Agatha asked in a horrified tone, realizing what her secretary experienced.

“She’s fine, let’s focus on you for now.” Wanda said as she guided Agatha and Rio out of the office. “I’ll get you down to her car and then you can take her back to her place. I’ll be home around 5:30.”

“I can do that.” Rio said as she guided Agatha over to the elevator.

“What about…” Agatha started to ask.

“No, stop worrying about everyone else. You need to worry about you.” Wanda said cutting Agatha off. Agatha huffed at her best friend who gave her a pointed look.

“Fine. I’m too emotionally exhausted to argue.” Agatha said as she leaned against Rio. They got on the elevator and made it down to the lobby that was congested and full of staff members still. Agatha looked panicked for a moment before Rio took her hand and Wanda quickly guided her out a side door toward the parking lot. Wanda rushed them over to Agatha’s car and handed Rio the keys to Agatha’s car.

“Get her home. I’ll be there soon. Thank you Rio.” Wanda said as she helped get Agatha into the car.

“Thank you Wanda.” Rio said softly. Wanda looked down at Rio and smiled brightly at her.

“I’m gunna hug you now.” Wanda said before she hugged the woman tightly. Rio was shocked and hugged Wanda back softly. “Thank you for coming into our lives. I’ll get her favorite snacks on the way home. Keep her calm. There’s a weighted blanket stashed in the hope chest at the end of the bed. Draw her a bath and force her to soak for a little while if she has another attack. It always seems to calm her down.” Wanda reassured.
