“Thanks for the advice. I’ll get your number out of her phone and text you when we get there. I appreciate you, tell Pepper I appreciate her too if you see her.” Rio said as she let go.

“I will, now I’ve gotta handle this shit.” Wanda said before she ran off. Rio sighed and climbed into the car and started it. She looked over at Agatha who seemed to be staring at her hands intensely. Rio sighed softly and backed it out of the space before she reached over and placed her hand softly on Agatha’s knee.

“I’m right here.” Rio said softly as she squeezed Agatha’s knee. She focused on driving back to Agatha’s place, a few moments later Agatha grabbed Rio’s hand softly with her own.

“Thank you.” Agatha mumbled, Rio shook her head as she continued to drive.

~Stark Law Offices~

“Alright! Clear out! If you need counseling go to the third floor. If you need to collect your items or shut off your computers go back to your desks and do so then head home!” Pepper announced over the intercom disrupting the chatter in the main lobby. Most of the employees took the hint and dispersed. Wanda walked over to where Pepper was standing at the desk.

“Wanda, we need to have a serious conversation.” Pepper said as she brought the woman toward the elevator.

“What is the plan?” Wanda asked.

“Oh, she’s been arrested. I’m about to pull some strings to make sure it’s impossible for her to make bail.” Pepper said as she pressed the up button.

“May I make a suggestion?” Wanda asked.

“You may.” Pepper said as they stepped into the elevator.

“Call a head coven counsel meeting. Summon the heads of several covens to sit as the jury for this trial. I recommend the defense use memory sharing spells so they can see this woman for the vile creature she is. Also may I suggest a glamor dissolving spell as well. No prettying up anything for anyone involved.”

“You cannot expect several large coven heads to show up to jury duty.”

“Oh, they will for a trial against Evanora Harkness.” Wanda explained.

“How could you possibly know that?” Pepper asked as she stepped off the elevator.

“That woman has made enemy’s of many.” Wanda said with a shrug.

“Now that I believe.” Pepper said as she opened the door of her office and let Wanda in. “I’ll consider it. But we cannot do this the wrong way, it must be executed perfectly. No tricks, no hand picked jury, nothing. Evanora has to dig her own grave.”

“Yes, but she is a coven head. A jury of your peers… so to say.” Wanda said honestly.

“Every person on the jury must have magical abilities, and a full understanding of what it means to be a spirit witch. Those are the conditions I’m sending the judge. The rest is in the universes hands.” Pepper said as she sat down at her desk and reached for her phone.

“Perfect, more than I could’ve ever asked for.” Wanda said as she turned to walk back out the door.

“One more thing…” Pepper said, haulting Wanda’s steps.

“Yeah?” Wanda asked not bothering to turn around.

“How weak is Evanora?” Pepper asked.

“Most of her power is gone from the siphoning. Someone helped her with that glamor spell. I suggest we find out who.” There was a long pause before Wanda spoke again. “Oh, and Rio says thank you.” Wanda said as she opened the door and walked out, leaving Pepper alone in her office with a simmering anger that she wouldn’t be able to quell for quite some time.

With a sigh Pepper picked up the phone and made a phone call to the courthouse, it rang a few times before someone picked up.

“Judge Heart’s Chambers.” A man spoke into the phone.

“It’s Pepper Potts. You are about to have a thick file come across your desk. My company is personally pressing charges against Evanora Harkness.” Pepper said into the phone. A loud sigh came through the receiver, he hated hearing that name.

“What did she do this time?” He asked.

“Broke the PPO again, but this time she actually made it into the building to harass Agatha.”

“I’m setting the bail so high she won’t be able to get enough money together by the time her court date comes.” He said as he rubbed his eyes. He was tired of this woman. It seemed like every five or six years she popped up to harass Agatha.

“I had a suggestion made to me… One that you absolutely do not have to take into consideration at all. But it may get us somewhere.” Pepper suggested.

“I’m listening.”

“Trial judged by her actual peers. Call coven heads in to be the jury. Require they use a glamor dampening potion and possibly a memory sharing spell. Let her memories dig her own grave.”

“I shall consider these things. Thank you Mrs. Potts.”

“Thank you Judge Heart.”

“You know she’s gunna have to be a witness this time, right?” He asked into the phone.

“I know. Fortunately this time… she’ll have someone there to support her who loves her. Well besides Wanda, Pietro, and I.” Pepper said into the phone.

“Now that… is new?”

“It is but I think she’s here for the long haul.” Pepper said into the phone before continuing. “Thank you. Have a great night. Now I gotta go deal with my egregious security team.”

“Good luck with that.” The judge said with a chuckle before he hung up.

Pepper sighed and took a long moment to herself before she picked her phone up again and called her husband.

“Pepper! You never call me before you leave work!” Tony said as he continued to tinker with something.

“Evanora Harkness managed to make it into the building today.” Pepper said into the phone. A loud clang resounded through the phone.

“Excuse me? How did she get past my security measures?” Tony said in an irritated tone, as he grabbed the wrench off the floor that he had dropped.

“Someone made her a very heavy glamor spell. I need your help finding out who.”

“I’ll call Strange and get back to you.” He said as he started to pull up the man’s contact information.

“Thank you. I appreciate it. If he needs to come to the office, the entire floor has been evacuated. She couldn’t make it past Agatha’s protection spell she had on her office door.”

“Good, thank god for contingency plans.” Tony said into the phone. “I love you, go handle business. I’ll see you tonight.”

“I love you.” Pepper said before she hung up the phone. She didn’t want to deal with the security team’s horrible response time. It shouldn’t have taken them that long to get upstairs. But she had to, for Agatha’s sake and the rest of her employees.

~At Agatha’s~

Rio had placed Agatha on the couch with a bottle of water and a kiss on the head as she drew her a bath. She was in the bathroom enchanting the water with soothing properties when her phone started ringing in her pocket.

Rio stopped for a moment and grabbed her phone to see it was her mother calling. With a sigh she answered the call. “Momma, I will call you back.”

“Why was Evanora Harkness arrested today?” Rita asked her daughter.

“I will call you back. More important things need attended to than talking about that vile woman.” Rio said into the phone trying to focus on the spell she was using to create a calming bath for Agatha.

“Okay. Are you with Agatha?”

“Yes Momma. I love you. Goodbye.” Rio said softly into the phone.

“Love you.” Rita said into the phone before disconnecting the line.

Rio sighed loudly as she looked at the water in the tub that was glowing a soft green. She walked out of the bathroom into Agatha’s bedroom then out into the living room.

“I drew you a bath babe. Come with me.” Rio said as she offered her hand to Agatha. Agatha sighed loudly and took Rio’s hand as she got up from the couch. Rio guided her into the bathroom and turned Agatha toward her. She helped Agatha undress slowly, taking extra care to make sure she felt safe. Then she guided her into the tub and placed a soft kiss on her head.

“Thank you for taking care of me.” Agatha said with a sigh as she sunk into the water. Rio sat down on the floor next to the tub so she could be close to Agatha.

“You don’t need to thank me. I’ll always be there for you when you need me.” Rio reassured.

“But you shouldn’t have to be! I’m thirty six years old. I should’ve handled it myself, you had to close the bookstore because of me! I ruin everything!” Agatha said in a frustrated tone.

“You didn’t ruin anything, tell me something. If I was in distress and I called for you. What would you do?” Rio asked.

“I’d tell Tricia to hold down the fort and be by your side in a heartbeat. If I was in court I would have asked for a recess. I would have gotten to you no matter what.” Agatha said honestly.

“So you’re allowed to do that for me, but I’m not allowed to do that for you?” Rio pried.

“But you just opened your store…” Agatha defended.

“And it will open tomorrow like nothing ever happened. In a few months I’ll be able to hire an employee or two and then I’ll never have to close the store ever again. Right now. You matter more.” Rio said reassuringly.

“But I shouldn’t.” Agatha said as she felt tears well up in her eyes.

“I know that woman has done more damage than anyone can repair, but I am not her. You matter to me, you are someone I care about, you are deserving of love and care. So stop assuming you deserve nothing, you deserve the world. You deserve everything I do for you, and Wanda does for you, and Pepper does. She isn’t your inner voice, stop letting her take up space in your wellbeing and mind.” Rio said softly.

“I’ll try.” Agatha responded.

“That’s more than I could ever ask for. Now, relax for me please.” Rio begged softly. Then her phone dinged in her pocket. Rio sighed exasperatedly as she pulled her phone out of her pocket.

“Do you need to make a phone call?” Agatha asked.

“No, my mother is just being my mother.” Rio said softly as she looked at the message.

Rita Vidal (ICE) 4:15 p.m: I found your great grandmothers spell book. There’s something you both need to see. Attachment Image.

The writing on the page was visible so Rio could read it.

I, Violet Vidal, am of the belief that spirit witches are not born but made. We are a result of our environment. My mother and father were cruel to me because my powers didn’t manifest at all. I was abused and neglected by them for many years before one day my body finally had enough and something inside of me snapped.

My mother was punishing me for making another mistake that was unavoidable. As if by magic my powers flared to life. She struck me hard, and then my magic began to siphon her magic from her body. My father did not know how to handle the moment and attacked me as well. I drained them of their life force and magic.

My aunt has taken me in and told me she will care for me as her own. I am scared and horrified. I am only 16 and an orphan by my own hands.

Rio sat there and reread the photo several times over. Then she sent a quick text to her mother

Rio 4:20 p.m: Momma, we need more proof than that but it’s a good start.

Rita Vidal (ICE) 4:21 p.m: already on it. Take care of my daughter in law.

Rio sighed and tucked her phone away from a moment.

“What was that?” Agatha asked, her eyes were closed but she could hear Rio sigh.

“Nothing we need to worry about right now. I just want to focus on you. But I need to go get Wanda’s number from your phone real quick so I can text her.” Rio said softly as she stood up.

“Grab me a towel so I can dry my hands off and I’ll put it in your phone. It hasn’t changed since we were 20.” Agatha said as she raised her hand out of the water, Rio grabbed a towel and let Agatha dry her hands off before handing her, her phone. Agatha typed the number into Rio’s contacts and handed it back to her.

“Thank you my love.” Rio said without thinking. Agatha paused for a moment but decided to not say anything because Rio was occupied with sending Wanda a message. A soft smile spread across Agatha’s face as she sunk deeper into the water. It wasn’t a confession but it wasn’t not one either.

Rio 4:30 p.m: Hey, it’s Rio. Got Agatha soaking in a soothing bath. She’s calm but i figured it would help. Once she’s done I’ll get her into bed or on the couch with the weighted blanket.

“Alright, sent Wanda a text. Do you want to soak longer or do you want to get out and cuddle?” Rio asked softly as she brushed some of Agatha’s hair out of her face.

“I’d rather be cuddling with you but this bath is very soothing.”

“We have all night for that. Just enjoy the bath. I’m gunna go grab a drink, do you want anything?” Rio asked as she stood up.

“Water is probably the safest bet. Alcohol sounds like a bad idea.” Agatha said honestly.

“I’ll be right back.” Rio said as she bent down and gave Agatha a soft kiss on the forehead.

“Can I have a real kiss before you go?” Agatha asked.

“Of course.” Rio said before she gave Agatha a soft kiss on the lips. Rio ran out into the kitchen and grabbed herself a bottle of water before snatching the bottle she had given Agatha off the couch. Before she made her way back into the bathroom.

“I’m back. Here you go.” Rio said as she handed Agatha her bottle.

“Thank you.” Agatha said softly before she opened the bottle and chugged it.

“Want me to refresh the water?” Rio asked looking at the tub.

“No, I want out honestly.” Agatha answered. Rio grabbed a big fluffy towel and stood next to the tub ready to wrap Agatha up in it. Agatha leaned forward and unplugged the tub before she stood up and stepped out of the tub.

“Let’s get you dressed in something comfy and cuddle up on the couch until Wanda gets here.” Rio suggested.

“Sounds perfect.” Agatha said as she leaned into Rio’s embrace.

Chapter 12

Rio made sure Agatha was dressed as comfortably as possible and nestled on the couch in a little nest of pillows and blankets with the weighed blanket over her. Then she took a few moments to collect her thoughts.

“Do you want to read what my mother sent me?” Rio asked as she pulled her phone out and slapped it against her hand. Like she was debating on even giving Agatha this information.

“My day cannot possibly get any worse. Sure. Let me read it.” Agatha said honestly as she held her hand out for Rio to hand her the phone. Rio pulled the photo up and handed it to Agatha. Then she sat down and braced for impact. She could feel her own anxiety bubble up as Agatha read the passage from her great grandmothers spell book.

Then, something amazing and quite shocking happened Agatha begun to laugh. Like a real authentic laugh that scared Rio even more than if Agatha had been angry.

“If that’s true, I no longer feel guilty about almost killing her 20 years ago! How can we prove this?” Agatha said as she calmed down.

“Really? You want to know if we can prove it?” Rio asked excitedly, all her anxiety and fear melting away.

“Yes, because if it’s her fault I’m a spirit witch then she has no one to blame for her own problems other than herself! She created this ‘monster’ herself.” Agatha said with a shake of her head.

“Do you want me to call my mom? She said she was working on something.” Rio asked.

“Fuck it! Put her on speaker.” Agatha told Rio. Rio took her phone back from Agatha and called her mom on speaker.

“You better be taking care of her, why are you calling me back?” Rita said into the phone softly.

“I showed her the photo. She asked me to call you.” Rio explained

“Hello Mrs. Vidal.” Agatha greeted the woman.

“Oh. Oh! Hello witchlett! I hope my daughter has been caring for you well!” Rita said into the phone.

“She has, very well in-fact.” Agatha answered.

“What have you been working on Momma?” Rio asked.

“Well, I’ve managed to get ahold of three of the five other spirit witches in the United States.” Rita said into the phone.

“How?” Agatha asked in a confused tone.

“Now… let’s not worry too much about that.”

“You asked Lilia for their names and phone numbers didn’t you.” Rio asked in a frustrated tone.

“Hey! When you are best friends with one of the most powerful diviners in the world. You cash in a favor…”

“Wait… Lilia Calderu?” Agatha asked.

“Yes, why?” Rita asked Agatha.

“I’ve heard of her. She’s extremely difficult to get a hold of supposedly.” Agatha said with a shrug.

“For most, yes. Me personally? Never. Anyway, on to what we were talking about. I have spoken to three of them already since I found out Evanora was arrested today.” Rita said into the phone.

“And? Was great grandma right?” Rio asked her mother.

“That seems to be the general consensus. 16 years old, abused their whole lives, something just snaps, dead abusers.” Rita summarizes.

“That’s the most fucked up version of karma I’ve ever heard of.” Agatha mentions.

“The only difference here is that Evanora managed to live.” Rita explained.

“So… We blame Wanda.” Rio joked.

“No! We don’t blame Wanda.” Agatha said in an exasperated tone.

“What are we blaming me for? I probably deserve to be blamed.” Wanda said as she walked into the house carrying a few plastic bags and something that looked like a brown paper sack.

“Call me back when you get settled, it sounds like Agatha’s best friend just arrived. I’m going to try and get ahold of the other two.” Rita said into the phone.

“I love you momma. Thank you.” Rio said into the phone.

“Love you too baby.” Rita said before she hung up the phone.

“Sorry! Didn’t mean to interrupt your phone call.” Wanda said as she set the bags on the coffee table.

“It’s fine, we are just learning things.” Agatha said as she looked at the bags curiously.

“What did we learn? I got you your favorite snacks, chocolate, and soda. I also picked up Chinese food.” Wanda said as she pulled out a few things from the bags.

Rio took a long moment to memorize everything that Wanda was pulling out of the bags. Honey mustard pretzels, twizzlers, Reese’s peanut butter cups, Root-beer, salt and vinegar chips, and several other things that Rio lost track of.

“Oh, that Evanora has no one to blame but herself.” Agatha said as she grabbed the bag of pretzels and a soda.

“We knew that but I have a feeling you mean something else.” Wanda said as she looked over at Rio.

“My mother has been contacting the five other spirit witches in the United States and is learning how their powers manifested.” Rio explained.

“Color me intrigued! What have we learned?” Wanda asks excitedly as she got rid of empty bags by putting them in another bag.

“That they all experienced the same thing I did. Years of abuse, something happens at the age of 16 and their magic snaps into place, parent strikes them with magic, ding dong dead parents.” Agatha said with a shrug.

“Oh…. So that’s why I’m being blamed. Because I unintentionally saved Evanora’s life.” Wanda said suddenly realizing.

“Unfortunately.” Rio said with a shrug.

“I didn’t stop the siphoning because I wanted to save her life. I stopped it because I wanted to save yours.” Wanda said as she sat down next to Agatha.

“I appreciate that, I really do.” Agatha said as she nudged Wanda with her shoulder.

“So what do we do with this information?” Wanda asked.

“Nothing at the moment. But… it has taken a weight off my shoulders.” Agatha said softly.

“Great! I’m glad you are feeling much better about things.” Wanda told Agatha, then she turned and leaned forward to grab the Chinese. “Now who wants Crab Rangoons?”

“Please don’t tell me that’s a whole bag of them!?” Agatha asked in an exasperated tone.

“What if it is?” Wanda asked knowing they were Agatha’s favorite. Agatha sighed loudly and Rio burst out laughing at the woman’s antics.

“Seriously? A whole bag?” Agatha asked as Wanda opened it and handed Agatha a cup of sweet and sour sauce and a styrofoam container.

“Yes, a whole bag. Today was a bad day. Crab Rangoons make it better.” Wanda said with a bright smile.

“She’s definitely a chaos witch.” Rio said with a chuckle as she looked over at the two of them.

“This is why I cook breakfast for us every morning. That way I’m guaranteed she eats one balanced meal a day.” Agatha said as she shook her head.

~Meanwhile At The High Security Institution For The Magically Inclined~

Evanora was in her cell, stewing in her own anger when she felt something shift. She looked up from her bunk to see an entity in the corner. A woman in black stood in the corner, she was holding a scythe. Evanora could see her skull through the paper thin skin on her face.

“Evanora Harkness.” A voice that sounded like thousands of souls speaking at once resounded through the cell. Evanora was paralyzed with fear. Her whole body started to shake as the being stepped closer to her.

“No! It’s not my time!” Evanora finally screeched out after a long moment.

“It is not, though that doesn’t mean you are undeserving of death. If you ever bother my grandchild or her bride again. My next visit will not be so kind.” Death said as she stepped forward again.

“Who is your grandchild?” Evanora asked full of fear.

“Rio Vidal, The green witch. The next in line to take my place as Death. Your daughter is her fated bride. If you bother either of them again. I will bend the rules. I will take you. For now, consider this your final warning.” Death told the woman sitting on the bed. Evanora was horrified, she felt herself grow weaker as the woman moved closer.

“You cannot harm me!” Evanora yelled flinching in fear.

“Who said I’d harm you?” Death asked as she tilted her head to the side. She stepped closer to the woman who was shaking on the bed in fear.

“No in-fact, I think I’ll just do the whole world a favor and take what little power you have left. It only seems fair. You don’t use it for anything sensible or good anyway.” Then death ran a cold knuckle down the side of Evanora’s face, collecting the last of her blue magic in her palm and smiled at the woman.

“Hasta la próxima Evanora Harkness.” Death said as she disappeared from the cell.

“You can’t do this to me! I don’t deserve this!” Evanora yelled into the empty room.

~Agatha’s Place~

All three women were cuddled up on the couch watching something stupid on the t.v. When Rio’s phone rang again. Wanda grabbed the remote and paused the show.

“Hey Momma, what did you learn.” Rio asked as she answered the phone and put it on speaker.

“Our current theory is correct. Even down to the age it happened.” Rita said into the phone.

“Fascinating.” Agatha said as she processed the information, before she came to a realization. “Wait! Are they all okay? They had to relive their trauma because of me.” Agatha said guiltily.

“No sweetie, that’s not how these conversations went down. I called them and told them about you and your current situation and what you experienced. They were more than willing to give up information once they found out that this wasn’t something exclusive to them. All of them were relieved to hear they weren’t alone.” Rita explained.

“It is nice to know we are the smallest group of witches for a reason.” Agatha answered honestly.

“I’m shocked there aren’t more.” Wanda blurted out.

“Wanda!” Agatha scolded.

“Honestly I’m inclined to agree with Wanda.” Rio told the group of women.

“Rio!” Agatha scolded her girlfriend this time.

“Maybe it depends on the abuse?” Rita asked over the phone.

“What do you mean Momma?” Rio asked in a confused tone.

“It seems like every case of Spirit witch development was brought on by severe abuse, neglect, fear, and pain.” Rita explained.

“Let’s not talk about that right now.” Wanda said trying to protect Agatha.

“I’m fine. I promise.” Agatha said as she placed a hand over Wanda’s, before she adds. “But yeah I don’t want to relive any more of that today. Please and Thank you.”

“Of course witchlett! No need to bring up anymore pain today. What are you girls doing?” Rita asked.

“Eating an ungodly amount of Crab Rangoons, junk food and watching tv.” Rio said into the phone.

“Good! Am I to expect you this Saturday?” Rita asked.

“Me? Yes. Agatha…” Rio trailed off.

“I have a ton of damage control I have to do tomorrow. My boss canceled my last two meetings today.” Agatha said honestly.

“If you are free, and have the time you are more than welcome to come.” Rita said honestly.

“Thank you. I appreciate the offer.” Agatha said appreciatively.

“I must call Lilia back, let her know what I’ve found out. Have a great night girls.I love you Rio.” Rita said into the phone.

“Goodnight Momma! Love you!” Rio said before she hung up the phone. Rio looked over at Wanda and Agatha after she hung up the phone and both of them had different expressions. Wanda looked like she wanted to make a joke but was trying to hold it back. Agatha just looked happy.

“Just say it Wanda.” Rio said with a huff.

“It’s so cute you still call your mom, Momma. Literally the most adorable thing ever.” Wanda said with a nose wrinkle.

“Watch it Wanda, I’ll have my girlfriend beat you up for picking on me!” Rio joked.

“Oh I’m so scared!” Wanda jabbed back. Both women then started laughing.

“I’m limiting the time you two spend together…” Agatha said in a completely serious tone causing both women to look at her as if they were offended.

“That reminds me. It’s getting late. You should go lay down you know how hard you sleep on days like this.” Wanda said as she stood up and started cleaning up the mess they had all made.

“Who’s staying?” Agatha asked.

“I am.” Rio answered.

“I’m a text away.” Wanda said with a shrug. Before she continued to clean. Rio got up and stretched, her shirt rising slightly as she did so.

“How many tattoos do you have?” Wanda asked as she caught a flash of color before the shirt settled.

“Three so far. But the vines are really like a sleeve.”

“What’s the one on your hip?”

“Six Poppy flowers growing out of a skull’s eye sockets sitting on two monstera leaves.” Agatha explained. As she took the weighted blanket off herself and stood up.

“Got them all memorized already I see.” Wanda joked.

“Not justifying that with a response.” Agatha said as she helped collect all the junk food on the coffee table. She followed Wanda into the kitchen and put stuff away. They got everything taken care of and put the left over Crab Rangoons in the fridge.

“I love you Aggie, don’t you forget that. I’m gunna head home and call Pietro and let him know what’s going on. Unless you don’t want me to?” Wanda asked.

“You can call him now. That way you can take him with you when you leave. Tell him you already got me snacks though. Remember last time?” Agatha asked as they walked back out into the living room. Rio walked over to Agatha and took her hand in hers.

“What are we doing?” Rio asked softly as Agatha leaned her head against Rio’s.

“I’m calling my brother.” Wanda told Rio as she pulled her phone out and dialed him. It rang once.

“What’s up sis?”

“Evanora Harkness was arrested today. She managed to make it into the building and up to Agatha’s office. Rio and I have been spending time with her and I spoiled her with snacks.” Wanda said into the phone. There was a long pause, like an even longer pause than Wanda expected.

Then the front door flew open and shut quickly. Rio was gently moved aside and Agatha was wrapped up in the biggest softest hug Pietro could muster. Rio noticed Wanda and Pietro hug the same way. One arm wrapped around Agatha’s head cradling it against their shoulder and chest while the other ran up her back and pressed their palm flat between her shoulder blades. Agatha hugged him back tightly, for a long moment before pulling away.

“You okay?” Pietro asked softly as he pulled away and checked Agatha over.

“Yes, but I was about to go to bed. I’m very tired. If you want to go home with Wanda she can fill you in.” Agatha said honestly.

“That’s okay. I’m only one call away. I’ll stay at her place tonight.” Pietro told Agatha.

“Thank you two. You’re the best siblings I could’ve asked for.” Agatha told Wanda and Pietro.

“I don’t know. I could live without him sometimes.” Wanda joked before grabbing her brother by the arm and dragging him to the door. “Come on Zippy, let’s go home.”

“Bye Agatha, Bye Rio.” Pietro said before the door shut quietly.

“Let’s go lay down.” Rio said softly as she used her magic to lock the door and shut off the lights. They made their way into the bedroom and climbed into bed before they shut off the lights. Once it was dark and they were under the covers Agatha pressed her ear to Rio’s chest so she could listen to her heartbeat.

“Thank you for taking care of me today.” Agatha said sleepily.

“You’re welcome, but there’s no reason to thank me.” Rio mumbled out as she pressed a soft kiss to the crown of Agatha’s head.

“Get used to me thanking you. I’m going to do it for the rest of our lives.” Agatha said with a yawn. Before she slid her hand under Rio’s shirt and pressed a finger to the sigil. Rio felt an overwhelming sense of calm and comfort. “That’s how you make me feel.” Agatha said slowly as she drifted off.

Rio’s heart swelled as her eyes filled with tears. She held Agatha close as she drifted off to sleep. Neither woman any the wiser about the fact that their lives were about to get a little easier.

~ Meanwhile At The High Security Institution For The Magically Inclined~

Evanora couldn’t even muster up a single spark of magic any more. Her little bit of glamor she had left faded completely after death had visited her.

“I’m powerless!” Evanora said in a frustrated tone. Then there was a knock on the cell door before it opened.

“You have a visitor.” The guard said as they opened the door.

“It’s past visitation.” Evanora said grumpily as she got up off the bed and walked over to the door.

“When this person says they want to speak to someone. We don’t argue. Now move.” The guard said as the held the gauntlets out for Evanora to put on.

“Absolutely unnecessary.” Evanora said as she held her hands out. The gauntlets locked around them and then didn’t glow at all. The guard looked at them suspiciously.

“I told you it was unnecessary.” Evanora said as the guard guided her down the hall and into the visitation room where two men were sitting at a table.

“Thank you for meeting with us Evanora Harkness.” The taller man said as he looked down at the woman.

“And you are?” She asked unsure of who the two men were.

“Well, I am Dr. Stephan Strange and this is my friend and co-worker Tony Stark. And we have a few questions for you. Please take a seat.”

“I don’t have to answer any of your questions. I know my rights.” Evanora seethed.

“That is true. But we aren’t cops. Our lawyer isn’t here. This is just a friendly conversation.” Tony explained.

“Yeah right.” She scoffed at the man.

“Honestly, we just wanted to know who helped you create the glamor spell that got you into my building.” Tony explained.

“That’s none of your concern.” Evanora hissed out.

“That’s fine, but I am curious. What happened in the last few hours that you are now completely powerless. When you arrived here you were labeled as a danger level 1. Now I can’t even detect a hint of magic in you.” Stephen said to Evanora.

“Ya know. I do think that is quite interesting. I noticed the gauntlets weren’t glowing at all when she walked into the room. Seems like somebody ran out of juice.” Tony said as he held his hands together and pointed both index fingers at them before tapping them to his mouth.

“You fowl mouthed cretin! Haven’t I been through enough? First my horrible daughter steals most of my power! Then! Her friend hexes me into the next century! When I finally get a chance to give the horrible little bitch a taste of her own medicine. I’m arrested for stupid shit like trespassing and breaking a PPO! So I’m thrown in this hellish place for something dumb and moronic. The last of my power was taken by Death herself! I don’t deserve this! I have done nothing wrong! Spirit witches are the scum of the earth and should not exist!” Evanora yelled at the two men as she slammed the gauntlets down on the table.

Two guards appeared a moment later and started to drag her off back to her cell.

“Death?” Tony asked after the door shut.

“Hey, I’ve never personally met the entity. But I’m aware of her existence.” Stephen said honestly.

“That will be unpacked later. Let’s go.” Tony said as he tapped the side of his glasses.

“Got all that Pepper?”

“Yep!” Pepper said loudly through Tony’s glasses.

“Perfect. Alright Strange, Let’s head to the office. Maybe you can find a trail of magic.” Tony suggested.

“Way ahead of you.” Strange said as she opened a portal to the office and stepped through it.

“Can you believe she called me a cretin?” Tony asked as he stepped through.

“Honestly…” Stephen said with a chuckle. “Yes, you have that effect on people who think they are better than everyone else.”

“You’ve wanted to call me one haven’t you?” Tony joked.

“Yes. Because you are irritatingly right all of the time. Now shush. Let me focus.” Stephen said as he walked around the office he found a trail of blue magic and followed it.“You good if I leave you here?”

“Yeah, I’m sure Pepper is still around here somewhere.” Tony said as he opened the door and walked toward the elevator.

“I’ll call you with what I find.”

“Thanks Dr. Strange. I appreciate the assist.” Tony said as he pressed the button for the elevator. Got in and turned around and realized he was alone in the office. He shook his head and hit the top floor button. A short elevator ride later Tony was walking into Peppers office.

“Hey babe, did you get a chance to look at the footage?” Tony said as he looked at his wife who was sitting at the computer chewing her thumbnail.

“Yeah… I’m confused about her power being gone…” Pepper said honestly.

“I really don’t know. Strange said that he’s never met Death but he know’s she exists.”

“Obviously Death exists, we all die. But I have a feeling you are talking about an actual entity.” Pepper said with a shrug.

“I am. But let’s head home. I know you care about Agatha but you need rest.” Tony said honestly.

“You’re right. Let’s go.” Pepper said she got up and closed her laptop before sliding it into her purse. Tomorrow was going to be interesting to say the least.

Chapter 13

Rio woke up first, her alarm blaring loudly from her phone as she reached over and smacked at the device. A groan came from Agatha as she looked at her own phone.

“Nooooooo.” Agatha whined loudly, she didn’t want to get up at all. She nestled her head into Rio’s neck again, hiding against her chest.

“I know my love. I know. But we both have to work today.” Rio said softly as she kissed Agatha on the forehead again.

“Stupid.” Agatha grumbled as she kissed Rio on the chest and neck.

“Don’t start that right now.” Rio groaned as she magicked the light on.

“Fine. I’ll get up and shower alone.” Agatha said with a sigh as she rolled away from Rio.

“Wait! I didn’t say that!” Rio yelled in an exasperated tone.

“You told me not to start anything. If you shower with me… I’ll start something.” Agatha said honestly.

“I’ll set an alarm for 20 minutes and bring my phone into the bathroom. So if we end up doing something we have an alarm.” Rio offered.

“Sounds like a good enough idea.” Agatha said as she got out of bed and took her shirt off, showing Rio her bare back as she went into the bathroom.

“This woman is going to be the death of me.” Rio groaned as she got up and followed Agatha into the bathroom.

Twenty five minutes later they were out of the shower and getting dressed. Agatha decided to wear a black button up, with a lavender tie and a gray suit. She took the time to put her rings on her fingers by hand this morning.

“Oh, I’ve been meaning to ask. Which ring did Pietro put on me the other day?” Rio asked as she looked at Agatha’s hands. Agatha paused for a moment and pulled the ring off her index finger and handed it to Rio.

“This one. It’s the first ring I bought myself after I graduated law school. Honestly, I have no idea why he picked that one.” Agatha said as she pointed to the ring. It was a silver band with ivy leaves etched into it.

“Why ivy leaves?” Rio asked looking at the band, she slid it onto her left ring finger for a moment which made Agatha’s heart flutter.

“I graduated from an Ivy League school. Seemed fitting. Do you want me to magic an outfit onto you?” Agatha said with a shrug.

“Makes sense. Also kind of fitting, that he picked this one ironically, seeing as my arm is covered in Ivy leaves. Would you? I’d appreciate it so much so I don’t have to wear my clothing from yesterday...” Rio explained. Agatha smiled and waved her hand. A moment later, Rio was dressed in a comfy loose fitting deep green tee shirt, black jeans and a cute black leather jacket.

“That seems fitting for you.” Agatha said as she walked over and kissed Rio softly on the lips.

“I guess you’ll want this back, also thank you, I’m very comfy.” Rio said as she took the ring off and handed it to Agatha.

“I appreciate it, thank you.” Agatha said as she slipped the ring onto her hand, it nestling against her second knuckle on her pointer finger.

“Wanda will be here soon demanding breakfast I’m sure.” Rio said with an eye roll.

“I don’t know if I have enough food to feed Pietro, but we will find out.” Agatha said as she turned and headed for the kitchen.

Once they were in the kitchen Agatha threw on an apron and started cooking breakfast for the four of them. Scrambled eggs, ham, and pancakes. She had most of breakfast made by the time the Maximoff twins rushed into the house.

“Breakfast smells great Aggie!” Pietro said as he zipped around the kitchen collecting a plate of food and pouring a generous amount of syrup on everything.

“Ooooooo pancakes!” Wanda said as she sat down at the island next to Rio. “Morning Rio. How did last night go?” Wanda whispered to the woman next to her.

“Fine, we both slept like babies.” Rio answered as Agatha set a plate down in front of Rio. “Thank you babe.”

“Good.” Wanda and Pietro said in unison.

“Here’s your breakfast Wanda.” Agatha said as she placed a plate in front of her best friend. Agatha took two pancakes and some eggs for herself and a slice of ham. “The rest of the pancakes are yours Pietro. Unless Rio and Wanda want more.”

“I’m good, thanks though.” Rio said as she cut into her pancakes and took a bite.

“Just eat them bro. You have to travel across six states to get to work in twenty minutes.” Wanda said with a wave of her hand.

“Thanks!” Pietro said as he grabbed the giant plate of pancakes and covered them in syrup. Literally thirty second’s later the entire plate was gone.

“Woah.” Rio said in a shocked yet impressed tone.

“Alright, eat up. Do you want coffee to go?” Agatha asked Pietro.

“Nah, I’ve got time to stop and get one.” He answered before he walked over to the sink and rinsed his dishes off. “Alright, I love you both, call me if you need me. But I’ve got young minds to teach. Nice to see you again Rio!” Pietro said before he was gone in a flash.

“Honestly, I should’ve made more pancakes…” Agatha said quietly as she watched the front door close.

“He’s a big boy, he will get more food if he needs.” Wanda said as she continued to eat her breakfast. Agatha decided she needed to finish eating her own as well.

“High metabolism?” Rio asked

“He requires 20,000 calories a day. More when he’s running around like this.” Wanda answered.

“I guess the super speed has a benefit of letting him eat fast…” Rio trailed off before she took another bite of food.

“Yeah. Almost ate our parents out of house and home when his powers manifested.” Wanda said as she took a sip of Agatha’s coffee.

“Hey! Get your own!” Agatha scolded. Wanda looked her dead in the eyes as she continued to drink.

“Insufferable.” Agatha grumbled softly as she walked over to the cupboard and grabbed herself an insulated tumbler and made herself a fresh cup of coffee to take into work with her. Wanda finished her breakfast and got up to wash her plate off. Then she grabbed the cup and headed out the door.

“Thanks for breakfast! Have a good day.” Wanda said as she walked out the door with the open cup.

“She really just is the embodiment of ‘I don’t give a fuck.’ Isn’t she?” Rio asked as she watched Wanda leave.

“A thousand percent.” Agatha said before she took her last bite of pancake. “Finish your breakfast, I’ll drop you off at the book store on the way to work.” Agatha said as she cleaned her plate off and then rinsed it in the sink.

“Can I have a to go cup of coffee as well please?” Rio asked before she started stuffing a couple bites into her mouth. Agatha turned around and grabbed another cup and filled it with coffee.

“How do you take it?” Agatha asked as she grabbed the creamer out of the fridge.

“The way you made it the other day was perfect. I like sweet things.” Rio said honestly, Agatha pumped some simple syrup into each cup and then added the creamer before putting the lids on.

“Ready to go?” Agatha asked as Rio stood up and walked over to the sink to rinse off her plate.

“Yeah.” Rio said as she turned around and gave Agatha a kiss on the lips. Agatha handed Rio both the coffees so she could use her hands.

“Let me clean up and grab my briefcase and we will go.” Agatha said as she waved her hand, the kitchen was instantly cleaned and then they walked into the entryway and Agatha grabbed her briefcase and keys. They made their way out of the house and into the car.

Agatha dropped Rio off at the bookstore with a kiss and a goodbye before she rushed off to work herself. She made it in fifteen minutes early. Most of her staff had arrived and was working quietly when she stepped off the elevator. Tricia seen her first and stood up to greet Agatha.

“Good morning Ms. Harkness. Mrs. Potts is in her office waiting for you.” Tricia told her.

“Of course she is. Can I speak to you privately first before I go up there?” Agatha asked.

“Of course.” Tricia said as she followed Agatha into her office and shut the door behind her.

“Are you alright? Wanda told me you came and found her after everything that happened.” Agatha asked as she set her briefcase down.

“I am fine, I was more worried about you than anything. I’ve never seen you that shaken up before. I knew she was your best friend so I went and told her. Was that the wrong thing to do?” Tricia asked in a worried tone.

“No, you didn’t do anything wrong. Thank you for telling her. Do you have any questions?” Agatha asked the woman.

“Yes… You have a girlfriend?” Tricia asked curiously.

“We just started dating but yes. I have a girlfriend.” Agatha answered.

“Awesome! She’s very pretty. I hope she makes you happy.” Tricia said with a smile on her face.

“She does, any other questions?” Agatha asked.

“Actually yes… Is she the reason you wore green yesterday?” Tricia asked.

“Yes, she’s a green witch and I felt like wearing something that reminded me of her.” Agatha answered.

“Makes sense. Your meetings you missed are rescheduled for tomorrow. Now go see Mrs. Potts her message seemed urgent this morning.”

“I’m going I’m going. Do I have court today?” Agatha asked feeling frazzled.

“Not tell next Tuesday. Just a few meetings today and 3 employee reviews.” Tricia answered.

“Not reviews!” Agatha groaned out exasperatedly.

“They hate them just as much as you do.” Tricia reassured.

“Fine, I’m gunna go talk to Pepper now. Make sure nothing crazy happens while I’m gone.” Agatha said as she headed out the door. It seemed like everything went back to business as usual no one even batted an eye as she got in the elevator and headed to the top floor.

Agatha stepped off and headed toward Peppers office. Timothy stood up as Agatha approached his desk.

“Ms. Harkness, Mrs. Potts is waiting for you. Go right on in.” Timothy said as he waited for Agatha to make it to the door before sitting down. Agatha opened the door

“How are you doing today?” Pepper asked as she stood up and walked around the desk.

“Considering yesterday? Great.” Agatha said honestly.

“I have a feeling I’m about to make it even better. Come sit, I have a video to show you.” Pepper said as she pulled her desk chair out for Agatha to sit in.

“Oh really? How is that?” Agatha said as she sat down.

“Have a watch and let me know how you feel afterwords.” Pepper said as she pressed play. Agatha sat and watched her mother have an absolute breakdown but something in the middle of it caught her attention.

“Did she say Death took the last of her power?” Agatha asked as she looked up at Pepper with a strange look on her face. She got that look when she was trying to unravel something.

“Yes. Why? What’s running through that head of yours?” Pepper asked.

“Nothing I can share at the moment. Can you send me this video?” Agatha asked.

“What can’t you share?” Pepper pried.

“Pepper… please. Let me figure this out first. Trust me, once I know for sure… I’ll share.” Agatha said to Pepper.

“Fine. I’ll send you the video.” Pepper relented knowing Agatha wasn’t going to budge.

“Thank you. Now I have to go make a phone call and attend meetings.” Agatha said as she stood up.

“Do you feel a little better knowing she’s completely powerless now?” Pepper asked.

“Yes. Much actually. Thank you for sharing this with me. I appreciate it so much.” Agatha said honestly.

“Good, because here comes the bad news. I need you to testify this time.” Pepper said honestly.

“I was waiting for that. I might have an even better solution to things than just my testimony. But… I have to ask first.” Agatha told Pepper.

“Tell me what it might be and I’ll let you know if it’s a good idea.” Pepper requested.

“So… fuck. I don’t even know where to start… Rio’s great great grandmother was one of the first known documented spirit witches…” Agatha started to say as she paced back and forth while spinning the ring Rio had tried on this morning.

“And?” Pepper asked.

“And she documented in her spell book… that her family abused her because her powers didn’t manifest at all. Then at the age of 16 something snapped while she was being abused. Her powers came to life and she siphoned her mother’s power, her father tried to intervene and she killed both of her parents.” Agatha explained.

“Ooof. So you think spirit witches are created not born?” Pepper asked

“I know they are, Rio’s mother called the most powerful divination witch in the world and asked for their names and phone numbers and spent all night contacting each one.” Agatha explained.

“And the consensus is?” Pepper asked very curious at this point.

“Abusive caretakers, years of neglect, they turn 16, the abuse happens one last time and then dead abusers.” Agatha explained.

“So your ability comes from the fact that your body finally had enough and decided to take over and eliminate the problem.” Pepper explains.

“Yep, all of us had the same shitty experience growing up and unfortunately for everyone but me, it ended in their parent’s deaths.”

“Would it have been so horrible if Evanora died?” Pepper grumbled.

“No one deserves to die, no matter how horrible they are. Also I wouldn’t be here if I had killed her.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“I didn’t think about that...” Pepper said before continuing. “I’d love to have their testimonies, but… I don’t want them on trial for their parents murders.”

“Yeah that’s my only problem.” Agatha said.

“Statute of limitations might be a benefit but if you could get a photo of the spell book page that could be a good start. I’ll have a couple of the interns and PA’s start scavenging the internet and the library of witch craft for any documented proof. Thanks for telling me about this.” Pepper said as she sat down.

“Please send me that video. It’s important.” Agatha requested.

“Doing it now.” Pepper said as she clicked a few buttons.

“Thank you. I’ll text you when I know more.” Agatha said as she grabbed the door handle.

“Good. I’ll let you know when her hearing is.” Pepper said.

“Who’s handling this case?” Agatha said pausing at the door.

“Me. I’m done playing games.” Pepper said in an irritated tone.

“Perfect.” Agatha said as she opened the door and walked out. She made her way back down to her office and cast a heavy sound dampening spell.

“Tricia. Give me twenty minutes. I have to make a very important phone call.” Agatha said before she rushed into the room with-out waiting for a response. Agatha pulled her phone out, confirmed she got the video and then sent it off to Rio. Then she waited. Her phone started ringing a few minutes later.

“Hey. Did you watch it?” Agatha asked into the phone.

“Yeah…” Rio trailed off.

“Violet Vidal the current standing entity of Death isn’t she?” Agatha asked. A heavy sigh resounded through the phone.

“Yes.” Rio answers.

“Well that explains that.” Agatha said as she rubbed her temples.

“What do you mean?” Rio asked.

“She took the last of my mother’s powers, I’m just trying to figure out how she left her alive.” Agatha said as she leaned forward and grabbed her coffee to take a drink.

“Maybe it wasn’t her time to die?” Rio suggested.

“That or she’s figured out how to control the siphoning.” Agatha suggested.

“I’ll call mom once we are done talking.”

“Pepper is getting suspicious. She knows I’m not telling her something.” Agatha said honestly, afraid Rio was going to get mad at her.

“You can tell anyone who you feel needs to know. I trust you.” Rio said softly.

“Are you sure? I don’t want to make you uncomfortable.” Agatha asked.

“Wanda, Pietro, and Pepper have stuck through so much when it comes to you. I don’t think they will be shocked or even bat an eye at this information.” Rio said vaguely.

“I’m more worried about Tony wanting to ask you a million questions if Pepper slips up.”

“I’d gladly answer any questions he has.” Rio said with a chuckle.

“Thank you dear. I’m sorry that we’ve only been dating a week and things like this keep happening.” Agatha apologized.

“Don’t make me come down there and kiss you!” Rio sassed Agatha.

“What if that’s what I want?” Agatha flirted.

“Ma’am you are at work!” Rio scolded.

“This is true, and I have three employee reviews to do today. So I better let you go.” Agatha said sadly.

“Good luck babe. Call me on your lunch if you get a chance.” Rio said into the phone.

“No promises. I don’t know how busy I’ll be. Have a good day.” Agatha told her.

“You as well my love.” Rio said into the phone before hanging up. Agatha got up out of her chair, opened her door and looked at Tricia with a smile.

“Let’s get shit done.” Agatha said as she walked over to Tricia’s desk. “What’s first?”

“You have a 10 a.m. meeting.” Tricia answered.

“Perfect.” Agatha answered, she was ready to get back to normal.

~Vidal Books~

After hanging up Rio watched the video a few times. Then she felt something shift, like time itself stopped. Rio looked up and around the book shop to see nothing had changed then she turned her head to the left to see Death standing next to her with a bright smile on her face.

“Hello witchlett!” Death said in a happy cheerful tone. Rio’s eyes widened as she looked at the entity.

“Uh. Hi?” Rio asked in a shocked tone.

“Don’t fret. I’m not retiring for a very long time. But I wanted to stop in and talk to you for a moment. Your bride seems to be having a rough time at the moment and I’m trying to make it a little easier.” Death reassured.

“How are you making it easier? How long?” Rio asked, she needed to know.

“I visited Evanora and took what was left of her power. Once you die a natural death you’ll take over. You and Agatha will have a long time together.” Death reassured.

“That explains that also, that’s reassuring.” Rio said relaxing slightly.

“You can ask me any questions you want.”

“What happens to Agatha when I take my place as Death?” Rio asked.

“If she outlives you, you can visit her at any time. If you outlive her I’ll take care of her until you take my place. My wife is currently at home in our comfy cabin waiting for me.” Death answered.

“Will Pepper, Pietro, and Wanda knowing that I’m next in line effect anything?” Rio asked.

“No, honestly it isn’t a big deal if it’s a secret or not. Everyone has to die eventually.” Death answered.

“About your spell book…” Rio trailed off.

“It would be an honor if you gave it to her. Now. I really must be going. I have souls piling up. If you ever need me, just call.” Death said as she waved her hand over Rio’s cellphone.

“Thanks for answering my questions.” Rio answered.

“I had to wait for you to find her, before I could talk to you.” Death answered before she disappeared and time restarted. Rio stood there in the book store with her brow furrowed as she replayed the conversation in her head.

“Wait! What!” Rio whisper yelled into the empty store.

Chapter 14

Rio wanted to call Agatha again in that exact moment after Death had left, but she knew she was in meetings so she settled for texting her.

Rio 10:45 a.m: Please call me on your lunch! Or ASAP! Nothings wrong. Just got new information.

“That will have to do.” Rio said with a sigh as she set her phone down. A few minutes later a very cute blonde walked into the store. Rio could tell the woman was a witch.

“Welcome to Vidal Books, spell books are in the back corner.” Rio said to the woman who turned and looked up shocked. Rio pointed to the back corner.

“I uh… thanks!” The blonde said as she walked in that direction. Rio stood at the counter and waited for the woman to finish shopping. A few minutes later the blonde came up to the counter holding a common spell book on analog magic, and a couple lgbt novels.

“Did you find everything you were looking for?” Rio asked as she rang the books up.

“Actually… no, there is one other thing I was looking for.” The blonde said softly, Rio looked up and tilted her head.

“Oh, sorry maybe I can order it in for you. What’s the name of the book and the author?” Rio asked.

“It was actually your number…” the blonde trailed off.

“Ah, sorry. I actually have a girlfriend. But her best friend is single.” Rio said thinking on her feet.

“Bummer. I’ll keep that in mind. How much do I owe you?” The blonde asked.

“$45.80.” Rio said as she started bagging the books up. The blonde handed Rio a $50 and Rio gave her, her books and change before saying. “Thank you for shopping with Vidal Books.”

The blonde smiled softly and walked toward the door before pausing. “Is she hot?” The blonde asked.

“ I don’t know about hot, but she is tall, objectively pretty, skinny, a redhead, with blue eyes, a chaos witch, with a spunky attitude, and very compassionate.” Rio listed off.

“Fuck it! Give me her number?” The blonde asked.

“One moment. Let me text her real quick.” Rio answered as she grabbed her phone and sent Wanda a quick text.

Rio: 11:05 a.m: found you a date, permission to give her your number?

Wanda 11:05 a.m: If you’re serious? Sure!fuck it!

“Okay, I’ve got the greenlight.” Rio said as she grabbed a bookmark and a pen. She opened Wanda’s contact and wrote her name and number down. “Here you go.” Rio said as she walked over and handed the woman the bookmark.

“Thank you. Have a good day!” The blonde said before rushing out the door. Rio walked back over to the desk and grabbed her phone. It literally started ringing the moment she picked it up. Agatha was calling.

“Hello my love.” Rio said into the phone.

“What’s wrong? That sounded urgent.” Agatha said slightly worried.

“So you’ll never guess who stopped by the book store today.” Rio told Agatha.

“Your mom?” Agatha asked.

“No, Death. Well, Violet Vidal.” Rio answered.

“Tell me everything right now, if you can.” Agatha requested, she was excited to hear about this.

“She paused time and just popped into the store. Reassured me that we will have a long life together before she retires. Then basically confirmed that she took the rest of your Mothers powers.”

“Well that’s good. Anything else?” Agatha asked.

“She told me that it doesn’t matter who knows about me, so we can tell them freely. Then… I asked about her spell book.”

“And?” Agatha asked.

“She said she’d be honored if I gave it to you. She wants you to have it.” Rio answered.

“I’m going to need to hear that from her personally before I keep it.” Agatha said into the phone as she shuffled some paperwork.

“You could call her tonight. She put her contact in my phone.” Rio said with a chuckle.

“Funny death has a phone number, maybe I will.” Agatha joked back before asking. “Is that everything?”

“No! She told me she had to wait for us to meet before she could speak to me then dipped! Who does that!” Rio said exasperatedly, which caused Agatha to chuckle.

“Sounds like something Wanda would do. Thank you for telling me all of this.” Agatha told her appreciatively.

“You gotta get back to work?” Rio asked sadly.

“Unfortunately. Both my meetings are done for the day, but I gotta give reviews. Which takes so long. It’s like 45 minutes to an hour.” Agatha explained with a sigh.

“I believe in you babe.” Rio said softly.

“Thanks. I appreciate it. Make sure you eat something. I’m about to have a chicken wrap.” Agatha requested.

“I’m gunna magic my left over pizza to me and eat that.” Rio told Agatha who hummed happily at the thought of pizza.

“That pizza was good.” Agatha said with a smile.

“It was. Call or text me after your done?” Rio asked.

“Of course. Bye babe.” Agatha said into the phone.

“Goodbye my love.” Rio said softly before they both hung up. Rio sighed into the empty book store then summoned her pizza and a drink and started eating it cold.

The rest of her day was relatively slow, a few customers would pop in at a time. It was a relatively slow day until around 3:30 p.m. then things picked up a little. It seemed like school had gotten out and the kids who wanted a place to chill or read before they went home for the night had filtered in.

Agatha 4:05 p.m: I’m sorry I assumed earlier. Are we spending time together tonight?

Rio 4:05 p.m: I’d love to spend time with you. My place or yours?

Agatha 4:06 p.m: Depends. Do you want a home cooked meal?

Rio 4:06 p.m: What kind of question is that? Of course I do.

Agatha 4:07 p.m: perfect. I have an idea on what I want to make. See you tonight 💜

Rio 4:07 p.m: what no hint?

Agatha 4:08 p.m: No. but if you could text me your allergies and food that you don’t like to eat that would be great so I don’t accidentally kill you.

Rio chuckled at that text message before she responded to Agatha.

Rio 4:09 p.m: no allergies, but I’m not super fond of fish.

Agatha 4:10 p.m: Perfect. I want to talk with Pepper before I leave for the night. I’ll text you when I leave work.

Rio set the phone down and focused on the customers in the book store. Yesterday may have sucked but at least she got to be there for Agatha and she now had less anxiety about being Death in the future.

~Stark Law Offices~

Agatha put her phone in her internal breast pocket of her suit and then stood up and headed for the door. Thankfully the employee’s she had to give review to today were all relatively good workers who did their jobs well so it wasn’t absolutely unbearable. She walked out into the main office and stood next to Tricia’s desk.

“Tricia, can you call Timothy and ask him if Mrs. Potts has a moment to speak to me?” Agatha asked her secretary.

The woman picked up the phone and dialed a number and waited. There was a long pause before she spoke. “Is Mrs. Potts free for a meeting with Ms. Harkness?” Then there was another long pause. “Thank you. Bye.”

“She’s free.” Tricia said as she hung the phone up.

“Perfect. Thank you. I’m unsure how long this is going to take. If I don’t see you before you leave, have a great night.” Agatha said as she patted the desk before walking away. She made her way to the elevator and headed to the top floor. Timothy smiled from his desk before he realized it was Agatha and stood up to be respectful.

“You don’t have to stand up every time Timothy, it’s fine.” Agatha said as she walked past his desk and opened the door to Peppers office.

“Thank you Tony. Tell Stephen I appreciate it as well.” Pepper said into the phone. Agatha took the hint and sat down in one of the chairs across from Pepper at her desk.

“She just got here. So I’m going to let you go and talk to her about this.” Pepper said into the phone, there was a pause before she spoke again. “I will. Love you too honey.” She responded to her husband before pulling the phone away and hanging up.

“What’s up Agatha?” Pepper asked as she set her phone down.

“Where to start… I’ll let you decide. Do you want the information I’ve been withholding or do you want what I’ve learned?” Agatha asked.

“Oh one thousand percent what you’ve been withholding.” Pepper said.

“Can I cast a sound dampening spell? I don’t want anyone I don’t trust knowing this information.” Agatha asked.

“I give you permission to do whatever makes you comfortable.” Pepper answered the woman. With a flick of Agatha’s wrist the room seemed to quiet.

“Okay. So have you done any reading on the Vidal family?” Agatha asked.

“No, I’m nosey and typically would’ve but I’ve been dealing with a pain in the ass named Evanora Harkness.” Pepper explained.

“They are the original Green Witch Bloodline. Which means nothing to you. But to witch-kind it’s a big deal. Think old money.” Agatha explained.

“Okay so you’re dating someone of status? Is that what the big deal is?” Pepper asked.

“No, I’m dating Rio Vidal, THE Green Witch. She is the next in line to take up her family’s mantle. The Green Witch Blood line originated as Death. Rio’s great great grand mother is the current standing entity of Death.” Agatha explained. She could see the gears in Pepper’s brain grind to a stop. There was a very long pause before she seemed to collect herself.

“So… let me get this straight… You, Agatha Harkness are dating and bound to the future embodiment of Death.” Pepper asked as her brain started working again.

“Yes.” Agatha answered, she sat and waited for Pepper to fully process.

“Okay. Cool. We are just gunna back burner that for a second while I process. What did you learn?”

“That Violet Vidal, the current standing entity of Death was a spirit witch and took the last of my mother’s power last night. Rio sent me an urgent message around eleven this morning. She decided to pay Rio a visit and answer some questions.” Agatha answered.

“What kind of questions?”

“Things that have been bothering Rio for a while now. Death can decide to retire at any point and then Rio would have to take her place. So there was some anxiety about that. She basically reassured Rio that we will have a long happy life together before she retires when Rio dies naturally.” Agatha explained.

“Well it’s good to know I won’t be seeing your wife when I die. I mean it might be a comfort for it to be someone I know… let’s not dwell on that for too long.”

“She’s not my wife.” Agatha clarified.

“Oh come on Harkness. That sigil on your chest says otherwise. The only one denying it is you!” Pepper jabbed.

“Can’t you just let me be delusional?” Agatha asked.

“No.” Pepper said seriously.

“Too bad. I’m gunna hang out in delululand for at least 6-9 months.” Agatha told Pepper.

“Normally I love how stubborn you are but right now… It’s irritating.” Pepper told Agatha.

“That’s because it’s normally not directed at you. Anyway, what did Mr. Potts have to say?” Agatha joked trying to change the subject.

“He thinks that’s hilarious by the way, but that’s beside the point. Stephen Strange found the individual that made the glamor spell for your mother.” Pepper explained.

“Oh? Do tell.” Agatha asked as she leaned forward, Pepper had her attention.

“Not much to tell, just some random witch that makes specified glamor spells for individuals who want to present as the opposite gender. Affordable gender affirmation spells. She had no clue what Evanora was using the spell for.” Pepper explained.

“Well at least there was no intended malcontent when it came to the spell. Maybe that’s why she got past my security measures so easily. The intent was made out of goodwill.” Agatha explained.

“I know you have sigils on the front of the building. Do we have witches who work here that need gender affirming care? Is that why it didn’t alert you?”

“I mean yes, but I’m going to be straight forward with you. It’s much easier to cast a spell than it is to go through hormone treatments, surgery’s, and all the other uncomfortable things needed to present as your preferred gender. So I allow that glamor to slip through the cracks.” Agatha explained.

“You have a good heart Agatha. Unfortunately Evanora used that to her advantage.” Pepper said as she rubbed her eyes with her thumb and index finger.

“Yes, well I’d rather my employees be happy at work instead of miserable. So I’ll work on fixing the spell so that they can still be comfortable. We should have a sign posted in the lobby after I fix it saying something along the lines of ‘If you aren’t a Stark industries employee glamor spells will be ineffective in this building.’ Or something similar.” Agatha explained.

“That sounds good. Now… back to Rio.” Pepper said in a tone Agatha didn’t recognize.

“Yes?”

“I’m thinking a fall wedding… or maybe spring the following year.” Pepper said with a grin.

“That’s it. I’m hexing you!” Agatha said with a laugh.

“Oh come on!” Pepper yelled exasperatedly.

“Look, I know that we are each others end all be all and that is very reassuring but… Right now I just want to enjoy what we have. I want to learn about her naturally, I want us to just be.” Agatha explained.

“You are literally no fun.”

“I know. It’s the best.” Agatha said sarcastically as she scrunched her nose.

“Anything else?” Pepper asked.

“Probably can have her moved to a regular non-magical facility. I expect with her magic gone she’s going to start aging rapidly. Soon.”

“What do you mean?” Pepper asked.

“I mean… Now that I know she’s lost her magic I don’t think Evanora Harkness will make it to her trial. She’s 250 years old in human years. Magic is the only reason witches live 800 plus years.” Agatha explained.

“You’re fucking kidding me!” Pepper said as she stood up, she almost seemed excited.

“This is new and unprecedented. She could live another 30 years easily, or she could die next week. She may look 55 but she’s no spring chicken.” Agatha said with a shrug.

“So right now continue with the legal proceedings and if she dies she dies?” Pepper asks.

“If she dies, she dies.” Agatha said as blandly as possible. “Either way, I’m finally free from her. She’s powerless, in prison, and getting her comeuppance.”

“Is it sad I want her to live another 30 years so we can see her rot?” Pepper asked.

“No, but it is petty.” Agatha told her.

“Okay, I’m okay with petty. But it’s 4:30 and I have to go home early today. So I’ll see you tomorrow. Also, you aren’t working this weekend. I don’t care how behind you are. Spend Saturday with Rio. Go to the botanical gardens, do something.” Pepper told Agatha leaving no room for argument.

“The bookstore is open Saturdays. She can’t hire employees yet, so she’s gotta work every day she’s open. But she did invite me to family dinner to meet her mother. So I guess I can tell her I’ll be coming tonight when I see her.”

“That is unfortunate…” Pepper said in a tone Agatha did recognize. It was Peppers ‘I can fix that tone.’

“Pepper…” Agatha drew out her name slowly, like a warning.

“What? I was just saying it sucks that she can’t afford to hire an employee. So she can spend the weekends with you. Now go home!” Pepper said as she shooed Agatha out of the office.

“Rude.” Agatha said as she got up and walked over to the door. “Behave Pepper.” Agatha requested before she walked out the door and made her way toward the elevator.

“Yeah, Harkness. I won’t be doing that.” Pepper said to herself as she smiled brightly and picked the phone up to call Tony.

“Hello Darling, how did the conversation with Agatha go?” Tony asked loudly, Pepper could tell he was in his lab working on something.

“It sure was enlightening… to say the least. But that’s not why I called.” Pepper told her husband.

“Then why did you call?” He asked.

“Got any ideas on how to make a bookstore successful over night?” Pepper asked.

“Call schools and libraries in the surrounding areas and ask them what books they need desperately. Order books from said store, then donate those books. Request the libraries and schools keep a standing list of books they want or need and order them from the store each month. Alternatively we could just have contracts with those areas that whatever book they order from the store is paid for by Stark Industries and foot the bill.” Tony offered.

“Would you be okay with that?” Pepper asked.

“Do you realize how much money Agatha Harkness has earned and saved us in the last 12 years? I’m more than okay with that, especially if it’s to support her girlfriend.”

“About that.. we have to talk in person about what I learned today.”

“Must be super important. Alright, when will you be home?”

“Soon, I’m getting ready to leave the office.” Pepper explained.

“I need a shower. I’ll speak to you when you get here. I love you.” Tony said into the room.

“Love you. See you soon.” Pepper said as she hung up the phone.

Agatha made it back down to her office in time to make sure Tricia was leaving on time. She grabbed her briefcase, empty coffee cup, and keys before she shut her office light off and headed out the door.

“Come on Tricia I’ll walk you to your car.” Agatha said to the woman who was packing her things up.

“Oh thank you.” Tricia said slightly shocked. Most of the office was empty so she quickly packed up and followed Agatha to the elevator.

“The two meetings I have tomorrow. What time are they scheduled for?” Agatha asked.

“Both are in the morning. The rest of the day is free. Why?” Tricia asked as Agatha hit the down button.

“I think I’m going to take a half day tomorrow.” Agatha said with a smile on her face. Tricia almost dropped her purse in shock.

“What? You don’t.. excuse me?” Tricia asked in a confused tone.

“I’m meeting Rio’s family on Saturday, I want to bake something so I’m going to take time off to do it. Not like I don’t have almost a year of personal days to use.” Agatha explained.

“Happiness looks good on you Agatha. I’m glad you are finally taking care of things that aren’t work.” Tricia said as she stepped off the elevator into the main lobby.

“Thanks. I think it will be nice to take a break for a change.” Agatha said as they walked out of the building and into the parking lot.

“Have a goodnight Agatha.”

“You as well Tricia.” Agatha told the woman as she broke away from her and headed toward her own car. She needed to get some groceries for what she had planned for dinner. But first she needed to text Rio.

Agatha 5:00 p.m: leaving work now! Gotta go to the store then head home and start cooking. See you soon!

One quick stop at the store and a drive home later Agatha hauled everything she would need into the house to make dinner and bake the surprise she had planned for Saturday.

“Let’s get this started.” Agatha said to herself as she walked into her bedroom and removed her suit. She put on a pair of sleep shorts and a baggy tee shirt and a pair of fuzzy socks. Then walked back out into the kitchen and tossed on an apron.

“Not that I need to pull out all the stops or anything but I think some marry me chicken sounds great.” Agatha whispered to herself as she opened the chicken breasts on the counter.

She coated the bottom of her pan with oil, and lightly dredged her chicken in seasoned flower before pan searing it. While they were searing she got the baby potatoes in the oven with seasoning. She pulled the chicken out after it had a good crust on both sides and then started making the sauce. Agatha took the time and care to make sure each ingredient was added in at the right time then the chicken was added back in and a lid was put on and set to simmer.

A knock on the door came at the perfect time. Agatha walked out of the kitchen and into the entryway. She opened the door to see Rio standing there with a bright smile on her face.

“Hey babe! Come on in, I’m almost done cooking.” Agatha said as she let Rio into the house.

“It smells amazing in here. What are we having?” Rio asked as she followed Agathta into the kitchen.

“Salad, roasted garlic new potatoes, and marry me chicken.” Agatha explained.

“Sounds amazing.” Rio said as she slid closer to Agatha. She wrapped her arms around Agatha from behind and softly kissed the back of her neck and shoulder.

“Rio…. Let me finish cooking.” Agatha said with a sigh. She felt all the tension melt away from her body.

“I’m not doing anything wrong.” Rio mumbled against Agatha’s skin as she slid her hands under her shirt to softly glide her fingers against Agatha’s stomach.

“How was the rest of work?” Agatha asked as she turned off the heat on the stove and oven. She side stepped and grabbed the salad out of the fridge before setting it on the countertop.

“I forgot to mention that I got flirted with by a customer today when I called you. I told her I was taken and actually texted Wanda to see if I could give her, her number.”

“Was she cute?” Agatha asked in a neutral tone.

“To me? No. Objectively? Yes. I don’t think Wanda would have any complaints about how she looks.” Rio said honestly.

“Not really, nothing too exciting really. It was a slow day today.” Rio told Agatha as she leaned against the counter. Agatha set the potatoes on the stove and grabbed two plates out of the cabinet.
