“That’s permanent babe, looks like you’re actually stuck with me now. Also because Pepper was already trying to plan our wedding this afternoon.”

“Just because I wanted to propose to you earlier… stupid magic… wait what?” Rio was mumbling to herself before focusing on Agatha.

“Oh so you did want to propose?” Agatha said with a smirk.

“Wait a second let’s rewind. Pepper was what?” Rio asked trying to get everything in order.

“I went to visit her to tell her about you. She took it well enough. I think she’s still processing. Then we started talking about the glamor potion that someone made for my mother. She was a trans-inclusivity, which made glamor potions for cheap. She had no malcontent when she made it which is why my mother made it as far as she did. Then once we were done talking about everything she joked that we should have a fall wedding or a spring wedding the following year.” Agatha explained.

“Are you really okay with this?” Rio asked as she touched the ring on Agatha’s hand that seems to be thrumming with her magic.

“I would’ve liked this to happen six to nine months from now. And you technically haven’t proposed to me. Your magic did and apparently so did mine. We both said yes to each other. No arguing with that. It’s fine. We can still call each other our girl… girl.. girl… apparently not.” Agatha said as she tried to say girlfriend.

“I can’t call you my girl… fuck! Why can’t I say it.” Rio said in a frustrated tone.

“Fiancé? Rio Vidal is my fiancé. Well thats inconvenient…” Agatha said softly.

“Can I try something?” Rio asked as she took Agatha’s hand.

“Go for it.” Agatha told Rio who tried to take the ring off, it refused to budge.

“Looks like you’re actually stuck with me.” Rio said with a sigh.

“I knew that when this showed up.” Agatha said as she trailed a finger down the sigil on Rio’s chest.

“It feels so rushed.” Rio mumbled.

“Yeah, well that’s what we get for fucking like rabbits.” Agatha said before she kissed Rio softly. “Rio Vidal is my partner. Rio Vidal is my girl.” Agatha said trying those loop holes on for size.

“There we go. That works.” Rio said with a smile.

“Perfect, see. No need to worry.” Agatha reassured.

“Until Wanda sees it in the morning.” Rio mentioned.

“Ugh. We will tackle that hurdle when we get there.” Agatha reassured.

“Agreed. Alright I’m getting tired. Wanna make out until we fall asleep?” Rio asked with a smirk.

“Nothing sounds better than making out with my fiancé until we pass out.” Agatha said as she cuddled close to Rio and started kissing her softly. Both women giggled into the kiss as they just enjoyed this moment together.

Chapter 16

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

They woke up early the next morning, both of them feeling pleasantly sore as they cuddled against each other.

“Good morning my love.” Rio whispered as Agatha kissed along her neck.

“Good morning my love.” Agatha mumbled as she kissed her neck and shoulder.

“We need to get a shower in.” Rio said with a sigh.

“Probably but I really just want you.” Agatha said with a groan as she suckled Rio’s shoulder.

“Sunday we can spend the whole day in bed” Rio promised.

“No, I have something planned for you. There’s a surprise in my briefcase that I haven’t gotten to give you yet because of everything that happened with Evanora.” Agatha explained.

“Oh what’s that?” Rio asked curiously.

“Let’s go take a shower and I’ll show you.” Agatha explained as she rolled away.

“Ugh fine! If I must leave this comfortable bed!” Rio complained.

“You must.” Agatha said as she kissed Rio before she got up.

Forty minutes later they were out of the shower. Agatha was getting dressed in a black suit with a gray button up and a dark purple tie with silver constellations dotting it. She braided her hair and let it run down her back perfectly.

“Why is every outfit you put on so immaculate?” Rio asked as she looked over at Agatha.

“Years and years of building my wardrobe.” Agatha answered as she slipped on a pair of heels and smiled at Rio who was still standing in a towel. “Going to try and get dressed with magic this morning or do you want me to do it?” Agatha asked.

“I’ll try but all I can imagine is you naked… so maybe you should…”

“Give it a shot. If I end up naked I’ll just magic my outfit back on. Just focus on what you want to wear today.” Agatha instructed. Rio really focused and imagined herself in her favorite jeans, and a soft baggy band tee. A moment later she was dressed standing in Agatha’s bedroom.

“I forgot underwear and a bra…” Rio said in a frustrated tone. Agatha waved her hand and Rio was wearing panties, a bra, and socks under her clothing. “Thanks babe.” Rio said appreciatively.

“Come on I’ll make waffles for breakfast.” Agatha told Rio before she headed out of the bedroom toward the kitchen. Rio followed and sat down at the island so she could watch Agatha.

“I wonder if your vanishing spell will work on these?” Agatha asked as she put an apron on.

“Worth a shot. Come here.” Rio requested as she took Agatha’s left hand in her own. “De facie evanescant, solum mereantur videre. De facie evanescant, solum mereantur videre. De facie evanescant, solum mereantur videre” Rio spoke clearly. Putting her intention clear in her mind. After she was finished she let Agatha’s hand go.

“I guess we will have to wait and see if that worked.” Agatha said as she turned to make breakfast. She pulled the waffle maker out and started heating it up while she made the batter. Once that was made and the first waffle was cooking she started making cheesy scrambled eggs and some ham.

Ten minutes later Wanda barged into the house excitedly. “This woman is fantastic! Rio I’m so glad you and Agatha met!” Wanda said excitedly.

“You’re welcome.” Rio said with a shocked look on her face.

“Okay Wanda, tell me everything.” Agatha asked as she continued to cook breakfast.

“She’s a published botanist that just moved here. She actually found Rio’s bookstore on Instagram and decided to check the place out yesterday. You should probably change your relationship status on your private Instagram to taken by the way.” Wanda said as she turned and focused on Rio for a moment.

“She thought the same thing I did when she seen you. ‘Oh she’s cute.’ And decided to shoot her shot after buying a couple books… So if you want to avoid this in the future. I’d recommend doing that. Any way. We spent all night texting. We have a date tonight.” Wanda explained, Rio instantly magicked her phone into her hand and started doing something on it.

“Where are you going?” Agatha asked.

“I thought about taking her to the botanical gardens…” Wanda said honestly.

“Not a bad idea. If she’s looking for a job Tony is looking for a replacement for Jeffery.” Agatha suggested.

“She is published in her field and well known so I’ll suggest it.” Wanda answered. Then something clicked for Rio.

“Oh my goddesses! Liliana Grey! Now I know why her name sounded familiar! She’s published a few papers on plants and potions work! I’ve read them!” Rio said excitedly.

“No! Bad Rio! She’s mine.” Wanda said as she playfully swatted at the woman.

“What? No. You can have her. Agatha’s the best thing that’s ever happened to me.” Rio said as she scrunched her face at Wanda.

“Wanda’s a jealous person babe, watch.” Agatha said as she set two plates of waffle, eggs, and bacon down in front of the two women.

“Can I get her number? Maybe she’d like to take us both for a spin.” Agatha joked, knowing Wanda would get jealous.

“No. Back off Harkness. I’ll stab you with a fork.” Wanda said as she magicked one into her hand. Agatha chuckled before she turned around and grabbed Rio a fork and handed it to her.

“You know she wasn’t being serious right?” Rio asked as she started eating.

“I know, that’s why the fork is still in my hand, and not through hers.” Wanda said with a glare before she dug into her breakfast.

“I constantly forget you are a chaos witch and then I am abruptly reminded.” Rio states.

“Do you two want coffee?” Agatha asked.

“Yes please.” Rio and Wanda said in unison. Agatha shook her head and poured three cups of coffee. She made two cups exactly the same and the third cup with just sugar.

“Black coffee with sugar for my favorite psychopath.” Agatha said as she set the coffee in front of Wanda. Then handed Rio one of the other two cups.

“Perfect thank you.” Wanda said as she took a sip before she continued to eat.

“Thank you babe.” Rio said as she also took a drink.

They sat comfortably together as they ate their breakfast. Agatha finished her breakfast first and cleaned up the kitchen with a wave of her hand.

“Let me go grab you the surprise I forgot about until this morning.” Agatha said as she walked into the entry way and grabbed the lifetime passes out of her briefcase. She made her way back into the kitchen and walked behind Rio before she slid the two passes into view.

“You must be joking! These must’ve cost a fortune!” Rio said excitedly before she got quiet and serious. “No Agatha you have to return them. They are so expensive.”

“I guess it’s a good thing I didn’t pay for them then huh?” Agatha asked.

“What? How?” Rio asked in a confused tone.

“Pepper felt bad for interrupting our date and Tony noticed how much you loved the place on the cameras. So they decided to give us these just in case I ever left Stark Law.” Agatha explained.

“Oh. I see. Well, can you thank them for me today?” Rio asked as she held the two passes.

“Lucky witches. How’s it feel to be loved by the world’s most powerful couple?” Wanda asked.

“You do know you get free admittance because you work for them right? This is just in case I ever leave the firm, or if Rio wants to go solo.” Agatha reminded Wanda before she told the two women. “Now eat. I’ve got two meetings today then I’m coming home and making dessert for tomorrow night.”

Wanda stuffed the last couple bites of food in her mouth before she chugged the rest of her coffee. She quickly got up and cleaned her plate off and rinsed everything before walking over to Rio and hugging her.

“Seriously, I know I was joking the other day about you finding me a date. But I really do appreciate it.” Wanda said before letting Rio go.

“You’re welcome. Have fun. Keep us updated.” Rio requested.

“I will.” Wanda said as she walked over to Agatha and hugged her. “What dessert are you making?”

“Oh no, go away Maximoff! Not telling you shit.” Agatha said as she shoved her best friend toward the door.

“Okay! okay. I’m going. I’m going. Have a good day you two!” Wanda yelled as she bolted for the door.

“We really should tell her everything soon.” Agatha said after the door shut.

“Maybe after her date…” Rio said as she looked toward the front door.

“Probably for the best. Can’t have her spiraling.” Agatha said with a shrug before continuing. “Want me to bring you lunch today? I am taking a half day.” Agatha asked.

“Only if you aren’t busy. I appreciate it. Now let’s head to work.” Rio said as she stood up and stretched.

“Yeah, I’m not looking forward to these meetings.” Agatha said as she headed toward the entryway.

“Why?”

“Because they are the ones that got canceled Wednesday…”

“Oh, great. Sorry babe.” Rio said as she turned toward Agatha.

“It’s okay. Give me a kiss and let’s get this show on the road.” Agatha said as she pulled the woman close.

“Make it two and you’ve got yourself a deal.” Rio joked before she leaned in and kissed Agatha who softly laughed as she kissed Rio several times before breaking away. The smiled softly at each other and made their way out the door.

~Meanwhile At The High Security Institution For The Magically Inclined~

The cell door opened and Evanora Harkness looked over at the door. There was a guard standing there looking at her with a sneer.

“Get up. You are being moved to a regular women’s facility seeing as you no longer have any powers.” The woman said as she stood in the door. Evanora sighed loudly and got up.

“Like I need another reminder that I’m powerless.” Evanora grumbled as walked over to the man.

“Your hearing with Judge Heart is Monday.” The guard explained as he guide her out the door and toward the inmate transfer area. Evanora decided to just keep her mouth shut as the guard forced her to sit down and locked her restraints to the bench.

“She’s the woman’s prisons problem now Glenda.” The guard said as he walked away.

Evanora looked up at the woman behind the glass and sneered at her before looking back down at the floor. She had accepted that no matter what she did, no one would ever believe that her daughter was a waste of space, time, and energy.

~Pepper’s Office~

The phone rang loudly through the room as Pepper looked up from her document.

“Pepper Potts, how may I help you?” Pepper asked into the phone.

“Pepper, it’s Judge Heart. Her bail is set at twenty thousand. She’s being transferred to the women’s prison today. Her hearing is Monday. Are you prepared for it?”

“I almost am. I do need to speak to Agatha one more time before I finish preparations.” Pepper explained.

“Perfect, don’t tell me anything. Have a great day! See you personally on Monday.” The man said into the phone.

“See you Monday.” Pepper said as she pressed the button on the receiver and then dialed Agatha’s secretary.

“Agatha Harkness is in a meeting at the moment Mrs. Potts.” Tricia said into the phone.

“How did you know it was me?” Pepper asked.

“I set my phone up so that one of the lines is a direct line to your office. I always know when you call.” Tricia explained.

“Can you tell her to stop by after her meetings I have a few questions for her.” Pepper requested

“Of course, have a great afternoon Mrs. Potts.”

“You as well Tricia.” Pepper said before she hung up the phone.

An hour later Agatha finished her second and last meeting for the day. She packed everything up for the day and walked out of her office.

“Mrs. Potts would like to see you before you head home for the day.” Tricia said to Agatha.

“Of course she would. Thank you Tricia. I appreciate you.” Agatha said before she made her way to the elevator. She made her way up to the top floor and Peppers office. Timothy wasn’t at his desk for once which shocked Agatha but she quickly made her way to Peppers door and let her self in because she could see she was alone.

“Hey, what’s up?” Agatha asked.

“Is there anyway you could get written testimony’s from each of the spirit witches? With dates these things happened? If the statute of limitations is up on their parent’s deaths, then we will use it on Monday. If not, we won’t.” Pepper reassured.

“Let me call Rio real quick.” Agatha told Pepper before she pulled her phone out of her pocket and called Rio. The phone rang a couple times before the woman answered.

“Hey babe, everything okay?” Rio asked.

“Everything’s fine, is there any chance you could send me your mother’s number so I could call her and ask her a question?” Agatha asked.

“Sure, what’s the question?” Rio asked as she pulled her phone away from her ear and sent Rita Vidal’s number to Agatha.

“Pepper would like written testimony’s from the women so we have proof that every spirit witch orients from abuse.” Agatha explained.

“Oh. Well she has today off so I’ll text her real quick and let her know to expect your call.” Rio said into the phone.

“Thank you my love, I appreciate it.” Agatha said softly into the phone.

“You’re welcome. I’ll call you once I’m done with work. Have a good day my love.” Rio said into the phone before both women hung up.

Rio 11:30 a.m: Rita Vidal Contact.

Agatha clicked the contact info and then hit dial. Her heart was in her throat, she wanted to vomit but swallowed the nerves as the phone connected.

“Hello Witchlett! Lilia told me you’d be calling me today. I already requested hand written letters but instead, every single witch has sent me a photo of their diary entries already. I just need your work email.” Rita said into the phone.

“I… Uh… thank you? I mean, Thank You Rita I really appreciate it.” Agatha said in a confused tone.

“You’re welcome Witchlett! When your best friend is Lilia Calderu you’re privy to things before most are.”

“I appreciate that, tell Lilia I appreciate her being so helpful with this as well. She owes me literally nothing.” Agatha said into the phone before she continued after a moment.“I’ve actually gotta give you my bosses email. She’s handling this case.”

“That is fine! I’m already sitting here with the email composed so just let me know and I’ll send it.” Rita said into the phone

“[email protected] Potts is with two T’s” Agatha said into the phone.

“Perfect. I appreciate it. I’m sending it now. Now, what are you bringing for dessert tomorrow?” Rita asked.

“What’s Rio’s favorite dessert? I was thinking a dolce de leche cake.” Agatha explained.

“That sounds delightful. She’s always been a chocolate lover though. Just something to think about.” Rita told Agatha.

“Thank you. I appreciate the info and all the help. You are a blessing.” Agatha said into the phone appreciatively.

“So are you, you just don’t realize it yet. Have a good day.” Rita said into the phone

“You as well.” Agatha said before they both hung up.

“Got the email already, do you want to read these?” Pepper asked.

“No… Maybe? I know I’ll have to hear them on Monday.” Agatha said with a blanch.

“You will. It’s okay you can read them at any point this weekend just email me if you want them. Now we need to talk about the elephant in the room…”

“Huh? What elephant in the room?” Agatha asked looking around sarcastically.

“The green and silver ring on your finger that seems to be flowing with magical energy because the green is fucking glowing.” Pepper said as she pointed at Agatha’s left hand.

“Great. You can see it.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“Explain. ‘Miss let me be delulu for 6-9 months.’ Because yesterday I clearly remember you saying that.” Pepper scolded lightly.

“Look… our magic is intertwining deeply. I have zero control over this… last night I made her dinner and we had sex again then this showed up.” Agatha said as she lifted her hand up.

“So… your magic literally said ‘fuck you we are married now.’ And you have no choice in the matter?” Pepper asked.

“Yes.” Agatha answered.

“Perfect. Does she need insurance?” Pepper pried.

“Legally we aren’t married Pepper.” Agatha sighed.

“Yet.” Pepper corrected with a smug smile on her face.

“You know, I thought the spell we put on the rings this morning had them hidden from everyone! I was hoping no one would be able to see it.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“One second.” Pepper said as she pressed a button on her phone. “Timothy come here.” Pepper requested.

The young man stood up and walked into the office a few seconds later. “Yes Mrs. Potts?” The man asked as he walked over to her desk.

“Can you look at Agatha’s hands and tell me if you see anything unusual?” Pepper asked the young man who looked over the rings on her hands.

“No ma’am just her normal arrangement of rings. Nothing new or unusual here. I always wondered why you never wear any on your ring fingers though Ms. Harkness.” The young man said to the two women.

“Perfect, thank you that is all.” Pepper told him before he shook his head yes and then went back to his desk.

“Seems like only I can see it. Any theory’s on that?” Pepper asked.

“You are the only person in my life who knows that Rio is next in line to be death.” Agatha lamented as she rubbed her eyes, coming to a realization.

“Oh that sounded like you just realized something you didn’t want to.” Pepper said to Agatha.

“I’m meeting Rio’s parents tomorrow. At the very least her mother… who definitely knows Rio is next in line…”

“Oof you better make the best damn dessert you’ve ever made.” Pepper said with wide eyes.

“Geeee thanks Pepper.” Agatha said sarcastically before sighing. “Can I go home and bake now?” Agatha asked.

“Yeah, I don’t need you anymore today. But I do think your future mother in law is a badass bitch.” Pepper told Agatha.

“I’m inclined to agree. Have a good day, call me if you need anything. Otherwise I’m going home and baking.” Agatha said as she grabbed her things and headed out the door.

“Good luck!” Pepper said as she went back to work.

~Some Random Correctional facility Bus on the interstate.~

Evanora Harkness was stewing in her own anger as she stared out the window. She was just being transferred to the county jail but she was so angry at everyone who ever believed her daughter was capable of being anything other than a monster.

She couldn’t believe Agatha had manipulated so many people into believing she was the problem. She wished she had just ended her life with her own hands instead of trying to do so with magic.

“Useless child.” Evanora grumbled quietly to herself before the bus came to a stop at the county jail. A guard stepped onto the bus and unlocked the restraints that she had holding her into the seat and hiked her up by the shoulder of her jumpsuit.

“Move it Harkness.” The guard said as they guided her off the bus.

“When do I get to call my lawyer?” The woman hissed out.

“Once you’re booked.” The guard said as they guided her into the building.

“Great.” Evanora sneered as she was forced to sit down and locked back onto the bench.

“Book her and let her call her lawyer Sully.” The man said to another officer.

“You got it!” The man named Sully said as he got up and started the booking process. The man looked at Evanora’s paperwork.

“Woof, had to fuck with the one lawyer in the state no criminal wants to be against did ya? Sounds like you’re about to have a bad time.” The man said.

“Just stop talking to me about my ungrateful shithead of a child.” Evanora said with a scowl.

“Ooookay then. Let’s get you booked.”

~Agatha’s Place~

Agatha had made it home and finished baking the cakes off for the dessert. She decided on the way home she would make two separate cakes. Death by chocolate and Dolce De Leche for tomorrow evening. She wanted to make sure everything was perfect for tomorrow.

Agatha spent the rest of the afternoon finishing up the cakes and getting them in the fridge before she took the scraps and made a parfait and magicked it onto Peppers desk with a note that said “thank you for everything.” Along with a fork.

Right as she was about to sit down her phone started ringing. She looked at it to see that it was Pepper calling her.

“Hey, did you get your snack?” Agatha asked.

“Yes, it’s delicious thank you. Got everything done?” Pepper asked as she looked at the clock, it was almost 5 p.m.

“Yep just finished, was about to sit down and read Violet Vidal’s spell book.” Agatha said as she sat down on the couch and magicked the book into her lap.

“Sounds good. Thanks for the cake. I appreciate it. Enjoy your book. See you Monday morning, bye.” Pepper said into the phone.

“Have a great night. Bye.” Agatha said as she pulled the phone away before she heard Pepper hang up.

Agatha opened the book and read the very first passage that she read the other day. She continued to read and learn about Violet Vidal and all the things she experienced after she killed her parents. Things started getting interesting when she met Rosaline, a chaos witch that was magically compatible with her.

“Fascinating.” Agatha said as she magicked a pen and paper next to her so she could take notes. “Magical connection, check. Love binding spell sigil, check. Rings, Check.” Agatha said as she wrote down a few notes.

“Any questions Agatha?” Death asked from next to Agatha on the couch.

“Yeah, actually who can see this?” Agatha asked as she held her left hand up.

“Oh we are that far along already?” Death asked.

“Apparently, but that didn’t answer my question.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“Just Pepper at the moment. Rio’s spell specified basically those who know she’s next in line. So once you tell Wanda and Pietro they will be able to see it.”

“Good. I can handle Pepper. I don’t know about Wanda right now.” Agatha said as she rubbed her temples.

“Any other questions?” The entity asked Agatha.

“Is Rosaline still alive?” Agatha asked.

“No. Our cabin is in my own realm. You are privileged in the sense that because Rio is your partner you don’t ever really get to die. I mean you will die but your spirit will live on in Rio’s dimension once she takes her place as death. It’s not super complicated really. If you die first Rosaline and I will care for you until Rio does.” Death explained.

“So… is this how deep it goes?” Agatha asked as she held her hand up again.

“In the mortal realm yes. Once you die it gets a little deeper. But that’s not for centuries.” Death explained.

“So… about your parents.” Agatha trailed off softly.

“Horrible people but not nearly as bad as Evanora Harkness. I don’t know how you survived as long as you did Witchlett.” Death said as she placed a reassuring hand on Agatha’s shoulder.

“Wanda and Pietro definitely made it easier.”

“Ah yes the twins. I am thankful for the both of them for your sake.” Death said honestly.

“Did you always know I was Rio’s magical soul mate? Is that what we are calling it?” Agatha asked.

“No, unfortunately for Me and every iteration of Death you are a blind spot. So my predecessor couldn’t see Rosaline for example. But once we find our ‘bride’ Death can speak to us and them freely. Which is why I’m here.” Death explained.

“Interesting…” Agatha said as she grabbed the notebook and wrote things down before asking her next question “Why did you want me to have your spell book?”

“Honestly? I know how hard it is to be a spirit witch. I wanted to grant you some comfort, just so you’d know you aren’t alone. Plus there are some really great spells in there that only you can do.” Death said as she reached over and flipped the book open to a spell that Agatha had never even thought of before.

“Magical transfers? Wait… I can take someone’s magic and give it to someone else?” Agatha asked as she read over the page.

“Yes, it takes lots of practice. Siphoning can be stopped as well. But it’s very difficult and painful for all parties involved in the beginning. I took the last of your mother’s magic but I could’ve easily given it all back to her if I wanted. I have the ability to do so, and one day you will as well. It just takes practice. If that’s what you want to do. I recommend it though so you don’t accidentally kill someone in the future.” Death explained.

“Why am I privy to this information?” Agatha asked softly.

“Honestly? Because I relate to you more than anyone else I’ve ever met. I know how you feel and I don’t want any other witches to experience it. I know you’ll do great things with this information. But I can feel the bodies piling up. So I must go. Sorry.” Death explained to Agatha before disappearing completely.

“Enlightening.” Agatha said as she turned back to reading. Then a moment later Agatha got a text.

Wanda: 5:35 p.m: I NEED help with an outfit.

Agatha 5:35 p.m: coming.

Agatha sighed as she closed the book and got up from her couch and walked over to Wanda’s. She walked right in the door and made her way to Wanda’s bedroom.

“What’s the problem?” Agatha asked as she opened the door. The whole room was a mess. Dresses and outfits strewn around the room and bed. Agatha waved her hand and sighed as the room cleaned itself up.

“I don’t have anything to wear.” Wanda said in a frustrated tone. Agatha chuckled at her best friend and then waved her hand again. Wanda was then dressed in a pair of black slacks, with a dark red button up with the sleeves rolled up 3/4ths of the way, she had a black vest on that was covered in embroidered roses, along with a black tie that had small red roses that matched the vest.

“There. Any other issues Maximoff?” Agatha asked.

“Fuck, how do you manage to make things like this happen?” Wanda asked as she looked in the mirror.

“There’s also a matching jacket but I felt like that was overkill. Now hair?” Agatha asked.

“Can you actually braid it for me? Like braid it and put it in a bun? I miss having girly days where we’d play with each other’s hair during sleepovers.”

“Yeah sit down on the floor. I’ll do your hair. Where are you going?” Agatha asked as she sat on the bed, Wanda sat down on the floor and Agatha magicked the materials she would need to do Wanda’s hair.

“I’m picking her up at 6:30 and we are going to the botanical gardens. They are open till 10 tonight so we are going to go check everything out there, then after that I’m going to take her to dinner.” Wanda explained.

“Sounds great. Do you need an emergency escape route?” Agatha asked.

“I’ll ask Jen to do it. Just in case you and Rio get busy…” Wanda trailed off.

“I’ve been meaning to talk to you about her.” Agatha said as she brushed Wanda’s hair.

“Oh? Finally gunna tell me what you learned in the cabin?” Wanda asked, she may be unobservant but she wasn’t forgetful.

“Yes.”

“Well spill Harkness! I don’t have all night!” Wanda said exasperatedly.

“Rio is part of The Original Green Witch blood line. Which originated as death, she’s next in line to be the entity of Death. Her great great grandmother Violet Vidal is the current standing entity of Death. The reason we have this deep magical connection is because I’m her other half.” Agatha explained as she braided Wanda’s hair.

“Okay. I feel like we skipped a few steps here.” Wanda said as she collected her thoughts.

“I mean yes and no. It was a connection when we touched, we had sex the other day and a love binding spell showed up trailing down our chests which I will show you after I’m done braiding your hair! Stop moving.” Agatha scolded as she grabbed Wanda’s head and forced her to look forward.

“Okay. So why are you telling me this?” Wanda asked. Then Agatha sighed and shoved her left hand into Wanda’s face.

“Because this showed up last night. Her magic asked, mine said yes. Now. Before you freak out. We put the invisibility spell on it so you wouldn’t see it this morning. Now that you know Rio is next in line to be death you can see it.” Agatha explained.

“Cool. Cool. Cool. One question?” Wanda asked.

“What.”

“Do I get to be the maid of honor?” Wanda joked as Agatha took her hand back and continued to braid her hair.

“If I don’t kill you first, yes.” Agatha answered.

“You love me! Also, honestly… very ironic that a spirit witch is the bride of death.”

“I said something similar, but it was ‘nothing more ironic than a spirit witch dating the embodiment of death, even if they are in their gestation period.’ You cool with this?” Agatha asked her best friend as she finished her hair. Wanda stood up and turned around so she could look Agatha in the eye.

“You are my best friend, all I’ve ever wanted is to see you as happy as Rio makes you. Who gives a fuck about her being death in the future? I can tell you two are head over heels already. Don’t sweat it too much. Now show me that sigil!” Wanda demanded. Agatha sighed and unbuttoned her shirt and opened it for Rio to see, the green sigil softly growling.

“Wow… okay. Fuck that’s cool! Shit I have a date!” Wanda said in a confused tone as Agatha buttoned her shirt.

“Sorry for dropping this on you before your date. But I really haven’t had time to talk to you.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“No it’s fine. The ring is beautiful by the way. Now get outta my house I gotta go pick up Lily.” Wanda said as she slipped a pair of shoes on and shoved Agatha toward the door.

“Fine! I’m going! I’m going!” Agatha said as she walked out of the bedroom and headed toward the front door.

“Thank you, I appreciate your help but I don’t want to be late!” Wanda said as she grabbed her wallet, badge and keys.

“You’re welcome bye.” Agatha said as she walked out the front door and then headed toward her house. Wanda ran to her car and got in quickly before pulling out of the driveway.

Chapter End Notes

Next chapter is Wanda’s and Lily’s date! And possibly Agatha meeting Rio’s parents! Depends on how long the date is.

Keep in mind Monday’s are my busy day guys. Gotta babysit my niece, go grocery shopping, and just do life shit. So the next update might not be until Wednesday… sorry! I’m hoping not though.

Chapter 17

Wanda stopped and grabbed a bouquet of flowers before she headed to Lily’s place to pick her up. She made her way up to the apartment and knocked on the door. A few moments later a gorgeous blonde woman with stunning green eyes wearing a soft blue sundress opened the door.

“Hello Wanda!” The woman said excitedly as she took Wanda in. “Fuck you look fantastic.”

“So do you! I got you some flowers.” Wanda said in a slightly nervous tone as she handed the flowers to Lily.

“Okay, I’m ready. Where are you taking me?” Lily asked with a smile as she looked up at the tall redhead.

“That’s a surprise, but I can almost guarantee you’ll love it.” Wanda reassured her as they made their way to Wanda’s car.

“Agatha is a lawyer for Stark Law. You’ve met her girlfriend Rio, she owns the bookstore.”

Their parents abuse them for whatever reason and their magical abilities flare up around the age of 16 and when they are attacked magically they siphon their care takers magic effectively killing them. It’s a defense mechanism. Unfortunately for Agatha.. her mother lived because of me and my twin brother.” Wanda said with a sigh.

“Stark Industries Employees and their family members get free admittance.” Wanda explained as she opened the door and let Lily walk in first. Wanda followed suit and scanned her badge.

“I’m glad you are enjoying yourself.” Wanda said after about an hour of them hopping from plant to plant.

“I really am! This is one of the nicest gardens I’ve ever been to! Thank you so much Wanda!” Lily said excitedly before she stood up on her tiptoes and gave Wanda a kiss on the cheek. Causing a blush to creep up onto Wanda’s face.

“She’s a green witch.” Wanda told her.

“That doesn’t necessarily mean she’s interested in botany.” Lily said as she stood up and looked at Wanda.

They pulled up to an old diner that looked like it had been around since the before either woman was even a thought in their parents minds. “What is this place?” Lily asked as Wanda parked the car.

“A diner that Pietro, Agatha and I used to hang out at and study at while we were in college. They are open 24 hours, always have the best burgers and don’t care how long you camp while you do your homework.” Wanda explained.

“Sounds like a college students dream.” Lily said as Wanda turned off the car and unbuckled before getting out and making her way around the car so she could open the door for Lily.

“Heya Wands! Where’s Aggie and Zippy?” A waitress asked as she walked up to the table. She was an older woman who looked like she had been there forever.

~Stark Tower, PentHouse Suite~

“Pepper! I got all the contracts signed by the school boards yesterday. The local libraries sent theirs over this morning as well. Can we both go down to the bookstore together and deliver this amazing news?” Tony asked.

“Sure, we can go around 10. They open at 9, but expect to see Agatha there. She’s got today off and I feel like they are going to be glued at the hip for an eternity.” Pepper explained.

“You mentioned they are magically bound the other day but didn’t elaborate. What did you mean by that?” Tony asked his wife as he walked over to her and handed her a cup of coffee.

“You know how Evanora Harkness said the last of her power was taken by Death?” Pepper asked as Tony sat down on the couch next to her.

“Yeah. Still a little lost on that but I have a feeling you’re about to explain.”

“Rio Vidal is THE green witch, which means she’s next in line to take up the title of death. Her great great grandmother Violet Vidal is the current standing entity of death. Agatha is magically bound to her and is her future bride. Their magic has intertwined somehow because of this. I don’t know much about it because I’m not a magic user but I’ve seen the sigil on Agatha’s chest and the new ring that popped up yesterday.”

“She’s known this woman a week and they are engaged?” Tony asked, the question didn’t sound judgmental at all just curious.

“I think their magic is the one driving at the moment. Neither of them have made a conscious choice here. It all seems to be ‘well I found you I’m locking you down.’ Kind of thing.” Pepper explained before she took a sip of her coffee.

“Interesting, I wonder if Strange knows anything about this… their magic interacting with each other I mean.” Tony clarified.

“Just don’t ask Rio too many questions about being the next Entity of death while in public. We can have them over for dinner or something and you can ask a million questions then.” Pepper suggested.

“I will be on my best behavior.” Tony promised.

“Good. Now, we’ve got a couple hours to kill. What do you want to do?” Pepper asked.

“I’d suggest trying again this month but you’ve got a lot on your plate with Evanora so I’m just happy to cuddle with you.” Tony said as he snuggled up to Pepper and took a sip of his coffee.

“Thanks babe. Maybe we can try later.” Pepper said as she kissed the top of his head.

“Oh, did you know that Wanda had a date last night with a published botanist?” Tony asked.

“How do you know that?” Pepper asked as she chuckled at her husband.

“She took her to the botanical gardens and the facial recognition picked up that she walked into the building… So I may have listened in to see if she’s a qualified replacement for Jeffery.”

“Anthony!” Pepper scolded.

“What? I hate doing interviews! She seems over qualified honestly.”

“Well you can have a meeting with Wanda on Monday or Thursday next week and talk to her about the woman and see if she thinks she’d be a good fit.” Pepper suggested.

“Great idea my dear!” Tony said excitedly.

“Tickles.” Wanda mumbled softly.

“Sorry, I didn’t realize you were awake.” Lily said as she scooted closer and kissed Wanda’s shoulder.

“I’m a light sleeper.” Wanda whispered softly before clearing her throat. “So can I ask you a question about last night?”

“I’m sorry if I left a bad taste in your mouth with all my questions.” Lily said quickly, trying to get ahead of the problem.

“That wasn’t what I was going to ask… Are you autistic?” Wanda asked.

“Would it be a deal breaker if I was?” Lily asked nervously.

“Not at all. I don’t care it would just explain many things.” Wanda said with a smile.

“Yeah, I am. I’ve been told I can be a bit much often and I ask personal questions. But I really just wanted to get to know you better. Agatha seems like a big part of your life, so I want to learn about her just as much as you. I’m sorry if I upset you.” Lily explained.

“You forget that I’m a therapist… I seen the signs and I just ignored them because they aren’t red flags to me.” Wanda said softly as she scooted closer to Lily.

“I should’ve lead with it though. It was just so easy texting you the other day, then you didn’t even batt an eye when I asked questions last night, and now I feel bad.” Wanda placed her hand softly on Lily’s cheek, before she leaned forward and gave her a kiss.

“Don’t feel bad. I could tell. It’s really not a big deal. I’m glad you are interested in my best friend. She’s a major part of my life.” Wanda reassured.

“Do you want to hang out today or do you have things you need to do?” Lily asked nervously.

“Where did that confident woman I fucked last night go?” Wanda asked with a smirk.

“She’s around here somewhere. But I just woke up so I’m in my feels.” Lily explained.

“Let’s fix that, Lily would you like to hang out with me today?” Wanda asked as she brushed her thumb across her cheek.

“That sounds delightful.” Lily said with a bright smile on her face.

“I’ll give you a tour of the city seeing as you said you just moved here. Then we can stop at the book store and harass Rio.” Wanda offered.

“Is that something you like to do? Harass Rio I mean.” Lily clarified.

“No but Agatha will probably be at the store and I do like harassing her.” Wanda said with a chuckle.

“Can we cuddle a little longer?” Lily asked as she snuggled into Wanda’s arms.

“Of course.” Wanda said as she kissed Lily on the head softly.

~Vidal Books~

Agatha decided she’d help Rio out with the book store today in anyway she could. She spent a good chunk of the morning helping Rio get books onto shelves while Rio helped customers.

Around 10:30 a.m: the bookstore’s customers slowed down to a trickle. So Rio took a moment to breathe as she leaned against the countertop as she checked her phone for a moment.

Rita Vidal (ICE) 10:01 a.m: what time will you and Agatha be arriving?

Rio Vidal 10:35 a.m: we have to stop at Agatha’s before we come to the cabin… long story. But we will come straight from there so hopefully the latest we get there is 6:45.

Rio sent the text off to her mom and then the front door opened and the bell rang alerting her to a customer coming into the store.

“Welcome to Vidal Books!” Rio greeted politely before she looked up and realized it was Pepper and Tony.

“Nice, this place is awesome!” Tony said excitedly as he looked around the store. Pepper reached out and grabbed his hand before he could run off to look at books.

“Business first dear, then you can act like a kid in a candy store.” Pepper reminded her husband who sighed then snapped into his business persona.

“Right, Rio Vidal I have a proposition for you. I’m all about supporting local businesses and getting more books into schools and libraries. We have made contracts up with each school and library in the area that they will order books from your shop and they will all be paid for by Stark Industries personally. You can have your lawyer look over the contracts and let us know next week if you would like?” Tony said as he handed Rio a usb drive.

“Pepper what did I say!” Agatha scolded as she came out from behind a bookshelf. Rio was standing at the counter with a shocked look on her face.

“It was Tony’s idea!” Pepper said as she held her hands up.

“Yeah my left foot. I assume I’m the lawyer in this case.” Agatha said with a grumble, not actually irritated but irked.

“I mean she’s your wife.” Pepper jabbed with a smile on her face.

“I regret telling you everything.” Agatha said as she walked over to Rio.

“Am I dreaming?” Rio asked as she looked at Agatha.

“No, you aren’t. Tony does this, though I think Peppers the mastermind here.” Agatha said as she side eyed the taller woman.

“Can I go look now?” Tony asked as he looked around the store.

“Yes you can, thank you.” Pepper said as she bent down and kissed her husband softly on the cheek. Tony ran off to look at the books.

“I’ll review this tomorrow.” Agatha said as she took the usb and stuck it in her pocket.

“I also emailed it to you before we walked in.” Pepper clarified.

“Why?” Rio asked in a confused tone that was directed at Pepper.

“Because you make my friend happier than I’ve ever seen her and I know that you’re officially a permanent fixture in her life. Might as well make it easier on both of you.” Pepper answered.

“Ridiculous! Absolutely ridiculous the lot of you!” Agatha said exasperatedly, Rio grabbed Agatha’s hand and smiled at her brightly.

“Look at it for me please? I trust you to make the best choice for me and my business.” Rio requested with a smile on her face that Agatha absolutely could not say no too.

“Anything for you.” Agatha said softly.

“Gross Harkness has gone soft.” Tony teased as he walked over to the counter carrying a couple books.

“Shut up, Mr. Potts.” Agatha softly bit back, while keeping eye contact with Rio. “Alright, I’m gunna continue to stock books.”

“I think I’ll actually look around now that we’ve got the business aspect out of the way. What did you find babe?” Pepper told the group before she asked her husband.

“Just a couple books on green sustainability. Maybe we can upscale it.” Tony said as he showed Pepper.

“Alright let’s look. Maybe we can find you something to read that is just for leisure.” Pepper suggested as she guided Tony toward the romance section.

A few seconds after Tony and Pepper walked away the front door opened. Rio looked up to see Wanda’s bright red hair dash into the room followed by a shorter blonde.

“Wanda, nice to see you. Agatha’s in the back.” Rio said with a chuckle. She was realizing everyone in Agatha’s life was filtering into her bookstore.

“Rio! Nice to see you, I told Lily I’d buy her a book after dragging her around the city a little. Your store is just a stop before we head off again.” Wanda said with a smile as Lily took her hand and waited for her to finish talking.

“Wanda just walked in Agatha!” Rio yelled toward the back of the store. Agatha popped her head out from behind a bookcase and sighed when she seen the bright red hair on her best friend’s head. Agatha got up and dusted herself off before walking to the front of the store.

“Why is everyone here right now?” Agatha asked with a sigh as she walked over to Wanda who smiled brightly and hugged her friend.

“Agatha, meet Lily!” Wanda said excitedly, Agatha met eyes with the blonde who looked Agatha up and down for a long moment.

“I never had a chance in hell.” Lily said before she realized that she said it out loud. “I mean, nice to meet you Agatha. My name is Lilian but everyone calls me Lily! Please ignore the first thing I said.” Lily said with a blush.

“Nice to meet you Lily, I’ll try my best to remember that but, you’ve inflated my ego slightly.” Agatha flirted.

“I will stab you.” Wanda threatened which caused Agatha to laugh.

“She flirted with me first, didn’t ya cutie?” Agatha asked before she winked at the blonde who blushed brightly. Rio literally was trying her best to not keel over laughing at her fiancé’s harassment of her best friend.

“Agatha, for your own health I recommend you don’t piss Wanda off too much.” Pepper said as she walked over to the group.

“I feed her, she’d never actually hurt me.” Agatha said before she walked back over to Rio and placed a hand on the small of Rio’s back.

“Perfect! I don’t have to wait for you to put your application in. Lilian Grey, would you like to come in on Monday for an interview for the head of botanical research for Stark Industries?” Tony asked as he popped his head around Pepper.

“I… Uh.. what?” Lily asked in a confused tone.

“What my husband is trying to say is. Hello we are Pepper Potts and Tony Stark owners of Stark Industries and we are currently looking for a replacement for our head of botanical research. Tony has read a few of your research papers in the last day or so and believes you are more than qualified for the job. Would you like to come into the botanical gardens on Monday for a proper interview?” Pepper asked.

“I’d be honored. Thank you for this opportunity.” Lily said politely.

“Monday. 4 p.m. work for you?” Tony asked.

“Yes that works for me Sir, thank you so much.”

“Look at that! You didn’t even have to put in an application!” Wanda said excitedly as she held Lily’s hand shaking it with joy.

“Wanda, don’t shake your date it’s rude.” Rio scolded from behind the counter, she felt for the girl they were both in very overwhelming positions for different reasons.

“Well, we really must be going. Tony let’s get our books. I have a few things that need done at home.” Pepper said as she guided her husband over to the counter. Tony set five books down and Rio rang them up.

“That will be $110 even Mr. Stark.” Rio said and the man pulled his phone out and tapped it to the keypad. The payment went through quickly and he smiled at Rio.

“Please call me Tony. We will be business partners soon anyway!” Rio shook her head at the man and bagged up his books before handing them over to him.

“Enjoy your books Tony. Have a wonderful day you two!” Rio said with a smile.

“You as well Rio.” Pepper and Tony said in unison before they headed out the door.

“Why were they here anyway?” Wanda asked as she jabbed her thumb toward the door.

“Pepper has a wild hare up her ass and is determined to make sure Rio is successful.” Agatha answered as she shook her head.

“Well she’s your fiancé so I’d fucking hope so.” Wanda said with a chuckle.

“You guys are engaged?” Lily asked and caused the three women to freeze.

“Uh… did I say fiancé? I meant girlfriend.” Wanda tried to backtrack.

“Wanda you’re a horrible lair.” Rio said with a sigh.

“It’s complicated.” Wanda and Agatha said in unison.

“Ya know what.. I don’t need to know yet. I wanna be nosy but I’ve been nosy enough lately.” Lily said as she let the conversation drop.

“Thank you. She’s gunna kill me later.” Wanda whispered to Lily before she spoke up. “Anyway, did you want to look for a book?”

“Yes I did. I’ll go do that while you three talk.” Lily said as she walked away.

“Way to go Maximoff.” Rio chided quietly.

“Does she know how long you have been dating?” Wanda whispered.

“No but it’s bound to come up at some point!” Rio hissed.

“Stop. We will have to tell her or we won’t. It’s fine. Stop stressing. You two might not work out.” Agatha said softly.

“I mean I hope we do. She’s pretty great.” Wanda said with a soft smile.

“Oh. Well then. That’s new.” Agatha said with a chuckle.

“What?” Wanda asked with a raised eyebrow.

“Oh nothing, don’t worry too much about it just enjoy your date.” Agatha said with a smile directed at her best friend. She then turned to look at Rio. “I’m gunna go finish stocking books my love.”

“Thank you I appreciate you.” Rio said with a smile before she gave Agatha a kiss.

“Ew public displays of affection.” Wanda joked.

“If we weren’t in the bookstore right now.” Agatha said with a sigh as she walked away.

“What does that mean?” Wanda asked Rio.

“I’ve kinda made it an accidental rule… nothing in the bookstore.” Rio whispered as she looked over at Agatha who was bent over putting books away, giving Rio a perfect view of her ass in the jeans she was wearing.

“Ahh I see. Well good luck keeping that rule in place.” Wanda said with a chuckle.

“Yeah. I’m a weak bitch and I know it. Now get out of the way I have other customers.” Rio said as she waved Wanda to the side.

“Sorry! I’m harassing my future sister in law.” Wanda said as she stepped out of the way of a pair of teenagers.

“You guys are friends with Tony Stark?” The young boy asked.

“We aren’t, but that cool lady over there with the wavy long black hair is. He’s just my boss.” Wanda explained as she pointed at Agatha.

“That’s awesome!” The young man said as the girl jabbed him in the arm.

“Just get your book Jake. They were talking.” The girl said in an irritated tone.

“It’s alright, she’s just waiting on her date to find a book and I own the place. Come on up, let’s get you checked out.” Rio told the two teens as they walked up to the counter and she rang the book up.

“That will be $18.99.” Rio said as she tucked the book into the bag. The boy gave Rio a $20 bill and she gave him his change with a smile.

“Thanks for shopping with us! Have a good day you two.” Rio said as the two teens walked out of the building. Leaving the four women alone in the book shop. Lily walked over to Wanda and Rio a few minutes later holding a couple books.

“I’ll pay for these.” Lily said as she walked over to the counter.

“No, you won’t.” Wanda said as she looked Rio dead in the eye.

“Wanda let me pay for my own books. Rio, please.” Lily begged.

“I’m literally stuck with her for the rest of my life… Sorry Lily. She wins.” Rio said with a sigh.

“You and Agatha could break up. You never know, we live a long ass time.” Lily said honestly not realizing how untrue that statement was.

“Trust me when I say this Lily, that’s never gunna happen.” Wanda reassured as she handed Rio her card.

“Why do I believe you?” Lily asked.

“Because it’s the truth.” Wanda said with a shrug, Rio put the books in the bag and then handed Wanda her card and the receipt.

“Have a good rest of your date you two.” Rio told them as they walked toward the door. Once they were out of the store and down the street Wanda took Lily’s hand and brought it up to her mouth so she could kiss the back of it.

“I have like seven questions. Give or take.” Lily said causing Wanda to laugh.

“I’ll answer them to the best of my ability.” Wanda reassured as they turned the corner toward the coffee shop.

“Have you and Agatha ever…” Lily started to ask but trailed off not wanting to actually ask.

“Yuck, no. She’s literally like a sister to me.” Wanda answered with a blanch.

“Ok. Why was she flirting with me?” Lily asked trying to understand their recent conversations.

“To piss me off if I’m being honest. If you need I’ll tell her to not do that because it makes you uncomfortable and she will stop instantly.” Wanda reassured as they walked up to the shop and she opened the door for Lily.

“Good to know… are you a jealous person?” Lily asked, even though she had a pretty clear idea. Lily got in line with Wanda while they waited their turn.

“Yes, I’ll try to keep that to a minimum though. If or when we start officially dating all bets are off.” Wanda explained while she looked at the menu.

“Does that translate to possessiveness?” Lily asked, she took a moment to look at the menu as well. “You bought me books let me pay for the coffee.”

“Yes, and into the bedroom on top of that. No, I asked you out on this date I’m paying ” Wanda answered as the line moved a little.

“Fine, you can pay but next time I am. How long have Rio and Agatha been dating? A year? Maybe two? How can you know for sure they are each others forever.” Lily trailed off trying to make sense.

“They have a special connection I promise. I’ll tell you about it one day.” Wanda told Lily before they got to the counter.

“Welcome in to Coffee Co. what can I get started for you ladies today?” The barista asked.

“Can I please get a black coffee with 3 pumps of hazelnut syrup?” Wanda requested.

“And you?” The barista asked Lilly.

“Can I have the cookies and cream frappe with a shot of espresso please?” Lily asked politely.

“Sure that will be $10.50 and a name for the order?” The barista asked as Wanda handed her card over to her. The girl swiped it, made sure it went through and handed it back.

“Wanda. Thank you.” Wanda answered as she took her card back. Lily and Wanda stepped off to the side to continue talking while they waited for their drinks.

“Is Mr. Stark always so forward?” Lily asked Wanda which made the woman chuckle.

“Yes. Yes he is.” Wanda answered.

~Back at the Bookshop~

Rio spent the rest of the day taking care of customers while Agatha cleaned and took care of things for her. Around 5:30 the store seemed dead to the world. So Rio took a moment to walk over to Agatha and give her a couple quick kisses.

“Thank you for helping today. Now we can spend the whole day together tomorrow doing whatever we want.” Rio said with a smile.

“You’re welcome babe, should I run home and get the cakes?” Agatha asked after she pulled away slightly to look at her watch.

“Nah, we will head to your place once we lock up then open a portal to the cabin there.” Rio answered.

“Do you have a laptop here?” Agatha asked.

“No, don’t worry about their proposal right now. I want you to relax you’ve been helping me all day.” Rio reassured.

“I honestly have no doubt they made sure it was fully to your benefit.” Agatha explained, then before Rio had a chance to respond the front door opened again. They broke apart and Rio went to greet her customer.

“Welcome to Vidal Books!” Rio said in a cheerful tone as she walked back toward the front. Agatha went and sat down on the couch in the spell book section. She pulled her phone out and checked her email and started reading the document on there. Everything seemed pretty straight forward for legal jargon.

20 minutes later the book store was locked up and Rio was ready to head to Agatha’s place. She walked into the back of the store and looked over at Agatha who was reading on her phone.

“In a store full of books you decide to read on your phone?” Rio teased.

“I remembered Pepper emailed it to me. So I’m reading it. I didn’t mean to offend the books or you.” Agatha said as she locked her phone and stood up.

“Anything interesting?” Rio asked as she walked over to Agatha.

“It was exactly what I was expecting. Pretty straightforward. We can talk more about it after dinner. Let’s head to my place.” Agatha said before she gave Rio a soft kiss, pulling her close. Rio could feel something bubble up inside her as Agatha slipped her hand under Rio’s shirt to press her left hand against her lower back.

“Behave we have to be at the cabin in 40 minutes.” Rio whispered as Agatha kissed her neck.

“Fine… I suppose I’ll have to wait to do what I wanted to.” Agatha said as she brought her left hand around and pressed it against Rio’s sigil. Rio felt desire flood through her. The ring seeming to amplify the sensation.

“Agatha…” Rio groaned out weakly.

“Rio.” Agatha husked before she kissed her on the lips again and then pulled away. “Let’s go, my love.”

“I’m going to get you back for that.”

“Why? Didn’t you tell Wanda you made a rule of no fucking in the book store?” Agatha said with a smirk as she walked toward the back door. Rio sighed and followed Agatha knowing they didn’t have time for anything.

They quickly locked the door and armed the security system before getting in Rio’s car and heading toward Agatha’s place.

“So I’ve heard a lot about your mom, what about your dad?” Agatha asked as Rio put the car in drive.

“He works a lot, I don’t even know if he will be there tonight. It might just be you, me, and momma.” Rio said honestly.

“What does he do for a living? Is he a witch?” Agatha asked as she watched the city drive through the window.

“He’s a Millwright, so he travels all over the country fixing machines that are too big to move. He is, but he rarely practices. He says if he can’t wrench it into submission he doesn’t want anything to do with it. A real fixer.”

“Wouldn’t magic help with his job?” Agatha wondered.

“I mean probably, but then he wouldn’t be built like a brick shit house. I personally think he likes the manual labor. Probably why I prefer analog magic most of the time. It feels like you’re earning it.” Rio explained.

“You seem to use magic the normal way around me a lot.” Agatha mused.

“Well since meeting you it’s become easier for me. I don’t know if that’s our connection or what but things seem easier and lighter than they used to when I did magic.” Rio explained.

“Interesting because I’ve felt more grounded since meeting you. Like I’m not as stressed about things anymore.” Agatha thought aloud, more to herself than anything. Then they both seemed to come to the same understanding at the same time.

“Looks like you two figured it out finally!” Violet said from the back seat startling both women. A loud yelp came from Agatha as she clutched her chest, Rio only jumped slightly as she looked in the rear view mirror.

“Okay grandma don’t do that shit while we are driving!” Rio scolded, as she glared into the mirror.

“Explain.” Agatha said after she calmed down.

“Death needs balance. You balance each other out, in every aspect. Your magic fills in the weak spots for each other. Which is why you feel more grounded now Agatha and why magic is easier for you Rio.”

“So… we can use each others magic?” Agatha asked.

“Less use each other’s magic. More you are both earth spirit witches. I’m a spirit chaos witch and so is my wife.” Violet explained.

“Can regular witches do what we do or is this just something exclusive to us?” Rio asked.

“I’ve seen a few deep bonds that make it as far as the sigil on their chests but the rings never appear. Take that information and digest it however you’d like.” Violet explained.

“Interesting.” Agatha said as she thought about it.

“You girls enjoy dinner, tell Rita I love her please Rio.” Violet said before she disappeared again right as Rio parked in Agatha’s driveway.

“Let’s go get the cakes and head to dinner. We can talk about all that later.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“That’s fine my love.” Rio said with a smile before she got out of the car. Agatha got out and used her magic to unlock her door because she realized she didn’t have her keys.

“Maybe we should leave keys at each other’s places just in case this keeps happening.” Agatha said as she let Rio into the house.

“If we keep having things like this happen I agree.” Rio said as she shut the front door. Agatha walked into the kitchen and grabbed the two cakes out of the fridge and then headed back into the entryway.

“Ready?” Agatha asked.

“Yep, I’ve already done the hard work so let’s go to your bedroom door and use that portal.” Rio said as she walked toward Agatha’s bedroom. She reached for the handle and opened the door to present a swirling green portal.

“Come on. Momma’s dying to meet you.”Rio said as she guided Agatha through the portal.

Chapter End Notes

Y'all couldn’t be patient.

Author wants all the sorry we were sus comments.

Sorry this update took so long.

Chapter 19

Agatha stepped through the portal first into the lush green forest floor. The soft moss cushioning her steps as she turned around to wait for Rio who stepped through a moment later. Both women stood in the clearing, Rio felt her whole body relax the second her feet hit the earth.

“Why did my shoes disappear?” Agatha asked.

“Oh. No shoes in the forest. Kinda like the moms that yell ‘no shoes in the house’ well this is the house for our family.” Rio explained.

“Makes sense, could’ve warned me.” Agatha said with a chuckle.

“I forgot until just now that we came here barefoot the first time. “ Rio explained.

“That’s fine, as long as those shoes are still at home because I love them.” Agatha said as she started walking toward the cabin.

“They are right by the door I promise.” Rio reassured.

“Good. Now let’s get this over with before I chicken out.” Agatha said as they stood at the steps of the cabin.

“I promise she will love you.” Rio told Agatha as she walked up the steps and put her hand on the doorknob.

“You have to say that.” Agatha said with a chuckle. Rio opened the door and the cabins warmth rushed over them as they walked into the house. Sounds could be heard from the kitchen as Rio guided Agatha deeper into the cabin.

“Momma it smells amazing!” Rio said as she walked into the kitchen. Rita Vidal was standing at the stove cooking something when they walked into the room. Agatha paused a moment later as the woman turned around to look at the younger women. She looked just like Rio, the only difference between the two women was Rita being a little shorter than her daughter, had smile lines, and a large gray streak framing both sides of her face.

“Rio! Papa will actually be here at 7, so I’m glad he gets to meet Agatha! Speaking of Hello witchlett! You are even more beautiful than I could’ve ever imagined!” Rita said as she rushed over to the two women. Rio hugged her mother tightly for a long moment before she let go. Rita went to hug Agatha and realized she was holding the cakes.

“These look stunning but let’s put them down witchlett! You deserve a real hug.” Rita said as she took the cakes from Agatha and set them on the countertop behind her. She then pulled Agatha in for a soft hug. Agatha felt so safe and loved in Rita’s arms. She had never been hugged like this by Evanora. Tears welled up in her eyes as she realized she had never been actually hugged by her mother. Agatha pulled away first and tried to wipe the tears away.

“Sorry. I..” Agatha tried to apologize but the words didn’t want to come out. She felt like there was a massive lump in her throat.

“Momma! Don’t make her cry.” Rio scolded. Agatha swallowed hard and tried to speak again but nothing came out. She took a deep breath and took Rio’s left hand and touched the ring there. Trying to communicate how she felt in this moment. She knew Rio could feel her emotions. Just not strongly. It seemed stronger when they touched sigils but the rings felt like a connection as well.

“Oh. I… ah I see. I’m sorry babe. Take a moment. It’s okay. Then you can tell her.” Rio said softly. Agatha breathed deeply and sighed loudly after a moment.

“I’m sorry, my mother never hugged me. I didn’t know what that felt like.” Agatha said softly.

“Oh witchlett! I’m sorry but you are gunna have to get used to hugs like that for the rest of my life. Now let me finish cooking dinner while we wait for my husband.” Rita reassured, hugging her softly again before turning around and going back to the stove.

“What is Mr. Vidal’s name?” Agatha asked as Rio guided Agatha over to the table to sit down.

“Daniel.” Rita answered, a moment later the front door of the cabin opened then shut.

“Girls I’m here!” A deep voice resounded from the living room.

“In the kitchen Papa!” Rio yelled for her father. A few moments later a tall muscular man walked into the room. He seemed about average build for a man to Agatha, just a few inches taller than Rio. He had dark black hair, tan skin, deep green eyes, and a handsome face with a warm smile.

“Pepita!” Daniel said loudly as soon as he seen Rio, he scooped her up into his arms and spun her around as they laughed in the kitchen before he set his daughter down. Agatha stood up during the spin so she could greet the man.

“Papa, I’d like to introduce you to Agatha. Don’t hug her, momma already almost made her cry. ” Rio said introducing her father to her fiancé.

“Ahh, well Pepita, that’s Agatha’s choice. Would you be okay with a hug?” Daniel asked.

“As long as my feet stay on the ground.” Agatha said honestly.

“I can do that.” Daniel reassured as he stepped closer to Agatha and gave her a soft hug. Both of Rio’s parents put so much love and warmth into their hugs. It felt so nice. Agatha soaked in the hug this time and then pulled away.

“Alright. Dinners done.” Rita told them.

“What are we having?” Daniel asked his wife.

“Ropa Vieja with rice, and Agatha was so kind to make us dessert.” Rita told her husband as she started serving up bowls of food and her husband walked over to the counter to help her grab the bowls. They all sat down at the table a few minutes later with their food in front of them.

“Thank you for dinner Mrs. Vidal.” Agatha said politely.

“Oh none of that Mrs. Vidal stuff, you can call us by our first names. Now eat, please.” Rita told Agatha, who looked shocked to say the least.

“Momma, she’s not used to this. We are going to have to give her some grace here.” Rio explained to her mother.

“Agatha, it’s okay. You don’t have to worry here. My wife is just trying to make you comfortable, just call us whatever makes you comfortable.” Daniel said softly.

“Thank you Sir. I appreciate that.” Agatha told him.

“So, tell us about yourself! Rio has been so busy we haven’t gotten to talk much lately.” Rita requested before she started eating.

“Well, you know the bad stuff already. So we will start with I’m partner at Stark Law offices, but I still take high profile cases. I graduated top of my class. I started college right after my mother tried to kill me because I had no other choice. Graduated highschool at 16, graduated law school at 24, got hired in at Stark Law as a little baby intern and climbed my way to the top. I like to cook, read, practice magic, and just learn as much as I can.” Agatha told Rio’s parents.

“Oh so you’re clever, good. Someone’s gotta be to keep Rio on her toes.” Daniel said with a chuckle. Agatha took a bite of her food and hummed happily. It tasted so good, like a dish that made you feel like you were home.

“This is amazing Rita. I’ll need the recipe so I can make it for Rio.” Agatha said after she finished chewing her food.

“Momma, don’t… please if you care about my waistline.” Rio begged.

“Why is that sweetie?” Daniel asked as he watched Agatha pick apart the food looking it over and analyzing it. Like she was taking mental notes of every item in the dish.

“Because she made this chicken for me the other night and it was so good! She can cook already, don’t give her the family recipes… she might improve them.” Rio told her father, before she added the last part sheepishly.

“I doubt I could improve this Rio. It’s perfectly balanced.” Agatha complimented.

“What was the chicken?” Rita asked.

“It’s called marry me chicken. It’s chicken breast pan fried in a light dredge of flour then cooked off the rest of the way in a rich cream sauce.” Agatha explained.

“Maybe we will trade recipes then! That sounds good.” Rita said with a wink before she went back to eating.

“She also roasted off mini potatoes that were super yummy as well. Honestly I’m probably going to get fat if she cooks like that for me for the rest of our lives.” Rio told her parents.

“What do you do for a living Rita?” Agatha asked.

“I own a green house here in Washington that I run. Keeps me busy while Daniel is out running around the country.” Rita explained.

“I’d love to see it sometime.” Agatha said as she took another bite of food.

“I think the cake helped.” Agatha said with a chuckle.

“I think you being you helped.” Rio said as Agatha opened the door for her.

“Let’s get home. I have a victory to celebrate.” Agatha said smugly.

~Sunday morning, County Jail~

Agatha chuckled at Rio before she got up and went to her office on the opposite side of the living room. She made sure to leave the door open so Rio could find her.

“At least moving will be kind of easy… but I don’t want her to have to commute 30 minutes everyday to work.” Agatha said to herself as she opened her laptop and pulled up the email. She started reviewing it and checking everything again. The longer she read it the more laughable the contract became. It was so full of loopholes it wasn’t even funny. Literally every paragraph basically gave Agatha a chance to get Rio out of this contract at any moment.

“Pepper you know better than to leave this many loop holes… Rio could cancel this contract ten minutes after she started it if she wanted. Fuck I feel loved.” Agatha said with a smile on her face. She looked at the time and realized that she had been reading the contract for 45 minutes already.

“Why do you feel loved?” Rio asked from the living room.

“Because Pepper is ridiculous but I know she did this because she loves me and wants me happy.” Agatha said honestly as Rio walked into the room.

“So she left herself vulnerable?” Rio asked.

“This is lawyer speak for ‘this is your wedding gift but not really because when you get married we are spoiling the fuck out of you.’ She basically is giving you this contract with the ability to back out at any point. No money owed, no dues paid nothing. Just take this money for helping educate young minds.”

“What money? I thought I was just going to be the school and library systems new distributor essentially. Like they only buy books from me.” Rio asked.

“Yeah there’s also the stipulation that you hire two salary workers and the funds that go along with them. Tony and Pepper are basically writing you a check for $100,000 so you can pay two people $50,000 to work for you. Every year they stay on your staff they will be paid that amount by Stark industries until you can afford to pay them that rate on your own.” Agatha explained to Rio who just stood there with her mouth agape.

“No. No way? What?!?” Rio asked in a confused tone.

“It’s there in black and white. Just need’s your signature babe. It’s one hundred percent safe.” Agatha reassured.

“Print it off and I’ll sign it?” Rio asked.

“Nah, we do e-signatures let me grab my iPad.” Agatha said as she leaned over and grabbed her iPad from the drawer and pulled open the document. She handed Rio her pencil and let her sign. Then signed next to her signature and sent it off to Pepper.

“Now you have me all to yourself. Do you want to go to the botanical gardens with your sketchbook seeing as it’s only noon? That will give you 7 hours in there to have fun drawing and observing plants.” Agatha offered.

“Please? That sounds amazing.”

“Well let’s get dressed and go!” Agatha said with a smile on her face as she stood up from her chair. Rio followed her out the door with a smile on her face as they made their way toward the bedroom. Today was going to be a good day.

Chapter End Notes

Okay! Next chapter is the Hearing. It might be a long one, lots of evidence is going to be presented guys. Hold on tight.

Chapter 22

The next morning Agatha and Rio got up and got dressed for court that day. Agatha put on her favorite deep purple suit that made her feel the most confident, she paired it with a light purple button up and black tie. Rio on the other hand let Agatha decide her outfit.

“What am I wearing?” Rio asked as she dried her hair. With a wave of her hand Rio was dressed in a formal black suit, deep emerald green button up and Agatha’s green tie with gold monstera leafs she was wearing last week. Rio’s hair was slicked back into a neat bun.

“Perfect, just perfect. I may have done too well though… you look good enough to eat.” Agatha said in a lust filled tone.

“No, no, no. Behave. We have to go to this. Plus Wanda will be here any second begging for food.” Rio said backing up slightly. Agatha sighed loudly before she walked out of the bedroom and toward the kitchen.

“I hate my mother so fucking much.” Agatha grumbled under her breath as she threw on an apron; and started to make breakfast for the four. She assumed Lily would be joining them as well.

“I’m inclined to agree but at least I’ll be there for you.” Rio reassured as she hopped up on the counter to watch Agatha cook.

“You’ll be behind me and Pepper. Along with Wanda. But I appreciate you coming.” Agatha said as she started making waffle batter.

“If you feel stressed or worried just talk to me in your mind I’ll be there. You’ve got me.” Rio reassured.

“Thank you babe. I appreciate it. You being there would’ve been more than enough. I’m glad I have this connection with you as well.” Agatha said as she walked over to Rio before she gave her a soft kiss on the lips.

The front door swung open a moment later.
“Good morning!” Wanda said cheerfully as she walked into the kitchen, Lily following behind her looking like a zombie.

“Wanda, you gotta make sure you let her sleep. Not all of us run on 3 hours of sleep and chaos.” Agatha said as she walked over to Lily and soothed her hands over the woman’s face, chanting an incantation in the process. Lily’s eye bags and sleepy demeanor seemed to almost completely vanish as soon as Agatha let her go. Lily walked over to the empty barstool next to Wanda and sat down to wait.

“There, that should help some. Sorry my best friend doesn’t know what rest is. Maybe you’ll be able to teach her.” Agatha said with a smile as she walked back over to the waffle maker.

“Wow! That is an amazing spell, what is it?” Lily asked curiously.

“Just an energy boost, something small that will get you through the day. You have an interview at 4 don’t you?” Agatha asked.

“Yes, with Mr.Stark.” Lily said cheerfully.

“Good you’ll need that spell and some coffee. I swear if Tony had been born to magical parents he would’ve also been a chaos witch.” Agatha joked as she waved her hand and the coffee maker started setting itself up for a large batch of coffee.

“Thank you Agatha. I appreciate it.” Lily said with a smile.

“What can’t you do, my love?” Rio asked with a smile, admiring Agatha’s ability.

“Lots of things but that doesn’t stop me from trying to do new things. The first step to being good at something is being really fucking bad at it.” Agatha said with a chuckle.

“Yeah, like you’re cooking when we got our first apartment.” Wanda joked.

“It was still better than yours is now.” Agatha jabbed back.

“Hey! You learned how to cook, I learned how to do other important things…” Wanda said sadly.

“Like?” Rio teased.

“I’m not saying, you guys are being mean.” Wanda said with a playful huff. She was trying to avoid the real answer, but Agatha instantly knew.

‘Keeping panic attacks at bay, keeping me from ending up in a psyche ward.’ Agatha told Rio in her mind.

“You are a good friend, stop sulking. I just like teasing you.” Agatha told Wanda before she continued. “But seriously… Lily. Energy potions. Lots of them.”

“Wayyy ahead of you. I ordered ingredients on my phone while you were talking. I just have to stop at Kale Cosmetics and Sundries sometime today to pick them up.” Lily said with a sigh.

“Oh! Shit! Have you spoken to Jen and Alice this week?” Agatha asked.

“No… probably should but you know how Alice gets…” Wanda said with a sigh.

“After the hearing, but you should text her and let her know your girlfriend? Girlfriend. Is coming in and picking stuff up.” Agatha told them.

“Wait… your friends with Jennifer Kale?” Lily asked.

“I also would like clarification here…” Rio piped up.

“Jennifer and her girlfriend Alice are our friends yes.” Wanda clarified.

“Small world.” Rio said with an amazed yet amused tone.

“Where ever you are, a coven there shall be.” Agatha clarified.

“God, I hate that fucking rule.” Wanda grumbled.

“Oh stop it’s a good universal truth to know.”

“Yeah but why does it always have to sound so snarky?!? Like you’re not going to find a coven in the middle of the forest.
Right?” Wanda pondered.

“Actually….” Rio trailed off.

“Green witches and their fucking forest living.” Wanda complained again.

“Hey my family’s cabin is quite nice thank you very much.” Rio scolded.

“I don’t doubt that. I’m sorry I guess I’m just cranky because I have to deal with Evanora today.” Wanda said in a grouchy tone. Lily walked over and kissed Wanda softly on the cheek.

“It’s okay. You’re allowed to be a lil grumpy. But look at Agatha, she doesn’t seem stressed at all.”

“That’s because the bitch is powerless now.” Agatha said happily.

“Have we thought about the coven showing up?” Wanda asked.

“I haven’t, but I have wards up with the judges permission.” Agatha explained as she finished playing up the waffles and eggs. She pulled a bowl of fruit out of the fridge and set it on the counter.

“If any of them socialize with her anymore.” Wanda clarified as she watched Agatha use her magic to get everything to the table and then grab the pot of coffee off the warmer.

“Grab the creamer and simple syrup please Rio.” Agatha requested as she shooed Wanda and Lily to the table.

“Of course my love.” Rio said with a smile as she jumped off the counter and got in the fridge to get what Agatha requested. She followed her over to the table along with the other two women. They all sat down and ate much faster today, knowing they had to be out the door by 8:45 a.m.

“You are a really good cook Agatha.” Lily complimented as she finished her last bite of waffle.

“I know I hit the jackpot when I met her didn’t I?” Rio told Lily but she was totally flirting with Agatha under the ruse of bragging.

“Honestly, yes. I’m just stuck with her hot bestfriend.” Lily joked.

“Thank you, I appreciate the compliment.” Agatha said with a smile as she stood up and started clearing the table. She cleaned the plates off and dumped them in the sink.

“Wait was that a backhanded compliment?” Wanda asked with a scoff as she stood up with her coffee cup and grabbed her own plate.

“Kind of? Unintentionally. Sorry.” Lily said apologetically as she picked up her plate and cup and followed Wanda into the kitchen. Rio picked up the rest of the table and followed suit, all of the women filtering in and cleaning up.

“Don’t apologize to her Lily, she likes being bullied by us.” Agatha said with a chuckle as she waved her hand and cleaned the kitchen instantly. Purple magic sparking around the kitchen.

“I never said that!” Wanda said defensively as she stood up.
