“Are you wearing that today?” Agatha asked as she looked at Wanda’s outfit. She was wearing her slacks and a loose button up.

“Yes?” Wanda asked the question coming out as a high pitched squeak.

“No.” Agatha said as she waved her hand and changed her outfit into a deep burgundy suit with black embellishments, a white button up and a slick black satin tie. Wanda’s hair was braided loosely down her back. “Much better.” Agatha said with a smile.

“I… um… wow.” Lily said appreciatively.

“Wanna try that again with actual words Lily?” Rio asked as she ushered all the women toward the front door.

“No, I’m done embarrassing myself.” Lily said with a blush.

“Suit yourself.” Rio joked.

“Lame pun babe.” Agatha said with an eye roll, then she took a deep breath and said. “Let’s get on the road. Today’s going to be a shitshow.”

Lily and Wanda hopped in Wanda’s car and drove off. Agatha and Rio got in Agatha’s car and made their way to the court house. Twenty minutes into the drive Rio pulled her phone out to see a text.

Aunt Lilia 8:30 a.m: I will be there today as a the memory spell administer. Do not acknowledge me. Love you.

“Huh…” Rio said aloud.

“Huh what babe?” Agatha asked as she pulled into the courthouse parking lot.

“Lilia is going to be administering the memory sharing spell. She doesn’t want me to acknowledge her, which I will respect.” Rio told Agatha.

“Interesting, let’s go I have to meet with Pepper.” Agatha told Rio as she unbuckled and turned off the car.

“Okay. But first. One kiss, just to settle the nerves?” Rio asked.

“I can agree to those terms.” Agatha said as she turned and gave Rio a soft kiss on the lips before pulling away and getting out of the car. Rio sighed sadly and got out of the car, she quickly made her way around the car and to Agatha who was waiting for her. She took Agatha’s left hand and brought it to her lips. This time pouring as much love and care into the soft kiss against the ring.

“I don’t want to cry right now Rio.” Agatha said softly before she tried to let Rio’s hand go. Rio let her hand drop back to her side but kept holding it. They walked up the stairs quietly for a moment before Rio spoke up.

“Sorry. Not the intended goal. I just.. I want you to know you are cared for, desired, and frankly needed by me. I don’t know how I’d live without you now.” Rio said honestly which caused Agatha to laugh.

“I guess it’s a good thing you are stuck with me then isn’t it?” Agatha teased as she opened the door to the courthouse, Rio felt the wards on the courthouse bend and shape around her.

“Sorry, they are a bit heavy but it’s for a good reason.” Agatha explained.

“It’s not that. It’s just very impressive. Most people can’t keep a spell like that running, let alone multiple.” Rio said honestly.

“This one is old. Honestly it’s been here twelve years? I don’t know for sure. I just know that I put a lot of energy into it in the beginning and now it’s self sustaining. Come on, Pepper’s waiting.” Agatha said with a smile. They made their way into the court room and Agatha guided Rio over to her seat before she went to speak privately with Pepper.

“Good morning, I hope you are ready for a long day.” Pepper said honestly.

“As I can be, but you, Wanda and Rio will be here for me.” Agatha said with a strange tone.

“I promise, she can’t hurt you.” Pepper reassured.

“Wanda asked if we were worried about her coven showing up. I strengthened the wards on the door as we walked through them.” Agatha said honestly.

“Way ahead of you. Any magical user here in support of Evanora Harkness has to have on magic suppression gauntlets or sit outside until the hearing is over.” Pepper explained. “Tony was irritated she actually made it into the building so he made contingency plans. Stephen Strange is also here sitting in the very back.” Pepper reassured.

“That makes me feel better. Thank you.” Agatha said with a sigh as she sat down.

“You gunna be okay? I did some research on our consultant, she’s the best memory recall spell caster that exists currently.” Pepper asked before explaining.

“I’ll be just fine. I promise.” Agatha reassured. She seen a blur of red hair and burgundy zip into the court room out of the corner of her eye, before settling next to Rio. Five minutes later Evanora Harkness was guided into the room.

‘Goddesses she looks like shit.’ Agatha thought clearly in her mind projecting it to Rio.

‘Yes, she does. I assume that’s what happens when you suddenly lose all your magic.’ Rio answered before the bailiff came out and spoke.

“Please rise for Judge Heart.” The man’s voice booming through the courtroom. Everyone stood and waited for him to enter the room. He walked in and settled at his podium and banged his gavel as he sat.

“Be seated. Today we are having the formal hearing on the Harkness Vs. Harkness case. I will hear Evanora’s side first. Please have your lawyer come to the stand and present your evidence.”

“Thank you Judge Heart. Today I present to you a mother who has tried over and over again to get her daughter to stop tormenting her. My client claims her daughter is a spirit witch and we all know what spirit witches are, they steal peoples powers. That’s all they are good at. All my client wanted was for Wanda Maximoff’s hexes to stop. She had no other way of contacting Agatha Harkness so she found another way.” Evanora’s lawyer explained.

“What proof do you have that spirit witches steal people’s power? Do you have documentation of this? Or is it just word of mouth?” Judge Heart asked.

“It’s common knowledge at this point.” The man said with a shrug.

“Would your client be willing to take a plea deal if Wanda Maximoff was to stop hexing her?”

“No!” Evanora spoke up in anger. A loud bang resounded through the courtroom.

“I was not speaking to you Evanora Harkness! Do not speak unless spoken to, or I’ll add contempt in court to your charges!” Judge heart said in a booming tone before turning his eyes back on her lawyer. “Have you prepared anything else in defense of Evanora Harkness?”

“Just proof of the twenty plus hexes Wanda Maximoff has on my client.”

“Paper document? If so hand it to the reporter.” The judge told the lawyer. He walked over to his briefcase and heaved a couple papers before he walked over to the reporter. “Please read the document for us.” He requested.

“All hexes in place as of last week. Numbers 1-6 are glamor malfunction hex’s, 7-13 are bad luck hex’s, 14-20 are binding spells. 21 is new. Unknown origin, unknown type.” The court reporter spoke out.

“Would you like to call a witness for cross examination?” The judge asked.

“Yes, I call Wanda Maximoff to the stand.” The lawyer said in an irritated tone. Wanda sighed and got up, walking around the bench and through the swinging doors before she made her way to the witness stand.

“Religious affiliation?” The bailiff asked. Wanda magicked her thick spell book into his hands and placed her right hand on it while raising her left.

“I Wanda Maximoff, swear to tell the whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help me goddesses and gods above and below.” Wanda spoke clearly. Before she magicked her spell book onto Pepper and Agatha’s table.

“Ms. Maximoff, is it true you have hexed Evanora Harkness twenty one times in the last twenty years?” The lawyer asked.

“No. I have hexed her twenty times in the last twenty years. I have no idea who hexed her the twenty first time.” Wanda said honestly.

“Why would you hex a woman who has been through so much already?” The lawyer asked, which caused Wanda to scoff.

“Why? Every one of those hex’s was earned. A year worth of panic attacks, sleepless nights, and self deprecating behavior all caused by her neglect all brought to a head every time she would try and contact Agatha. I have spent 20 years of my own life watching my best friend fall apart over this woman’s actions. One little hex a year could be considered under kill really.” Wanda explained.

“My client would argue other wise.”

“Your client would argue with a rock.” Wanda snapped back.

“Next question, you say Agatha Harkness is your best friend. Is that how you’ve made it this far without being siphoned by her?” The lawyer asked.

“Objection! He’s leading your honor.” Pepper said as she stood up.

“Overruled, I’ll allow it this time.” The judge said knowing exactly where this was heading.

“I’ve made it this far without being siphoned by her because I’ve never been dumb enough to blast her with my magic. A little fire ball here, a toss of chaos magic at her feet, a sprinkling of it in her morning coffee on a day she’s been a real pain in the ass but I’ve never taken all my magical energy and blasted her with it. I use my magic on her all the time. She does the same for me and look, still alive! Still have my magic!” Wanda said in a tone that was teetering on goading but not quite there.

‘In your coffee? Really?’ Rio asked Agatha.

‘Yes, really. Chaos witch. Remember?’ Agatha answered.

“Do you have any further questions?” The judge asked.

“Not for her, I now call Agatha Harkness to the stand.” The lawyer said dismissively before turning and pointing at Agatha. Wanda got off the stand and made her way back to Rio. Agatha got up and made her way to the stand. She willed her spell book into being visible for all in court before she magicked it into the bailiffs hands.

“I Agatha Harkness, swear to tell the whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help me goddesses and gods above and below.” Agatha stated clearly and loudly for the judge and room to hear as she held her right hand over her own tomb and her left up in the air. She sat down and waited for Evanora’s lawyer to speak.

“Agatha Harkness, is it true you are a spirit witch?” The lawyer asked her with a distasteful tone.

“Yes.”

“Is it also true you stole your mother’s powers?”

“Yes.”

“Do you have remorse for doing so?” He asked.

“I used to. But after this week I no longer do.” Agatha said as she watched the man pace the room. Agatha looked over to Pepper, who had an intense look on her face.

“Why is that?”

“Objection, leading!” Pepper said in an irritated tone.

“Sustained, ask a better question.” Judge Heart said in an annoyed tone.

“Are there any events that have happened in the past week to make you reconsider your remorse?”

“I think showing up in my office in full glamor as a man under the ruse of needing legal help to harass me about my best friend’s hexes was the straw that broke the camels back.” Agatha clarified.

“Why did you not stop the hexes when asked?”

“I have no control over Wanda Maximoff, you’d have better luck holding the ocean back with a broom. And unfortunately for all parties involved I am not well versed in chaos magic. I couldn’t undo them even if I wanted to.” Agatha explained.

“Why not simply ask her to stop hexing your poor mother?”

“Why would I treat someone to a kindness they never afforded me? My mother has never been loving, compassionate, caring, or even capable of a kindness toward me. Why should I give something I was never given?” Agatha questioned.

“Because I’m your mother you ungrateful brat!” Evanora screamed, quick succession of the gavel hitting the wooden block rang through the room.

“Last warning Evanora Harkness! You speak when spoken to!” Judge Hearts loud and booming voice rang through the chamber.

“I have no further questions.” The man said as he stepped away.

“Good, Pepper Potts. Please bring forth whatever evidence you have against Evanora Harkness. Agatha you may return to your seat.” Judge Heart requested before speaking softly to Agatha.

“I have several documents from the last 12 years Agatha Harkness has worked for me of every attempt made by Evanora Harkness trying to harass my client. She never made it past security until last week.” Pepper said as she handed over the documents to the court reporter.

“Evanora Harkness has attempted to break into Stark Law Firm 9 times, her 10th attempt was a success. Video evidence has been sent to your email.” The court reporter said as they pulled up their computer and projected the video onto the screen behind the empty stand.

The video with time stamps for each event played for the next 5 minutes. Each attempt resulting in Evanora being ushered away by security, until the last. Where she made it up to Agatha’s office. Rio popped into the office seemingly out of nowhere.

“Pause the video. Who is this fourth woman?” The judge asked

“Rio Vidal, Agatha Harkness’s partner.” Pepper answered.

“How did she get through the protection ward Agatha has in place?” The judge asked.

“Agatha’s wards are to protect from malcontent, which is why Tricia was able to walk through the door with ease. Rio is a green witch and can teleport.” Pepper explained vaguely.

“Continue.” Judge Heart requested as he watched the scene unfold. Once the video was finished he looked at Pepper. “Any more evidence?” He asked, knowing Pepper was essentially holding a nuclear bomb.

“Yes, I would like to present five spirit witches diary entries from their 16th birthdays. Each detailing how their powers manifested.” Pepper said as she brought the papers over to the court reporter, before going back to her seat.

The reporter looked at the thick stack and grinned. They seemed to love things like this.

“July 7th 1950

My name is [redacted], and Today was my 16th birthday. My father had decided today was the day that he was sick of me. He woke me up this morning and dragged me out into the kitchen by my arm and made me kneel on the floor while he and my mother berated me. My mother finally snapped at me for not responding and slapped me hard across the face. My heart started to ache knowing they valued me so little because I had no powers. Then my father grabbed me with a red glowing hand, his fire magic intending to burn me again. I felt a searing pain rush through me before something snapped. Purple magic spread across my shoulder and neck before it over took his hand. Fear spread across my mother’s face as she tried to use her own magic to pry my father from me as all their magic drained from their bodies as they collapsed on the ground. The husks of their bodies still lay in the kitchen as I write this. I must collect things and flee. I am no safer here than I was a few hours ago, just for different reasons. “ The reporter spoke, coming to a strong realization as tension filled the room.

“Next.” Judge Heart said as he wrote something down.

“November 2nd 1926

I don’t know what I did to deserve this kind of abuse in my life… I tried so hard to be a good daughter but it never seemed to come. I didn’t wash the dishes properly today, that’s what triggered all of this. Mother found a dish with a spot on it. She screamed at me for a long time as I sat at the table staring at my hands. I was so terrified of her in that moment as she waved the dish at me.

Then she did something that even I never expected. She smashed the dish over my head! I felt the dish shatter against my head. I know I’m still bleeding. I didn’t even move or flinch. She screamed at me again and grabbed me by my arm; her yellow magic flaring to life as she intended to rewind time so I could relive the pain. Fear struck me as I felt things shift. Her yellow magic turned purple as something shifted in me. I felt her magic draining into my body. The look of fear on her face as she turned into a husk of herself almost matched mine. I am so terrified. I don’t know what to do next.

[redacted]” the reporter spoke clearly but everyone in the room started to realize the implications behind these two documents.

“Objection! The evidence is too old!” Evanora’s lawyer yelled.

“Overruled. Shut up and sit down.” Judge Heart said in an irritated tone before looking back over at the reporter. “Continue.”

“January 17th 1976,

I, [redacted] discovered I am a spirit witch. Today wasn’t anymore unusual than any other day I’d experienced before. The only difference is that today is my 16th birthday. I was awoken by my father putting his cigarette out on my shoulder. He was cruel normally but today seemed excessive. I didn’t even bother flinching as I got up from the couch and walked away from him. He screamed something at me and I turned to look at him. His glamor magic was failing as he yelled at me. I don’t know what I did but something caused him to hit me with a horrible spell again. I felt something snap inside me as I flinched hard expecting a blow from him. His magic hit me but it turned from blue to purple as my body started siphoning his magic from his body. I stood and watched him crumple to the ground in a lifeless heap.

Mother will be home soon. I should pack my bags and leave. Her reaction will not be any kinder than my father’s. I don’t know where I’m going but I can’t stay here.” The reporter spoke clearly.

Each entry that was read aloud, twisted knots into Agatha’s stomach. She was so enraged by what these women had to endure. The only difference here is that these witches didn’t have abusers left standing.

‘You are okay. You are safe.’ Rio said clearly in her mind.

‘Thank you my love.’ Agatha thought back to Rio, attempting to calm down.

“Next?” Judge Heart asked as he continued to write things down.

“March 3rd 1995

Most teenagers are elated to turn 16, I’ve dreaded this day for years. My family have called me a disappointment for not having magic, they have abused me my whole life, and left more scars than I can imagine. I feel so broken for a young woman. My mother’s anger at me for being a non magical being has been growing as of late. This afternoon she poured scalding hot water over both my hands straight from the kettle, just to gloat that if I had powers I would’ve been able to heal myself. The pain was horrible. I begged her to fix my hands and she told me to suffer. I told her she was cruel and a horrible mother. She snapped at me and blasted me with a strong bolt of magic. I screamed in pain as I crumpled to the ground. Then something shifted in me. The pain turned into something else, I watched her green magic turn purple as her body withered away. I siphoned my mother’s life and magic from her body. I had no control over what happened and now my hands are fully healed. I can feel magic, my magic coursing through me. She finally got what she wanted, it just came at the cost of her life.

[redacted]” The reporter spoke into the room. Evanora’s lawyer looked over at her with an almost unreadable expression. One that said ‘this isn’t a joke, we are fucked.’

“The last document please.” Judge Heart requested.

“August 21st 1897

Those dreaded horrendous creatures that I have called my family have drawn their last breath at my hands today, I have been neglected, abused, stepped upon and spit at more times than I can count in my life! I was scrubbing floors for mother as she sat in her chair eating her breakfast. My 16th birthday would be celebrated the same way my last 15 were. On the floor like a dog! Being thrown scraps of food because I didn’t have magic like my siblings. My whole family abused me for it. Today something changed, my father scolded me for missing a spot and stomped on my hand with the heel of his boot. I made the mistake of screaming out in pain. He tried to silence me with a spell, his red magic flaring to life as he blasted me. I felt my voice being stolen for a moment before something changed. His magic turned purple as my magic took over. My mother quickly stood and tried to intervene with her own magic causing my magic to siphon both of them dry. Their husks laid on the cobblestone floor as I stared at them. My youngest sibling ran into the room and screamed loudly. I tried to stop her but she ran off to get my two brothers who came back and attacked me. I lost my entire family to this stupid magic. Now I must leave, their coven will hunt me down if I don’t.

[redacted]” the court reporter spoke out, this time their voice was starting to waver. They took a deep calming breath after they finished speaking.

“Do you have anything else you’d like to present?” Judge Heart asked.

“No, now I’d like to call forth Evanora Harkness for cross examination.” Pepper said as she stood up from her seat. Evanora made her way to the stand and sat down.

“I no longer have magic. I need a Wiccan tomb to swear on.” Evanora said as she sat down. The bailiff grabbed the tomb from the corner of the room and brought it over for her to swear on.

“I, Evanora Harkness swear to speak the whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help me goddesses and gods above and below.” Evanora said as she placed her right hand on the tomb and raised her left.

“Perfect.” Pepper said as she stood and walked over to the witness stand. “Now Evanora, is it true you have violated the restraining order against you 10 times in the last 12 years Agatha has worked for Stark Law Firm?”

“Yes, because that brat wouldn’t call off the chaos witch!” Evanora said digging her own grave.

“Do you know why Agatha has a protection order against you?”

“Yes.” Evanora said begrudgingly.

“Care to elaborate as to why she has this PPO against you?” Pepper asked.

“No.” Evanora said turning her head and crossing her arms.

“Judge Heart, I’d like to call forth our court appointed third party memory spell caster. I think Evanora is unwilling to participate.” Pepper said honestly to the judge.

“Lilia Calderu If you could come assist us it would be greatly appreciated.” Judge Heart requested. Lilia stood up from the bench behind Rio and Wanda, then walked over to Pepper.

“How far do we want this spell to reach? Just you or everyone in the room?” Lilia asked the Judge.

“The whole room, if you can.” Judge Heart requested.

“If I can, insulting really. Which memory would you like to pull from?” Lilia asked Pepper.

“Agatha Harkness’s 16th birthday. The day of her attempted execution.” Pepper answered. Lilia started chanting softly before the whole room was bathed in a soft yellow hue. Then everyone inside was teleported into Evanora’s memories.

“You wretched child! I should’ve killed you the second you were born! All you’ve ever been is a burden, a thorn in my side and now this! You are undeserving of drawing breath! How dare you!” Evanora scolded as she slapped Agatha across the face.

“Mother please! I love her!” A young Agatha begged.

“First you go running around with those abominable twins! Now this! You have been an utter disappointment since day one! How dare you. I put my blood, sweat, and bone into raising you. Just for you to shame me like this!” Evanora yelled as she slapped her daughter again. Purple magic flared from Agatha in that moment, haulting Evanora’s movements.

“Mother Stop!” Agatha pleaded, fear painting Agatha’s tone.

“You… you’re a…” Evanora started to say but stopped, her anger growing even deeper. Her face twisting into a look of disgust. She reached forward and grabbed Agatha by her hair and dragged her out of the house.

“Mother please! Stop!” Agatha pleaded, begging for her mother to let her go. Evanora shot a beacon of blue magic into the air and continued to drag Agatha though the woods.

Suddenly the rest of the coven was there pulling Agatha up by her arms and helping Evanora bind Agatha to a dead rotting tree. They left her there while they discussed her fate.

“She’s a fucking spirit witch.” Evanora spat loudly.

“To protect the coven we must kill her.” One of the other witches said. Evanora sneered in her daughter’s direction as she looked at her.

“She’s young and weak, we can fry her and end this now.” Evanora said to the coven before they walked over to Agatha. She was utterly disgusted with the child she bared.

“Mother please! I can be good.” Agatha begged struggling at her restraints tears spilling down her cheeks.

“No you cannot. You are incapable of it. It must be done my child. You cannot live. You are undeserving of life.” Evanora said to her daughter before continuing. “You have been nothing but a problem since the day you were born, today I eliminate that problem.” Evanora said as she blasted Agatha with her magic, the rest of the coven joined in. An agonized scream left Agatha before something shifted. All the magic turned purple and they couldn’t stop it.

“No! No no no no no. Please no!” Agatha begged. Then everything went black.

The yellow hue faded away from the room as Lilia stood there and turned to look at Evanora.

“Permission to speak Judge Heart?” Lilia asked.

“Permission granted.”

“If you haven’t grasped it yet Evanora, your neglect, abuse, and torment has created the ‘monster’ you view your daughter as. Her magic did the one thing it was meant to. Protect her. Every spirit witch that has ever existed has come from an abusive situation.” Lilia said while staring at Evanora, who finally seemed to grasp what was happening.

“No! That cannot be true! She was born evil!” Evanora said grasping at straws. Her lawyer was shaking his head in disbelief at the way Evanora treated her daughter.

“The evidence would argue other wise.” Pepper said with a shake of her head.

“No! You are manipulating the facts!” Evanora yelled from the stand, the gavel fell hard against the block.

“Cease! You ignorant woman! We all seen your memory! The only one in denial right now about the fact that Spirit witches are created is you!” Judge Heart yelled at Evanora.

“I did nothing wrong! She… she…” Evanora started to protest but even she started to realize she had no leg to stand on here. Pepper took a deep breath and sighed. She was enraged but she knew this wasn’t the place for that anger to bubble up.

“I’m done speaking to you. Go back to your seat. Do you want to ask any questions Judge Heart?” Pepper asked.

“Yes, just one. Evanora Harkness, do you have any remorse for how you treated your daughter?”

“No. She’s still a monster.” Evanora said clinging to the false truth about spirit witches.

“Give me a moment to speak to your lawyers before I make a decision. You two, my chambers now.” Judge Heart said to Pepper and Evanora’s lawyer.

“Give me five minutes I need to speak to my client.” The man said to the Judge.

“Fine. Bailiff call for someone to escort him to my chambers once he’s done.” Judge Heart directed.

“The best you are going to get is a plea deal. You dumbass.” Evanora’s lawyer said to her.

“I just want the hexes gone, I’ll do whatever time I have to.” Evanora said with a scowl.

“I’ll see what I can do. Keep your mouth shut while I’m gone.” He told the woman before he walked over to the second bailiff that had walked into the room. They guided him to Judge Hearts Chambers and opened the door for him.

“What’s the max amount of time she can get?” Pepper asked.

“I’m not sending this to trial. I’m making the decision today. 7-10 years the multiple PPO violations and trespassing are doing the heavy lifting.” Judge Heart explained.

“That’s more than enough.” Pepper said with a sigh.

“She’s willing to take a plea deal if the chaos witch removes the hexes she has on her.” The man explained to the two.

“Bailiff collect Wanda Maximoff for me.” Judge Heart requested.

“Yes, sir.” The bailiff said before disappearing toward the courtroom. A few minutes later Wanda walked into the office.

“My presence was requested?” Wanda asked.

“Yes, Evanora is willing to take a plea deal if you remove the hexes on her person.” Pepper said honestly as she rubbed her temples.

“What happens if I don’t want to?” Wanda asked.

“This goes to trial, which might not be the greatest for Agatha’s mental health.” Pepper explained.

“How long?” Wanda asked.

“7-10 years depending on behavior.”

“She won’t live that long. I’ll lift the hexes the second you make your verdict. I have no clue who left the last hex though. So I can’t do anything about that.” Wanda promised.

“So it’s agreed? Plea deal?” Judge Heart asked.

“Plea deal. I don’t want this going to a trail… it would be a bloodbath.” Evanora’s lawyer said with a shake of his head.

“Good, as long as you’re aware of how dumb your client is.” Pepper said with a smile.

“Give me a moment to get everything in order, head back to the courtroom. Please.” Judge Heart requested. The three of them got up and headed back into the courtroom.

Agatha was sitting there starring at the door waiting when they walked back into the room. Pepper walked over to her and took her seat, a moment later Wanda made her way back to her place next to Rio and Evanora’s lawyer made his way back to his chair.

A few minutes later Judge Heart walked back into his room and took his seat. He cleaned his throat and begun to speak.

“In the case of Evanora Harkness Vs Agatha Harnkess I find Evanora to be guilty of breaking several PPO’s, and trespassing on private property with the intent to cause harm. For these crimes you will serve 7-10 years jail time, Wanda Maximoff has kindly agreed to lift the hexes she has placed upon you once the verdict is final. The last hex is not her doing, therefore she cannot undo it. My verdict is final. You shall serve your time at the woman’s correctional facility.” Judge Heart said before slamming his gavel down. The hexes on Evanora disappeared instantly. Red magic sizzling and hissing as they evaporated off her skin.

“Bailiff get this woman down in lock up until the next bus arrives for the correctional facility.” Judge Heart requested before he waved his hand. The bailiff walked over to Evanora and hiked her up by the arm and dragging her out of the room.

“I wonder who hexed her…” Wanda asked as she watched the door shut.

“That would be me, I hate that bitch.” Lilia said with a cheerful smile as she walked over to the group. Pepper was shaking Evanora’s lawyers hand before she walked back to the group of women.

“I drove all night to get here, god it was even worse experiencing that the second time.” Lilia said as she shook her body trying to remove the memory from her mind.

“Yeah. I wish I hadn’t…” Agatha said with a sigh as she shook her own head. Rio reached across the median and took Agatha’s hand in her own.

“You did great. She’s no longer our problem.” Rio reassured as she pulled Agatha closer and gave her a soft kiss on the lips.

“Thank you my love. Sorry I was so anxious I didn’t even think…” Agatha said.

“No, it’s fine. I get it. Are you okay?” Rio asked.

“I’m okay. I’m free.” Agatha said with a smile.

“Good, now let’s get the fuck out of here!” Pepper said as she packed her briefcase up.

“Yeah, I’m officially over being in a suit.” Wanda said with a chuckle.

“I was thinking about requiring all Stark Industry therapists to wear suits starting tomorrow because of how good you looked.” Pepper said in a serious tone.

“Goddesses no. I’ll never get out of the house, Lily would never let me leave.” Wanda begged. Which caused Pepper and Agatha to laugh at Wanda.

“Now Rio, are you going to introduce your Aunt to your life partner?” Lilia asked her Niece.

“Oh I’m supposed to acknowledge you now?” Rio teased her aunt.

“Oh you little shit! Come here!” Lilia said as she reached out and grabbed Rio by the cheek before she let her go and gave her a big hug.

“Ah why! You’ve done that since I was a child! I’m a grown woman Lilia!” Rio complained after she hugged Lilia and let her go.

“Still just a wee pup to me. Now introduce me!” Lilia scolded.

“Aunt Lilia, this is my life Partner Agatha Harkness. Agatha, this is my adoptive Aunt Lilia Calderu. My mother’s best friend.” Rio said to Agatha and Lilia.

“Nice to meet the Legend, you are extremely impressive. Though experiencing that again wasn’t exactly fun.” Agatha said honestly.

“It’s okay sweetie, you never have to see her face ever again.” Lilia promised.

“I believe you, only because of your ability.” Agatha said with a smile.

“Alright, I have to get back to the office, I think you have a couple meetings today as well Agatha.” Pepper said with a smile.

“I’m sure I do. Alright, let me take Rio home and I’ll meet you at the office.” Agatha answered.

“No need, I’ve got this one. I haven’t seen her in a while.” Lilia reassured before slipping an arm through Rio’s. “Now you go have a good day at work.”

“Thank you, I appreciate it Lilia. Hopefully our next interaction is a nicer one.” Agatha told Lilia.

“I’m sure it will be, see you later.” Lilia answered, before she tried dragging Rio off.

“Let me say goodbye Lilia!” Rio whined.

“If you must! Not like you won’t see her tonight.” Lilia said as she let go of Rio who wrapped her arms around Agatha and gave her a hug before she kissed her goodbye.

“Have a good day. I’ll see you tonight.” Rio said after she let Agatha go.

“You too, enjoy your time with your Aunt.” Agatha told Rio before the two women walked away.

“You have married into an interesting family.” Pepper said to Agatha as they made their way to the front entrance with Wanda following behind.

“Not married.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“No, just cosmically bound to each other for eternity.” Wanda joked.

“Don’t you have somewhere else to be?” Agatha asked sarcastically.

“Nope, you are my top priority today. Be that annoying you or just hanging out.” Wanda answered.

“Go annoy your girlfriend for a couple hours before her interview… wait. Actually. Don’t do that.” Agatha started to say but back tracked.

“You know.. You never realized how much energy you waste keeping 20 hexes running at once. I feel like a whole new woman. I have so much energy now.” Wanda said as she bounced on her feet.

“Uh. Stark law firm has a gym on the main floor… maybe we should take her there and drop her in it?” Pepper asked.

“Might not be a bad idea. Who knows what trouble she’ll get into now…” Agatha answered Pepper as they made their way down the steps.

“I’ll be fine! You two have a good day, I’m gunna go cause some chaos.” Wanda said with a smile before running off to her car.

“Don’t get arrested!” Agatha yelled to her friend.

“I won’t!” Wanda yelled back before she got in her car and sped off.

“I don’t know how I feel about a more energetic Wanda…” Pepper said as she watched the car drive away.

“I’m gunna call someone on the way into the office. I’ll see you soon.” Agatha said as she approached her car.

“See you soon.” Pepper said as she turned and headed toward her own vehicle. Agatha got in and quickly dialed Jen’s number as she started the car.

“Hey Agatha, good to know you’re still alive!” Jen said into the phone.

“It’s been a busy ass week, sorry. I actually am calling you for a few reasons… got time?” Agatha asked as she put the car in drive.

“Yeah, stores dead. The online order I got this morning is already taken care of, what’s up?” Jen asked into the phone.

“Is that order for a Lilian Grey?” Agatha asked.

“Yeah, it is. Why? She a friend?” Jen asked.

“She’s Wanda’s girlfriend.” Agatha answered as she turned onto the street. There was a long pause.

“Excuse me.. I think my ears need cleaned. Wanda has a girlfriend? Is this the woman she went out with the other day that she never texted me back about after asking me to be a just in case bail out call?” Jen asked into the phone.

“One and the same. You’ve missed a lot.. honestly more than I can cover in a 20 minute conversation but I’ll summarize. I also met someone, she owns a bookstore. Her name is Rio Vidal, and I’ll elaborate more in depth on that later. Before you ask more important things are about to come out of my mouth.” Agatha explained then waited for Jen to say something.

“I’m waiting Harkness.” Jen said into the phone.

“My mother successfully made it into Stark Law offices and up to my office under a glamor spell last Wednesday. Today was her hearing for breaking the PPO, and trespassing. She’s officially in jail for the next 7-10 years. Part of the plea deal was that Wanda had to lift her hexes off my mother. So… now Wanda has way more energy than she did yesterday.” Agatha explained.

“Already working on it. I knew what the order was for based off the ingredients. I’ll make her 6? No 12 energy vials and maybe some liquid nectar for sustenance….” Jen said catching onto what Agatha was saying.

“Thanks, send me the bill for both. Now you can ask questions. You’ve got me for 5 minutes.”

“So you’ve got a girlfriend now too?” Jen asked.

“Yes.” Agatha answered. Still not technically a lie but it felt like one.

“What’s the bookstores name?” Jen asked.

“Vidal Books.” Agatha answered. She heard some typing in the background.

“Damn! She’s just your type Agatha! Score. Is she a green witch?” Jen asked.

“You could say that.” Agatha said with a chuckle.

“Oh? Tell me more.” Jen pried.

“I would love to, more than anything but I have meetings this afternoon. Maybe I’ll call you on my way home if Rio doesn’t call me before I get out the door.” Agatha told Jen.

“I miss the honeymoon phase. It was nice. Alright, I’ll talk to you later. Already sent you the Venmo request.” Jen told Agatha.

“Thank you! I’ll call you later!” Agatha said before she hung up the phone. She parked her car and headed into the building.

~Meanwhile down in the courthouse inmate holding area~

“I cannot believe I have to suffer in prison for the next 7 to 10 years! Absolute bullshit! But the hexes are gone so maybe…” Evanora said with a grin that quickly fell from her face when she felt a cold shift in the room. Death was sitting next to her. Silently waiting. She looked over at the entity and stared.

Nothing happened for a long moment and then the door was being opened. “Get up Harkness it’s time to go.” A man said to her. She slowly stood up and made her way to the door. Death stood and followed her, always one step behind her, a cold creeping presence settling in the back of her mind as she walked.

Once she was loaded onto the bus Death sat next to her, the cold bitter chill of her aura bitting into her. Evanora could feel her bones start to rattle inside her. She was so cold, she just couldn’t shake the chill that was clinging to her. The bus stopped and they offloaded them into the prison. Every step in the process was followed by Death. Once she was locked in a cell alone Death finally spoke.

Evanora was on edge, her body was bitterly cold and she was terrified. She had no clue why Death was still following her around.

“Do you really think you won?” Death asked as she floated over to the woman.

“I think I’m free from all these fucking Hexes.”

“Yes, but at what cost? All that chaos energy that was clinging to your body was the only magical energy you had left…Don’t you see? Wanda Maximoff’s hexes were the only thing keeping you alive. Your body can’t keep up now that it’s got no juice left.” Death explained as she ghosted around the woman.

“What do you mean?” Evanora asked in a fear filled tone.

“You’ve always been destined to die this way you know… alone, scared, and confused. Just the way you made your daughter feel.” Hissed out. “If you’re lucky you’ll make it through the week, but you’ve never been lucky Evanora now have you?”

“No! No! I’m finally free! You can’t take me! It’s not fair!” Evanora screamed at the deity floating around her.

“Life isn’t fair. You got as much time as you got, and more time than you ever deserved. Now, are you going to keep fighting me or are you going to come willingly?” Death asked.

“Fuck you!” Evanora screamed out.

“Wrong answer Evanora.” Death screeched out with a thousand voices, her scythe slicing through her soul and plucking it from her body. Leaving the woman’s corpse crumpled on the floor.

“Now, you get to experience the fear and torment you put your daughter through for the next century. I’m throwing you in a pit and forgetting about you.” Death said as she opened a portal and dragged her through it.

“No! It’s not fair!”

“You keep saying that, but unfortunately for you it’s more than fair.” Death said as she dropped the woman into the void and walked out.

“Now to have a conversation with Gaia.” Death said as she dusted her hands off and teleported herself to Gaia’s domain.

Chapter 23

Lilia and Rio got into Lilia’s car and headed toward Rio’s bookstore. They sat quietly in the car for a long moment before Rio spoke up. “Did momma put you up to this?”

“No, actually Rita has no idea I’m here. Honestly I’d like to keep it that way.” Lilia explained to Rio.

“Ooooo you’re in trouble.” Rio joked.

“Hardly… you just know how Rita can get…”

“How mad is she going to be when she finds out you did all this just to meet Agatha?” Rio asked honing in on the actual reason Lilia offered her services.

“Why you little shit! How did you figure it out?” Lilia asked as she poked Rio in the side.

“I’ve been your niece for the last 35 years. I’m not stupid. No matter what future you divine, I will always know when you have ulterior motives. Helping Agatha may have been the primary reason but it wasn’t the only one.”

“Actually seeing Evanora get her just desserts was the primary motive. I’ve always hated that bitch. Secondary motive was actually helping Agatha. Your mom asked me to look back when everything happened with her. All things considered, she seems wonderful.” Lilia said to Rio as they pulled into the bookstore parking lot and parked the car.

“She’s fantastic! She’s amazing, and kind, and I just know one day she will be a great mother because of how well she puts up with Wanda and Pietro! She’s so intelligent and utterly stunning to look at! Her laugh is so cute and I really love it when she snorts. It’s adorable.” Rio told Lilia, spouting off all the things she admired about Agatha. Lilia smiled brightly at Rio, she was so happy that Rio was happy.

“That is the smile I’ve been looking to see on your face since you were told you were next in line! That smile right there is my favorite thing!” Lilia said with tears in her eyes, she was so happy she could cry.

“Lilia! Stop! If you cry, I’ll cry!” Rio said as she looked away from the older woman. Lilia laughed and wiped her tears away before she looked over at Rio.

“Come on! Show me your store! The fourth reason I drove all night to be here!” Lilia said as she unbuckled and got out of the car.

‘Testing. Testing.’ Rio heard Agatha say softly in her mind, almost like a whisper.

‘Why are we whispering?’ Rio whispered back to Agatha as she got out of the car. She walked over to the side door Lilia was standing at and unlocked it before disarming the security system and turning on the lights.

“Wow! Look at this place! I could spend a whole Saturday in here! It’s stunning, the green really screams ‘Vidal’. Though the kids corner could use some purple, don’t you think?” Lilia asked with a wink.

“I hope our kids aren’t spirit witches… that would mean we were bad parents.” Rio said with a panicked look on her face.

“None of your children will be spirit witches.” Lilia reassured.

‘Still with Lilia?’ Agatha asked, still speaking softly.

‘Yes and she’s trying to bait me into asking her questions about our future children. One moment my love.’ Rio answered back before focusing on Lilia.

“Don’t, I know you looked. I don’t want answers to questions I didn’t actually ask.” Rio said to Lilia in a half serious tone.

“Fine! You are no fun! What’s the sense in knowing the future if you can’t tell anyone about it!” Lilia said with a huff.

“You tell the CDC everything.” Rio clarified.

“That’s not the same and you know it!” Lilia huffed out.

“Yes, but I physically cannot lie to Agatha, at all. I wish I was kidding but I’m not. She has a way of bringing out the truth without you even realizing it. If you tell me something, I will tell her and then… if she’s disappointed… I don’t think I could handle that.” Rio said honestly.

“Oh Rio, I don’t need to look into the future to know that you’ll never disappoint her. You both may do dumb things in your relationship in the future but you’ll never be a disappointment to her.” Lilia reassured.

“You have no guarantee of that, and I don’t want one either. Stop trying to bait me!” Rio said with a laugh realizing her Aunt was just trying to get her to dig for info.

“You’ve always been so good at evading me and my guidance.” Lilia said with a laugh.

“Do you want to crash at my place tonight? You look very tired.” Rio asked changing the subject.

“I can get a hotel.” Lilia told Rio.

“Yeah but I’m probably not going to be using my bed. I expect tonight to be a rough one for Agatha after today so I planned on staying the night with her.” Rio explained.

“It may be, or it may not. It’s one of those things that even I don’t know how she’s going to be once the sun sets.” Lilia said before she walked around the room.

“Why…. What aren’t you telling me?” Rio asked.

“Nope! You won’t let me talk about kids. You don’t get to know the other shit!” Lilia scolded before she softened. “But you should be a good partner and maybe get her some flowers or something…”

“I think I can do more than flowers. Let me text Wanda real quick.” Rio said as she magicked her phone into her hand.

Rio 1:45 p.m: Hey, are you coming to Agatha’s tonight?

Wanda 1:45 p.m: maybe… really depends on how well Lily’s job interview goes. Do you realize how much energy I have right now?!? I feel like I’m buzzing.

Rio 1:46 p.m: how much magical energy were you using to hex her?!?

Wanda 1:47 p.m: a decent amount… like more than I probably should have… but I didn’t realize I was missing it because I was doing it in small chunks over the last 20 years. I feel like I’m 25 again!

Rio 1:48 p.m. maybe you should come over tonight so you don’t kill Lily.

Lilia walked over to Rio and smiled at her brightly as Rio sent the last text. Rio looked at her and smiled back. “What?”

“I’m just happy you are finally happy.” Lilia told her.

“You ready to head to my place so you can rest? Or I can open a portal for you and you can go harass momma?” Rio asked.

“No, show me your apartment!” Lilia requested, them Rio turned around to head toward the back door they came through. before mumbling to herself “Even though it won’t be yours for long.”

“What was that Lilia?” Rio asked.

“Nothing, come on I’m tired, you can drive this time.” Lilia said as she walked over to Rio. Rio let them out of the store and then made her way over to Lilia’s car and got in the driver seat. Lilia handed her the keys and Rio started the car. They pulled out of the parking lot and 10 minutes later they were at Rio’s.

“Come on. I’ll change the sheets and get you fresh bedding.” Rio said as she handed Lilia the car keys. They make their way up to Rio’s apartment, and Rio lets them in.

“Thank you sweetie, I’ll keep myself busy while you do what you need to.” Lilia said as she walked through the apartment. Rio disappeared into her bedroom to clean and change the bedding.

~Meanwhile in Gaia’s Domain~

“Violet! Wonderful to see you!” Gaia said with a smile as she rushed up to the embodiment of Death. Green grass blooming brightly under each step she took with wild flowers popping up behind her in the grass.

“Gaia! Nice to see you as well.” Violet said with a smile.

“You’re late!” Gaia scolded.

“I had a pickup I needed to attend. My bad, I was waiting for the sands to run out on someone I’ve wanted to collect since the day she was born.” Violet said with a sneer.

“I told you to trust me, everyone is exactly where they are supposed to be!” Gaia said with a smile as she started to walk toward her home.

“About that… they’ve exceeded expectations.” Violet said with a chuckle as she looked at Gaia, the woman next to her stopped in her tracks.

“What do you mean?” Gaia asked Violet.

“Their hearts have shown up.” Violet said as she continued to walk toward the home. Gaia zoomed over to her.

“What! When? Take me to them right now?!” Gaia said excitedly as she grabbed onto Violets shoulders and shook her lightly.

“You heard me. Saturday night I believe? And no, they aren’t even together right now. They are still human, and have day jobs.” Violet said as she tried to get out of Gaia’s grasp. She finally managed to break free and head toward the home.

“Any idea how they managed to do it?” Gaia asked.

“Besides the deep intimate connection they’ve already developed? I think the fact that Agatha is a whole coven rolled into one person has a lot to do with it. Don’t you?”

“Maybe….” Gaia said as she looked away from Violet.

“Come on Gaia! We can’t be keeping secrets from each other!” Violet yelled in an exasperated tone. Gaia looked like a kicked puppy.

“She’s just super powerful, I wish I could tell you more! There are infinite possibilities with her!” Gaia answered honestly.

“Narrow it down.” Violet told Gaia as she opened the door and walked into the kitchen and started making tea.

“Honestly, they both will surpass us power wise. Agatha may end up as something similar to a celestial, a cosmic being. Not sure what her role will be yet, but we will get there when we get there. We’ve got over a thousand years before we have to deal with this.” Gaia told Violet.

“What am I supposed to tell them?”

“That they should live their life! Let them just have each other. Let them be happy!” Gaia said to Violet.

“What if they get their crowns early? What if they transcend before death?”

“Then we worry about it when it happens.” Gaia answered which caused Violet to look at her with a panicked expression. “Which it won’t. I’ll make sure of it personally. I promise, take me with you when you go see them tonight after she gets the call about her mother.”

“Do we know how she’s going to handle that?” Violet asked.

“As well as she’s handled everything else in life.” Gaia answered.

“Well that’s reassuring… Now… did you want me to go get Rosaline so we can gossip?” Violet asked.

“Yes! I miss her!” Gaia said excitedly.

“I’ll be right back.” Violet said before she blipped out of Gaia’s domain and home real quick before she and Rosaline reappeared in the kitchen.

“Hiya Gaia!” Rosaline said as she rushed over to hug the goddess.

“Never fails. You say that every time!” Gaia said with a laugh.

“You love it! Now, let’s gossip while you two wait for Agatha and Rio.” Rosaline said as she sat down at the table. Gaia followed suit and allowed Violet to make the tea.

“I might be able to bend the rules and bring you along as well.” Gaia told Rosaline.

“I’m good. You two need to talk to the girls more than I need to meet them.” Rosaline said as she relaxed in the chair.

“Yeah, let’s not overwhelm them. They are technically going to meet ‘god’ today.” Violet said as she set the tea pot on the table and magicked 3 tea cups, honey, and milk.

“Valid point. Okay. So what have you two been up to?” Gaia asked getting into the gossip part of their tea time. Violet poured all of them a cup and sat down as she listened to her wife and friend chat away.

~Stark Law Firm~

‘Did you forget about me?’ Agatha whispered to Rio as she sat at her desk waiting for her second meeting of the day.

‘No, Lilia drove all night last night to make it in time for the hearing. So I brought her back to my place. I had to change the sheets and bedding and now she’s asleep in my room.’ Rio answered Agatha.

‘Why did the sheets need changed?’ Agatha teased.

‘I wonder.’ Rio said sarcastically in her mind before she let the memories of fucking Agatha with a strap on for the first time flood her mind.

‘Rio… please I’m at work.’ Agatha begged, sounding needy and desperate already. Rio shook her head and tried to think of something different.

‘My 3:30 is here, I’ll see you tonight.’ Agatha thought before closing the connection, it was much easier for her to do than Rio.

Agatha stood up and greeted her client before they sat down and got down to discussing their wants and needs out of an agreed deal. They really just wanted a contract written up that had zero wiggle room.

An hour later Agatha had an outline and was ready to work on getting the contract locked in after their meeting. She thanked her client for their time and sent them on their way. Tricia came into the office a few minutes after they left and grimaced a smile at Agatha.

“What is that face?” Agatha asked as she looked up from her computer to see Tricia.

“I don’t know how you’re doing… and I don’t know if you want me to ask. But I really want to.” Tricia said honestly as she wrung her fingers.

“You are beyond sweet Tricia, I’m okay. It was a rough hearing, but I had Pepper, Rio, and Wanda there with me. Speaking of which… her girlfriend had an interview with Mr. Stark at 4:00 I wonder how that went.” Agatha mused.

“What was the interview for?” Tricia asked.

“Head of Botanical Research at Stark Botanical Gardens.” Agatha answered before her phone in her office rang. She reached for it and picked it up.

“Agatha Harkness Speaking.” Agatha spoke into the phone as she looked at Tricia who was about to turn around.

“Hello Ms. Harkness, I’m calling you from the women’s prison… I have some unfortunate news. Evanora Harkness has been found dead in her cell.” A woman spoke into the phone. Agatha held her hand up and motioned for Tricia to come in and shut the door. Tricia did and waited.

“I see, thank you for calling me to inform me of this. Is there anything I need to do?” Agatha asked the woman.

“You can come pick up her possessions if you’d like. Otherwise we can just dispose of them.” The woman offered.

“Itemized list please?”

“A cellphone, wallet, ID, house keys, car keys.” She listed off the normal things that come along with people when they get arrested.

“I’ll come get the items. Thank you. What time do you close?” Agatha asked.

“We’re here all night. Take your time. Sorry for your loss.” The woman said into the phone compassionately, Agatha sighed softly.

“Thank you, that is much appreciated. Have a good day.” Agatha said into the phone trying to sound genuine.

“You as well.” The woman said before hanging up the phone. Agatha let the phone drop from her ear as she looked up at Tricia, tears welling up in her eyes.

“Go get Pepper. Now.” Agatha said in a strange tone. She wasn’t distressed. She wasn’t happy. She wasn’t sure how to feel. Tricia bolted out the door leaving Agatha alone in her office.

‘Evanora is dead.’ Agatha’s voice rang through Rio’s mind as she sat on her living room couch. She paused, surely that couldn’t be right…

‘Excuse me?’ Rio asked back, her brain going a million miles per minute.

‘Fuck if I know, the prison just called me to inform me.’ Agatha thought, then Rio felt a pull. She just let Agatha call her, the next thing she knew she was in Agatha’s office sitting in her lap.

“You know when Violet said in my lap yesterday, I kinda thought she was joking.” Agatha said with a laugh as she hugged Rio tightly.

“Are you okay?” Rio asked slightly worried as she got off Agatha’s lap. A moment later the door opened again and shut.

“What happened? Why did Tricia come get me? Oh, Hi Rio.” Pepper said in a rushed tone as she walked into the room.

“Evanora Harkness is dead.” Agatha stated clearly, her expression and tone absolutely unreadable.

“I… uh… excuse me?” Pepper asked.

“That seems to be the general consensus today.” Agatha said honestly.

“She couldn’t have died yesterday and saved us all some time?” Pepper joked before she looked at Rio. “Got anyway of contacting Death and giving her an earful?”

“Even if I did, do you think she’d listen?” Rio asked Pepper, before the world seemed to grind to a stop.

“I listen all the time!” Violet said in a hurt tone from behind the two women.

“Oh yeah?” Rio said as she and Agatha turned around. Violet Vidal was standing next to a gorgeous black woman who had a glowing white aura around her. Stunning green eyes seemed to peer into her soul.

“Yeah, I do. Unfortunately some chaos witch threw a monkey wrench in my plans. Also, I have someone who is dying to meet you.” Violet told the two women.

“Hello Rio, Hello Agatha. I’m Gaia. Nice to meet you both.” Gaia said with a smile as she walked over to the two women. Agatha stood there struck in awe of the goddess, Rio was standing with her mouth agape in shock.

“The pleasure is all mine, it’s not every day my mother dies and I get to meet the Goddess Gaia.” Agatha said charmingly before she smiled at the woman.

“Nice to meet you Goddess. Though, I am curious… why are you here?” Rio asked, bold and blunt as always.

“Oh, you weren’t kidding Violet. Not even a twitch of surprise. I see why you were so worried.” Gaia said as she observed the two.

“They stopped jumping in shock after I popped into the car. They seem acutely aware of when I’m arriving.” Violet said with a shrug.

“You said a chaos witch threw a monkey wrench in your plans? Care to elaborate?” Agatha asked as she crossed her arms and honed her eyes on Violet. Gaia raised an eyebrow at the question but then turned to look at Violet who was floundering.

“Wanda, your best friend. Her chaos energy was the only thing keeping Evanora alive. So when she asked for the hexes to be removed as part of the plea deal… She sealed her own fate.” Gaia explained to Agatha.

“I need you to deeply elaborate on how that’s even possible.” Agatha requested.

“Witches live so long due to the magical energy coursing through their bodies. The hexes were a form of magical energy. Evanora’s body was using that energy to keep her alive. The second they were gone, so was her bodies ability to keep going.” Gaia explained.

“Wanda is going to be pissed.” Rio said quietly to herself.

“Well actually… she might find it absolutely hilarious.” Agatha said in disbelief.

“Why?” Violet and Gaia ask in unison.

“Because to put it simply, she held her life in her hands and that would’ve been the one thing Evanora Harkness hated more than anything. Knowing right before her death that the woman who hexed her was the only thing keeping her alive. The irony that she begged for those hexes to be lifted, oh man I wish I could’ve seen her face!” Agatha said gleefully, knowing her best friend was about to be on the moon.

“I mean…. I could replay the memory… later. Maybe in a hundred years or so.” Violet said honestly.

“You think Wanda is going to want to wait a hundred years?” Rio asked with a scoff.

“I’ll make the exception this one time Violet, Wanda and Lily can meet you. Just so you can give Wanda that gift. She deserves it after every thing she’s done for Agatha.” Gaia told the group.

“Really?!?” Violet said excitedly, she really wanted to interact with the chaos witch that Agatha called a best friend.

“Yes. Now onto the important reason we are actually here. Girls, you’ve surprised even me with how deep your connection is. So I have to pause it, only if you will allow me?” Gaia asked.

“Why does it need paused?” Rio asked.

“Because you’ll ascend and then never be able to live a normal life. You’ll get stuck in the in between. To give you the only real negative, you won’t be able to have children. The rest is more of a benefit than anything but I know how badly you both want them.” Gaia explained.

“How would you pause it?” Agatha asked.

“Oh, that’s simple. I just have to touch you. Might sting a little, godly aura can burn mortals. But you two are… well different, so I doubt it will hurt at all.” Gaia said unmoving from her spot.

“Can you let us discuss this for a moment?” Rio asked.

“Of course.” Gaia answered, she had all the time in the universe for these two.

‘What do you want? Do you actually want children?’ Rio asked in Agatha’s mind.

‘More than anything. You?” Agatha answered.

“With you, I want them. Anyone else? It wouldn’t matter.”

“How will this work?” Agatha asked Gaia.

“You walk over to me and if you’ll allow it, I’ll hug you, or take your hand.” Gaia answered. Agatha sighed and moved first, she walked over to Gaia and held her arms open. Gaia smiled happily as she reached out and wrapped her arms around Agatha pulling her into a hug.

Contrary to what Gaia told them it didn’t burn at all, the hug was the softest and warmest hug Agatha had ever received. It felt so full of a mother’s love that Agatha felt tears well up into her eyes as Gaia pressed her face against Agatha’s. Something warm and loving settled into Agatha’s chest. A pure and warm feeling that she had never felt before, it was like the hug Rita gave her but more intense. Gaia held onto Agatha for a long moment before she placed a soft kiss to her temple as she let her go.

Agatha pulled away and smiled softly at Gaia who smiled brightly at her. “I’ve never experienced anything quite like that before.” Agatha said with a soft sob.

“A mother’s love has been hard to come by for you. I guarantee you if you ever need a hug like that again I’m one call away. It seems your soul has decided for you that I’m exactly what you need.”

“What does that mean?” Agatha questioned with a furrowed brow.

“That I am your mother now, witchlett. Deal with it.” Gaia said with a smile that left no room for argument.

“Aren’t you the mother of all technically?” Rio joked.

“Technically yes, but this is different. Now come here Rio.” Gaia requested. Agatha stepped aside and allowed Rio to walk over to Gaia, Rio held her arms open and Gaia took her into her arms as well. This hug was different yet familiar for Rio, it felt like she was hugging a close friend, that she hadn’t seen in years. She let Rio go much sooner than she did Agatha and smiled brightly at the two women.

“You my child, just need to call and I’ll be right there for you. Just like Rio can call this pain in the ass any time she needs.” Gaia told Agatha.

“Hey! I’m not a pain in the ass!” Violet said in an exasperated tone.

“That’s subjective.” Gaia argued.

“Thank you, what do I call you?” Agatha asked in a confused tone.

“Mom, Mother, Momma, Gaia, what ever you prefer. Just know that I’m here for you. Now, enjoy your lives! I expect grandchildren in the next hundred years or so!” Gaia said with a smile before she disappeared. Leaving Rio, Agatha and Violet standing in her office.

“I wasn’t expecting that…” Violet said honestly as she looked at the bunch of flowers sitting on the floor where Gaia was standing. Rio bent over and picked them up and read the tag.

“A blessing for my daughter and her wife.” Rio said out loud as she handed the flowers to Agatha. It was a beautiful bouquet of lilies, hydrangeas and lavender.

“They all mean prosperity…” Violet said with a smile.

“And other things…” Rio answered vaguely as she looked over the bouquet.

“True but I know Gaia, if she wanted either of you pregnant she would’ve blessed you with that. Neither of you are.”

“Thank the goddesses and gods. I’m not ready to be a mother right now.” Agatha said as she rubbed her face.

“Honestly same, here ya go babe. These are technically for you. We will see you tonight?” Rio said as she handed Agatha the flowers before she turned to look at Violet.

“Yes. I’ll see the four of you tonight. Just summon me once you are all settled. Now I really must be going. Bodies are piling up again.” Violet said before time started back up and she disappeared.

“You didn’t have flowers in your arms a moment ago…” Pepper said in a confused tone.

“Well you asked if Rio could contact Death to give her an earful…” Agatha said trailing off as she looked down at the flowers.

“Oh? Did she pop in and have a conversation with you two?” Pepper asked.

“Yes, and this time she brought a friend.” Rio said with a shake of her head.

“Who? God?” Pepper joked.

“Close, Gaia.” Agatha said with a smirk.

“If anyone other than you told me that I’d think they were fucking with me. What did we learn?” Pepper asked.

“Well we can officially blame Wanda for wasting our time.” Rio joked.

“Elaborate, please.” Pepper requested as she leaned against the door.

“Wanda’s magical energy she had in those hexes was the only thing keeping her alive. So when the hexes were removed so was the magical energy.” Agatha explained.

“Please, please tell me Death told Evanora that Wanda’s hexes were what was keeping her alive?!” Pepper begged trying to keep the laugher that was threatening to bubble up contained.

“Oh she did.” Rio said with a shake of her head. Pepper then keeled over with laughter at the thought of that woman coming to the horrifying realization that she was her own undoing.

“Perfect, immaculate even! Wanda will love that!” Pepper said after she collected herself and wiped away the tears in her eyes. “She deserves a raise…” Pepper mused to herself.

“I hope so, and that’s on you and Tony. She just got a large chunk of her magical energy back so she’s already going a million miles a minute. You seen her earlier…” Agatha trailed off.

“Fair. Alright, well it sounds like everything is sorted out.” Pepper said as she walked over to Agatha. “I’m going to hug you, then you are going to collect that horrible woman’s items and we will figure out the legal bullshit tomorrow when it comes to her estate.”

Agatha sighed and let Pepper hug her, knowing she wasn’t getting out of this office without doing so. “Thank you Pepper. I appreciate you so much.” Agatha whispered.

“Just wait until you get my bill.” Pepper joked.

“Take it from my retirement I’ll never use.” Agatha jabbed back as Pepper let her go and headed toward the door.

“Go get her shit, I’ll start figuring out where everything is going.” Pepper instructed as she opened the door and walked out.

“Yes boss lady!” Agatha yelled back as she watched Pepper leave, she turned to look at Rio who was snooping around her office. “You want to go with me babe?”

“Huh? Oh yeah! Sorry, I was being nosy.” Rio said with a smile.

“No need to apologize. Let me pack up my stuff and we can head out.” Agatha reassured.

“Sounds great! I have a few questions though…” Rio said as she walked over to Agatha.

‘If they are about our connection I’d wait until we are in the car.’ Agatha thought before she spoke. “What would those be darling?”

“Do you know if she had a will?” Rio asked.

“Probably, we can go check the house out on Sunday and see if we can find anything. Or contact her lawyer. If Pepper hasn’t already started doing things. Ready?” Agatha asked as she looked at Rio who looked lost.

‘Are you okay?’ Agatha asked in her mind as she grabbed Rio’s hand.

‘I just can’t imagine losing my parents… so this is a little weird.’ Rio said back, squeezing it softly.

‘Evanora was never really a parent to me. But I understand what you mean. I’ll explain in the car. Come. Please.’ Agatha requested as she guided Rio out of her office.

“Tricia, have a great evening. See you tomorrow.” Agatha said to her secretary as she walked Rio toward the elevator. They made it down to the lobby and out the door before Rio spoke up.

“Are you sure you are okay? I know everyone thinks it’s funny, and it kind of is. But… she was still your mother. I just want to make sure you aren’t going to break.” Rio said softly.

“This is the freest I’ve ever felt in my life. If I could fly up into the sky and scream at the top of my lungs ‘I’m Finally Free!’ I would but I don’t need the government yelling at me right now.” Agatha said honestly.

“You can do that at the cabin on Saturday if you want.” Rio offered.

“I might just take you up on that offer. Now come on, I want to get this part over with.” Agatha said with a sigh as she guided Rio to her car. They got in and Agatha started it before pulling out of the parking lot.

“I don’t blame you. Sorry for being so weird about it. I was in my own head about my parent’s mortality. I know Evanora was a monster, and deserved what she got out of life. But I just wanted to make sure you were okay.”

“I appreciate it. But honestly I’m okay for now, that might change next week or next year. But right now, I’m relieved. I finally feel like I don’t have to be looking over my shoulder in fear constantly. Thank you for worrying Rio, it just proves to me that my magic chose the right person for me.” Agatha reassured the woman.

“Agatha Harkness I am of the belief that you were made just for me and I am so thankful for that gift.” Rio said sincerely.

“Okay stop being cheesy. That will make me cry.” Agatha said with a huff.

“So… are we gunna talk about the fact that our goddess just decided you’re her child now?” Rio asked changing the subject.

“That was the single most loving and maternal hug I’ve ever experienced. Rita’s hug was also so loving, but that hug… that hug felt like I was the most cherished and loved person on the planet. That hug felt like a hug I used to wish for from Evanora.” Agatha said with her voice cracking.

“Honestly, when she hugged me it felt like I was hugging an old friend I hadn’t seen in forever. But I believe you, I’m glad you are finally are getting all the love you deserve.”

“If I had only gotten you out of the deal. It would have been worth it. You coming into my life has been the best thing that has ever happened to me… well besides Wanda and Pietro… but those two knuckle heads aren’t here right now.” Agatha said with a chuckle as they pulled into the prisons parking lot.

“Are you ready?” Rio asked.

“As I’ve ever been.” Agatha said honestly as she shut off the car. “No let’s go collect her things and head home.”

Chapter 24

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Agatha and Rio went in, got Evanora’s shit and left quickly. Agatha kept everything in the evidence bag and threw it on the passenger side floor before she started driving home.

“Can I snoop?” Rio asked as she grabbed the bag.

“You are more than welcome to, but I doubt you’ll find anything interesting.” Agatha said as she turned.

“You never know. Maybe she had a fat stack of cash on her.” Rio joked as she pulled the tab on the evidence bag and pulled out Evanora’s wallet.

“I highly doubt that.” Agatha said as she focused on the road. Rio opened the wallet and found the woman’s ID, a few credit cards, deep in a hard to access pocket there was a picture of Agatha as a child.

“Huh… I wasn’t expecting that.” Rio said honestly. As she pulled the photo out of the wallet and looked at it.

“What’s that?” Agatha asked.

“I assume it’s a photo of you.” Rio answered.

“How old do I look?” Agatha asked.

“Maybe 3? Not sure. You were cute as fuck though.”

“Ah, Right before the diviner of the coven figured out I was powerless. Probably. She had so much hope for me to be a powerful illusionist like her. I think that was the last time I was happy… but I was so young I don’t remember it. Let me see the photo.” Agatha requested as she pulled up to a red light. Rio handed her the photo and Agatha looked at it before handing it back over to Rio.

“Goddesses above you were adorable!” Rio said gushing over the photo.

“That was the last photo taken of me as a child.” Agatha said honestly.

“You must be kidding? Really?” Rio asked.

“She became bitter quickly when she realized that I was of no use to her or the coven. Honestly I’m shocked that was in her wallet.” Agatha said to Rio.

“It wasn’t in a place that was easy to access. She might have just shoved it in there and forgotten about it. Is this the same wallet she had when you were a child?” Rio asked.

“I think so actually. So you might be right.” Agatha told Rio as they pulled into Agatha’s neighbor hood.

“I’m going to text Wanda real quick and tell her to meet us at your place.” Rio said as she magicked her phone into her hand.

Rio 6:10 p.m: We are pulling up. New things have happened, meet us at Agatha’s please.

Wanda 6:10 p.m: coming! Bringing Lily if that’s okay?

Rio 6:10 p.m: that’s fine.

“She’s bringing Lily.” Rio said as Agatha parked the car.

“Perfect I wanted to ask about her interview.” Agatha said as she turned the car off. They both got out and headed inside the house.

Rio decided to try some clothing manipulation as she walked into the house and changed her suit into a gray pair of lounge pants and a baggy soft green tee that hung off one shoulder. She then focused on Agatha, a cute little pair of dark purple sleep shorts and a soft purple tank top appeared on the woman.

“Hey!” Agatha said excitedly as she turned around. “Good job babe, but I feel like this is a little revealing.” Agatha said as she looked at herself. Rio took her in for a moment and then took two quick steps forward to place a hand on the heart on her chest.

“It changed!” Rio said as she softly placed three fingers on the sigil. A halo like crown with stars dotting it, was behind the heart sigil. Rio was instantly reminded of the night sky with clouds shining in the moonlight.

“How? What do you mean? I can’t really see it with your fingers on it.” Agatha said with a huff, she was trying to see it but couldn’t.

“There’s a crown resting on it. Did mine change?” Rio asked as she pulled her shirt down, a crown was resting on the heart shaped sigil as well.

“Gaia.” Agatha said as she traced her finger over the jagged crown that looked like it was made from branches.

“You called?” Gaia asked.

Both women looked over at the goddess who had a bright smile on her face. “Oh! I see you found them! Your crowns that is, they aren’t your real ones mind you. Just a temporary cap so to say. Once you die they will become real and we can talk about everything that entails. But right now they are in stasis.” Gaia reassured the women.

“Oh thank goddesses… I mean…” Agatha said floundering.

“It’s okay witchlett! Your welcome. Even though that’s not what you meant.” Gaia reassured.

“So we are safe? No accidental ascension?” Rio asked as she trailed her finger over the spires of Agatha’s halo crown on her chest.

“Safe as safe can be. No need to stress too much. Now. Violet really wants to meet Wanda, so I’m gunna go home. I love you both so much, take good care of my daughter Rio. I’m counting on you.” Gaia said with a soft smile before she disappeared again.

“What is so important that I had to walk ALL the way over here.” Wanda complained as she opened the door. Lily followed Wanda into the house looking a little more energized than she did this morning.

“For starters, how did your interview go Lily?” Agatha asked.

“You’re looking at Stark Industries New Head of Botanical Research!” Lily said excitedly.

“Awesome! We have multiple reasons to celebrate tonight then!” Agatha said while pumping her fist in the air.

“What did you want to tell us?” Wanda asked.

“Let’s all go sit down and we will call Violet and she can tell you.” Rio said as she ushered the women into the room.

“Good idea.” Agatha agreed as she made her way to the living room.

“Is it me or did Agatha get more confident in the last 12 hours?” Lily asked Wanda.

“I think the outfit she’s wearing is blinding you.” Wanda joked.

“I won’t deny Agatha is hot… but no, something changed.” Lily told Wanda as they walked into the living room.

“Thank you?” Agatha questioned as she plopped down into the L of the couch. Rio settled next to her and, then Wanda and Lily sat down on the opposite side of couch.

“Okay seriously, what happened?”

“Evanora Harkness died shortly after being incarcerated today…” Rio said trailing off.

“You have to be fucking kidding me!” Wanda yelled as she stood up, no woman could get a read on this reaction. “Why couldn’t she have saved us some fucking time and kicked the bucket sooner! Goddess above I hate that cunt!”

“Told you she’d be pissed. Also Pepper reacted the same way.” Rio said with a chuckle.

“Wait, we haven’t gotten to the good part.” Agatha soothed, Rio smiled at her when Wanda turned around and honed her eyes on Agatha.

“What’s the good part Agatha? I don’t see how any of this is good. She’s put you through hell, she’s been a horrible mother, she’s been a thorn in my side for the last 30 years, so what’s the good part? Please tell me!” Wanda ranted animatedly as she paced around the living room. This time, time didn’t slow to a halt, but they all felt something in the room shift.

“Well that’s where I come in! Nice to actually meet you Wanda! I’m Violet Vidal, aka Death.” The woman said from behind Wanda. Lily, Agatha, and Rio could see the bright smile painting the normal looking woman’s face. Wanda turned around and looked over the woman for a long moment.

“I’m not dying today, so how come I can see you?” Wanda asked defensively.

“Because the Goddess Gaia has decided you deserve a gift for taking such good care of Agatha the last 30 years. I’m just here to share the memory of Evanora’s death with you.” Violet explained to Wanda.

“I uh… can I have an explanation?” Wanda asked.

“Nah, I think you’ll enjoy this unfiltered. Now come here.” Violet said as she reached for Wanda’s face. Wanda sighed but didn’t argue as she let Violet take her face into her hands and pressed her forehead to her own. A bright white flash happened in Wanda’s mind as the memories started to flood in.

~

“Do you really think you won?”

“I think I’m free from all these fucking Hexes.” Evanora hissed at the entity.

“Yes, but at what cost? All that chaos energy that was clinging to your body was the only magical energy you had left…Don’t you see? Wanda Maximoff’s hexes were the only thing keeping you alive. Your body can’t keep up now that it’s got no juice left.”

“What do you mean?” Evanora asked in a fear filled tone, her eyes widening.

“You’ve always been destined to die this way you know… alone, scared, and confused. Just the way you made your daughter feel.” Death hissed out as she floated closer. “If you’re lucky you’ll make it through the week, but you’ve never been lucky Evanora now have you?”

“No! No! I’m finally free! You can’t take me! It’s not fair!” Evanora screamed at the deity floating around her. Her face contorting and twisting as death inched closer.

“Life isn’t fair. You got as much time as you got, and more time than you ever deserved. Now, are you going to keep fighting me or are you going to come willingly?” Death asked as she held her scythe above Evanora’s head.

“Fuck you!” Evanora screamed out.

“Wrong answer Evanora.” Death screeched out with a thousand voices, her scythe slicing through her soul and plucking it from her body. Leaving the woman’s corpse crumpled on the floor.

“Now, you get to experience the fear and torment you put your daughter through for the next century. I’m throwing you in a pit and forgetting about you.” Death said as she opened a portal and dragged her through it.

“No! It’s not fair!”

“You keep saying that, but unfortunately for you it’s more than fair.” Death said as she dropped the woman into the void and walked out.

~

Violet pulled her head away from Wanda’s and let her go with a smile. Wanda’s face split into a wide grin before she begun to cackle, a genuine witches cackle.

“Excuse me!?” Wanda said excitedly. “That’s not real! You have to be pulling my leg!”

“I promise you it’s not a joke dear. That’s exactly what happened. I would never fuck around like that.” Violet reassured.

“Goddesses, I could kiss you! That is the greatest gift! I won’t, because you have a wife and I have a girlfriend. But still! Thank you! Can I hug you?” Wanda rushed out excitedly.

“Yes, you can. I’m not going to hurt you.” Violet answered and Wanda scooped her into a hug so fast and squeezed her so tight.

“Thank you! Goddesses that was so gratifying!” Wanda said as she let Violet go and she started dancing around the room. “Ding dong! The witch is dead!”

“That’s the reaction I was expecting.” Agatha said with a bright smile as she pointed at Wanda. Rio just shook her head at Wanda’s antics.

“Unfortunately I cannot stay much longer to watch this unfold. I have things to do, bodies to collect, and a wife gossiping with Gaia still I’m sure.” Violet said with a sigh. “I’m sure you’ll tell Wanda all about that as well, she deserves to know. These two will never ascend like you two but their connection will get deeper over time.” Violet explained to Rio and Agatha.

“Yeah we can do that. Have a goodnight grandma!” Rio said with a smile.

“Goodnight girls!” Violet said with a smile before she clipped out of the room.
