“Okay, what about Gaia?” Lily asked Rio and Agatha while Wanda continued to dance around the living room singing happily to herself.

“Oh, we met her today. She’s decided to adopt me and is my new mother. She also put these sigils on our heart sigils that represent our crowns. The heart sigils weren’t supposed to show up until we died.” Agatha explained to Lily, Wanda paused and turned to look at Agatha.

“Wait, what was that middle bit?” Wanda asked.

“The fact that I’m dating the daughter of a goddess?” Rio asked.

“Yeah, that.” Wanda said before she walked over to Agatha. “What do you mean Gaia adopted you?”

“Can I give you the cliff notes version, please?” Agatha requested.

“No. You don’t get to just skim over this.” Wanda said seriously as she looked down at Agatha.

“Fine. Let me get some wine, and we can order some food and sit down and actually talk about everything. Discuss what you want while I get the wine.” Agatha said with a sigh as she stood up.

“Do you want some help Agatha?” Lily asked as she stood up.

“I’d appreciate it. Thank you.” Agatha said as she made her way to the kitchen with Lily, leaving Rio and Wanda in the living room.

“What’s the plan?” Rio asked.

“Keep her happy? I don’t know how she’s going to be once the sun goes down. Honestly, she seems fine right now. But I have no idea.” Wanda whispered.

“I have to go check on my Aunt at some point are you two staying here?” Rio asked.

“I’ll be staying, I don’t know about Lily.” Wanda answered.

“Don’t you two want to celebrate her getting the job?” Rio asked softly.

“Lily knows Agatha comes first right now.” Wanda explained.

“Yes…. But all the magical energy you have…” Rio implied the need to burn the energy off without saying it.

“I’ll be fine.” Wanda said as she plopped down next to Rio.

“I do want to bring something up that might help with that but I don’t know how much you and Agatha talk about sex.” Rio offered.

“I mean Agatha really only did one night stands before you, I kinda was the same. If the sex was good we’d mentioned it to each other. If the sex was horrible we’d spend hours bitching about them.” Wanda offered.

“She doesn’t know about the magic trick babe.” Agatha said as she walked into the living room carrying two glasses of wine. She handed one to Rio as she sat down. Lily was carrying the other two glasses of wine.

“What magic trick?” Lily asked as she handed Wanda a glass of wine.

“This is about to get very personal.” Agatha told Wanda and Lily.

“Like that’s ever deterred me before. Spill.” Wanda said as she took a sip of wine.

“I created a spell that makes your strap on feel like it’s actually a part of you. So you can feel everything.” Agatha explained.

“Share that with me right now.” Wanda said in an aggressive tone, she needed that spell.

“That’s the problem… it’s something I have to make. I don’t actually have a spell for it. It’s more an intention than anything.” Agatha explained.

“Oh….”

“I mean.. I could.. make you both your own. But that requires a few things.” Agatha explained.

“I didn’t think about that when I suggested this.” Rio said honestly, realizing they would be possibly learning more than they wanted.

“It’s possible, it’s just something that might not be comfortable for Lily.” Agatha explained, looking over at the blonde.

“I’m more curious than I am embarrassed. I’d love to know more.” Lily said honestly.

“Describe your perfect dildo, length, girth, texture if that’s something you want. Then I can make it for you. I want this to be the most enjoyable experience for both parties if I’m going to make one. If you already have a toy you prefer… that might make it easier. The spell will be personalized as well so you can’t use the same one.”

“I’ve never used one honestly.” Lily answered.

“A toy? Or a strap on?” Rio asked.

“Both.” Lily told the group. Wanda turned and looked at Lily, for a moment.

“Is that something you’d be interested in trying? I don’t want to make you uncomfortable.” Wanda asked trying to make Lily as comfortable as possible.

“I’d like to try it, it’s more appealing now knowing you’ll be able to feel it as well.” Lily said honestly.

“We can shelve this for now…” Agatha offered. “I know Wanda’s never been on the giving end of one… as far as I’m aware so it’s going to be a learning experience for both of you.”

“Way to call me out Agatha!” Wanda scolded!

“What!? It’s the truth!” Agatha said with a shrug. A bright blush painted Wanda’s face, which caused Rio to burst out laughing at Wanda.

“Don’t be embarrassed, it will be a new experience for both of us Wanda.” Lily reassured as she took her hand.

“Awe, you two are perfect for each other.” Rio teased.

“Wait! I just had a magnificent idea!” Agatha said as she got up from the couch and magicked her spell book into her hands. She started flipping through the pages and read something. “I was working on enchanting clothing a while ago… maybe I can just enchant a harness…” Agatha said as she landed on a page. She sat back down and handed Wanda the book.

“What am I looking at.” Wanda said as she looked over the page.

“Right here. I was working on an incantation. It never seemed to work right. I don’t know if it was not having enough power to put into it or what.” Agatha said as she pointed in the book.

“That’s illusion magic. I can’t touch that even if I wanted!” Wanda said in an exasperated tone

“I’ll make you the harness and enchant it so that it spreads the magical energy into the toy, so do you both want one?” Agatha asked.

“Why can’t we share?” Lily asked.

“Because the spell will be personalized to you. The harness will act as an extension of you and only you.” Rio explained.

“How do you…. Never mind.” Wanda started to ask.

“No Wanda, ask. I wanna hear this question.” Rio jabbed.

“I figured it out Rio.” Wanda said as she shook her head. While Agatha sat down and contemplated how to get this spell to work with just a harness, so that it would extend to the toy.

“Alright, I think I’ve got it! Unless you want personalized toys?” Agatha said as she looked over at the women.

“Let’s just go with the harnesses for now and if they don’t work like we think they should we can do the toy’s later.” Lily requested.

“Wanda come here. Stand in front of me.” Agatha said as she sat up a little better. Wanda sighed and handed Lily her drink and stood up in front of Agatha who looked up at her best friend. “Consent to tug on your magic?”

“Of course. I wanna try this out!” Wanda said excitedly. She then felt Agatha’s magic start to tug and pull on hers as Agatha held her hands at pelvis level. A moment later the harness was wrapped around Wanda’s waist over her pants.

Rio couldn’t help herself, a muffled laugh slipped out. If she had been drinking she would’ve spit it out. “Nice color babe.” Rio said with a laugh.

“It suits her! The harness is also based off her magic.” Agatha said as she pointed at the bright red leather harness.

“Over my pants? Really?” Wanda scolded.

“Fine” Agatha said with a wave of her hand and it was under her pants, tightly strapped to her legs and waist.

“You couldn’t put it in my nightstand at home?” Wanda said with a huff as she sat down on the couch.

“I’m not feeling that nice.” Agatha said with a chuckle, before she looked at Lily. “Your turn sweetie.”

Lily got up and walked over to Agatha and stood up in front of the woman. Agatha looked up at Lily and smiled before asking. “Consent to tug in your magic? Might feel a little weird the first time. Nothing like the connection you and Wanda have. More like it feels like someone’s plucking on your soul.”

“Yes, I trust you to not do anything weird.” Lily said as she looked down at Agatha. Agatha started doing the same motions that she had done with Wanda and a few moments later a bright pink harness settled on Lily’s hips.

“I’m noticing a pattern.” Rio said softly as she looked at the harness over Lily’s pants.

“I’ll magic yours to Wanda’s in a moment. Is it comfortable?” Agatha asked softly.

“Yes. Thank you.” Lily said with a smile, then with a wave of her hand both harnesses were on Wanda’s bed.

“What pattern are you noticing Rio?” Lily asked a moment later.

“The harnesses are the color of our magic.” Rio answered.

“That tracks. I used their magic to make them. I think this could be considered spirit witch craft if I’m being honest.” Agatha explained.

“Not to change the subject but I’m starving.” Rio said as she looked at the group.

“Actually… I don’t think I’ve eaten since breakfast.” Agatha said realizing that it had been a long day.

“What are we ordering? I’m paying.” Wanda said excitedly as she plopped down.

“Pizza or Chinese?” Agatha asked.

“What do you want Agatha?” Lily asked.

“It’s your celebration Lily! You got the job.” Agatha said with a smile.

“Seriously? Aren’t we supposed to be comforting you?” Lily asked.

“Honestly I’m fine, I have seriously never felt more loved in my life than I do right now. I have this whole support system that has just grown and expanded over the last week and a half. My mother’s death is just the cherry on top. The last person that hated me for existing no longer does. So I promise you all. I’m fine.” Agatha reassured.

“Fine… Chinese sounds good!” Lily answered.

“Great. Wanda isn’t allowed to order.” Rio said with a laugh.

“Oh come on!” Wanda said in an exasperated tone.

Chapter End Notes

I’m sorry I’ve been so busy the last few days guys! Hopefully this will tie you over for a day or so!

Chapter 25

“Why isn’t Wanda allowed to order food?” Lily asked.

“Because the last time she ordered Chinese she ordered like 6 orders of Crab Rangoons! And that was all we ate!” Rio said in an exasperated tone.

“Wanda! No egg rolls?!” Lily scolded as she shoved Wanda playfully.

“Hey, my best friend was sad. I got her favorite thing. Now what are we eating?” Wanda said as she pulled her phone out.

“Nuh uh! Not happening you chaos gremlin! You tell me what you want and I’ll pay this time.” Rio said as she pulled her phone out.

“How about I get my iPad and everyone just orders what they want, then I pay.” Agatha offered as she magicked her iPad into her hands and pulled up the website for the restaurant. She handed the iPad to Wanda. “You order first.”

“No fun. Fine. But I am getting at least two orders of Crab Rangoons!” Wanda said as she ordered her food. She then handed Lily the iPad so she could order. Lily ordered her food before handing the iPad across to Agatha and Rio. Agatha handed the iPad to Rio so she could order food. Then once Rio was finished Agatha put in her order and checked everything over and ordered their dinner.

“Thank you for not being absolutely chaotic Wanda.” Agatha said after she set her iPad down.

“Soooo.” Wanda started to ask.

“Just ask.” Agatha told the redhead next to her.

“You were adopted by our Goddess?” Wanda asked looking over at her best friend who was sipping her wine.

“I was really hoping the strap on thing would’ve distracted you.” Agatha said with a grumble as she took a sip of her wine.

“I’m a chaos witch, you can’t distract me that easily. I have a million things running around up here at once.” Wanda said as she tapped her temple.

“I think that’s just called ADHD.” Rio joked. Agatha laughed softly at her best friend and partner.

“So when do you start your new job Lily?” Agatha asked, trying to distract them all again.

“Nuh uh! Stop trying to get out of this Harkness!” Wanda scolded, knowing exactly what her best friend was doing.

“Ugh! Fine! Seriously I don’t know what to tell you other than I’ve been adopted by a goddess!” Agatha grumbled out.

“Yes, but what does that mean? Are you a Demi-god now? are you the same person but more loved? What is it?” Wanda pried trying to get any information she could out of the raven haired woman next to her.

“I don’t know. I mean I could call her and ask but she’s a busy lady and I don’t want to bother her.” Agatha said with a sigh. She was exhausted and today had been a very long day. It wasn’t like she had a ton of answers for her best friend.

“You will never be a bother to me, my sweet girl! To answer Wanda’s questions though. She’s the same person she’s always been. She just can call me whenever she needs. She’s already extremely powerful, so no need for the title of Demi-goddess. Also I’m really not that busy… Everything is pretty self sustaining if I’m being honest. I could take a hundred years off and nothing would change.” Gaia told the group of women in the living room.

“Holy shit!” Wanda said in awe of the goddess in front of her. Rio was sitting on the couch just absolutely unfazed by the fact that another deity had popped into her fiancé’s living room.

“Wow. You are so beautiful, I mean I knew you were but wow!” Lily said in shock, her filter failing her the second she seen Gaia.

“Thank you. Any other questions Wanda?”

“How many am I allowed to ask?” Wanda asked as she looked at the glowing goddess in front of her.

“As many as you want, I’ll decide if they are worth answering.

“Why Agatha? Not that she doesn’t deserve to be loved by you or anything but why her in particular?” Wanda asked trying to figure things out.

“Oh! So we are asking the heavy ones first. Got it. Move over. I wanna sit down.” Gaia said as she patted Agatha on the leg. Rio slid over into the corner of the L on the couch and pulled Agatha into her arms. Gaia sat down next to Agatha and placed her hand on her knee.

“This one right here has been through more hellish torment than most. She’s experienced things that children never should, and yes to me you are all children. But she’s special. Whether she realizes it or not, she is one of the most unique witches I have ever had the privilege of meeting. She has endured so much and is so powerful. She just hasn’t unlocked every ability she has yet. One day, a long time from now she will take her place as a goddess. But right now I just want her to experience being human. She deserves that.” Gaia explained before she looked at Agatha and smiled softly. “You deserve all the love in the universe witchlett, I’m sorry it took so long for it to come to fruition.”

“Stop, I will cry.” Agatha said with a lump in her throat. She felt overwhelmed by all the love in the room. She wanted to flee but Rio was holding her close, anchoring her in her spot.

“Tears are a good thing sweetheart. Nothing to be ashamed of for that. I promise. Now, what’s your next question Wanda?” Gaia reassured Agatha softly as she soothed a hand up and down the young woman’s leg.

“Is this going to be a normal occurrence? You just popping in whenever you’d like?” Wanda asked.

“Only when Agatha is too stressed or needs me. Sorry sweetheart I could tell that you didn’t have answers for Wanda, or that you just didn’t want to talk about this in general. But I promise it’s okay. You are safe. Look at all the people in your life who show up in mass.” Gaia answered before turning back to Agatha.

“It’s just a lot to take in all at once…” Agatha said trailing off.

“It is, but I know how strong you are. But right now, in this moment. You are allowed to be weak. You have an amazing support system. You are loved.” Gaia told Agatha who actually started crying softly. Rio held her closer and kissed the side of her head and soothed her hands over Agatha’s arms. Agatha felt her body shake slightly but she held it together. Wanda quickly got up and settled on the floor next to her legs and pressed her face to her knee as she wrapped her arms around the one Gaia wasn’t touching.

“Hey, it’s okay. We are here. You can cry all you want but that’s not going to scare us off.” Wanda said softly, which made Gaia smile brightly at the redhead on the floor. They were all soothing Agatha in the best way they knew how by allowing her this moment.

The doorbell rang a moment later, and they all froze. “I’ve got it.” Lily said as she got up from the couch and made her way to the front door to collect their food. A few minutes later she came back into the living room carrying 2 large bags and set them on the coffee table.

“Thank you Lily.” Rio said softly as she held Agatha close. Agatha was still trying to compose herself and failing.

“No problem. I’m gunna go grab the wine from the kitchen and some silverware. Does anyone want anything else?” Lily asked the group.

“I’d love a glass of wine as well. I think I’ll stay and hang out with you girls tonight.” Gaia said softly as she watched Lily walk toward the kitchen.

“Momma no, you don’t have to do that.” Agatha said weakly, not even realizing what she said. Gaia felt her heart soar, as she smiled brightly at Agatha.

“Oh my sweet girl. I do, and I am. You are far more important right now than anything that may need my attention.” Gaia reassured as Lily walked back into the room and handed Gaia a glass of wine, making sure to not touch the Goddess.

“It’s utterly unfair.” Agatha whispered, feeling overwhelmed by all the love.

“What is Witchlett?” Gaia questioned softly, knowing Agatha was feeling helpless.

“How you all ganged up on me! My heart hurts so much!” Agatha told them, her voice cracking with emotion as she tried to calm herself down.

“How dare we love you? Is that what you’re saying?” Rio asked, as she squeezed Agatha tighter.

“Yes.” Agatha said weakly.

“Those pains you feel in your chest will settle into something amazing soon. I promise. But right now it’s gunna hurt a little, but this time it’s a good hurt.” Gaia reassured. “Now! You girls need to eat dinner.” Gaia said with a wave of her hand. The food started unpacking itself from the bags.

Wanda pulled away from Agatha slightly so she could get her something to eat, Wanda opened the containers and grabbed the Crab Rangoons out for Agatha along with the sweet and sour sauce. She handed the food to Agatha and then looked at Rio. “What did you order?”

“Chicken lo-mein, but I can wait to eat.” Rio reassured, both her arms were wrapped around Agatha.

“No, let me go. You need to eat, please babe.” Agatha asked softly as she tried to wiggle out of Rio’s grasp. Gaia gladly threw an arm over Agatha’s shoulder and pulled her in.

“Fine, but only because it smells good.” Rio said with a huff as she let Agatha go and reached for the food Wanda was holding out for her. Lily had grabbed the food she ordered and settled on the floor in front of the coffee table. She was happily eating her food as she watched the small family interact.

“You will be just as comfortable as Wanda is with these two soon enough. Thank you for the wine.” Gaia reassured Lily.

“You’re welcome! I’m sure of it, I’m already pretty comfortable, I just didn’t want to overwhelm Agatha.” Lily said with a smile.

“Too late for that! I’m so overwhelmed.” Agatha said after she finished chewing her bite of food. Rio smiled softly at her and gave her a kiss on the cheek before she took a bite of her own food.

“Did you have any other questions Wanda?” Gaia asked.

“I mean about a million, but nothing that matters. I do want to thank you for allowing Death to show me that earlier.” Wanda said with a smile as she opened a box of Crab Rangoons for herself.

“You’re welcome! I’ll be paying her a little visit tomorrow as well.” Gaia said honestly causing the women in the room to look at her with confusion.

“Why?” Rio asked.

“Most souls get the chance for reincarnation. Especially witches. She never will.” Gaia explained before she took a sip of her wine.

“Good.” Agatha said honestly before she stuffed another bite of Crab Rangoon into her mouth. “Wanda can I have my orange chicken please?” Agatha asked her best friend. Wanda turned around and grabbed the orange chicken and a box of rice. Agatha magicked a bowl into her lap and put some of each item into it before she handed the take out containers back to Wanda.

“Can I ask a question?” Lily asked Gaia.

“Of course.”

“Can you explain the magical connection-compatibility thing to all of us? I feel like we are stumbling through the dark a little.” Lily asked trying to understand. Agatha paused mid bite and looked over at Lily.

“That is actually a very good question that even I want the answer to!” Agatha responded before she went back to eating her dinner.

“It’s simple really. Every witch has a weak point. Rio is phenomenal at analog magic, Agatha has always struggled with that because her birth giver never taught her anything. Rio doesn’t struggle much with anything because of who she was meant to be but this shared connection with Agatha will make her job in the future much easier. When it comes to you two in particular you have always been one to just let things happen, go with the flow. Your magic is the calm in Wanda’s storm of chaos. You two will balance each other out.” Gaia said with a smile.

“That’s not exactly what I was asking.” Lily said with a sigh unsure of how to ask this question.

“Oh, are you looking for how each connection deepens and the way we unlock them? Agatha and Rio managed to do all this in a week?” Lily asked waving at the women.

“Remember Agatha is a whole coven rolled into one? That has a lot to do with it, her and Rio’s magical connection is much deeper than any I’ve ever seen here on the mortal plane. They are the exception, not the rule. The deepest yours and Wanda’s will go is the rings. As for how you unlock them, it’s about having a deep intimate connection.” Gaia answered.

“So we have to have lots of sex? Is that how you two unlocked it?” Wanda asked as she poked Agatha in the thigh with her fork. A blush creeped up into Agatha’s face as she realized her best friend said that in front of her adoptive mother.

“Really Wanda?” Agatha asked in an exasperated tone.

“Yes? No? I don’t know, I think we just were enjoying each other.” Rio explained.

“That’s a good way to do it, enjoy and live the experience. The sigils will show up when they show up. There’s nothing you can do to expedite it. It happens when it happens.” Gaia explained.

“Makes sense. Can’t rush perfection.” Rio said with a chuckle.

“Says the witch who found her magical soulmate and put a ring on it in less than a week.” Wanda jabbed.

“I’m special. Deal with it.” Rio teased before she took a sip of her wine.

“Momma, how am I going to put up with these two for the rest of my life?” Agatha asked Gaia.

“Lily is the blessing on that one, she will become your ally in arms against these two. When they get up to shenanigans.” Gaia explained to her daughter.

“Good, we can gang up on them together Lily.” Agatha offered.

“I’m game. Someone’s gotta keep them in line.” Lily said with a smile as she looked at Wanda and Rio. Their faces falling instantly.

“Wait! no… you aren’t allowed to team up against us!” Wanda said in an exasperated tone.

“Yeah wait a second babe, let’s talk about this…” Rio said in a nervous tone.

“Oh? I think we are, I mean you two have ganged up on me a few times this week. Maybe Lily and I will give you two a taste of your own medicine.” Agatha suggested before she winked at Lily. Rio and Wanda looked at each other like they were scared for a long moment.

“I think I can manage that. Wanda needs to be put in her place for once.” Lily said with a smile.

“We are so fucked Vidal.” Wanda said to Rio.

“Speak for yourself. I’m well behaved compared to you.” Rio told Wanda, which caused Agatha, Lily and Gaia to laugh at the panicked look on Wanda’s face.

“I don’t like this.” Wanda said sadly.

“You will live.” Agatha said as she patted her best friend on the head. The women settled into a comfortable silence and just went back to eating their dinner.

They all cuddled up on the couch together, Lily and Wanda were careful not to actually touch Gaia.

“Good. Listen to it. It’s telling you that for a reason. Not that I’d hurt you. But it might not be a pleasant experience for you.” Gaia said to the woman next to her.

“I believe that. I knew Agatha was powerful, I just didn’t realize how much until she so casually touched a goddess with out flinching.” Wanda said with a sigh.

“I think it’s more because she decided I’m hers. But Rio seems to be able to touch her just fine.” Agatha said from her spot between Gaia and Rio.

“That’s because she’s next in line to be Death. She’s technically a Demi-god sweetie.” Gaia explained.

“Oh.” Agatha said as she came to the realization that she was far more special than even she had thought.

“There it is! Finally. Took you long enough!” Gaia said excitedly.

“What?” Lily asked.

~Meanwhile in some dark pit~

A bright flash of light illuminated the Darkness, as Gaia’s light flooded the pit Death threw Evanora in.

“You! You horrible creature! I don’t know how you slipped through the cracks last time you reincarnated but this time. I’ll make sure you never escape your cage!” Gaia said to the vile woman floating in the void.

“Fuck off Gaia!” Evanora screamed at the goddess.

“Starting to remember who you actually are? You know if you had been a good mother… all of this could’ve been avoided. But you always mess up don’t you?” Gaia asked as she walked closer. Evanora sunk into herself as much as she could, Gaia’s light was blinding after being in the dark for so long.

“I’ll get out again.” Evanora hissed.

“No, you won’t. This time I’m eliminating you. You don’t even get the hundred year punishment you deserve. All you’ve ever been is a cockroach that persists to come back time and time again. I’m tired. So very tired of you and your behavior. We are done.” Gaia said as she reached forward and grabbed Evanora by her neck. She stood up and held the woman above her head.

“With this spell, I cleanse the universe of your pestilence. I cleanse everything you’ve ever touched with your ichor, the vile hatred you spread shall die with you. I will make sure there’s nothing left of you for your souls to regenerate from. You’ve gone too far this time.” Gaia said as a bright energy started to spread from her hand down Evanora’s throat.

“Wait! We can talk about this! We can come to an agreement!” Evanora tried to barter as she grappled at the hand on her throat.

“I’m done giving you grace. Every life time, every iteration of you has created a spirit witch, and I am DONE. You’re out of chances.” Gaia said as the light spread and started to incinerate her soul. The light flashing brightly as Evanora’s body broke into pieces.

“What if she wants to face me!” Evanora screamed one final plea in hopes of getting out of this with her soul intact.

“Then when she becomes a goddess she can resurrect you. I’ll lock your broken soul in boxes in the deepest recesses of the universe, far far away from anywhere you could ever cause any damage. But for now you are going to experience this pain, and I’m locking you away. No chance of reincarnation, no light, nothing but darkness, pain, suffering, and the feeling of being incomplete. You won’t even know how long it has been since you felt anything besides the pain you are experiencing. I AM DONE. I’m sick of being kind and giving you grace. You’ve proven you don’t deserve it.” Gaia said as she blasted the woman’s soul with pure light, it fell apart in a crumpled heap in the floor. Leaving what looked to be glowing fragments of soul on the floor. With a wave of her hand Evanora’s soul was boxed in multiple boxes and sent to the darkest corners of the universe.

“Get fucked Evanora. You cunt.” Gaia said as she left the space Violet had created just for her. Now she needed to talk to Violet again. She decided to just head to Violets domain this time. She loved the deep lush forest the cabin Violet and Rosaline resided in.

Gaia walked up to the door and knocked before she waited a long moment. Rosaline opened it a moment later and smiled brightly when she realized it was Gaia.

“Gaia! Nice to see you again! What do I owe the pleasure?” Rosaline asked as she opened the door and let her into the cabin.

“I destroyed Evanora Harkness’s soul.” Gaia said passively as she walked inside. Rosaline paused for a long moment before she turned around and looked at Gaia.

“Violet isn’t here.” Rosaline said with a huff.

“I can wait. I’ll summon some ambrosia and we can chat.” Gaia said as she made glasses of the golden nectar appear in their hands.

“Sounds delightful. Let’s go hang out in the living room.” Rosaline said as she walked toward the living area. Both women settled in the couch and started talking about everything that had happened over the last few days.

Chapter 26

The next morning Agatha and Rio woke up before Lily and Wanda who had decided to stay in the guest room the night before. Rio had opened a portal to her apartment and checked on Lilia last night before they went to bed. The woman promised that she would stop at the book store before she headed home.

“I think I’m going to open a portal back to my apartment and head to work from there after checking on Lilia again. Thank you for making her one babe.” Rio said as she took a bite of her breakfast sandwich Agatha had made.

“That’s fine I have court today. Lily when do you officially start working?” Agatha told Rio before turning to ask Lily.

“Tomorrow. Orientation at Stark Tower, then I get to meet my team on Thursday and probably clean house.” Lily said honestly.

“Did Tony give you permission to do that?” Wanda asked.

“He said I could start with a clean slate if I wanted. Which I don’t. But it’s an option.” Lily answered.

“Good to know. Alright everyone let’s get headed out. I have lots of work to catch up on after this past week.” Agatha said in a serious tone as she waved her hand and cleaned the kitchen. Purple magic flooding the room as she did.

“I’ll see you tonight.” Agatha told Rio before she kissed her softly on the lips. Rio grabbed the sandwich for Lilia before she walked through the portal she had opened in the hall closet.

“Alright, love you. Have a good day!” Wanda said as she dragged Lily out the door. Agatha magicked her things into her hands and made her way to her car.

~At Rio’s apartment.~

“Aunt Lilia! I brought you breakfast.” Rio said as she walked in her front door.

“Perfect, you have no food here! How do you live?” Lilia said as she walked out of the living room. Rio handed her the breakfast sandwich and grabbed her keys off the counter.

“Are you gunna check out the city today or are you headed home?” Rio asked Lilia.

“I think I’ll be headed home but I think I’ll be coming to dinner on Saturday.” Lilia told Rio as she took a bite of her sandwich. “This is good!”

“Agatha made that by the way.” Rio told her.

“And now I know why there’s no food here.” Lilia said with an eye roll as she continued to eat her breakfast.

“Can I ask you a question?” Rio asked.

“For once you are actually going to ask me for something!? Really?” Lilia teased.

“Two names. I need two names of employees that will work out and be a good fit for the store.” Rio requested.

“Oh darn. I thought you were going to ask me for something else. Fine. Sage and Rowen. Those two are the best fit. I won’t say anything else.” Lilia told Rio before she finished her sandwich.

“Tell Agatha I said thank you and her cooking is delightful.” Lilia said before she gave her a hug.

“I will, or you can if you come to dinner on Saturday.” Rio offered.

“That might be worth the trip. I love you witchlett, have a good day.” Lilia said as she collected her things and walked out the door.

~Wanda’s Place~

“Do you want me to call off today?” Wanda asked Lily as they walked over to their cars.

“No it’s fine, I need to call my parents and tell them I got the job. Then clean my apartment.” Lily said with a smile before she gave Wanda a kiss.

“Or we could go shopping and spend the day in bed.” Wanda suggested softly as she brought her hand up to caress her neck and pull her close.

“As tempting as that sounds. You should go to work. I’ll go shopping today and pick up a couple toys for us to test out. Send me photos of what you think you might like.” Lily said as she pulled away and made her way to her car.

“Not helping!” Wanda said in a frustrated tone as she walked toward her house so she could get dressed and head to work.

~Stark Law Firm Peppers Office~

Pepper was sitting at her desk reading over Evanora’s final will and testament. Her brow was furrowed as she looked over the document. It was updated a year after Agatha’s birth.

“Why did you never update this?” Pepper wondered aloud as she continued to read. She grabbed her phone and dialed Tricia. The phone rang once before Agatha’s secretary picked up.

“Hello Mrs. Potts, Ms. Harkness is in court until after lunch. Is there anything I can assist you with or would you like to leave a message?” Tricia asked the women on the phone.

“Just tell her I’d like to see her when she gets back. No rush or anything I just have some interesting news for her.” Pepper said into the phone.

“Can do, have a good day Mrs. Potts.” Tricia said into the phone before waiting.

“You as well Tricia.” Pepper said before hanging the phone up.

Pepper sighed loudly as she started reading over the document. She felt so confused by everything that was stated in it, she literally left every worldly possession to Agatha. It just made no sense to Pepper that after all these years she never bothered to change it. She really wanted to talk to Agatha but she knew she had to be patient so she settled for calling her husband.

She picked her phone up and dialed Tony. It rang once before her husband picked up. “Heya Pepperoni! What’s up?” Tony asked off in the distance.

“I’m reading over Evanora’s last will and testament… and it’s confusing me.” Pepper told her husband.

“How many of those spells did Maximoff have on this woman again?” Tony asked.

“Yeah but that was after they turned 16. The last time she updated this document was right after Agatha’s first birthday…” Pepper said in a confused tone. Like she couldn’t understand why this was the last time she updated the document.

“Hey, maybe she got busy, then she got hexed. Who knows, not like you can call her up and be like ‘why didn’t you ever update this shit?’ She’s dead.” Tony said into the phone.

“Maybe… but now I have to force Agatha to take bereavement so she can get all this shit sorted out.” Pepper said with a sigh.

“Or just have her plan a vacation? Ask her what she wants to do? We can hire a company to go clean the house out for her so she doesn’t have to think about it?” Tony offered.

“Honey…. Evanora Harkness was alive for 250 years. She had stocks, bonds, bank accounts, and a plethora of other things lined up. She owned stocks in our company. She’s an original stock holder. The woman may have been a bitch, but she was financially well off.”

“How many?” Tony asked.

“You don’t want the answer to that question.” Pepper said nervously.

“Don’t tell me this woman was a major stock holder!” Tony said in a disgusted voice.

“Well… Now Agatha is… if that makes you feel any better.” Pepper told her husband.

“Hey Jarvis, how much was a Stark Industries stock when our company started?” Tony asked his computer.

“$0.25 sir. The current value of Stark Industries stocks is $20,000.” Jarvis said over the intercom system.

“How many stocks does she have Pepper?”

“Tony let’s just hope she doesn’t decide to cash it all at once.” Pepper said with a shake of her head.

“Or retire….” Tony said with a sigh as he started looking up original stock holders.

“I doubt she’d retire. She likes her job too much.” Pepper told her husband.

“How did Evanora Harkness have so much money back then? Dad started this company during the war.” Tony pondered to himself.

“Let’s not get into the ethics of Evanora Harkness right now… let’s just say with everything that’s here she’s about to be in the same tax bracket as us.” Pepper told her husband.

“Are you actually worried she’s going to leave?” Tony asked his wife.

“No… maybe… this is a lot of money.” Pepper said to her husband.

“Well we will see. I doubt she’ll book it. Especially seeing as we are helping Rio out.” Tony explained.

“Or she could quit and just have a happy simple life working at the bookstore with her wife.” Pepper said in a worried tone.

“Stop stressing. We will cross that bridge when we get to it. I have no regrets about helping her or Rio out. I doubt Agatha will leave. She loves you too much to just bail.” Tony reassured his wife.

“You’re right.” Pepper said with a sigh as she continued to read over the paperwork.

“Did Evanora at least have a decent lawyer set everything up?” Tony asked.

“Yeah…. One of the best family and estate lawyers you can get. She didn’t use our firm in her case because she knew she was black listed by us.”

“It was your mother wasn’t it?” Tony asked in disbelief.

“Yeah, impressive really. I should call her and commend her on her work making sure Agatha would get every single penny.”

“Maybe you should. How about this. You call your mom, and I’ll be annoying somewhere else. Maybe have a moment of existential dread in the bathroom.”

“Don’t be a drama queen Tony.” Pepper said with a chuckle.

“It’s only a thousand stocks Tony.” Pepper reassured her husband who sputtered on the other end of the line.

“Insanity. Absolute insanity! I’m just glad it’s in Agatha’s hands now.” Tony said trying to calm himself down.

“It’s okay. If she decides to dump them. We will figure it out. I love you. I’m going to call my mom now.” Pepper told her husband before she continued. “I love you.”

“I love you too.” Tony told his wife before she hung up. Pepper then picked her cellphone up and called her mother on it.

“Pepper! What do I owe the pleasure on a Tuesday morning?” Peppers mother asked into the phone.

“Hi Mom. This is going to be a weird one but I have a question. Do you remember an Evanora Harkness coming into your office 35 years ago and getting an estate set up for her daughter?” Pepper asked into the phone.

“Yeah, that woman was loaded. She wanted to make sure her daughter could follow in her footsteps after she passed as America’s greatest illusionist witch.” Her mother explained into the phone.

“Do you have any idea why she would’ve never changed it?” Pepper asked.

“Oh, that’s simple. She signed a document saying she wouldn’t edit or alter the document until her daughter was 50. That way if something bad happened to her before she reached full witch maturity she would be taken care of.” Her mother explained.

“Where is it? I can’t find it anywhere.” Pepper asked her mother.

“Oh no, did the young woman’s mother pass?”

“Oh… wait… sorry, I forgot I haven’t talked to you in a few weeks. Evanora Harkness… wasn’t a good person or mother. Honestly the reason I called you was to talk to you about this because I was so confused as to how this stayed this way.”

“Care to elaborate for your mother?”

“Long story short, Evanora Harkness turned into a horrible parent the second she found out Agatha wasn’t going to be Americas next great Illusionist witch. Agatha was born powerless.” Pepper explained to her mother.

“Oh… Wait.. is this the same Agatha that is a partner in your firm?”

“Yep.” Pepper told her mother, waiting for the dots to connect. She rarely talked to her mother about work. But when she did Agatha was usually brought up, but never her last name.

“But she’s a spirit witch isn’t she? Oh. Oh! I remember! Oh god, she’s the one that’s been harassing her daughter hasn’t she? She really fucked herself didn’t she?” Peppers mother asked.

“In more ways than even I can count I’m sure. But we’ve come to a few realizations when it comes to Agatha and being a spirit witch.” Pepper explained.

“Cliffnotes?” Her mother asked.

“I’ll send you the notes from the court reporter, and you can read everything.” Pepper said as she started typing on her laptop.

“I’ll do that once we get off the phone. Did you need any other questions answered?”

“No, the why has been answered at least. I’m sorry I don’t call you more. I’ve been very busy lately.” Pepper told her mother.

“That’s okay, between running a law firm and keeping Tony in line I’m surprised you have time to sleep. I love you. I’ll text you after I read the documents.”

“Love you too mom. Try to have a good day.” Pepper said into her phone before hanging up. “I doubt she will after she reads that though.” Pepper mumbled to herself before she sent a text off to Tony.

Pepper 11:16 a.m: she had it set so that she couldn’t change it until Agatha turned 50. Just in case something bad happened, that way Agatha was guaranteed to be taken care of.

Tony 11:17 a.m: Oh the irony!

Pepper rolled her eyes at her husband before she set her phone down and closed her laptop. She needed a moment to not think about everything. She leaned back in her chair and closed her eyes for a moment. She was absolutely baffled by the way everything was happening lately.

Ten minutes later there was a knock on her door. “Come in.” Pepper said loud enough for the person to hear.

“You wanted to see me?” Agatha asked as she walked into the office.

“Yes, I did. I received all of your mother’s documentation this morning along with her final will and testament…”

“I’m sure she left everything to her coven.” Agatha said as she walked over to the chair in front of Peppers desk.

“Actually… No. She left everything to you. She had her will set up so that you would receive everything, financial assets, the home, all worldly possessions go to you. And before you ask, I contacted the lawyer who set this up and your mother had it sealed until you were 50 so she couldn’t edit the document until that point.” Pepper explained to Agatha.

“I don’t believe you.” Agatha said in a shocked and disbelieving tone. Pepper sighed and opened the document on her computer and turned the laptop toward Agatha before she got up and walked to the door.

“Read it, I’m going to have Timothy order lunch for us.” Pepper said as she stepped out of the office. Agatha grabbed the laptop and started reading the document, her whole world felt like it was spinning. Each asset that was listed just kept getting grander and grander as time went on. She felt a strange sinking feeling at the realization, she never had to worry about money again.

A soft hand on her shoulder pulled her from her downward spiral. She looked up to see Pepper smiling at her. “Welcome to the rich kid club.”

“I feel like this is some kind of sick joke.” Agatha said as she looked over the document.

“Funny, I thought the same thing until I called my mother and asked her about it.” Pepper said as she squeezed Agatha’s shoulder and then sat down in the seat next to Agatha.

“Your mother wrote this?” Agatha asked knowing the woman had a reputation for iron clad family documentation.

“The one and only. It’s real. Evanora Harkness really did fuck herself six ways to Tuesday with you… now for the hard part. You have to take bereavement. You have to go get this all sorted out.”

“No I don’t. Not right now. I can handle all of this at a later date.” Agatha said honestly.

“Agatha…” Pepper warned the woman softly.

“I’d rather burn that house down than step foot in it ever again.” Agatha told Pepper.

“You can hire a company to clean it out if you want but I recommend just doing it yourself. Go in, take what you want or need. Cancel the insurance on it. Call the local fire department and offer it up for training and tell them you want it burned to the ground.” Pepper suggested.

“Now that’s the best idea you have ever had.” Agatha complemented a bright smile spreading across her face imagining the place up in flames.

“Hiring you was the best idea I ever had. But I’ll take the compliment. Now miss millionaire… what will you do with your new found financial freedom?” Pepper asked.

“I’m not quitting, I like it here. I like my job. But I think I will be moving now that I can afford anything I want.” Agatha said with a smile, she was already making plans with this new found wealth.

“Moving?” Pepper questioned.

“Yeah, I think it’s time for a bigger house, closer to work and the book store. So Rio and I don’t have to commute as far. Fuck it! Maybe I’ll build one.” Agatha said with a smile setting her priorities on building a future with Rio.

“That… was not what I was expecting your reaction to be.” Pepper said honestly as Timothy walked into her office carrying two take out containers.

“Here you ladies go, I’ll fetch you something to drink as well. What would you like?” Timothy offered.

“No need, I’ve got that handled.” Agatha said as she waved her hand and two drinks appeared on Pepper’s desk. Timothy smiled and then walked out of the room.

“I know you’ve been stressed this week. If you want Tony and I can handle things?” Pepper offered.

“Honestly, I’m fine. I can get this sorted out, I appreciate it. I’ll talk to Tricia after lunch.” Agatha told her.

“Take as much time as you need. Most of the money has started moving into your accounts though. Just as a warning, the coroner submitted her death certificate this morning. Off shores accounts might be a little more difficult, you’ll have to talk to her financial advisor. Which is in the email I was about to send you before you walked in.” Pepper explained.

“Good to know. Thank you.” Agatha said appreciatively to Pepper before she opened her container Timothy had handed her and picked up the chicken wrap to take a bite of it.

“Are you sure you’re good?” Pepper asked nervously.

“What are you worried about?” Agatha asked as she set her wrap down.

“Honestly a lot has happened this week. I’m afraid you are going to have a mental break. Which is why I’m encouraging you to take your bereavement. Just as a little break. You also have so much accumulated time off… I’d rather you take a break than actually break.” Pepper told Agatha in a worried tone.

“Pepper, listen. I promise you. I’m fine. You, Rio, Wanda, and our literal goddess Gaia are here for me. Among several others. I am actually genuinely happy for the first time in my life. Let me get everything sorted out and make sure I have a clear week with no cases, hearings, meetings. Then I’ll take my bereavement. I promise.” Agatha reassured.

“Fine, eat your lunch. But if I notice you with even a hair out of place. I’m throwing you at Rio and deactivating your badge for a week.” Pepper threatened.

“You would never!” Agatha said in a sarcastic shocked tone. Pepper rolled her eyes at the woman and sighed.

“Don’t tempt me. I’ll do it at the end of the day Harkness.” Pepper scolded.

“I’ll behave. I promise. I’m fine. Now let me eat my lunch.” Agatha said before she picked her wrap back up and started eating.

“You know sometimes you confuse the living hell out of me.” Pepper said as she opened her own container and started eating.

“How so?” Agatha said with half a mouthful of food, covering her mouth with her hand.

“How are you so composed all the time? Like most people who find out they are coming into this kind of money would be like ‘I’m quitting my job and buying an island.’ Or some other crazy outlandish shit! You are just over here like ‘yeah, I’m gunna buy a house and keep working my job.’ It’s almost too sensible.” Pepper explained before she took a bite of her own food.

“Yes… but most people only get 80 years on this planet. I can literally work this job for another 50 years and then happily ‘retire’ and live a happy life with my wife. I get a thousand or more. No point in rushing out and blowing it all in one sitting. Gotta think about the long term.” Agatha explained, to her it was as simple as talking about the weather.

“You suck, I always forget you think too far ahead.” Pepper told her.

“I’ve spent my whole life walking on egg shells. I learned to plan my moves before I made them. She may have been a horrible mother but I definitely learned a lot from her.” Agatha said before she popped the last bite of her food into her mouth and chewed slowly.

“I’m so glad you work for me. I’d hate to ever have to be against you in anything.” Pepper said honestly before she smiled at Agatha. “Go communicate with Tricia and take time off. Bosses orders.”

“Fine! I’ll go do that. Oh by the way, do you want Rio to cancel the contract with you and Tony? I’m sure I could finance her ambitions now.” Agatha asked.

“No! Sorry, no. I’d rather you not. Think of it as an engagement gift.”

“But.”

“No Agatha, no buts. Accept the gift. Please.” Pepper requested.

“Fine! Only because I’m too tired from everything to argue with you right now.” Agatha said with a sigh as she got up and headed toward the door. “Thanks for always taking care of me Pepper.” Agatha said softly before she darted out the door, not giving Pepper the chance to say another word.

Agatha made her way down to her office and stood next to Tricia’s desk for a moment. The blonde looked up at her with a raised brow.

“How may I assist you Ms. Harkness?” Tricia asked.

“How many meetings do I have next week?” Agatha asked as she peered toward the cubicles dotting the large space.

“A few. Nothing that can’t be rescheduled though. You have no hearings at all next week though, seems kind of slow. Why?”

“Reschedule those meetings for this week if you can. I’m being forced to take bereavement, seeing as I won’t be here, how about you take next week off as well. Spend time with your kids and husband.” Agatha offered.

“I’ll consider it.” Tricia said with a smile as she reached for her phone. “Let me start working on rescheduling your meetings. You have one in an hour also.”

“Thank you, I appreciate it.” Agatha said before she turned around and headed into her office. She sat down and pulled open her laptop. She opened the email from Pepper and decided to call the financial advisor her mother was using. She found the number and grabbed her phone to call it.

“Thank you for calling Wicca and Co Finance. How may I assist you today?” A woman said politely into the phone.

“Hello my name is Agatha Harkness and I am calling to settle Evanora Harkness’s estate and finances.” Agatha said into the phone.

“One moment.” The woman said before the phone transferred to another person.

“Hello Ms. Harkness. Your lawyer sent over the death certificates. We are already working on getting everything transferred over to you. Is there something you would like expedited?” The man asked into the phone.

“No, I just wanted to touch base with you about the home.”

“It’s yours free and clear. She put it in a trust. If you have keys just go right on in. You can sell it, if you’d like.” The man offered.

“I’m intending to do something very special with it. Thank you. I’m sure Pepper Potts left you all my contact information.” Agatha assumed.

“She did.” The man answered her.

“Perfect. Alright. I’ll be in contact with you later this week. Thank you for your time.” Agatha said into the phone.

“Have a wonderful day Ms. Harkness.” The man told her before hanging up. Agatha sighed loudly before she set the phone down on the receiver.

“I need my own financial advisor. Maybe I should just use the one Pepper and Tony use.” Agatha mused to herself.

‘Good afternoon my love.’ Rio said popping into her mind.

‘Good afternoon. Has Lilia left yet?’ Agatha asked softly.

‘She just did. I was wondering how you were doing?’

‘Fantastic. We have a ton to talk about tonight, do you want me to meet you after work?’ Agatha asked.

‘Sure, I set up two job postings already and Lilia told me who would be the best fit for the store.’ Rio explained before she quickly changed the subject ‘I’ve got a customer. Sorry.’

‘Take your time my love.’ Agatha reassured before she went back to work.

“Maybe I’ll look at houses… or property.” Agatha said to herself as she opened up Zillow.

Chapter 27

A few hours later Agatha had finished her meetings and found a couple places she liked that she wanted to check out next week while she was off and some land as a back up plan. But she wanted to talk to Rio first. So she tabbed the locations before packing up her brief case and heading out the door.

“Have a good night Tricia.” Agatha said to her secretary before heading toward the elevator.

“You as well Agatha.” Tricia replied back before Agatha had made it too far.

Agatha made her way down to the main lobby and exited the building. She still had Evanora’s keys in her possession so she decided to try and find her car in the parking lot. She held the keys up and hit the panic button. A dark blue car started alarming in the far corner of the parking lot. She sighed loudly to herself before walking over to the car to look at it.

“I’ll admit she did have nice taste. I am going to hate transferring this over to myself though. Oh well. I’ll have Rio help me get it home later.” Agatha said as she pulled out her phone and took a photo of the car and it’s license plate.

Agatha 5:10 p.m: attachment image. Please don’t have this one towed. It’s Evanora’s, I have to get it to my place somehow.

Pepper 5:11 p.m: I’ll forward it to security and let them know. Thank you.

Agatha stuck her phone back in her pocket and headed over to her own car. She got in and decided to head toward the bookstore. She wanted to talk to Rio about a few things after she finished working.

The drive to the bookstore was fairly short, Agatha pulled around back and parked next to Rio’s car. The idea struck her that she could easily trade in Evanora’s car for something different so her and Rio would always have two vehicles at their place’s and they could go back and forth without using a portal all the time. She mentally added it to the list of things she wanted to talk to Rio about. She got out of her car and made her way into the store through the back door.

She was quiet enough that she was able to sneak up behind Rio and wrap her arms around her lover. “Got you.” Agatha whispered softly as she pulled Rio close.

“Maybe I just let you think you were being sneaky.” Rio teased as she leaned her head back against Agatha’s shoulder.

“Probably, but a girl can dream.” Agatha teased.

“My wards told on you.” Rio said as she shook her head.

“Of course they did. How has your day been?” Agatha asked as she let Rio go so the woman could turn around and give her a proper greeting. Rio placed a soft kiss on Agatha’s lips before she stepped away.

“The store was actually quite busy. Seems every parent in the area wants to check out the place their kid’s school is getting their books from.” Rio said with a smile.

“That’s a very good thing my love. Do you need me to restock shelves for half an hour?” Agatha asked looking around the store.

“It would be a great help honestly.” Rio said as the front door opened again pulling her focus from Agatha to her job. “Welcome to Vidal Books!”

“Thank you, what a lovely store!” A random woman said as she walked deeper into the building. Rio looked at Agatha longingly before heading toward the front of the store. Agatha smiled softly before she crouched down and opened a box near by. She started shelving books trying to be as helpful as possible.

Time seemed to fly by quickly because before even Agatha had realized it, it was 6 p.m. and Rio was locking up the store. She made her way over to Agatha with a bright smile on her face.

“So what did you want to talk about my love?” Rio asked as she wrapped her arms around Agatha’s neck.

“Well… this might be a hard pill to swallow, but I just became a millionaire? billionaire? I’m unsure at this moment in time... My mother, set up a final will and testament that she couldn’t edit until I was 50 years of age shortly after my first birthday. I have inherited everything. I just don’t know what everything is yet.”

“How financially well off was your mother?” Rio asked.

“Let’s just say… I’m in the same tax bracket as Tony Stark now according to Pepper.” Agatha said with a smile.

“So what will you do with your new found wealth?” Rio asked as she pulled Agatha closer.

“I’m thinking about moving. I want to be closer to the book store and work. That way it’s easier on the both of us.” Agatha explained before she leaned forward and kissed Rio.

“Who said I was moving in with you?” Rio teased, speaking softly against Agatha’s lips.

“You don’t have to if you don’t want to… but I found a few places that might just be exactly what you want. Or alternatively we can build something, anything you could want I can make happen.” Agatha offered.

“Where ever you are is exactly where I want to be.” Rio said with a smile, before her face fell. “What will Wanda do without you living next door?”

“I’m sure we will figure out all of that eventually. But there are other things I need to talk to you about.” Agatha told Rio.

“What would that be?”

“Pepper is forcing me to take next week off so I can deal with my childhood home. I really just want to burn it to the ground but I should probably head over there and see if there’s any documentation I need to collect. Will you go with me?” Agatha asked in a nervous tone. She knew Rio would say yes, but she was more worried about having to go at all.

“Of course. We can bring Wanda as well if that will make you feel better.” Rio offered.

“I fear she will be busy testing her new harness out for the foreseeable future.” Agatha said honestly.

“How about we invite Lily, then Wanda has to come.” Rio suggested with a chuckle.

“Not a bad idea. If we see them any time soon I’ll ask.” Agatha told Rio.

“Now what else did you want to talk about?” Rio asked, Agatha pulled her closer and kissed the side of her neck softly.

“What are your plans for the evening?”

“Spending time with you. What did you have planned?”

“Go home, eat left over Chinese. Look at the houses I have tabbed on my laptop. Maybe have sex?” Agatha suggested.

“Let me lock up. I’ll go drop my car off at my place and meet you at yours through the portal door.” Rio offered.

“Sounds great.”

~Meanwhile at Wanda’s place~

Wanda had gotten home and was walking around the large house trying to decide what she was going to do with her evening when her phone started ringing.

“Hello?” Wanda said into the phone without looking at the contact.

“Hey, I’ll be there in twenty. I just finished picking a few things up from the store.” Lily said into the phone.

“Oh really? What did you get?” Wanda asked curiously.

“That’s for me to know and you to find out. Are we hanging out with Agatha and Rio tonight?” Lily asked.

“Not that I’m aware of. Agatha’s not even home yet. I think she went to the book store after work.” Wanda said as she plopped down on her couch.

“How are you feeling magically? I know last night you were pretty handsy in your sleep.” Lily teased.

“I still feel like I could run the Boston Marathon with no prep. It’s so strange, I didn’t realize how much magical energy I was using. I do wonder how long my hexes would’ve kept that bitch alive.” Wanda said to Lily.

“Ask Rio to ask Death?” Lily suggested.

“Not a bad idea. I have other things I’d like to be thinking about right now though.” Wanda husked into the phone.

“Oh? And what might that be?” Lily said in a playful tone, knowing exactly what Wanda wanted.

“Who gets to be the guinea pig first.” Wanda said excitedly.

“I’ll let you test your best friend’s magical abilities first.” Lily told Wanda, unsure if she wanted to be the crash test dummy.

“That’s fine. How close are you?” Wanda asked.

“Not as close as you want me to be. Sorry. I’ll be there soon though. I talked to my parents today.” Lily offered changing the subject to distract Wanda.

“How did that go?”

“Well mom’s super proud I got a job, dad’s on the fence about you though.” Lily said into the phone.

“Why? Because I’m a chaos witch?” Wanda joked.

“No, because he wanted a son in law to force into taking over the farm. He will live. Maybe we can give him grandsons eventually so he’ll shut up about it.” Lily joked.

“Oh, sorry to disappoint you Mr. Grey. Magical soulmates don’t come customized to their partners parents preferences.” Wanda joked. Lily laughed at her girlfriend’s antics before asking. “So you want kids?”

“I mean eventually. But my dad wants grandchildren in the next 5 years.” Lily said with a sigh.

“Is he not a witch?” Wanda asked.

“Unfortunately he’s not. Neither is my mother. I don’t know where my powers came from.” Lily explained.

“I think I can be okay with kids in the next five years. I’d like them to meet their grandparents.” Wanda told her.

“Thanks. But we can worry about that at a later date.”

“Agreed. I’m here.” Lily said as she pulled into the driveway. “I’ll be in, in a second.”

“I’ll meet you at the door.” Wanda said before she hung up. Wanda got up and headed for the front door. She opened it and leaned against the door frame while she waited for Lily who was carrying a large black plastic bag.

“Hey babe… that’s a big bag.” Wanda said eyeing the bag suspiciously.

“I got a few things. You can snoop in a little bit.” Lily said as she walked past Wanda into the house and toward her bedroom.

“A little bit? You think I have patience?” Wanda asked the blonde woman as she shut the door and followed her.

“Do me a favor and text Agatha before we start anything. See if she needs you tonight before we start messing around? I don’t want any interruptions.” Lily told Wanda who sighed and pulled her phone out of her back pocket.

Wanda 6:15 p.m: Do you need me tonight?

“She might be driving, and she never texts and drives.” Wanda said as she stuffed the phone in her back pocket.

“Well let’s get something to eat while we wait for her to get home. I have a feeling you are going to keep me up fairly late.” Lily said with a smile as she put the bag on the bed and headed toward the kitchen.

“By the way… do you happen to know how to cook?” Wanda asked curiously.

“Babe, I grew up on a farm. Growing my own food in the summer and processing it so we had food through the winter. I know how to cook.” Lily said in a mirth filled tone.

“You and Agatha really are going to get along great. Don’t steal my best friend from me.” Wanda said seriously.

“It seems like I should be competing with her for your attention more. Maybe I will steal her so I can get you all to myself more often.” Lily teased.

“I… look… I’m sorry. It’s just we were all we had for a long time. It was us three against the world for a long time. I don’t even like that I have to share her with Rio sometimes.” Wanda said honestly. She was being vulnerable and Lily realized it quickly.

“I’m kidding. You’ve got me now so she’s gunna have to learn how to share you with me. Just like you have to learn how to share her with Rio. I know she needs you right now, I’m not arguing with it. I promise you, it’s okay. If she needs you I know she takes top priority.” Lily reassured.

“Thank you for being so understanding Lily. I really appreciate it.” Wanda said as she pulled Lily into her arms. She leaned down a little and kissed her softly. Lily slid her hands around Wanda’s back and down to her ass to grab it. Her hand collided with the phone in Wanda’s back pocket. Right when it vibrated. She grabbed the phone out of Wanda’s pocket and leaned back to look at it.

Agatha 6:30 p.m: No, enjoy your night. See you two for breakfast.

“Perfect. I get you to my self. Take me to bed and fuck me.” Lily demanded as she let Wanda read the phone. They were teleported to the bedroom a moment later. “Still not used to that.” Lily said with her head spinning.

“Sorry, I forget potion witches can’t teleport, just fly.” Wanda apologized.

“It’s okay, I’m adjusting. I got a few options… one I feel like I’d enjoy and then two other options, lube, cleaner, and a vibrator.” Lily explained as she dumped the bag onto the bed.

“Holy shit babe.” Wanda said in a shocked tone.

“Don’t judge.” Lily said with a sigh.

Chapter 28

Wednesday morning came much sooner for the four women than any of them wanted. Agatha and Rio got up early and showered together before getting dressed. Rio was dressed in a loose fitting tank top that showed off her tattoos and sigils, and a pair of cargo pants. Agatha was in a black suit, a deep purple button up, and a soft gray tie. Once they were both dressed Agatha started making breakfast sleepily while Rio dragged herself out into the kitchen looking absolutely exhausted.

Ten minutes later Wanda and Lily walked into the house looking exhausted together. Agatha looked over at the two women and smiled softly as they made their way into the kitchen.

“Good morning you two.” Agatha said softly as she continued to cook breakfast.

“G’morning.” Wanda said as she sat down at the island and put her head in her arms on the counter.

“Do we all need something stronger than coffee today?” Rio asked looking at the three women in the room.

“Yes.” All three of them answered in unison. Rio chuckled softly but she also felt the exhaustion in her own bones. The last week or so had felt like a year. She magicked 4 glowing green vials onto the countertop.

“This is called Vidal Vitality. It’s an energy potion that was created by the first iteration of Death. She was human while doing her job unfortunately so she had to survive off this stuff until she died. It’s safe, and won’t hurt you. But it’s only for when we are this exhausted or worse.” Rio said as she grabbed a vial and popped the cork off before downing it. “But it’s very bitter!” Her disgusted face told the group of women everything they needed to know.

“I don’t care about bitter, give me that.” Wanda said desperately. Rio handed Lily and Wanda their vials before offering one to Agatha. Agatha grabbed a vial and downed it before making a disgusted face.

“Fair, but… maybe it doesn’t have to taste so bad.” Lily offered before she handed the vial back to Rio. Wanda handed her’s over as well. All four of them settled comfortably into their places in the kitchen while they waited for Agatha to finish cooking.

“No, why?” Wanda asked.

“I need to go back to that hell hole and collect whatever I need from it. Evanora Harkness left me everything because she set up her will and testament when I was 1 and couldn’t make any changes until I turned 50.” Agatha explained.

“Alice is a protection witch. She’s a police officer. She’s also Lorna Wu’s daughter.” Agatha explained as she started getting pancakes onto a plate. She pulled the bacon out of the oven and set it on the counter top before she finished working on the eggs while they talked.

“Good morning Agatha! You never call me this early. Everything okay?”

“Everything is fine. Would you and Alice like to come to dinner on Friday? Rio, her parents, Wanda, and her girlfriend Lily will be there.”

“And why would I want to socialize with that many people I’ve never met before?” Jen asked.

So when my mother was arrested for getting into Stark Law Firm; Death dropped by the facility that was holding her and decided to take her powers away from her completely.” Agatha explained then waited for a long moment.

“Okay…. So how did Evanora die?” Jen asked in a confused tone.

“Part of her plea deal was for Wanda to remove her hexes. By removing the hexes it removed the magical energy keeping her alive. So by the time she made it to the prison the little energy she had left keeping her alive ran out. So now I need my coven to go with me to the last place on earth I ever want to visit again.”

“I’m not one hundred percent sure. I’ll let you know after I talk to Rio and Rita tonight.”

“Sounds good. I’m there for Agatha no matter what.” Alice said into the phone.

“That’s fine whatever you think of I’ll try to answer between meetings. But I’m pulling into the parking lot so I’ll talk to you later.” Agatha explained as she parked her car.

“Have a good day!” Jen and Alice said in unison.

~Vidal Books~

Rio was frustrated but she needed to talk to her mother first. So she picked her phone up and called her mom. It rang once before Rita picked up the phone.

“Baby, why are you calling me on a Wednesday morning? Is everything okay?” Rita asked.

‘The more the merrier my love.’ Agatha answered back quickly.

“She is also invited to dinner at Agatha’s. I have no idea where we are going to put everyone but we will figure it out.” Rio said with a soft chuckle.

“Well, if dad comes also. I think nine in total. Unless I’m missing someone.” Rio explained.

“You, Dad, Lilia, Wanda, her girlfriend Lily, Agatha’s friends Jennifer and Alice, and us. Jenifer and Alice are a couple and part of Agatha’s coven. We figured Agatha’s place was the safest place for everyone to meet.” Rio explained to her mother.
