‘I love how you taste.’ Rio’s voice resounded in Agatha’s mind before she started swirling her tongue over Agatha’s clit.

“Fuck Rio.” Agatha moaned out as she softly rolled her hips.

‘Only I get you like this. I’m the only one that will ever know what you taste like.’ Rio said possessively.

“Yes! Only you! I belong to you!” Agatha moaned out as Rio drank her in, curling her tongue over her clit.

‘MINE.’ Rio growled possessively in Agatha’s mind.

“Yes!” Agatha screamed as she came. Her body curling around Rio’s head as she gripped her hair. Rio continued to flick and curl her tongue over her clit with a satisfied moan. “Oh fuck! Rio!”

‘Again.’ Rio demanded, she wanted another orgasm.

“Rio! I’m getting sensitive.” Agatha groaned out as Rio started moving her tongue faster as her hand reached up to lay flatly against the sigil on her chest.

‘Too bad, give me what I want.’ Rio demanded. Agatha’s moans started to pitch up as she became more sensitive. One hand was removed from Rio’s hair as she reached up to grab a pillow to muffle herself. Her face turned to scream into the pillow as she came.

Rio pulled her mouth away and smiled softly as she kissed Agatha’s thigh. “I love you.” Rio said with admiration, before a cold wave of panic rushed over her.

Agatha’s hand shot down to stop Rio from running, wrapping around her hand that was clinging to her thigh. “Come here.” Agatha requested softly.

“No, I’ve embarrassed myself already.” Rio said with downcast eyes. Agatha teleported her to eye level and grabbed her face softly.

“Rio Vidal, I love you. I thought that was obvious but apparently I need to be more clear. I love you. This heart beating in my chest beats only for you. My magic chose you and I could never be more thankful for every blessing that has come into my life because of you.” Agatha said as she held Rio’s face. Then she leaned down and kissed her lips softly. Tears welling up in Rio’s eyes as she pulled Agatha close.

“Not the reaction I was expecting.” Rio said in a watery tone.

“What were you expecting My Love?” Agatha asked while emphasizing the ‘my love’ part of the sentence.

“I don’t know… I kinda forgot about us being magically bound and just realized I said that way too soon.” Rio answered Agatha.

“The rules don’t apply to us, none of this was meant to go this fast but it did and here we are. I love you Rio, I think my soul and magic have always loved you, my brain just took forever to catch up.” Agatha said with a soft kiss.

“I love you Agatha Harkness.” Rio said with a sigh of relief as she settled against the woman.

Chapter End Notes

Not sure when the next update will be. I’m honestly surprised I got this done as fast as I did with how busy I’ve been.

Thank you everyone for reading and loving it so far!

Chapter 30

Chapter Notes

I’m sorry for the delay! I’ve been busy as fuck. I watched my 1 year old niece Monday and Tuesday. Then we did family Christmas with my wife’s sister, her husband and said niece last night! This chapter is mostly filler. Thanks for reading!

Thursday morning came and went with out much event, the women got ready for work, Agatha made breakfast. Lily and Wanda showed up right on time.

“Good morning ladies. How did your night go?” Rio asked the two women as they walked in the door looking absolutely exhausted.

“Got any more Vidal Vitality?” Wanda asked in an exhausted tone. With a wave of her hand there were 2 vials on the countertop in front of Wanda and Lily.

“I love your girlfriend.” Wanda said excitedly as she popped open the vial then downed the liquid. Lily was silently doing the same but with a grimace.

“Fiancé.” Agatha corrected without thinking.

“Excuse me?” Wanda asked her best friend in a confused tone.

“I… uh… Rings?” Agatha started to backtrack.

“Oh… yeah.” Wanda said softly coming to a realization.

“So did you call Pietro?” Rio asked Wanda in an attempt to change the subject.

“No…” Wanda answered begrudgingly.

“Coward.” Agatha grumbled out at her best friend who was looking at her sheepishly.

“I wanted to have sex with my girlfriend. I’m so sorry.” Wanda jabbed.

“You could call him tomorrow… after dinner. He can come eat the left overs. Also, I’m going grocery shopping after work tonight. Any requests babe?” Agatha told Wanda before she turned her question to Rio.

“No?” Rio asked in a confused tone.

“That’s fine. I’ll just text your mother and see what staples I should keep in the house for you.” Agatha said with a wink as she got breakfast on the table.

“Why don’t I go with you?” Rio asked, she really just wanted to spend as much time with Agatha as she could.

“Because the bookstore is open until 6 and I’d like to be home by the time you get here, but if you want to go with me that’s fine.” Agatha said to Rio as she started eating her breakfast, Rio decided to start eating as well.

“Awe man, that means it’s fend for yourself night.” Wanda said sadly as she poked at her pancakes, as Lily dove into hers.

“Or you could meet me at my place after work and I can cook you dinner.” Lily offered which seemed to peak Wanda’s interest.

“I like that idea way more.” Wanda said excitedly to her girlfriend.

“I’m so glad the universe sent you someone who can cook. I can worry less about my future nieces and nephews.” Agatha joked.

“Nephews if my future father in law has anything to say about it.” Wanda joked.

“I mean I know a lady, I’m sure I could ask for some confirmation.” Agatha teased, knowing Wanda was curious as hell.

“Technically you know two. But I’m pretty sure you were talking about Gaia.” Rio pointed out before shoving another bite into her mouth.

“Oh yes, Lilia is quite skilled. I was talking about Gaia though.” Agatha clarified as she took a sip of her coffee.

“If you are gunna ask Gaia, might as well guarantee it’s a boy first for us. That way we don’t have to listen to my father lament about no grandsons.” Lily joked as she took a bite of bacon.

“I know you are joking, but I would actually ask her if you are serious.” Agatha told them sincerely.

“I’m not too worried about kids right now. Let’s just enjoy us.” Wanda said to Lily as she took her hand.

“Awwwww, lame.” Agatha teased her best friend.

“Fuck you Harkness.”

“Love you!” Agatha said in a sing song tone before she finished the last of her food and got up to clean the kitchen a little.

“Alright, we’ve all got big days ahead of us. Finish eating and let’s get to work.” Lily said as she went back to eating.

Fifteen minutes later they were all rushing out the door to their cars except Rio who took the portal door home to her apartment. She looked around the apartment at all her plants, their lush green hues painting bringing life to the place.

“Maybe I should start bringing you guys over to Agatha’s so you don’t feel so neglected… or to the book store.” Rio mused to herself before she grabbed her keys and headed to work.

~Stark Law Firm~

Agatha walked into her office ten minutes early and was greeted with Tricia standing up and meeting her half way. “Mrs. Potts is in your office.” Tricia said calmly as she walked back over to her desk with Agatha in stride.

“Thank you. How many meetings do we have on the docket today?” Agatha asked.

“Four.” Tricia answered.

“Perfect thank you.” Agatha said as she opened the door to her office and cast a few sound dampening spells as she did so. Pepper was leaning against her desk with her arms crossed.

“Yes?” Agatha asked as she walked around her desk and made her way over to the other side so she could sit in her office chair.

“You’ve managed to almost give my husband a heart attack.” Pepper told Agatha.

“I’m sorry? What did I do?” Agatha asked in a confused tone.

“Became a major stock holder in Stark Industry’s overnight, along with several sister companies, you should get a mirror because if you look in it… You will see one of the richest women in the world.” Pepper told her.

“How?” Agatha asked.

“Well on top of Evanora Harkness having money stashed everywhere… she also had a plethora of life insurance on herself because most of these company’s never thought they’d have to pay out due to her witch life span. She had several million dollar policies on herself with you as the sole inheritor. As your lawyer, I’ve already taken the liberty of sending death certificates in Stark Law Firm embossed sealed envelopes.

“Am I richer than your husband?” Agatha joked.

“Close. You two are about even now. But I know you’ll invest it well.” Pepper told Agatha.

“That’s not even ‘fuck you’ money anymore, that’s… ‘stupid insane’ money. And I know exactly what I’m going to do with some of it. Build a house.” Agatha said with a soft smile.

“Only you would have the smallest of ambitions with that kind of money.” Pepper teased.

“I mean I could give Tricia a bonus, build Lily and Wanda a house, help kids in need. Whatever I want. Besides quit my job. You are stuck with me. Forever.” Agatha reassured.

“Good, I was slightly worried about losing you still. So care to tell me what’s going on tomorrow?” Pepper asked.

“Jen and Alice need to meet Lily, Rita and Lilia want to come with us on Sunday. That’s a lot of people to cook for so I’m taking a half day tomorrow so I can cook. Plus I thought you’d be thrilled that I’m taking my bereavement early?” Agatha teased.

“I was worried something bad might be happening is all. So… you and Rio are good?” Pepper asked looking over Agatha, who looked a little tired but no worse for wear.

“Fantastic. Best thing that’s ever happened to me.” Agatha said with a bright smile.

“So those slight bags under your eyes are from…” Pepper trailed off.

“A healthy sex life. My apologies. I don’t like using glamor before 9 a.m. but let me fix that real quick.” Agatha told Pepper before her glamor snapped into place. “Now… do you have anything to do today besides harass me about my under eye bags?”

“Nothing nearly as fun.” Pepper teased as she headed for the door. She paused as she held the handle. “Iron man and his gaggle of friends are one call away if you need them Sunday. Keep that in mind.”

“I will. Thank you Pepper.” Agatha said appreciatively.

~Meanwhile at Lilia’s~

The elder witch woke up and did her morning ritual of checking for spreadable disease’s coming through US ports and on planes. She wrote down every detail the CDC would need and sent it off to her corresponder. She then got up from her crystal ball to make herself some tea. Her phone rang halfway through the process.

“Good Morning Rita.” Lilia said casually into the phone.

“Morning Lilia…” Rita said into the phone in a confused tone.

“I have a plan today, don’t throw a monkey wrench in it.” Lilia scolded her best friend.

“What’s your plan? Because I’m worried about Evanora Harkness’s coven freaking the fuck out on Sunday.” Rita told her friend.

“Oh ye of little faith. I plan on making exactly 6 phone calls today. If you think a single one of those women won’t listen to me you are dead wrong. But this is all precautionary, the odds of them showing their faces is slim, but I want it in the zero percentile. Now, why are you worried? I have everything under control.” Lilia said reassuringly into the phone as she poured herself some tea.

“She’s been through enough…” Rita lamented.

“And now she’s got an entire coven standing behind her. Don’t stress so much dear. She’s the safest woman on the planet right now. So if you don’t mind I have phone calls to make and the fear of Gaia to place in these women’s hearts.” Lilia said with a smile into the phone.

“Fine, be at the Cabin by 7 tomorrow night. Love you Lilia.” Rita said into the phone with a sigh.

“Love you too, see you tomorrow.” Rita said before hanging up the phone. Lilia sighed loudly into her kitchen as she took a sip of her tea. She opened her notebook and dialed the first phone number. It rang several times before it went to voicemail.

“Hello, My name is Lilia Calderu, I’m calling as a kindness more than anything really. This Sunday Agatha Harkness will be visiting her mother’s home to collect some thing’s. If you have any sense about you, you’d better leave her and her coven alone while they are there. Thank you for your time.” Lilia said into the phone.

The next four phone calls went the same, straight to voicemail, on the last one someone decided to pick up.

“Why are you threatening our coven?” A woman asked in an irritated tone.

“Threats? Is that what you think this is? The greatest divination which in the world calls you up in secession on a Thursday morning and you don’t have the sense to look at it for the blessing it is?” Lilia asked into the phone.

“You must be joking right? I doubt it’s actually THE Lilia Calderu calling us.” The woman spat into the phone.

“I have verified caller ID you dumb bitch.” Lilia said flatly into the phone. “Now listen, and listen closely. If you, or any of your coven show up, it won’t end well for you.”

“Why should we listen to you? That woman is evil. She’s gotten away with too much.”

“Your coven has gotten away with too much. Just because it happened twenty years ago doesn’t mean it wasn’t an attempted murder. I’ve seen your faces, I know your names. If you thought I was threatening you before you were wrong. Now I’m threatening you, if any of you step out of line and cause anymore harm to Agatha Harkness, you won’t just be dealing with me, you’ll be dealing with half the avengers, her entire coven, and a police force.” Lilia threatened before continuing indignantly, digging the barbs of insult to add to the injury. “You couldn’t even handle 3 teenagers 20 years ago, what makes you think you can handle all that?”

The line was quiet for a long moment before she spoke up. “You can’t be fucking serious.” Her tone angry and bitter.

“Oh but I am. Now be a good witch and listen to the wisest woman who will ever speak to you.” Lilia snarked.

“I’ll consider it.” The woman said before Lilia hung up the phone.

“Sunday is going to be fun.” Lilia said flatly. There’s one of two ways this can go, and she hopes the ‘smoothly and without event’ part is the way this turns out. The odds were in her favor now, she knew she had done everything she could to have the best outcome.

~Vidal Books~

Rio was in the book store milling about getting things done that she had neglected over the past week or so when Agatha’s voice chimed in. It was around 5:30.

‘How would you feel about me buying some land and building a house? I’m much richer than I thought I’d ever be and I want us to have the perfect home.’ Agatha said softly.

‘I’d love nothing more. But again for now I’m thinking about just moving my plants into the book store.’

‘Or my place…’ Agatha offered meekly.

‘You already used your magic to teleport them there didn’t you?’

‘What? Noooo I would never!’ Agatha said in mock innocence that sounded very much like a confirmation. ‘Green Witchery is much easier now… I do see what you mean about the peace lily…’

‘Very upset she’s been moved?’ Rio asked with an audible chuckle.

‘Egregiously so, how do you handle this around you all the time?’ Agatha asked in a confused tone the sound of the peace lily’s whines coming through Agatha’s thoughts.

‘She’ll calm down. Put her next to the big window in the living room, let her get some sun and I’ll move her tonight. I assume you are home already?’ Rio asked.

‘Yes. I left after my last meeting. Been home moving the plants for a couple hours, I teleported them here but I’ve been finding places for them on my own. I was going to talk to you about everything else when you got home… I hope I didn’t overstep?’ Agatha asked slightly afraid she may have upset Rio.

‘Never. I appreciate it. I have nothing to hide from you Agatha. I’ll be home soon. Then we will talk about canceling my lease and me moving in.’ Rio told Agatha, before the bell rang at the front of the store. ‘I’ve got a customer. See you in 30 ish minutes.’

“Welcome to Vidal Books!” Rio yelled loudly from the back of the store. She started walking toward the front of the store when she seen someone walking around looking lost. It was a young woman standing at the counter holding a piece of paper.

“Hello, how can I help you today?”

“Are you Rio Vidal? I wanted to put my application in to work here.” The woman said softly. She was a witch and looked to be about 20, young and green.

“Why didn’t you fill out an application online?” Rio asked as she walked over to the woman.

“I find that it’s nicer to check the place out, speak to someone personally, show initiative.” The woman told Rio.

“Ah, I see. Is that your resume?” Rio asked the young girl as she pointed at the paper in her hand.

“Yes.” She said as she offered Rio the thick card-stock with a bright smile.

“I don’t have any paper applications but I will look over your resume and give you a call tomorrow if I feel like you are a good fit.” Rio offered.

“Thank you.” The young woman said as she turned to walk away. Rio looked down at the resume and read the name Sage Deveron.

Rio desperately wanted to stop the young woman but she told her she’d call her tomorrow. Which would give her plenty of time to have a real interview with the woman after reviewing her resume. Rio sighed and pulled her phone out to look at the time 5:45 p.m. she could handle waiting 15 more minutes. She just had to be patient.

‘How much magical energy did you use moving my plants?’ Rio asked Agatha as she went back to putting books on the shelves.

‘Not much. Most of them came willingly. The peace lily on the other hand… she put up a fight.’ Agatha said with a chuckle.

‘Oh really?’ Rio asked in a knowing tone.

‘I’ve noticed it’s easier to summon your things than others. I think that has a lot to do with our magical connection. What’s mine is yours and yours is mine.’ Agatha explained.

‘I’ve noticed it’s easier summoning things in general. So I guess that has to do with your ease of doing so?’ Rio asked Agatha.

‘I find most things come naturally to me…’ Agatha answered Rio before she continued. ‘It’s 6 o’clock my love.’

‘I’ll be home in ten.’ Rio said as she locked the bookstore up and headed to her car. A short drive back to her apartment and then up the flight of stairs to the apartment. Rio walked into her apartment to find every single plant missing. She chuckled and shook her head at Agatha. She turned around and grabbed the door handle and activated the portal before walking through it.

“Honey I’m home!’ Rio joked as she stepped through the door.

“In the spare bedroom!” Agatha yelled back, Rio made her way toward the spare room and noticed her plants were dotted around the house. Every single one of them happy and content to be where they were except for the peace lily.

‘Shifted. Don’t like. Rude.’ Seemed to be said over and over in an annoying high pitched frequency. Rio sighed and walked over to the plant and placed her hand softly on the dirt it was growing in.

“Stop, you are fine. Do you want me to give you back to your original owner?” Rio softly threatened the plant.

‘No!’ The plant seemed to respond. A soft chuckle leaving Rio as she used her magic to fertilize the plant before getting up and heading toward the guest room.

“I talked to the destroyer of peace lily. I think she’ll chill the fuck out soon.” Rio reassured as she opened the door and found Agatha putting her plants on shelves in the room.

‘Thank the goddesses above. Why is that one the loudest out of all of them?”

“Because she used to belong to Lilia and was severely neglected. So now she knows we can hear her and she’s going to be obnoxious about it.” Rio told her as she walked over to Agatha and took the woman in her arms. Agatha smiled softly and gave Rio a soft kiss on the lips.

“Welcome home my love.” Agatha said as she melted into Rio’s arms.

“So, you want to build a house? What happened to the cute little one with the green house in the back?” Rio questioned.

“We can build one that will have an atrium for all your plants, places for them and our future children to grow, and it will be away from people. I found a 20 acre lot today and I just wanted to get the ‘let’s build a house’ approval from my favorite person.”

“I didn’t know Wanda was here? Where is she? I wanna know if I’m allowed to move in.” Rio teased Agatha who looked at her with an unamused expression.

“Really? If you don’t stop being sassy I will build two houses and she will still be our neighbor.” Agatha said flatly. Rio raised her hands in surrender.

“Let’s build a house.” Rio said with a smile.

“Thank you my love. I’ll put a bid on the property tomorrow. Then we can start talking to builders next week. Whatever you dream up. We can make happen.” Agatha said as she pressed her forehead to Rio’s.

“Perfect, are you ready to go grocery shopping? I had something I wanted to do with you after.” Rio said honestly.

“Not quite yet. I’m still trying to find homes for all your plants. Sorry I thought I’d be done by now.”

“Wait until we have to find homes for all my books.”

“There’s plenty of room in my office for those, and I’ve moved all my things to one side of the closet in the bedroom.”

“You’ve been efficient today!” Rio teased before she gave Agatha another kiss. “Don’t worry about the plants they will be fine until we get back. Come on, let’s go get what we need for tomorrow.” Rio said encouragingly.

“Fine. Only because I need a break from the peace lily.” Agatha said she let Rio go and rubbed her temples.

“Sorry, she will calm down to a soft hum here soon just like the rest of them.” Rio reassured her.

“I’m gunna go change out of my suit into something more comfortable. I’ll be with you soon, if you want to keep tending to your babies.”

“Why don’t you just magic something different on?” Rio asked, wondering why Agatha was doing things the normal and mundane way.

“The peace lily put up more of a fight than I thought. Just feeling a little drained. I’ll be right back.” Agatha reassured before she made her way through the door.

A few minutes later Agatha walked back into the guest room where Rio was taking care of her plants. Rio turned around and looked at Agatha. She was wearing a pair of yoga pants and a baggy off the shoulder sweater that showed her bra strap. Rio’s eyes darted across Agatha’s outfit.

“You are going to be the death of me. How does everything make you look so good?” Rio asked as hungry eyes looked over Agatha’s form.

“Nuh uh! Let’s go babe.” Agatha said as she turned around and headed out of the room. Rio’s eyes instantly fell to take in the perfect shape of Agatha’s ass in those yoga pants. A groan resounded from Rio as she followed Agatha out of the room and toward the front door.

Twenty minutes later they were at the grocery store and Agatha was putting everything she would need for tomorrow in the cart. Rio was three steps behind her at all times admiring the view.

“Rio Darling, what are you doing back there?” Agatha teased as she continued to fill the cart with items.

“Just admiring the view. Did you need something?” Rio asked as she watched Agatha’s hips sway. Agatha rolled her eyes as she continued to walk down the aisle.

‘What are you thinking about?’ Agatha wondered in her mind.

‘You don’t want to know.’ Rio answered honestly.

‘Horny witch.’ Agatha teased as she put a few more things in the cart.

“Alright that’s everything for tomorrow now we gotta do regular grocery shopping. Do you have anything you can’t live without?” Agatha asked as she started navigating down the aisle.

“You.” Rio said without thinking, causing Agatha to roll her eyes.

“Insufferable. I meant life sustaining food that nourish’s your body.” Agatha clarified in a way that gave Rio no wiggle room.

“I like real sugar sodas like Mexican sodas. And I was living off microwave meals and left overs from family dinner before I met you. Honestly anything you make I will eat.” Rio told Agatha which caused the woman to shake her head.

“Fine but if you think of anything or see anything you want put it in the cart.” Agatha said as she continued to walk down the aisles.

An hour later they finished shopping, paid and made it out to Agatha’s car. “So what else did you want to talk about?” Rio asked as she buckled into the passenger seat.

“My mothers car is still parked at the firm. I have to go get it, would you be willing to help me with that? Like if we stop there can you drive it home?” Agatha asked.

“Of course. We can do that now.”

“Thank you my love. Let’s go do that and then head home.” Agatha said with an appreciative smile as she turned the car toward the law firm.

Chapter 31

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Friday morning brought two meetings to Agatha’s attention where she was less than keen on even being present for. With a sigh she listened to her client ask for the best way to “legally” do something. She rubbed her temples and looked at the man. He wanted to embezzle funds, the stupidest of crimes in her opinion and the easiest to get caught at. She would never take this case.

“There is no best way to ‘legally’ do this. As your counsel I recommend not doing it at all.” Agatha told the man sitting across from her.

“But what if it needs done?” The man asked.

“Then I recommend you find a better lawyer than me.” Agatha said with an exasperated sigh.

“But you’re the best on the east coast…”

“Now you get the picture don’t ya? Look I don’t even touch embezzlement cases with a ten foot pole unless I’m helping the person who lost the money. Now. Unless you have a real problem I can fix, this meeting is over. I don’t recommend doing this, and I don’t recommend leaving a paper trail following in your wake before your actions of visiting multiple lawyers asking them these questions either. Have a good day.” Agatha said dismissing the floundering man. He flushed in embarrassment and quickly collected his things and stormed out of her office.

“Goddesses above how stupid can one person be?” Agatha asked herself after she rubbed the bridge of her nose. A soft knock on her door stirred her from her thoughts. She looked up to see Tricia standing there with an amused look. Agatha waved her into the room.

“Why did we even take that meeting?” Agatha asked.

“He didn’t disclose what the meeting was about. He just wanted legal counsel on something extremely important. What was it about?” Tricia asked Agatha.

“He wanted to embezzle funds as ‘legally’ as possible. Like embezzlement is something you play around with.” Agatha said as she rubbed her temples.

“He probably seen that you have several cases under your belt with wins and assumed you won for the people embezzling funds instead of the people who lost their money.” Tricia said honestly as she leaned against the door frame.

“I have something for you, come here. Shut the door behind you.” Agatha told Tricia who turned and shut the door before she walked over to Agatha.

“This is a gift. The most I can give you as a friend without you getting taxed on it. Now, I want you to do whatever it is you need to with it. Take your husband and kids on vacation, pay off some bills, keep it for yourself and don’t tell a soul. I don’t care. This is a thank you for being so amazing and such a great secretary.” Agatha said as she handed Tricia a cashiers check. The woman looked down at the check and her eyes widened.

“Agatha, no… this is too much!” Tricia said as she looked at the amount on the check.

“Tricia… I mean this in the nicest way I possibly can say. That is like me giving you a quarter for the vending machine. That’s how much money I’ve come into in the last week. Now, say thank you and go back to your desk. I have one more meeting before I leave for the day correct?” Agatha asked the woman.

“Correct, and Thank You. I appreciate it so much. More than you will ever know. I’d hug you if your office wasn’t a fishbowl.” Tricia said honestly.

“Sorry, plus you know how much they like to gossip.” Agatha said as she tilted her head in the direction of the main office.

“That as well. Thank you again. I appreciate it. Your next meeting will be here in 10 minutes.”

“Good, I want to be done so I can go home and cook for my coven and future in-laws.” Agatha said without thinking again.

“Oh so the great Agatha Harkness is serious about this woman?” Tricia joked.

“Very. One day when you no longer work for me. We will sit down and I’ll tell you everything.” Agatha promised.

“I don’t think I can wait that long. Maybe at your wedding instead?” Tricia asked.

“Maybe, now get back to work. No more slacking off for either of us.” Agatha told the woman.

“After next week.” Tricia reminded Agatha.

“After next week.” Agatha said remembering she had to take her bereavement. Tricia nodded curtly and headed back to her desk where Agatha watched her put the check into her wallet then tuck it into her purse purposefully and slide it under her desk.

~Meanwhile at Vidal Books~

Rio was reading over Sage’s resume when her phone rang. She answered it with out even looking.

“Hello?”

“Hello baby, just hire her. She’s the perfect fit.” Lilia said into the phone.

“I’d like to interview her first.” Rio told the woman as she continued to read over the resume.

“Must you be so difficult.” Lilia said with a scoff.

“Yes, as a matter of fact I must. Just to be a pain in your ass!” Rio said with a laugh.

“You are so stubborn!” Lilia scolded into the phone.

“Oh, I have a question? Can you do me a favor tonight?” Rio asked.

“Depends… are you going to listen to me?”

“I was about to call her in for an interview when you called me Lilia.” Rio told her.

“Interview, no interview she’s the perfect fit.” Lilia said into the phone and Rio could just imagine her waving her free hand passively.

“She’s young, she deserves to know what a real interview is like. Make her feel like she’s earned it, ya know?” Rio told Lilia.

“Fine I suppose that confidence boost will benefit her. Now what’s your request?” Lilia asked Rio.

“Tonight when you meet Wanda and Lily officially, I know you’ve technically met Wanda. Can you please look and see if they will ever have boys? They are magically bound together like Agatha and I. Their connection isn’t as strong but they are definitely made for each other.” Rio asked her aunt.

“Oh! I get to tell you about future nieces or nephews?” Lilia said excitedly into the phone.

“That depends on if Wanda wants to know.” Rio said honestly.

“She will. She’s a chaos witch. Alright, go call the girl and I’ll see you tonight.”

“Love you. See you tonight.” Rio told Lilia as she pulled her phone away.

“Love you too.” Lilia said before she hung up.

Rio pulled the resume out and dialed the number. It rang 3 times before Sage picked it up.

“Hello?” The woman said into the phone.

“Hello, this is Rio Vidal, would you be interested in coming in for an interview on Tuesday?” Rio asked the girl.

“Of course! What time would you like me to arrive?” Sage said into the phone.

“Would 2 p.m. work for you?” Rio asked.

“2 p.m. on Tuesday is perfect! Thank you so much for this opportunity!” The woman said cheerfully into the phone.

“See you then. Have a wonderful weekend.” Rio said into the phone.

“You as well, thank you again.” The woman said before disconnecting the phone. Rio opened her phone and sent a text to Agatha.

Rio 11:45 a.m: I have an Interview with Sage Deveron 2 p.m. Tuesday.

Agatha 11:46 a.m: Perfect I’m leaving work now. I love you.

‘Am I to assume you texted me so you wouldn’t forget?’ Agatha teased causing Rio to roll her eyes at Agatha.

‘Yes my love. I’ll see you tonight.’ Rio said softly before she went back to work.

Agatha’s drive home was uneventful and once she made it into the house changed her clothing, and took a moment to decompress. The peace lily had settled down like the rest of the plants into a subtle hum. It was soothing now to be surrounded by so many things that were inherently Rio.

She settled down and relaxed into the couch for a long moment before she felt the room shift. “Hello Momma.” Agatha said with her eyes still closed.

“Hello witchlett. I have a gift for you.” Gaia said as she sat down next to Agatha who still had her eyes closed.

“Really? What’s the occasion?” Agatha asked as she cracked one eye open to look at the goddess.

“Well it occurred to me that yes you can call me whenever you need. But I feel like it would be more reassuring for you to have something you could use to call me. But also something you could wear to remind you that you are loved.” Gaia explained as she set a dark purple box with a lavender ribbon on it. Agatha finally opened both eyes and sat up straighter. She pulled the ribbon and took the lid off the box. Inside the box on white satin sat a purple broach with three ivory white figures carved and inlayed into the amethyst.

“Maiden, Mother, Crone, the three goddesses of woman hood?” Agatha asked as she softly picked the broach up with delicate fingers.

“Yes.” Gaia said to Agatha as she watched the young woman observe and fiddle with it. The chain still sitting in the box. Agatha realized it was a locket as well very quickly.

“A locket?” Agatha asked in a very confused tone.

“Yes. It will have many uses as time goes on. But right now its use is just as a reassurance you are loved. Would you like a photo of Rio in it?” Gaia asked her daughter.

“If you wouldn’t mind?” Agatha asked unsure of how to feel about such a meaningful gift. A moment later there was a photo of Rio in the locket. “Thank you.” Agatha said with tear filled eyes as she looked up at Gaia.

“You are most welcome witchlett, now. It can be worn as a necklace, broach, or bracelet. Now once you put it on, you should be able to feel my presence. Tap it 3 times in quick secession if you need me. Even if it’s just for a hug.” Gaia explained as she magicked the necklace onto Agatha.

“Am I going to need this Sunday? Is that why you are giving it to me?” Agatha’s asked skeptically as she held the broach in her hand.

“No, that should go fairly smooth. But anything can happen. If you want I can guarantee they will leave you alone.” Gaia offered softly, Agatha looked up at the goddess with a pained look on her face that told her everything she needed to know. “Got it, divine intervention it is then.”

“Thank you. I really don’t want them trying to pull anything and I end up accidentally killing them.” Agatha said in a watery tone, like she was trying her best to not cry.

“Anyone stupid enough to attack a spirit witch a second time after surviving the first encounter deserves to meet Violet.” Gaia said honestly. “Now let’s cuddle for a little bit before you start cooking. I feel like you need some extra love today.” Gaia said as she pulled Agatha into her arms and placed a soft kiss on the crown of her head.

‘How’s it going babe?’ Rio asked softly in her mind as Gaia pulled her into her arms.

‘Momma Gaia is here, she gave me a gift. Now we are cuddling before I start cooking dinner.’ Agatha told Rio in her mind.

“That little mind link is very convenient isn’t it witchlett?” Gaia asked Agatha.

“Very, can you hear what we are thinking?” Agatha asked.

“No but I know you are using it. It’s like I can feel Rio’s presence. That’s all.” Gaia explained.

“Good to know.” Agatha said softly before Rio popped back into her mind.

‘What’s the gift? Something nice I hope.’ Rio asked.

‘It’s a brooch. I’ll show you when you get home.’ Agatha explained to her.

“What are you planning on making for dinner tonight?” Gaia asked Agatha.

“Two different lasagnas and some garlic bread along with strawberry chocolate tiramisu for dessert.” Agatha told her.

“That sounds delightful. Maybe after everyone leaves I’ll pop in and steal a slice of the tiramisu.”

“I’ll set one aside for you just in case Pietro shows up after. He will eat everything if I don’t.” Agatha said honestly.

“I wouldn’t fault him for it. But I appreciate it. Now. I have to go check on a few things. Give this 3 taps after everyone leaves, and I’ll pop back in. I love you Agatha, have a good night.” Gaia said as she squeezed the woman tightly before she kissed her softly on the head once more.

Agatha sighed softly before she pushed herself off the couch and headed into the kitchen. It was time to start cooking anyway and she needed everything to be perfect. She first started by getting a pot of water on the stove and bringing it to a boil with a heavy amount of salt so she could cook the noodles. Then she started making the red and white sauces for the lasagna’s.

Once the main components were cooked and set aside Agatha started assembling everything. She got both lasagna’s made and then started working on the tiramisu.

She made the cream with strawberry wine and added fresh cut strawberries to it before she soaked her lady fingers in a chocolate infused coffee. She then assembled the dessert and dusted it with coco powder and stuck it in the fridge while the lasagnas baked. Right as she got the tiramisu in the fridge the portal door to Rio’s apartment opened.

“It smells amazing in here babe!” Rio said as she rushed into the kitchen.

“Thank you. How was work?” Agatha asked Rio as the woman walked up to her and gave her a soft kiss on the lips.

“Great, just started getting orders from the schools and library’s today. I’m surprised Wanda isn’t here yet.” Rio said honestly as she looked around the house.

“She knows better than to be in the way on coven meeting nights.” Agatha told Rio as she took off her apron so she could give her a hug and another kiss.

“Oh so she has some sense about her.” Rio joked.

“Sometimes. Oh, here’s the gift Gaia gave me.” Agatha said as she leaned back and showed Rio the necklace hanging around her neck. Rio picked it up and looked at the brooch pensively.

“It suits you.” Rio said softly as she let it fall against Agatha’s chest. “Do you need any help with anything?” Rio asked as she pulled away.

“There are table extenders in the closet in the dining room and extra chairs. Could you work on that before you go get your parents and Lilia?” Agatha requested.

“Of course.” Rio said as she pulled away from Agatha.

“Thank you my love.” Agatha said appreciatively before she turned back around and started working on the garlic bread. She got it set up and on sheet trays quickly before she placed it on the oven. She would bake it off right before everyone started arriving.

Ten minutes later Rio came back into the kitchen with a smile on her face. “All set up! Do you need anything else done before I head to the cabin and collect them? It’s 6:45.”

“No, I need to get changed and I can use my magic to set the table while you get them. Thank you for your help.” Agatha said appreciatively before she walked over to Rio and gave her another kiss.

“You’re welcome. I’ll be back soon.” Rio said as she took Agatha’s hand and squeezed it.

“Do you want me to change your outfit before you leave?” Agatha asked as she looked at the outfit Rio was wearing. It wasn’t a terrible choice honestly but she wanted to dress Rio up.

“Go for it.” Rio said with a shrug. Then her outfit was changed into a sage green button up with the sleeves rolled 3/4ths of the way up, a deep green vest that had Ivy leaves embroidered in gold, black slacks and shoes. The shirt had the top two buttons unbuttoned and her hair was done up in a neat bun.

“Stunning.” Agatha said appreciatively as she looked over Rio with hungry eyes.

“You did this to your self my love.” Rio teased before she stepped toward the bedroom door. “I’m going to get my family now. You better look magificent when I get back.” Rio said with a smile before disappearing out of sight.

“I am my own worst enemy.” Agatha said to herself as she magicked an outfit on herself. A deep purple knee length dress, with corset back settled against her skin, black heels and her jewelry added accents to the outfit before she put her apron back on to finish taking care of dinner.

Ten minutes later there was a knock on her front door. Agatha made her way to the entry way and opened it to find Jen and Alice looking well dressed with smiles gracing their faces.

“We brought wine.” Jen said with a smile as Agatha stepped aside and let them in.

“Perfect thank you. Dinner is almost done and you are the first to arrive. Rio is collecting her parents and Lilia now. Head toward the dining room.” Agatha said as she guided the women toward the kitchen.

“You look great Agatha.” Alice said with a smile before she followed Jen into the house. Jen was wearing a soft pink sweater and black slacks, Alice was wearing a blue button up and black slacks as well.

“So do you two. Wanda and Lily will be here last I’m sure.” Agatha told the women as they walked deeper into the home. A moment later she heard her bedroom door open.

“Babe I’m back, it’s just Momma and Lilia though. Papa’s in Nevada dealing with an emergency.” Rio said loudly into the house as the three of them walked though the portal.

“Well that sucks.” Agatha said mostly to herself. Rio guided Lilia and Rita toward the entryway but not before hearing a panicked scream from the peace lily that was still in the living room. “Rio! Reassure the damn plant!”

“I’m going! I’m going! Momma, Lilia go down that hall into the kitchen.” Rio said loudly before she headed toward the plant.

“What was that about?” Jen asked as she looked at Agatha.

“The peace lily in the living room used to belong to Lilia and is traumatized.” Rita said with a laugh as she walked into the kitchen.

“Oh! So you can hear it too?” Agatha asked.

“Loud and clear.” Rita said as Lilia swatted at her.

“Well I’m sorry that someone gave me a plant that I didn’t know how to care for! Get over it you dramatic greenery!” Lilia yelled down the hall.

“I feel like I missed something.” Alice said in a confused tone.

“Most green witches can ‘hear’ plants. But because we are from the original line we can actually hear them. The peace lily in the living room felt Lilia’s presence and decided to scream something along the lines of ‘no! Not her! I’ll be good! I’m sorry I was dramatic about the purple one moving me.’ When we walked in the room.” Rita explained.

“I’m the purple one now?” Agatha asked with a laugh as she put oven mitts on and pulled the lasagnas out of the oven and put the garlic bread in. There was a knock on the front door right as Rio was walking past.

“I’ve got it babe!” Rio yelled as she opened the door. Wanda and Lily stood there with a smile. “You never knock.” Rio teased as she stepped aside and let the women in.

“I thought I’d use my manners for once.” Wanda said with a huff as she walked into the house.

“She has those?” Rio whispered to Lily.

“Nope. Not touching that one right now.” Lily said with a blush as she followed Wanda into the house.

“Alright you all go sit down at the table. I’ll get everything taken care of.” Agatha told the group as she magicked the table and its place settings down. Then with a flourish the candles were lit, the lasagna’s were on casserole mats and the wine Jen had brought was opened and breathing along with a few more bottles.

The women filed into the dining room and Agatha took her apron off, pulled the garlic bread out of the oven and cut it before getting it into a basket on the table as well. She then made her way into the dining room.

Everyone was seated at the table and waiting patiently for Agatha. “Have we all been introduced?” Agatha asked as she sat down next to Rio.

“Not yet, we were just settling in and looking at everything you made. Two different types of lasagna?” Lilia asked the young witch.

“White lasagna with spinach, ricotta, sausage, onion, and peppers. A more ‘traditional’ lasagna with red sauce, ground beef, sausage, ricotta and blended cheeses. Garlic bread and for dessert I made strawberry chocolate tiramisu. I hope I don’t offend your Sicilian roots too much with my cooking Lilia.” Agatha explained.

“A home cooked meal is appreciated no matter what form it comes in.” Lilia reassured.

“Alright do we want to go around and introduce ourselves or do you guys just want me to tell everyone who everyone is?” Agatha asked.

“I think it would just be easier to introduce ourselves, name, craft, affiliation to Agatha or myself.” Rio suggested.

“I’ll go first. I’m Lilia Calderu, I’m a divinations witch, and I’m Rio’s adoptive Aunt.”

“I’m Rita Vidal, I’m a green witch and if it wasn’t obvious I’m Rio’s Momma.”

“I’m Wanda Maximoff, I’m a chaos witch, I’m Agatha’s best friend and adoptive sister.”

“I’m Lilian Grey, I’m a potions witch and I am Wanda’s girlfriend.”

“You are much more than that, you are also my future sister-in-law and our friend. Okay, Kale your turn.” Agatha reassured.

“I’m Jennifer Kale, I am also a potions witch, Alice is my life partner, and I’m Agatha’s friend.”

“I’m Alice Wu-Guliver, I’m a protections witch, Jen is my life partner and I’m also Agatha’s friend.” Alice explained.

“And my father is MIA but his name is Daniel and would’ve loved to have been here.” Rio said finishing the conversation off.

“Alright it’s hopefully cooled down enough to serve let’s get some food on plates and wine in glasses.” Agatha told the group of women. Everyone was served their meals and they started eating.

“Thank you for going to all this trouble Agatha.” Jen said before she took a sip of wine.

“Thank you for coming. I know how much you actually hate people.” Agatha said with a smirk before she started eating her dinner.

“Oh is that the standard we are setting for the evening?” Wanda asked in a gleeful tone.

“No.” Jen, Alice, Lily and Agatha said in unison, shutting Wanda down quickly, who just huffed and picked up a piece of garlic bread and bit into it aggressively.

“You guys never let me have any fun.” Wanda said with a huff.

“How long have you two been dating?” Lilia asked Wanda and Lily.

“A week, but we are like they are.” Lily answered as she pointed at Agatha and Rio.

“Fascinating. I’ve never seen it happen outside our family.” Rita said to the two women.

“My mother mentioned she’s seen it a few times but she’s been around the world a few hundred times.” Alice said with a shrug.

“So it’s rare but not unheard of.” Rita mused to herself as she took a bite of food. “This is delightful Agatha!”

“Have you two tested it?” Agatha asked Jen and Alice. “Thank you Rita.”

“In what sense?” Alice asked looking over at Agatha.

“Have you two used your magic with each other in anyway in the last ten years? A good example is touching magical energy together.” Agatha explained, Jen and Alice pause for a long moment before they looked at each other.

“Have we?” Alice asks in a confused tone as she looked over Jen, trying to remember.

“I don’t know. I don’t think we have.” Jen said to Alice.

“Before you two do that. Let’s pause for moment.” Rita said to the group, which caused all of them to look at her. “Magical energy is typically dormant. Maybe that’s why you two have never discovered this. It has to be a conscious choice. Agatha and Rio are so powerful that their magic is always thrumming through them. They can’t turn it on and off like the rest of us. I have no doubt you two will be magically compatible especially if you’ve been together a long time. Daniel and I dated for 5 years before we tested to see if we were compatible.”

“We’ve been together ten years. But honestly using magic on a partner is seen as tabu in my culture so we never thought to try it out.” Alice explained.

“Ah, that explains a lot.” Lilia said with a shrug before she went back to eating.

“Well what are you waiting for?” Agatha encouraged the two women. Alice’s orange magic sparked to life as she held her hand out for Jen who had her pink magic sparking softly at her finger tips. They reached for each other and then the sparks arced out to one another. With a flash two rings settled on their left hands. Alice’s ring was gold with soft pink spires and Jen’s was almost black with orange lightening bolts shooting across it.

“Woah! Wait a second that’s not my esthetic.” Jen said sassily as she looked at the almost obsidian ring on her left hand.

“Like I want your girly shit stuck to me for the rest of our lives Jen.” Alice joked as she admired the soft gold ring.

“Welcome to carrying a small part of your partner with you wherever you go.” Agatha said before she took a bite of her food.

“Well this isn’t how I expected this evening to go.” Lilia said in a shocked tone as she looked over at the two women.

“How was this evening supposed to go?” Rio asked.

“Are you actually asking me for once?” Lilia said in an excited tone.

“If she’s not, I am.” Lily requested.

“I didn’t expect their connection to be as deep as it is already. Maybe the sigils on their chests but not the rings.” Lilia told them before taking a bite of her food.

“Does that bode well or not for us?” Wanda asked thinking ahead, worried about Sunday.

“It doesn’t change anything for Agatha or Rio. Alice and Jen on the other hand it does. Now if they want to know they can ask but other than that nothing important changes.”

“I’m good.” Alice said before she went back to eating.

“Honestly, same. Although I am afraid of Lorna’s reaction the next time she sees us.” Jen said with a shudder at the thought of Lorna being angry.

“She will be ecstatic, don’t worry.” Lilia reassured.

“You’ll be hearing from my lawyer if she isn’t.” Jen joked which caused Lilia to raise an eyebrow at the women.

“She’s talking about me Lilia.” Agatha told the divination witch who just scoffed at the group before she went back to eating.

“This is quite good Agatha, I don’t know if Rio told you but the breakfast sandwich you sent with her was also delicious.” Lilia complimented.

“Thank you for the compliment Lilia.” Agatha said appreciatively before they all started eating again. Once everyone was finished eating Agatha used her magic to clear the plates away and then got up to get the tiramisu out of the fridge.

“So what’s the plan for Sunday?” Rita asked.

“I don’t really have one. Honestly I don’t even want to step foot inside the damn place ever again. If I could take a gas can and a box of matches with me and light it on fire I would.” Agatha said honestly as she set the dessert on the table.

“Yeah let’s not do that.” Alice said nervously, knowing that she would have to report it.

“I’m donating it to the fire department for them to practice with. Then specifically requesting when they want to burn it down to call me when they plan to so I can watch it go up in flames.” Agatha told them.

“Good idea” Rita and Lilia said in unison.

“I vote for just lighting it on fire on Sunday.” Wanda said with a smirk.

“No, we won’t be doing that.” Lily said in a tone that left no room for argument.

“Yes dear.” Wanda said sadly.

“I like her. I’ve never seen Wanda so well behaved.” Jen said with a chuckle.

“You don’t want to get into that right now Jen.” Rio told her as she shook her head.

“Maybe I do. You don’t know Rio.” Jen said curiously.

“Please not with my Mother and Aunt here.” Rio requested.

“We aren’t prudes dear.” Lilia scolded Rio,

“I understand that but we are getting off topic. Do we want to meet here around noon on Sunday then head over there and get everything sorted out?” Rio requested as Agatha started serving up dessert for everyone.

“Thank you witchlett.” Rita said as Agatha handed her a plate. “I can handle that. Pick us up at the cabin like you did tonight?” Rita asked.

“Sounds good to us. I’m closed on Sunday’s and Alice took the day off.” Jen agreed.

“I’ll be here.” Wanda said with a shrug.

“So will I.” Lily said with a smile.

“Okay now that we’ve established that. You can ask your personal questions.” Agatha said with a sigh as she sat down.

“Why is Wanda so well behaved all of a sudden.” Jen asked.

“Lily is a pleasure dom and put me in my place more than once this week.” Wanda answered before she took a bite of the tiramisu.

“Oh. Not the answer I was expecting.” Jen said honestly.

“Oh that reminds me! I owe you two something before you leave.” Agatha said with a grin that told Alice and Jen they should be very afraid.

“Why am I suddenly afraid for my life?” Alice said as she scooted closer to Jen.

“I don’t know babe, but same.” Jen answered.

‘I don’t know if I support this idea or not.’ Rio said in her mind.

‘I think they deserve a taste of their own medicine.’ Agatha answered.

“Don’t worry, she’s not going to harm you.” Lilia said as she shook her head at the vision she just got.

“Lilia… what did you see?” Rita asked her best friend.

“Nope. Some things are better left unsaid.” Lilia told Rita which was speak for ‘we will gossip about this while getting wine drunk on the cabins couch.’

“I just realized something… but I’m afraid to ask.” Rio said softly.

“The cabin accepted me because your mother and I are best friends. Just like it would’ve accepted Wanda if you ever bring her because she’s Agatha’s best friend, and Lily in turn.” Lilia explained. “Now let’s enjoy this dessert Agatha worked so hard on.”

They all started eating their desserts at the same time and looked over at Agatha in unison, and for the first time that evening everyone spoke over one another. A chorus of “This is so good”, “Delightful”, “magnificent” and several other words that got lost before all the women burst out laughing.

“Can we try that again, one at a time?” Agatha requested after the laughter settled down.

“It’s delightful Agatha.” Lilia complimented.

“This is so good, I need to take some to Daniel.” Rita told Agatha.

“I’ll make sure he gets a healthy portion. I was a little sad he couldn’t come.” Agatha told Rita.

“Papa would’ve felt so overwhelmed by this many women.” Rio reassured Agatha.

“I don’t know why you don’t bake more, this is delicious.” Jen complimented.

“Honestly one of the best desserts I’ve ever had.” Lily told Agatha.

“Don’t inflate her ego.” Wanda scolded Lily softly before looking at her best friend. “But it really is good. We need to hide this from Pietro.”

“Oh is your brother scheduled to visit as well?” Alice asked, she liked him even if the was a zippy pain in the ass.

“After dinner I’m gunna call him because he hasn’t met Lily yet.”

“Ah, okay. Well anyway. It’s magnificent Agatha. I’ve had quite a few different types and this one is made very well.” Alice complimented.

“Stop, you guys are too much.” Agatha said with a blush. “But thank you, I appreciate it. I’m glad you all love it.”

They all finished eating their desserts quickly and then Wanda and Lily got up and started cleaning the kitchen leaving Lilia, Rita, Jen, and Alice sitting at the table.

“I still have to open the green house tomorrow, can you take us home Rio?” Rita asked.

“Let me get a to go container for some food for Daniel and the dessert.” Agatha said as she stood up. She walked into the kitchen and opened a cabinet and grabbed a couple containers out of the cabinet. “Thank you for helping clean up I appreciate you two.” Agatha said to the two women before she headed back into the dining room.

Agatha served up a portion of each lasagna before putting a lid on and handing it to Rita then scooping a large portion of the dessert into the container and putting the lid on before handing it to Rita. “Thank you witchlett. I’ll send your cake container home with Rio. I forgot to grab it before we left.”

“Wait there was cake at some point?” Alice asked in an indignant tone.

“Last week. Been gone for a minute.” Agatha answered as Rita, Rio and Lilia got up.

“Thank you for dinner and the delightful conversation.” Rita said as she hugged Agatha before letting her go.

“I need to speak to Wanda before we leave but I appreciate dinner it was delightful. Dessert was also splendid. I’m so glad my niece has found someone who can cook so well.” Lilia said as she hugged Agatha.

“What did you need to talk to me about?” Wanda asked as she walked back into the dining room with Lily.

“Rio mentioned something about wanting to know if your first child will be a boy?” Lilia asked.

“It would be nice to know.” Lily told Lilia.

“Give me your hands. Let’s look.” Lilia said as she held her hands out for the two women to take. A vision of twin boys flashed before her eyes being held in Wanda’s arms in a hospital bed. She looked exhausted but absolutely on the moon. Then a vision of twin girls being held in Lily’s arms and two young boys about 4 years old peaking over the edge of the bed looking up at Lily holding the two girls.

“Do you want to know everything or just the minor details?” Lilia asked as she let their hands go.

“Minor details.”

“You’ll have boys first.” Lilia said honestly before she stepped back with a smile.

“Lilia…” Rio trailed off as a warning.

“Fine. Twin boys first. Wanda has to be the one to get pregnant.” Lilia clarified.

“Not shocked by that in the least.” Agatha said with a laugh.

“Alright let’s head out before you start talking about my grandchildren.” Rita said dragging Lilia along by the arm toward the living room.

“I’ll be back soon.” Rio said as she gave Agatha a kiss before she rushed off to send her Mother and Aunt home.

“Now, are we hanging around and getting wine drunk?” Jen asked the other women in the dining room.

“No, Rio has to work tomorrow and I think you do too don’t you?” Agatha asked.

“You’re right. Alright. Come one Alice, let’s get ready to head out.” Jen said as she stood up, Alice followed suit and they both made their way toward the door.

“Hands before you leave.” Agatha said holding her hand out for them to give them to her.

“No.” Jen said defiantly Alice sighed and just put her left hand out for Agatha to touch.

“You don’t get to say no Jen.” Agatha told her sternly.

“But I’m scared.” Jen said with a nervous tone.

“You only have to suffer for the 45 minute drive home. I had to suffer for over 7 hours. Suck it up Kale.” Agatha scolded the woman who huffed and put her hand out. Agatha took Alice’s first and softly ran her thumb over the ring. She seen Jennifer bristle out of the corner of her eye before letting Alice’s hand go. Then Agatha grabbed Jen’s hand and did the same motion.

“Nope! Leaving now! Sorry about doing that! Bye!” Alice said as she grabbed Jen by the arm and dragged the taller woman out the door.

“That was mean Agatha.” Rio said as she walked up behind Agatha and placed a soft kiss on her shoulder as she watched the two women get in the car and speed off.

“I think it was plenty fair.” Agatha said with a chuckle.

“Depends on who you ask.” Rio said as she pulled away and headed into the kitchen with the cake container. Agatha reached up and tapped the necklace Gaia gave her three times.

“Hello witchlett! How did dinner go?” Gaia asked as she appeared next to Agatha.

“Great. There’s plenty of left overs if you want some before we call Pietro.” Agatha told Gaia before she walked back into the kitchen. Rio was serving up a slice of dessert for Gaia as they walked in.

“I’m mostly interested in dessert, but I’d be willing to try the lasagna.” Gaia said as she followed Agatha before sitting down at the island.

“You don’t eat often do you?” Agatha asked.

“Not really. Ambrosia is pretty sustaining.” Gaia said as she magicked a fork into her hand before taking a bite of the dessert. “Absolutely Marvelous.”

“Tell me, am I gunna get fat?” Rio asked the goddess.

“No you aren’t going to get fat. Your nightly activities are going to keep you two skinny.” Gaia told Rio.

“I don’t even know what to say to that.” Agatha said before she walked over to Wanda and Lily who were leaning against the counter talking softly with each other. “Are you two okay?”

“Yeah. We are just trying to figure out how big of a house we are going to need in the future.” Wanda explained.

“I was contemplating building you two one as well so our kids could grow up together and we could still be close. I found a decent sized property that I could split and we could be neighbors. That way Lily and Rio can have a huge garden and green house.” Agatha told the two.

“No. That’s not something you need to burden yourself with Agatha.” Lily said in a distressed tone.

“You haven’t told them yet have you?” Rio asked.

“I’ve been busy.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“What haven’t you told us?” Wanda asked

“I’m just as rich as Tony Stark. Evanora fucked herself and made it so that I was the sole inheritor of her finances, estate and assets and couldn’t edit it until I turned 50.” Agatha explained to them.

“Oh.” Lily said softly.

“So if I want to build my best friend and her future wife a house I can and will… If Wanda will let me.”

“Have I ever been able to stop you before?” Wanda asked with a laugh. “Also that’s the best fucking thing I’ve ever heard! The irony! It keeps getting better and better.”

“Dessert was delicious. But I must be going so Pietro isn’t here all night. Have a good night girls. Agatha come give your mother one more hug.” Gaia requested, Agatha walked over to the goddess and gave her another hug before letting her go and the woman disappeared.

“Do I have to call him?” Wanda asked in a sad tone.

“I’ll make sure he goes home after feeding him all the left overs.” Agatha promised as she magicked her phone into her hand and dialed Pietro. It rang once before he picked up the phone.

“Aggie! Everything okay?” Pietro asked into the phone.

“Everything’s fine, I just have a ton of left over lasagna from the coven meeting tonight and a surprise standing in my kitchen for you.” Agatha explained.

“Heck Yeah! Be there in a minute!” Pietro said as he hung up the phone. A literal minute later Pietro rushed into the house and skidded to a stop in the kitchen.

“Is she the surprise?” Pietro asked looking at the small blonde standing in Wanda’s arms.

“Pietro, meet my girlfriend Lily.” Wanda said nervously to her brother.

“Hello Lily, you are quite the cutie! I can’t believe my sister had kept you a secret from me.” Pietro said in a slight scolding tone directed at his sister.

“Oh it’s about to get much heavier. But how about you sit down and eat something first and we will explain everything.” Agatha told him as she shoved the pan of lasagna toward him.

“Sure, I haven’t eaten enough today anyway.” Pietro said as he sat down at the countertop. He quickly scarfed down half the pan before looking up at the four women.

“Okay spill. What’s going on.” Pietro said requesting an explanation. Agatha sighed and decided to just start talking while he ate.

Thirty minutes later everything had been covered and he was fully caught up. He looked over at his two sisters with a bright smile on his face. “In less than two weeks you two have finally found your soulmates. That makes me so happy! I don’t have to worry as much about dying before you two now.”

“Really? That was a concern?” Agatha asked.

“Yeah. Just because you two get to live for a thousand years doesn’t mean I get to. I know my lifespan is much shorter than yours. At least when I go I know you two will have each other and your partners. Which by the way are very beautiful women who seem to care deeply about you.” Pietro explained.

“Sometimes you are sweeter than honey… it makes me forget how much of a little shit you can be.” Agatha said with a smile:

“So am I getting nieces and nephews before I die?” Pietro jabbed.

“Yes, Jeeze! You are fucking ridiculous!” Wanda scolded.

“Language Wanda.” Pietro scolded.

“I’m not a teacher, I can swear all I want!” Wanda said with a huff.

“The real reason you could never work for Charles Xavier.” Pietro said with a laugh.

“Like Logan doesn’t swear at the children.” Wanda said flippantly.

“Okay, time for dessert then you get to go back home. I have things I have to finish. Rio has to work tomorrow. Wanda and Lily have to go home at some point.” Agatha said as she slid a plate of the tiramisu over to him. He took a bite and looked at Agatha skeptically.

“I only get this much?” He asked her with a pout.

“Yes because I actually like it and wanted some for myself.” Agatha told him with a pointed look.

“Fine. I guess I should just be grateful for basically a whole pan of lasagna. Thanks for dinner sis.” He said as he quickly ate the dessert before he got up and gave Agatha a hug after washing his plate and fork.

“You’re welcome. Now get outta my house. I wanna cuddle with my fiancé.” Agatha told him playfully as she shoved him toward the door. He stopped Agatha and turned to give Wanda a hug before looking at Lily.

“Nice meeting you Lily. Welcome to the family.” Pietro said as he gave her a hug and then dashed out the door.

“If you put him in a line up with several men I would’ve never picked him as your twin brother.” Lily told Wanda.

“I know. Now let’s head home. It’s been a long day.” Wanda said to Lily as she started to pull her toward the door.

“Goodnight ladies!” Agatha said as she watched the two women leave.

“That went way smoother than I expected.” Rio said honestly after the front door shut.

“I know right. Now let’s go cuddle and get some rest.” Agatha said as she grabbed Rio’s hand and headed toward the bedroom.

Chapter End Notes

My niece, one of the lights of my life… gave me something for new years. A sickness that has stuck with me since Thursday afternoon. I’ve been trying so hard to get this finished and over a cold at the same time. Sorry for the delay. Hopefully the wait was worth it.

~Back at the Cabin~

Lilia and Rita were settled on the couch drinking wine. The hearth in the middle of the room was burning keeping the room a nice temperature.

“One of those two is getting pregnant tonight aren’t they?” Rita asked.

“Which two?” Lilia asked before she took a sip of her wine.

“Jen and Alice.” Rita stated clearly.

“Oh yes. Right after we left Agatha made a very clear point to touch their rings. Because Alice had to be nosey on Wednesday and touch Rio’s ring.”

“Oh no! Why would someone do such a thing?” Rita said with an eye roll.

“Uneducated I suppose. I’m shocked yours and Daniel’s never showed up.” Lilia said honestly.

“Every magical connection is different. You know that. I’m just happy the cabin didn’t kill him.” Rita told Lilia before taking a sip of wine.

“I’m also happy about that, he’s a good man, husband, and father. Now. Do you want to know who’s actually getting pregnant tonight?” Lilia asked

“Neither of them seem very maternal…. But I’d assume Jen.”

“That’s correct. Alice’s job is too dangerous for her to be carrying a child… ever. But Lorna Wu will be over the moon about her first and only grandchild.” Lilia said with a bright smile.

“You are just happy to be talking about baby’s in general.” Rita said with an eye roll as she took another drink of wine.

“Hey, life long friends and playmates for your grandchildren are always a bonus.”

“If they have kids.” Rita clarified.

“They will. Don’t stress too much. You’ll be a grandma before you know it, then all that gray hair will finally be justified.” Lilia said as she pointed at the two gray streaks framing Rita’s face.

“She was worth them. Plus it’s a nice indicator and warning to know you are carrying the next one in line.” Rita said with a sigh as she looked at the hearth, focusing on the fire for a moment while the memory of her hair turning gray sent her into a mild panic while she was carrying Rio.

“Still quite a shock to see happen over 9 months.” Lilia said as she placed her hand on Rita’s knee. “But she was worth it, wasn’t she?”

“Yes, she was. I’m so glad she’s finally met Agatha. That witchlett truly is a gift. I’ve never seen my daughter smile so brightly!” Rita said cheerfully.

“I am so mad that she was even a blind spot to me until they met! That was so frustrating.” Lilia said in an irritated tone.

“Was she worth it?” Rita asked with a laugh.

“Of course she was! She’s brilliant, gorgeous, and most importantly she loves Rio.” Lilia said with a smile then the front door opened.

“Rita I’m home! Oh, Hi Lilia!” Daniel said as he walked in the door.

“Agatha packed up dinner for you, it’s in the fridge. Dessert as well.” Rita said from her seat on the couch.

“I knew I loved that girl. Thank you darling. I’m starving.” Daniel said as he walked over to Rita and bent over the couch to give her a kiss before standing up straight and heading into the kitchen. A few minutes later Daniel came out of the kitchen holding the lasagna container and a fork.

“So how did it go?” He asked as he sat down in his chair.

“Great, Agatha and Rio have already started moving in together.” Rita said with a smile.

“Good, maybe I’ll get grandchildren before my 150th birthday.” Daniel said with a smile before he took a bite of the lasagna. He looked up at both women as he chewed slowly.

“I know. She’s an amazing cook. Wait until you get to dessert.” Lilia said with a chuckle.

“I’m just glad I don’t have to worry about making a week’s worth of food for Rio every Saturday now.” Rita joked.

“You are still going to make too much food and you know it.” Daniel said as he shoved a bite of lasagna into his mouth.

“I can send it with you and ship some off to Lilia. I’ll adapt eventually.” Rita told the group.

“I’ll never complain about a home cooked meal.” Lilia said honestly as she took a sip of wine, while Daniel finished off his meal.

“I’m gunna go get dessert. Do you two want refills?” Daniel asked as he stood up.

“No I think I’ve had enough wine tonight, thank you Daniel.” Lilia said honestly as she handed him her glass.

“I’ll take a bottle of water dear, thank you.” Rita said as she handed her husband the wine glass.

“Got it, be right back.” Daniel said as he walked toward the kitchen.

“An entire love bound coven seems to be a good omen. Don’t you think?” Lilia said with a smile.

“I’d argue that you need to find yours for that to count.” Rita said before she got more comfortable on the couch.

“I’m much too old for all that flimflam.” Lilia said with a scoff.

~Meanwhile in Salem~

Gaia was busy deciding how to handle the coven that was collected at their new coven heads house. The six women were sitting at a table arguing about how to handle Agatha Harkness’s arrival on Sunday.

“Fucking morons.” Gaia said as she walked up to the window and watched them for a long moment; they all seemed to be bickering about how to handle the situation. She sighed and walked around to the front door and knocked on it. Figuring that politeness might get her farther. All the noise in the house stopped and a chair slid across the floor before footsteps made their way to the door.

“What do you want!?” A woman yelled as she opened the door, she looked up at Gaia and instantly froze in fear at the realization.

“A conversation about my adoptive Daughter Agatha Harkness would be nice.” Gaia said as she stood in the doorway.

“How… are you.. uh.” The woman started to say but Gaia cut her off.

“Your goddess? Yes. And I am only here because Agatha asked me to be. Now kindly step aside. You won’t like it if I have to touch you.” Gaia said to the woman who had the decency to step aside and let Gaia walk into the house. She made her way into the dining room where the 5 other women were sitting. They all stood up instantly when they realized who was in the room with them.

“What do we owe this delightful surprise?” One of the women asked in a sickly sweet tone.

“Sit down you fucking suck-ups. I’m here because Agatha asked me to be. Not because I like any of you. You have a grand opportunity to make your goddess very happy. It’s up to you if you have any sense to listen.” Gaia said to the group. Who all had the sense to sit down, even the woman who had opened the door for her took her seat.

“If any of you step out of your houses on Sunday, if any of you decide you want to bother MY Daughter ever again. I will intervene in a less than kind way. Lilia’s threats will seem like child’s play compared to what Death and I will do to your souls after you die. Do you understand?” Gaia asked the women.

All the women at the table shook their head yes. “Good, now educate yourselves on how spirit witches are created and never bother Agatha Harkness or her coven ever again.” Gaia said as she dropped a thick stack of information on the table and left. Leaving all the woman paralyzed with fear.

~Saturday Morning~

Rio woke up Saturday morning and smiled brightly at the woman in her arms. Agatha had her head resting on her chest, soft raven curls falling over her face as she slept. Nothing could ruin this moment with her, Agatha was so peaceful in her arms and Rio didn’t want to disturb that.

“You have to work today my love.” Agatha mumbled sleepily as she nuzzled into Rio’s arms even more.

“You make that difficult.” Rio said with a smile gracing her face.

“I’ll go with you and help out.” Agatha said with a yawn.

“Or you could stay in bed and relax.” Rio offered.

“Why would I do that when I could spend my day in my favorite book store admiring the most beautiful woman I’ve ever met?” Agatha asked as she scooted up and kissed Rio on the lips.

“Ridiculous. You know that? You are absolutely ridiculous.” Rio told Agatha with an eye roll before she kissed her again.

Daniel Vidal (ICE) 10:45 p.m: Pepita tell Agatha everything was amazing! Love you both.

“I’m glad he liked it. I didn’t realize it was that late. Let’s get up.” Agatha said seriously this time as she pulled away from Rio.

“Are we driving or taking the portal?” Rio asked.

“Probably taking the portal. Maybe you should establish one at the book store with the front door? And teach me how to use it?” Agatha asked.

“We can work on that on Monday. I mean I can establish one today but we can work on teaching you how to use it on Monday.” Rio said honestly.

Jennifer Kale 8:05 a.m: I’m sorry for touching Rio’s ring, so is Alice. Also Fuck you and thank you.

She hit send and set her phone down so she could eat her breakfast in peace.
