Chapter 33

Sunday morning brought its own set of challenges. Agatha was anxious as hell, she was nervously pacing around the living room waiting for everyone to arrive. Rio had left her alone to collect Lilia and Rita and she was chewing her nail’s down to the quick.

“Witchlett. I spoke to them. Well, threatened them really.” Gaia said softly as she pulled Agatha into her arms. The woman didn’t even realize she was being pulled into Gaia’s embrace until she was already being held.

“What do you mean?”

“They were having a coven meeting and I popped in and told them if they left their houses today, they’d have to answer to me.” Gaia said as she placed a soft kiss on Agatha’s brow. “Now stop stressing. I have century’s posted ready to alert me if they step out of line. Momma is here to take care of you baby, don’t you worry about those witches.”

“I just don’t want to hurt anyone ever again.” Agatha said with tears welling up in her eyes.

“You won’t. Also, you didn’t hurt them. Tell me, do you blame the fire when you get burned?” Gaia asked Agatha.

“No, I blame myself for being dumb enough to stick my hand in the flame…” Agatha answered, a sudden realization hitting her. “Oh.”

“Yeah baby, You’re the flame. Never feel bad about people dumb enough to get burned by you. Now, what are you going into the house for?” Gaia requested.

“Just going in and seeing if there’s anything Pietro might have missed when he stole my social security card and birth certificate.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“I’d find all the bank information you can, and get whatever you need from your room. Then call a company to clean the house out. But get every scrap of information that has your name on it out of that house. Even if you have to summon it.” Gaia instructed.

“I think I can do that.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“You’ve got this. Also, you are allowed to destroy things. Keep that in mind, it belongs to you now.” Gaia reminded Agatha as Rita, Lilia and Rio walked through the portal door.

“Oh Hello Gaia, how are you?” Rio said as she shut the bedroom door behind her. Lilia and Rita stood in the living room absolutely gobsmacked.

“Why is our goddess hugging Agatha?” Lilia asked in a confused tone.

“Because I adopted her. She’s my daughter now.” Gaia stated simply.

“Ah okay. Cool. My future daughter in law is the child of a goddess now.” Rita said as she sat down on a chair and ran her hand through her hair.

“Momma… you gave birth to the future embodiment of Death. Are you really shocked?” Rio asked softly as she walked over to her mother.

“Shocked? No. Just taking a minute to absorb this new information.” Rita said.

“Are you the reason Agatha was a blind spot?” Lilia asked in a slightly annoyed tone.

“Technically…. No. You can blame the first entity of Death for that one. She didn’t want any of her predecessors using divinations witches to find their brides before it was time to.” Gaia explained as she hugged Agatha tightly. “But I must be going. Call me if you need me sweetheart.”

“I will Momma. Thank you.” Agatha said before Gaia disappeared. A moment later the front door opened and Wanda and Lily walked in the door.

“Sorry, I know we are running behind.” Wanda said rushing into the living room before she paused and looked around. “Wait, where are Jen and Alice?”

“Not here yet.” Agatha said with a sigh as she collapsed into the couch.

“I’ll call them.” Wanda said as she pulled her phone out of her back pocket and dialed Jen. The phone rang 4 times before Jen picked up.

“For once it’s my fault we are late. I don’t want to hear it. We will be there in 5 minutes.” Jen said into the phone.

“Why is it your fault?” Wanda asked.

“I’d rather not say. Just don’t ask. We will be there soon. Who’s driving?”

“I’m driving my car. You two will ride with me and Lily. Agatha will drive her car and Rio, Lilia and Rita will ride with them I assume.” Wanda explained.

“Okay sounds good. Be there soon. Bye.” Jen said before hanging up. Wanda just stuck her phone back in her back pocket.

“Jen’s the reason they are late.” Wanda said in a confused tone.

“Probably not used to feeling her feelings out loud.” Agatha joked.

“Is that a thing?” Wanda asked.

“I don’t know you tell me Wanda, seems like you two got your sigils at some point yesterday. How does it feel to have your partner know everything you are feeling when they touch it?” Agatha asked.

“How did you… You can’t even see them! How did you know?”

“I can feel them. Well not them, but your magic is more unified now. You’re less separate than you were yesterday.”

“Wait. Wait. Wait. You can feel our magic?” Lily asked.

“Yes? You can’t tell what kind of witch someone is by looking at their magic?”

“You can look at someone’s magic?!” Rita asked.

“Again yes. You can’t?” Agatha asked in a confused tone.

“No babe. That’s not normal. I can tell if someones a witch. But even I can’t tell what kind of witch they are, I just make educated guesses.” Rio told Agatha. Every woman in the room was looking at Agatha like she’d grown a second head.

“What? I thought everyone could see magical energy coursing through someone. Lilia’s is yellow, Jen’s and Lily’s is pink, Rita and Rio’s is green, Wanda’s is Red, Alice’s is orange… you can’t see that?” Agatha asked.

“Wait is that why you said you knew their magic the other day when they touched my ring?” Rio asked in a confused tone.

“Yes.” Agatha said softly, coming to a realization.

“I wonder if it’s all spirit witches that can see that or just you.” Lilia pondered.

“Well we have their phone numbers….” Rita clarified.

“Leave them alone, we can just bother Violet. She hasn’t popped in, in a while to bother us.” Agatha started to say then time froze.

“Rude. I’m a very busy woman.” Violet said with a huff.

“I was half joking ma’am.” Agatha sassed.

“Yes spirit witches are the only ones that can do what you do. I don’t know why. I can speculate, but I don’t have an exact reason we can do it.” Violet told Rio and Agatha.

“Well. Speculate away.” Rio requested.

“Just in case we wanted to steal a powerful witches energy, we have the ability to see it and take it. Sometimes witches are undeserving of their powers. We are the judge, jury, and executioner. I know you’ve been busy Agatha but you really should read my spell book when you get the chance.” Violet clarified.

“Maybe that’s why you became a lawyer babe.” Rio joked.

“We can give it to someone more deserving as well. Magical transfer of power is a thing. It’s even possible to do without killing any of the parties involved. But that’s for a later discussion. Now stop being sassy I have body’s to collect. Love you both! Bye!” Violet said before she disappeared and time restarted.

“Yeah all spirit witches can do that.” Rio said with a shake of her head.

“That…. Is scary as fuck.” Lilia said honestly.

“Oh it gets scarier… Spirit witches can literally take peoples powers away and give them to someone else.” Rio clarified right as the front door opened.

“Sorry we are late. You can blame me. It’s been an interesting 48 hours.” Jen said looking a little frazzled and tired.

“You are forgiven. Not like I actually wanted to do this today.” Agatha said as she stood up. “Let’s get this over with. Everyone go to the bathroom if you need it’s an hour and a half drive.”

Ten minutes later they were all piled into two cars and headed to their destination. Rio kept her hand on Agatha in some way the whole ride. Be it her hand on her thigh, or holding her hand physically when she could. They pulled up to the grand house an hour and a half later and Agatha felt her stomach drop at the sight of her childhood home. Rio made Agatha take her left hand again and feel the calming aura she was trying to share.

“Thanks babe.” Agatha said with a sigh as she looked over at Rio. Lilia and Rita were already out of the car and standing next to Wanda, Lily, Jen and Alice.

“Come on. The sooner we get this done the sooner we can go home.” Rio reassured Agatha. Agatha sighed and turned off the car before she got out and found the house key. Wanda walked up next to her and placed her hand on her shoulder. Agatha swallowed audibly before she walked up to the front door and unlocked it. Rio took her hand and they stepped through the threshold together with Wanda one step behind her.

Unsurprisingly nothing happened. The house was silent. Only the hum of the refrigerator could be heard in the kitchen. Agatha felt like she was going to vomit at any moment as the rest of the women filed into the house.

“I mean… the bitch had some nice taste.” Jen said as she looked around the house.

“Appearances meant everything to her. So she had to have the nicest of things.” Agatha said as she felt bile climb up in her throat as Wanda took her other hand and started guiding them toward Evanora’s study.

“What are we looking for exactly?” Alice asked.

“Anything with my name on it. Financial information, court documentation, etc. I don’t have anything I’m attached to sentimental wise so a lot of this is going to be left here.” Agatha explained as the women walked into the study. Lilia noticed the large display case with trophy’s from Evanora’s accolades and awards for being a great illusionist.

“How about these? Do you want to take a baseball bat to them?” Lilia asked with a smile.

“Actually…. I kind of do.” Agatha said with a grin, the idea of destroying Evanora’s pride and joy instantly making Agatha feel better.

“Well girls you know what to do, help me load these into the trunk of Wanda’s car.” Lilia said as she opened the display case and started handing the trophy’s to Alice and Jen while Rita was digging through the desk looking for anything with Agatha’s name on it.

“Gladly.” Alice said while grabbing the larger trophy’s from Lilia.

“I’m gunna see if I can find a box to put the smaller ones in.” Jen said as she stepped away.

“There’s a foldable crate in the trunk. Here’s the keys.” Wanda said as she handed Jen the keys.

“Thanks.” Jen said as she left the room.

“I think using a summoning spell might be the most efficient method to finding everything with your name on it sweetie.” Rita said with a sigh as she sat down in the office chair.

“Probably. I’ll do one in a moment. Let me walk around the house and see if I can find anything else I might want to keep or deem important.” Agatha said in a strange tone that told them she didn’t want to do it at all.

“Hey, listen. I know how hard this is for you. If you want to come sit outside with me while they handle things you can.” Lily offered. Knowing the rest of their coven would undoubtably handle it.

“That’s not a bad idea actually. I can stay in here with Wanda and use our connection to communicate with you if I find anything I think might be worth bothering you over.” Rio said as she took Agatha’s hand again and brought the ring up to her lips to kiss it softly.

“Really?” Agatha asked hopefully, but she didn’t want to burden Rio or the coven.

“Yeah, I promise we’ve got this. You and Lily go get some fresh air.” Wanda reassured as well, both women looking at Agatha with nothing but love and care. Lily took Agatha’s hand and guided her back toward the front door

“Come on, you don’t need to relive this all alone. You can take it in chunks. You’ve done so well already.” Lily told her softly before they walked out the door. Agatha sat down on the steps and rubbed her eyes with one hand while Lily kept the other in her grasp.

“I can’t claim to know how you are feeling. But I do know that Wanda and Rio love you. They will handle the hard parts for you, and I’ll be right here to help. Just like the rest of the coven.” Lily reassured.

“Thanks Lily. Honestly, I’m very glad you tried hitting on Rio. Wanda deserves to be loved by someone like you.” Agatha said with a smirk.

“I know you’re deflecting with humor, but same. I know I’ve been quiet the last few days but you guys have made me feel welcome and safe. I never thought I’d have a coven, let alone one as amazing as this. So thank you Agatha. You, Rio, and Wanda have all been a blessing. I was born to magic-less parents so I’ve never had a coven or a sense of community. Thank you for giving me that Agatha.” Lily told Agatha honestly as she squeezed her hand.

Jen walks back up the steps and paused in front of the two women. She looked down at them and smiled softly at them. “You okay Agatha?”

“Yeah, I’m okay. Rio and Wanda kicked me out for a minute. Thank you.” Agatha told Jen with a smile.

“Okay, just know we are here for you.” Jen said as she leaned down a softly squeezed Agatha’s shoulder before walking back into the house.

‘Lilia wants permission to use your name in a spell to help us find everything we will need.’

‘Go for it.’ Agatha said in her mind then audibly sighed. She wanted this to be over with.

“Maybe that makes us kindred spirits Lily, minus the emotional trauma. Neither of us had a community that understood us, now we have this whole group of people who care and understand. Thank you Lily, you’ve given me prospective and I really appreciate that.” Agatha said as she leaned her head on Lily’s shoulder.

“Thanks for being so welcoming. You didn’t have to be.”

“I knew Wanda was head over heels for you before the first date. All that’s ever mattered to me is that she found someone to love. She’s been my bestfriend, sister, and rock for so long that I wanted her to find someone who would love her just as deeply as she’s loved me. It’s not the same kind of love, yours will be much deeper and extraordinarily passionate. She deserves someone like you, after taking care of me for so long.” Agatha said in a watery tone that told Lily she was being extra vulnerable.

“Stop feeling like a burden. Not once has Wanda even remotely expressed that you are one to her. She loves you so much, you two have been each other’s lifelines for so long that I understand how deep the tether goes. You know the other day, after you gave us those harnesses? I made her text you, just in case you’d need her. Because I know how important it is to have someone on standby. You aren’t a burden to her, or even me. You are our friend.” Lily reassured as she squeezed Agatha’s hand and let her have a moment.

“Thank you Lily. You really are a blessing.” Agatha said with a sigh. A moment later Rio walked out the front door carrying a box.

“I think we found everything.” Rio said honestly before she looked down at the two. “But you should do a summoning spell just in case my love.”

“I can do that. Lily has made me feel a lot better about being here.” Agatha said as she let go of Lily’s hand. “Thank you Lily.”

Agatha walked back into the house and made her way into the living room and took a deep breath. She held her hands out and started the incantation. “id quod meum nomen et consilium voco. id quod meum nomen et consilium voco. id quod meum nomen et consilium voco.” Then a long moment passed and nothing happened. Agatha sighed. Then with a flash of purple magic a singular envelope settled on the coffee table with her name on it. Agatha picked it up and looked at it incredulously.

“What is that?” Rio asked.

“I have no clue. It’s not in Evanora’s handwriting.” Agatha said as she flipped it over and opened it.

Agatha Lynn Harkness,

Did you know you were named after me? I’m sad I’ll never get to meet you. Your mother had you far too late in my life for me to be present. I wish I would’ve gotten to meet you. I wonder what you’ll look like. Grandparents always wonder what their grandchildren will look like. Honestly I’m not sure you will ever exist. I’m writing this letter to make myself feel better about my own mortality.

I’m giving it to your mother on my death bed. I told her she could read it any time she missed me. Will you have raven hair like Evanora and I or will you be something completely different? I hope my piercing blue eyes manage to make it though. They were the one thing I was happiest about giving Evanora. I’ve always prided myself in having them.

Will you be a great illusionist like your mother? Or something even more outstanding? Our family’s magic is so strong and deep rooted I have no doubt you’ll be an amazing witch. Just know, that no matter what you become I would be proud of you. Even if that meant you had no magic at all. Non magic users run in this family, I would’ve loved to have been your grandmother. I’m sorry I couldn’t hold out for you. Just know that I would’ve loved you more than anything on this planet.

Love, your grandmother Agatha Lynn Harkness.

Agatha felt tears well up and a lump form in her throat. Her mother knew she could’ve been magic-less. Her body started to shake with anger as she felt Rio place a soft hand on her shoulder.

“It’s okay, what does it say.” Rio said softly. Agatha handed Rio the letter and let her read it. Rio folded the letter up and handed it back to Agatha.

“We will talk to Violet about that later. Now…. Did she value anything other than her trophy’s? Fine China? A favorite item of hers?” Rio asked.

“She loved her wardrobe.” Agatha said with a huff.

“Good. Let’s go get some and burn them. Rio said with a smile.

“Why are we burning clothing?” Jen asked in a concerned tone.

“To make Agatha feel better.”

“I hope her wardrobe is atrocious then. Or I might cry.” Jen said honestly, before she carried another box over to the front door.

“Oh yeah, it’s not your asthetic at all Jen. Don’t worry.” Agatha joked as she took Rio’s hand and made her way toward Evanora’s bedroom. Agatha walked in and looked at the room. It was immaculate and tidy, the woman never left her bed unmade. So Agatha wasn’t shocked. The last time she was allowed in this room she was 2 and honestly she felt like she could vomit. She walked over to the walk in closet and turned on the light. Proudly displayed in a case was her illusionist costume she used for competitions.

“Oh yeah, we are burning that.” Rio said with a grin as she walked over to the cabinet and opened it. Agatha rolled her eyes softly at Rio before smiling at the woman.

“Careful she might have some protection spells on it.” Agatha said as she waved her hand and eliminated the protection spells.

“I wasn’t worried about an illusionist witch’s protection spells. The worst they would’ve done is give me frizzy hair for a week.” Rio joked as she grabbed the outfit and turned toward Agatha. “Donating the rest of this to the fire department to see how each clothing item burns?” Rio asked.

“Not a bad idea. I need to call them still. Did Lilia find the deed?” Agatha asked.

“Yep. It’s in a folder in the passenger seat.” Rio answered as she walked toward Agatha and they exited the closet.

“Maybe we will go over there and talk to them in person.” Agatha suggested as they left the bedroom.

“Not a bad idea. We can talk to the coven and see what they want to do.” Rio suggested as they made their way toward the living room where everyone was waiting.

“Got the trophy’s, and all the paperwork with your name on it packed up into my car.” Wanda said with a smile.

“You guys go on and head home. I think we are going to stop at the fire department and get that sorted out.” Agatha said with a smile. “ I appreciate you guys.”

“We can go with you if you need us to?” Alice offered knowing they’d be more inclined to listen if a police officer was with Agatha.

“Nah, I’m just going to have a conversation with them to see if it’s something they’d want. If not I’m calling a demolition team and having it tore down after having someone deal with the estate. Like selling all the items in the house or donating them.” Agatha reassured Alice.

“Alright sounds good. We will see you in a couple hours.” Wanda said as she ushered Lily, Jen and Alice out the door.

“Are you two okay with us going to the fire department?” Agatha asked Lilia and Rita.

“That’s fine. Lets go.” Lilia answered.

“I’ve got all day sweetie. No rush.” Rita agreed. Agatha smiled and they all headed for the door. Once everyone was out of the house they locked the door and headed to the fire department.

Agatha and Rio got out of the car and headed into the fire department and asked for their chief. “Hello, my name is Agatha Harkness, and I’d like to donate a property to you once I have completed taking care of items inside.”

“Are you sure? We will most likely be destroying the home?” The chief asked.

“That would be ideal. I’d love to see it go up in flames. So once you are done training I want to be there when you burn it to the ground.” Agatha told him, he had the decency to not look shocked.

“We can do that, come back once everything is out and we will start using it for training purposes. Just give us a call or stop in once everything is taken care of. Are you sure you don’t want to sell the property instead? Make some money off it? Not that I wouldn’t complain about a chance to train my crew.”

“I never want a child raised in those walls ever again. If I knew I could get away with it I’d burn it down myself. But I know I can’t. So I’m doing the next best thing, giving it to someone who can use it to help save countless lives.” Agatha explained.

“Alright, I’ll get you my card and you can call me whenever you are ready for it to change hands.” The chief said as he pulled a card from the desk next to him and handed it over to her.

“Thank you. I’ll be in contact with you over the next week or so.” Agatha said with a smile.

“Thank you Ma’am have a lovely day.” The man said to her before they turned around and walked out. They got in the car and Agatha sighed.

“How did it go?” Rita asked.

“Well they will take it but we gotta call a service to clean everything out first. I’ll call places through out the week and have things donated and cleared out. Once it’s taken care of we can donate the house and I can close this chapter of my life.” Agatha said as she started the car.

“Sounds wonderful. Now let’s head home. I think Wanda said something about buying baseball bats on her way back to your place.” Lilia said as Agatha pulled out of the parking lot.

“Hopefully she gets more than one.” Agatha said as she started driving.

An hour and forty minutes later they pulled into Agatha’s driveway and she sighed loudly as she parked the car.

“Are you okay sweetheart?” Rita asked.

“Yeah, I’m fine. I’m just glad I never have to set foot in that hell hole ever again.” Agatha said honestly.

“Exactly, now let’s head inside. I think Wanda’s already in the back yard setting things up.” Rio said to the group.

“She texted you didn’t she?” Agatha asked before getting out of the car.

“Of course she did.” Rio answered before Agatha shut the door. The rest of the women got out of the car and headed through the house and out the back door. Wanda had pulled lawn chairs out onto the patio and had all of Evanora’s trophy’s set up with a couple baseball bats, a broom and the trashcan next to it.

“At least the chaos which had a plan to clean up as well.” Lilia said with a scoff.

“Are we having wine as well?” Jen asked the group of women.

“We can, you can’t.” Lilia said not realizing until it was too late.

“Last I checked I was an adult and could have wine whenever I wanted Lilia.” Jen snarked causing Rita to look at Lilia with an exasperated face.

“Yes, you are. But the child you are carrying cannot. Alice got you pregnant Friday night.” Lilia said with a huff as she rolled her eyes. “Not exactly the way the coven was supposed to find out. But I suppose there’s no point in lying about it.”

“I’m pregnant?! How am I pregnant? That’s not how this works!” Jen said in a confused tone.

“Did you two use magic while having sex? For example, fingering with magic on their fingertips?” Rita asked.

“That’s not how this works is it? Is it?!?” Alice asked.

“Well it’s that and the intention…. Anything sticking out in either of your minds. Maybe a few phrases that might make sense?” Lilia teased causing both women to blush.

“Exactly. Now. I know you two weren’t exactly raised and educated about these sorts of things but Intention did a lot of the heavy lifting. Someone wanted to get you pregnant, and you wanted someone to get you pregnant. The need to be possessive also didn’t help either of your cases.” Rita said honestly.

“No wine or sushi for 9 months.” Jen said sadly. Wanda and Agatha had very different reactions to this revelation. Wanda looked over at Lily with a pointed look that said ‘not yet’ and Agatha looked over at Jen with a bright smile.

“Well that’s so exciting! I’m so happy for you two! If that’s what you want. Otherwise we can head to the clinic tomorrow and get this sorted. Either way. I support you.” Agatha said honestly.

“Agatha!” Lilia and Rita scolded.

“What? My friend comes first. I don’t want her having a child she won’t love.” Agatha told the group, the realization of Agatha’s words hitting them all. Every single one of the women in the group realized that she wished her mother had aborted her instead of keeping her. Even if none of them agreed with the idea they would have to support Jen if that’s what she wanted.

“I’m keeping my child, but thank you for being supportive Agatha. I appreciate it more than you know.” Jen told her friend as she walked over to her and then hugged her. “For the record I’m glad you exist.” Jen whispered softly just to Agatha.

“Good! I’m so excited to have a little cute witchlett running around!” Agatha said as she let Jen go, completely ignoring her friend’s comment. “Now let’s destroy some shit.”

“Sounds like a good idea!” Alice said as she handed Agatha a bat. Agatha walked over to the largest trophy and reeled back before she swung as hard as she could. The petal of the trophy dented and a loud clang rang through the air.

“Honestly, I didn’t expect it to be solid metal.” Wanda said with a chuckle.

“Neither did I. But that was the heaviest one.” Lilia said pointing at the trophy.

“Honestly, Wanda grab another bat and help me with this. Let’s both get some anger out.” Agatha told her best friend who giddily grabbed the second baseball bat and took all her energy and swung at the trophy. Another loud clang rang out as Wanda left a decent dent in it. Both women started swinging together until the cup was a large dented mess on the patio.

“I feel better.” Agatha said in a winded tone before looking over at Wanda. “Do you feel better?”

“Fuck yeah I feel better! I’ve wanted to take a bat to this fucking trophy since the day she brought it home!” Wanda said with a smile and equally winded tone.

“Remind me to never piss off my girlfriend.” Lily said to Rio in a slightly scared yet impressed tone.

“Remind me to never piss off my fiancé.” Rio said back to Lily in a flat out impressed tone.

“I’ll remind you both.” Jen said honestly.

“Thanks.” Lily and Rio said in unison.

“I kinda want to use the rest of these as magical target practice.” Agatha said as she looked at Wanda.

“We can do that! That sounds fun!” Wanda said excitedly.

“Should we get some wine and watch them or…?” Lilia asked.

“Or?” Rita asked.

“Leave them out here and order some pizza until they are done burning off their anger and energy?” Lilia asked.

“Not a bad idea honestly.” Alice said as she watched the two women set up the trophy’s before they started blasting them with magical pure energy.

“Yeah let’s get me out of the blast zone.” Jen said as she headed toward the house.

“Great idea.” Lilia, Alice and Rita said in unison.

“You two stay here and watch your partners do whatever they are doing and make sure they don’t destroy the neighborhood.” Rita instructed. “We will go inside and order pizza.”

“Ham and pineapple for Agatha.” Rio told her mother.

“And Wanda.” Lily added.

“Those two are peas in a pod.” Lilia said as she guided the women into the house once everyone was inside and settled into the living room Rita looked over at Jen.

“Sorry my tactless best friend ruined you finding out you are pregnant.” Rita told Jen.

“I have tact, you bitch.” Lilia said with a huff.

“It’s fine. I like wine. So I’m glad she said something. I don’t want a child with fetal alcohol syndrome. So I really appreciate knowing as soon as possible. Thank you Lilia.” Jen said appreciatively.

“You’re welcome.” Lilia said in a smug tone directed at Rita.

“So… can I ask how my mother is going to react to this information?” Alice asked.

“She’s going to be ecstatic about finally getting a grandchild from you two.” Lilia answered Alice.

“Good. I was worried.” Alice said with a sigh.

“Yeah, don’t stress too much. Now let’s order food… Wait… What pizza place do they order from?” Rita said with a pause.

“I’ll order. Don’t you two live like 8 hours away?” Jen asked.

“Yeah we do. Don’t ask me why my daughter moved here. I’ll never know for the life of me! But I am so thankful she did.” Rita told the two women as Jen started ordering pizza.

“What will you two eat?” Jen asked.

“Meat lovers.” Lilia and Rita said in unison.

“You two are also peas in a pod.” Alice said with a chuckle.

“Order pepperoni for Rio and Lily. They both like that.” Lilia told Jen who gave her a thumbs up before she finished ordering their food.

“Alright I’m ordering. It should be here in the next hour or so.” Jen said. They all settled comfortably into the couch. They were all just happy to relax after the day they had.

Chapter 34

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Agatha and Wanda were still busy causing chaos in the backyard with Evanora’s trophy’s when the pizza arrived. Alice popped her head out the back door and yelled for them. “Hey! Food is here! Take a break ladies!”

Agatha and Wanda looked at each other and then at the mess they had created and sighed realizing they had made a big one. “Let us clean up and we will be in, in a second.” Agatha said as she started picking up the larger pieces of plastic.

“We can help with that part.” Rio said as she grabbed the broom and dustpan.

“Give me the broom Rio.” Lily said as she held her hand out. Rio handed her the broom and they started sweeping up bits and pieces of trophy. The large metal one was picked up by Agatha and tossed straight into the trashcan before Rio and Lily started dumping the debris out into the can.

Ten minutes later the mess was cleaned and they headed inside. Rita, Lilia, Alice and Jen were chatting.

“We are not hyphenating this child’s name. Kale-Wu-Gulliver is too much.” Alice said with a laugh.

“When you say it like that Alice I’m inclined to agree.” Jen said as the other four women walked into the room.

“I think Alice should take your last name, and so should the baby Jen.” Agatha said as she sat down in the L of the couch.

“Why’s that?” Jen asked.

“Only fair that the one growing the child gives it it’s name sake.” Agatha explained.

“Not a bad idea. Honestly no offense to my mother but she didn’t think about how often I’d be racially profiled for my last name anyway. Then how much I’d be harassed bc I was her daughter. So maybe when we get married I’ll just become a Kale as well.” Alice said with a smile as she looked at Jen with so much love and adoration.

“Gross, get a room.” Wanda joked as she grabbed a paper plate and started opening boxes.

“I’d tell you to eat a dick Maximoff but it seems you prefer pussy anyway.” Jen jabbed back.

“Can’t even argue with that. Because that’s always been the preference.” Wanda said before she opened the box of ham and pineapple. “Fuck yeah! Ham and pineapple!” She grabbed two slices and threw them on the plate and handed it to Agatha before grabbing a couple for herself.

“Thank you Wanda.”

“Okay how come Agatha gets served?” Lily said with a pout.

“Because she likes the same thing I do. What do you want babe?” Wanda asked as she handed Lily her plate and grabbed another.

“Pepperoni is fine.” Lily told Wanda who opened the box of pepperoni and got Lily two slices and handed her the plate.

“Rio?” Wanda asked.

“I can get my own food.” Rio told Wanda. Who gave her a pointed look.

“Pepperoni.” Agatha answered, for Rio which caused her to make an indignant sound. Wanda grabbed a couple slices for her and handed the plate to Rio.

“Anyone else?” Wanda joked as she looked at the other women already eating their pizza.

“So what did you guys talk about while we destroyed shit?” Agatha asked.

“Mostly how my mother’s going to react to becoming a grandma and baby stuff.” Alice told Agatha.

“Lorna is gunna be on the moon. I remember an interview she did 3 years ago about wanting to retire and how the only thing stopping her was that she wasn’t a grandma.” Lily said with a smile.

“Wait… what?!” Alice asked.

“You don’t watch your mom’s interviews?” Lily asked. “Here one second. Let me get my phone. I think it was a late night talk show. I’m sure there’s a Reddit post or YouTube clip.” Lily said as she summoned her phone and started looking for the video.

“If I watched all of my mother’s interviews, I’d have no time for a real life.” Alice joked.

“Found it! Here!” Lily said as she turned the volume up and handed her the phone. Then she picked up her pizza and started eating.

“Tonight we have with us special guest, pop icon, witch, and everyone’s favorite diva! Lorna Wu!” The host announced.

“Thank you for having me, it’s such an honor to be here.” Lorna said politely. Alice and Jen were watching the interview but everyone else could hear it.

“So Lorna, you’ve been touring for the better part of 60 years, which seems like nothing for a witch like you, but retirement has gotta be something that’s been on your mind right?” The host asked her.

“Oh, starting with the hard questions right off the bat I see! Retirement has been a thought lately, but it’s hard to justify. I took a break when my daughter was born, you all know that. I think I’d officially retire if I were ever given a grandchild. Not that my daughter or her life partner need to have children. But it would be nice!” Lorna explained to the host.

“I don’t know how witches mature, is your daughter even old enough to have kids?” The host asked politely.

“Yes. Her and her partner are. We age normally like humans do until around 25 then our body starts slowing down. So she could realistically give me a grandchild at any point. But again no rush. She probably won’t even see this interview. She’s so busy serving and protecting the community. I really am so proud of her for picking such a noble career.” Lorna explained and Alice paused the video.

“We should just send her this with the message ‘happy retirement Grandma.’ And see what she says.” Alice joked.

“I’d rather tell her in person.” Jen said with a smile.

“I can’t believe you two haven’t seen that. Also… what kind of friends do you have that no one sent you this when it happened?” Lily asked.

“Normal ones who aren’t obsessed with my mom. Plus I don’t tell people I’m her daughter often. So unless you are stalking her or me you’d never know I’m her daughter.” Alice explained.

“Fair. Well you’ve seen it now. And I’ll keep an eye out for any more interesting interviews that may pop up just for you guys.” Lily said before she went back to eating.

“Don’t tell us, but do you know the gender Lilia?” Wanda asked.

“No, only because I haven’t touched Jen yet. If they want to know I can tell them but I’d have to touch one of them. I just know she’s pregnant.”

“Okay, now I gotta ask. Why were you late this morning?” Agatha asked.

“Ask after Rita and Lilia leave.” Jen said with a blush.

“We are all adults here, you can say it. I know what my hormones did to me when I was pregnant with Rio.” Rita said with a smile.

“Fine, I’m sorry Agatha but this is technically your fault. Alice can tell when I’m horny now and took care of me before we left the house this morning.” Jen answered with a huff.

“Thank you Agatha.” Alice said with a bright smile, causing Jen to sink deeper into her seat in embarrassment. Which caused Agatha to laugh at Jen.

“I hate you both.” Jen said in an annoyed tone.

“I love you too.” Agatha said after she finished laughing.

“Are we burning that bitches outfit tonight?” Lilia asked changing the subject.

“Yeah at some point, got a hot date Lilia?” Rio asked.

“No, I was just curious, and I was trying to save Jen.” Lilia said with a laugh.

“I appreciate it. How about we get you ladies some wine, and me a water and head back outside after eating and we can burn her outfit.” Jen offered.

“Sounds fantastic. I’ll get you some non alcoholic wine for the next coven meeting Jen.” Wanda said with a smile before the women settled into a comfortable silence to finish eating their pizza.

Twenty minutes later the women were all sitting around the fire pit with their wine and water. Agatha poured some lighter fluid onto the costume and lit a match before dropping it onto the costume. It went up in flames with a loud ‘whoosh’. Agatha then went over and settled on the ground next to Rio’s chair.

“You can sit in my lap babe.” Rio offered.

“I don’t think the chair can hold both our weights. I’m fine right here.” Agatha said as she leaned against Rio’s knee as she watched the outfit burn.

“How are you feeling after today?” Rio asked softly as she ran her fingers through Agatha’s long hair.

“Loved.” Agatha answered as she closed her eyes and hummed softly.

“Gross, you two are adorable.” Jen said with a sneer and a smile.

“Not justifying that with a response Jen.” Agatha said with a sigh as she just enjoyed this moment of comfort with her partner.

“Once that’s done burning Rita and I should be headed home. I have a meeting with the CDC in the morning I cannot miss.” Lilia said in a slightly irritated tone.

“I’ll take you home. Let’s go.” Rita said with a sigh as she stood up.

“Fine! Thank you for the lovely company ladies. Sorry for ruining the surprise Jen and Alice. Congratulations on the little bundle of joy.” Lilia said with a smile.

“Thank you for telling us, honestly it’s much appreciated. Oh, also you are invited to the baby shower when we get that far.” Jen said to the woman.

“Have a great night.” Agatha said good bye to the women.

“You think you are getting away with not giving me a hug?” Rita scolded as she stood in front of Agatha who just smiled and stood up.

“I don’t think I’ll ever get away with that Rita. Thank you for being here today I appreciate you.” Agatha said as she hugged the woman.

“Thank you for existing. You are one of my greatest blessings.” Rita said honestly before she pulled back and gave Agatha a kiss on the cheek. “Now, keep her out of trouble and I’ll see you two next week for dinner.”

“She’s been the one keeping me out of trouble. Without Rio and you guys I would’ve done some dumb things today. Especially if it had just been Wanda and I.” Agatha said honestly.

“You’re smarter than that witchlett. Goodnight.” Lilia said honesty as Rita let Agatha go and Lilia moved in to give her a hug.

“You too Lilia?” Agatha asked as she hugged her.

“Of course! You deserve all the love. Now have a goodnight.” Lilia said as she squeezed Agatha tight before letting her go. Rita and Lilia made their way back into the house and to the portal.

“I cannot believe you got me pregnant!” Jen scolded Alice once the women disappeared into the house.

“Not like you were fucking complaining!” Alice sassed back.

“There it is!” Wanda said with an excited tone. “So tell me, how does one conceive magically?”

“Wanda, I don’t know if I want to know right now.” Agatha told her friend.

“Yeah, don’t give me any ideas babe.” Lily said with a smirk causing Wanda to look at Lily with a panicked face.

“Nevermind. I’m good, don’t tell us.” Wanda said back tracking, she wasn’t exactly ready for kids.

“It’s official I love you Lily.” Jen said as she took a drink of her water.

“I don’t like being ganged up on.” Wanda said sadly, still feeling a little dread.

“You will live.” Rio promised as Agatha dragged a chair over to Rio and sat down next to her.

“Wait until it’s your turn Vidal!” Wanda said with a glare.

“Yeah. I’m safe. I’m well behaved compared to you. But I think I know how they managed to do it.” Rio told the group.

“Lilia said it was about intention, that’s all I’m going to say.” Jen told the group.

“Y’all are into some kinky shit aren’t you?” Wanda teased, the chaos witch in her unable to help herself.

“What? No! Not like that. It was more like ‘I wish I could get you pregnant.’ And ‘well we could always give it the old college try.’ As a joke.” Alice said with a huff.

“Oh… so this really was but wasn’t intentional.” Lily said with an amused tone.

“Yeah. Like one of those lesbian jokes. ‘It wasn’t for my lack of trying!’ Because I’m always trying.” Alice explained causing Jen to blush and hide behind her hands.

“Please stop. I don’t want these women knowing how our child was conceived. They will never let it die.” Jen mumbled into her hands.

“We literally will never give you shit about it after the child gets here. Promise.” Wanda said honestly.

“Or until one of us gets pregnant.” Lily said with a smirk.

“Please, I know you are mostly joking babe. But I am not ready for kids right now. I want to enjoy my time with you for a little while. Maybe a year after we get married?” Wanda offered trying to placate Lily.

“I just have to put you in your place, I promise I won’t get you pregnant. Yet. But Alice I do want your phone number before you leave.” Lily requested.

“I think I can do that.” Alice said with a wink.

“You two have been awfully quiet.” Jen said pointing at Agatha and Rio.

“I’m just enjoying the commentary.” Agatha said with a smile.

“And I personally am just trying to figure out how long I need to wait before she doesn’t kill me if I get her pregnant.” Rio said honestly.

“I’d like to be married first.” Agatha told Rio.

“I think I can handle that my love.” Rio said softly before she turned and gave Agatha a kiss on the cheek.

“Thank you, I want kids. I really do. But I also want to enjoy our time together and establish a life together before we take that step. Plus I don’t want to be building a house while pregnant. Sounds like a bad idea.” Agatha clarified.

“Sounds perfect. Also do we want to throw a couple logs in the fire pit and have a little bon fire or do we want to go back into the house?” Rio asked.

“I think it’s time we head home. Alice has to work tomorrow. The shop needs opened tomorrow, and I am kind of emotionally exhausted.” Jen told them honestly.

“That’s fair. I get it. Thank you for coming with us today.” Agatha said as she stood up and magically snuffed the fire. Alice stood up and helped Jen stand before she started heading toward the house. Wanda and Lily followed suit and they all made their way inside.

“Take your pizza with you please.” Agatha requested. Alice walked over and picked up the veggie pizza before heading toward the door.

“Have a goodnight, see you soon. Don’t be a stranger.” Alice said as she hugged Agatha.

“Thanks for ordering food while I got my anger out.” Agatha said as she let Alice go and then gave Jen a hug. “Go rest you deserve it.”

“I think we will head home as well. Give you two time to decompress.” Wanda said as she and Lily headed out the door.

“Thanks I appreciate it.” Agatha said before she shut the door and sighed loudly. Rio was in the living room collecting things and condensing the pizza into one box so she could put it in the fridge. Agatha met her in the hallway and gave her a kiss on the lips before she made her way into the kitchen.

“I think I need a stronger drink than wine.” Agatha said with a sigh as she followed Rio into the kitchen.

“Do you have something stronger than wine?” Rio asked as she put the pizza in the fridge.

“Yeah. Vodka.” Agatha said as she opened the freezer and pulled out the bottle of top shelf vodka and then opened the bottle and set it on the countertop before grabbing orange juice and grenadine out of the fridge. She then magicked a large glass onto the countertop and made herself a strong drink.

“Do you want one?” Agatha asked.

“Nah. I’m okay I’ll stick to wine.” Rio said with a soft smile as she waited for Agatha to finish making her drink. “Let’s head into the living room and cuddle.” Rio suggested as Agatha put everything away and grabbed her glass.

“Great idea. Because tomorrow is going to be a day of phone calls I can just feel it.” Agatha said as they made their way to the couch. As soon as they sat down Violet popped into the room.

“Finally! I thought they’d never leave!” Violet said as she plopped down on the couch.

“Really? And why are you here?” Agatha asked before she took a long drink of her cocktail.

“Well… Gaia informed me you found Agatha’s letter to you.” Violet answered.

“Yes.” Agatha said flatly. She was running out of emotions.

“Would you like to meet her?” Violet asked.

“I’m not sure how to answer that question right now.” Agatha told Violet.

“That is completely fair. But she would like to meet you, whenever you are ready.” Violet told Agatha.

“How would that even work?” Agatha asked. Trying to understand how she would meet someone that died long before she was ever born.

“Well you have proven yourself powerful enough to handle visiting my domain. I’d invite you and her for tea. Rio as well. It’s really not that complicated. Plus you’d get to meet Rosaline.”

“Do the rules even apply to us anymore?” Rio asked.

“Have they ever?” Violet asked.

“I used to think they did.” Agatha answered.

“You are a spirit witch. They never really applied to you. You are next in line as Death, I can make whatever rules I want for you. Now that Agatha is here at least.” Violet said. Agatha sighed and tapped her necklace three times.

“Yes witchlett?” Gaia said as she popped into the living room.

“Is Violet fucking with us?” Agatha asked.

“No? Not that I’m aware of, but I guess I need some clarification.”

“Can I really meet my grandmother?” Agatha asked.

“Yes. You can. If that’s what you want. We can’t bring her here, but we can bring you to her if you’d like.” Gaia explained to Agatha as she sat down on the couch next to the young woman.

“Does she want to see me? Does she want to meet me?” Agatha asked.

“More than anything Witchlett. She would love to meet you. She’s nothing like your horrible birth giver I promise.”

“Okay. Today has been a long day. Maybe tomorrow.” Agatha said as she leaned back into the couch and took another sip of her drink.

“That’s fine, we can get it sorted out tomorrow.” Gaia reassured.

“Yes, absolutely no rush. She’s waited this long. She can wait a little longer.” Violet reassured.

“Okay. Let me think about it. I still have to deal with Evanora’s estate, and all that mess.” Agatha said with a huff as she took another sip.

“I’ll be here to help you babe.” Rio reassured.

“Yeah but you have an interview on Tuesday and will hopefully hire her.” Agatha clarified.

“Lilia said she’s the one for the job but she’s young and I want her to feel like she’s earned it.” Rio explained.

“Rowen will show up later this week as well.” Gaia explained.

“Thank you! I am hoping we can get them set up in the next few weeks so I can take Saturdays off with Agatha.” Rio said appreciatively.

“Everything should settle down soon. Until Jen and Alice have their child at least. Then things might get a little chaotic again but not in a bad way.” Gaia reassured.

“You need a coven to raise a child so I get it.” Agatha said with a smile.

“Can you bless me with the ability to not get pregnant until after Rio and I get married?” Agatha asked Gaia.

“If that’s what you want.” Gaia offered.

“Maybe we should ask for the blessing for Wanda also.” Rio suggested.

“Where’s the fun in that?” Agatha asked with a chuckle.

“If you don’t you’ll be an auntie sooner than you want to be.” Gaia.

“Please bless Wanda as well. I’m not in the mood for all that. A pregnant Wanda sounds unfun.” Agatha said honestly.

“Then it shall be. Now, Violet, why don’t you come back over tomorrow around 2:30?” Gaia requested.

“I can do that, I can feel the body’s piling up again. You know how it is. Nobody waits for death, death waits for you. Alright ladies, have a good night. Love you!” Violet said before disappearing again.

“Has she always been like that?” Rio asked.

“Yes.” Gaia said flatly.

“Alright do you need anything else Witchlett? You and Wanda have been blessed, so you don’t have to worry about children for a minute. If you change your mind you know how to get ahold of me.” Gaia told the two women. “Now I’m going to go home, you two try to relax. I love you both. Have a great night girls.”

“Should we text Wanda and let her know?” Rio asked.

“You can if you want. I just want to get drunk and cuddle with you.” Agatha said honestly as she scooted closer to Rio and threw her legs over Rio’s lap.

“Sounds like a perfect way to end the night. But first, check in? How are you doing my love?” Rio asked.

“Fine. It’s finally setting in that she’s dead. That I never have to deal with this ever again if I don’t want to. I could just let that house rot. But I want it to be useful.” Agatha said honestly.

“That’s admirable my love, but I want you to take care of your mental health as well. So maybe we hire a company to handle the rest?”

“Yeah I’ll be doing that in the morning, definitely making a few phone calls first thing. Maybe I’ll text Pepper and ask her for help.” Agatha said as she magicked her phone into her hand.

Agatha 6:45 p.m: what company do you recommend to clear out Evanora’s house?

Pepper 6:45 p.m: Depends on if you want things donated or destroyed.

Agatha 6:46 p.m: Donated.

Pepper 6:46 p.m: Hire a moving company and have them take it all to Habitat for Humanity.

Agatha 6:47 p.m: Thank you. Can I borrow a drone so I can have the key dropped off to the movers tomorrow?

Pepper 6:48 p.m: Tony is already contacting places for you, a drone will be there to scan the key in 5 minutes and we will make a copy here. Don’t worry about it. The house will be cleared out tonight.

Agatha sighed and decided to call Pepper. The phone rang once. “You really don’t have to do this.”

“Oh we insist!” Tony yelled from the background.

“See, I didn’t do it this time.” Pepper reassured.

“Fine. Honestly I don’t want to go back to that place until it’s time to burn it down.” Agatha said honestly

“Good the drone is at the front door.” Pepper said with a smile. Agatha sighed and got up and grabbed the key and walked to the front door to see an iron man suit standing on her front porch. She held the key out and it took it and scanned it before handing it back to her and flying off.

“Anything else?” Agatha asked.

“Yeah, how did it go?” Pepper asked.

“Went in, got all the documentation with my name on it, took her trophy’s from the house and her fucking show outfit and destroyed them. Then went and talked to the fire department. They will take the house once it’s empty.” Agatha explained.

“Perfect! The movers will be there in the next hour to start clearing things out, then they will drop everything off at habitat for humanity first thing in the morning.” Tony explained into the phone.

“You know I could’ve done this…” Agatha said with a sigh.

“Yeah but just because you could’ve doesn’t mean you have to! Let us help!” Tony said with an excited tone.

“Thank you. I appreciate you two so much.” Agatha said into the phone as she walked back over to the couch and settled against Rio’s side.

“Besides, I want you to go do something for you instead of stressing about this. Relax this week Agatha. It’s handled.” Pepper said into the phone.

“You two are ridiculous but I feel very loved and cared for.” Agatha told Pepper and Tony.

“Good! Because you are!” Tony told her.

“Yeah, what my husband said. Now go relax! I’ll call you if there’s any problems.” Pepper told Agatha.

“Yes boss lady, thank you.” Agatha joked. “Goodnight, I’ll call you two later this week.” Agatha told them.

“Goodnight Agatha.” Pepper and Tony said in unison before hanging up.

“You are so loved.” Rio said softly before she took Agatha’s phone out of her hand and took her face into her hands. She then brought her lips to Agatha’s and kissed her softly.

“I know. I never thought I’d be this loved but I don’t know what I would be doing right now if I wasn’t.” Agatha told Rio after the kiss.

“I guess it’s a good thing you’ll never have to find out.” Rio said before she kissed her again. Everything was going to be just fine, Agatha knew it and she was so happy with how her life was going. She just had to work on the next step which was buying that land and building a home for her and Rio.

“I’m buying that property tomorrow.” Agatha said with a smile before she rubbed her nose along Rio’s.

“If that’s what you want my love.” Rio said with a soft smile.

Chapter End Notes

1,002 of you have given me Kudos on this work and honestly I could cry tears of absolute joy at the overwhelming amount of love I have received! Thank you all from the bottom of my heart. I appreciate it more than you will ever know. 🥹

Chapter 35

Rio and Agatha spent all morning together in bed on Monday. They were content to just comfortably drift in and out of sleep until it was well past noon when Agatha finally stirred from her slumber. Rio was still sleeping peacefully next to her. Agatha kissed her cheek softly before placing a gentle hand on her face as well.

“Rio, my love. Violet will be here soon to harass us.” Agatha said softly.

“Nooo.” Rio whined as she wrapped her arms around Agatha and snuggled closer to her.

“My love. If you don’t get up soon there won’t be time for food before we travel.” Agatha whispered.

“I’d rather have you for breakfast anyway.” Rio said in an aroused tone.

“We have even less time for that darling.” Agatha said with a laugh.

“Unfair.” Rio grumbled out.

“After Violet shows up we can do whatever you want.” Agatha suggests.

“After we meet your grandmother.” Rio clarified before yawning.

“If she wants to meet me today.” Agatha told her.

“She’s waited forever. She wants to meet you. Do you want to shower?” Rio asked.

“Yeah, I do. Let’s go take one together. I think we have time for that at least.” Agatha said before she magicked her phone into her hand. It was past 1 p.m.

“What time is it?” Rio asked as Agatha tried to untangle herself from Rio.

“It’s half past one. Come on, let’s get up.” Agatha said as she finally managed to wiggle out of Rio’s grasp and head toward the bathroom. She magicked her pajama’s off before she made it through the doorway giving Rio a view of her figure on the way. Agatha could hear the exasperated groan come from Rio as she leaned over to turn on the shower.

“Come on Rio, we don’t have all day oh!” Agatha said before she was startled by Rio pressing her body into hers.

“Teleportation magic is much easier when you are motivated.” Rio whispered as she palmed Agatha’s ass. Agatha groaned as she started the shower and let it run before stepping into it.

“Rio…” Agatha softly scolded, they didn’t have time for this.

“Agatha…” Rio husked out full of desire and want as she watched Agatha step under the shower stream.

“If you are good, I’ll actually let you use the strap first tonight.” Agatha said as she wet her hair.

“And if I’m bad?” Rio asked stepping closer and palming Agatha’s breast softly, a barely audible moan leaving Agatha.

“I’ll tie you up and pin you to the bed and torture you. I’ll deny orgasms. I’ll kiss and touch you everywhere but where you want me.” Agatha explained in a tone that told Rio she wasn’t kidding. Rio stepped forward and gave Agatha a soft kiss on the lips.

“I’ll behave.” Rio lamented before stepping away.

Thirty minutes later both women were out of the shower and drying off. “You didn’t mean that did you?” Rio asked Agatha as she admired her body. Still damp from the shower. She could see beads of water in her hair that softly dripped onto her skin.

“Oh, I meant it my love. Don’t test me.” Agatha told Rio who had the sense to listen to Agatha. She sighed and walked into the closet to find an outfit for the day. She grabbed a pair of black jeans and a soft forest green t-shirt. She quickly threw a bra and under wear on before getting dressed the rest of the way. Agatha was already dressed when she walked back out of the closet.

“What would you like for breakfast my love?” Agatha asked as she magicked her phone into her hand and looked at the time before she sighed softly. “It’s almost two.” Agatha told Rio.

“Let’s just have cold pizza?” Rio asked. She wasn’t sure Agatha would agree to that but it was better than nothing at this point.

“Better than cereal I suppose.” Agatha mentioned before they made their way to the kitchen.

“Should we just call her early and get this over with?” Rio asked.

“Might as well.” Agatha mentioned as she pulled the pizza box out of the fridge and handed Rio a slice of pepperoni while she grabbed a slice of ham and pineapple pizza. Rio magicked her phone into her hand and found Death’s contact. There was a long pause and then they felt something shift in the room.

“Good morning sleepy heads.” Violet said with a smile as she propped herself up on the countertop.

“Good afternoon Violet.” Agatha answered.

“Hi grandma.” Rio said in a slightly disgruntled tone.

“Oh, don’t be like that Rio. You cause your own misery. You knew I was going to be popping in today. Don’t take your frustrations out on an old lady like me.” Violet told Rio.

“So how does this work?” Agatha asked Violet before taking a bite of her cold pizza.

“I spoke to Aggie, She’s at the cabin with Rosaline right now if you want to meet her. She is over the moon about you already. I just have to take your hands and we will go. But I really do recommend not moving much. It can be a little nauseating the first time. Which is why Rosaline has made some spearmint tea for you both. Just in case.” Violet explained to the two women. Rio stopped eating her pizza and set it back in the box before standing up.

“No point in eating if I’m going to want to throw it up.” Rio said honestly as she walked over to Violet. Agatha then set her pizza in the box and put it back in the fridge before she walked over to Violet and Rio.

“Fuck it. Let’s just go.” Agatha said as she took Rio’s hand. Violet put one hand on each woman’s shoulder and smiled at them.

“Hold on ladies. Try to not move much, and relax. The least resistance the better.” Violet said before she transported all three of them to her domain. Agatha and Rio felt the shift but the nausea didn’t come. Rio instantly felt an inner peace she had never experienced in her life, like she was finally where she was meant to be. Agatha could feel how calm Rio was, she looked over at Rio and smiled as a giggle bubbled up in her throat.

“Do you feel that?” Agatha asked with a bright smile on her face.

“Of course I do.” Rio said with a bright smile on her face, this place felt like their bond.

“Are you two okay?” Violet asked.

“We are great. Though you could’ve told us it would feel like our connection when we got here. It feels like we settled inside of our bond.” Agatha explained.

“Huh…. Never thought of it that way before.” Violet pondered before she turned around and they finally took in their surroundings. They were standing in a forest that reminded them of the forest the Cabin was in. A soft mist hung in the air that got heavier the farther out you looked; the distance seemed almost pure white. There was a cozy looking cabin settled amongst the trees, that Violet was walking toward. Agatha and Rio started walking toward the cabin, following Violet.

Once they were inside they could hear two women speaking softly but couldn’t make out what was being said. “Darling I’m home. I brought the girls.” Violet said into the cabin.

“We are in the dining room!” Rosaline yelled into the house. Agatha felt anxiety bubble up but it was quickly tamped down by Rio bringing her hand up to kiss the back of it softly. They followed Violet into the room and she stepped aside to give her wife a hug and a kiss which both women thought was endearing and sweet. Sitting at the table looking nothing like either women expected was a raven haired women with piercing blue eyes. Agatha half expected her grandmother to look exactly like her mother but instead was greeted with someone much softer.

“Hello Agatha, I’m your grandmother. It’s nice to finally meet you.” The woman said as she stood up. She looked young and happy, nothing like what Agatha was expecting.

“Before you ask, In death you get the body you were healthiest in.” Violet explained.

“Thank you. I was confused.” Agatha said honestly.

“I’ve been informed that my daughter was a wretched mother. I am sorry witchlett. If I had been around she wouldn’t have gotten away with any of that.” Aggie explained.

“At least I’m stronger for it. It sucked. I hated every moment of it. But it lead me to Rio, Wanda, My Coven, and being adopted by our Goddess Gaia.” Agatha explained.

“Come sit, come sit. No need to have this conversation standing.” Rosaline said with a bright smile, as she guided them over to the table.

“I’ll be back in a bit to take you girls home. Have a wonderful time.” Violet said before disappearing again.

“Do you ever get a full hour with her?” Agatha asked.

“Several most of the time. But people like dying.” Rosaline said with a shrug.

“So, tell grandma everything! You’re a spirit witch and a magnificent one at that from what I can see. But tell me about you sweetie!” Aggie requested.

“I graduated high school early, went to college and passed the bar at 24, started working hard and now I’m a partner at Stark Law Firm. I met Rio at her bookstore a few weeks ago and my life has been an absolute whirlwind ever since. I think it’s finally starting to calm down though.” Agatha explained.

“I knew you’d be intelligent! Passed the bar at 24! Magnificent! You are such a brilliant young woman. Most importantly you got my stunning blue eyes. I was hoping that wouldn’t get muddled along the line. Evanora’s never quite looked as bright. But yours shine brighter than the sky on a summer day!” Aggie complimented Agatha causing the woman to smile and look away, she was embarrassed by the genuine praise.

“I think they remind me of a peaceful spring fed lake that’s crystal clear but I’ve spent more time in forests than I should.” Rio told Aggie.

“I could see that. All I care about is how soft they are when the look at you Rio. That’s a look every grandparent wants to see on their grandchild’s face. One of pure adoration.” Aggie said with a smile.

“Stop I will actually cry.” Agatha told them as she felt tears well up in her eyes.

“No need for tear’s witchlett! It’s okay. I’m just happy you are happy.” Aggie told Agatha with a soft smile. “Now tell me all about you. Your favorite color, what you like doing in your free time, what is your best friend like because I’ve heard she’s a chaos witch. Everything you can.”

“My favorite color is purple, I love reading and cooking in my free time, and my best friend is a chaos witch. Her name is Wanda and she was until recently the best thing that had ever happened to me. That new honor goes to Rio. Because ever since she came into my life it’s been nothing but blessings.”

“I want to know how a chaos witch and a spirit witch become best friends.” Rosaline said with a smile.

“You scrape your knee in the middle of the school yard and she uses her magic to fix your boo-boo after her brother picks you up off the ground with his super speed. Then they convince you to come hang out at their house with their parents and you find out what love actually is at the age of 6.” Agatha explains. “She’s been my best friend ever since. Her and Pietro have been the best siblings a woman could ask for over the years. Their parents were also a blessing until we lost them.”

“Violet still feels bad about having to take them. She argued with Gaia on that one, but it was past their time. I’m sorry you three had to go through that.” Rosaline explained.

“Does she argue with my mother often?” Agatha asked.

“No, not at all. But she felt like leaving you three alone at the ages of seventeen and eighteen was utterly unfair.”

“It wasn’t exactly fair. But we managed. Life had never been fair for me though. I will tell Wanda that Death tried to fight Gaia for them though. She will appreciate it.” Agatha told Rosaline.

“I really didn’t want to take them. Even before I knew you were Rio’s bride. It hurt so much to see you three so broken. It’s the one thing I hate about this job.” Violet said popping back into the kitchen.

“It was a bad night. I don’t want to think about right now. It still hurts a little.” Agatha told her.

“Understandable. Now. I hate to be this person but I have to take you girls back home. Sorry Aggie. But I will definitely be giving you life updates whenever possible.” Violet told Agatha’s grandmother.

“Thats fine. Thank you for letting me meet her. It’s one of the greatest gifts I’ve ever received. Now I’m going to hug my granddaughter.” Aggie said as she stood up. Agatha stood up and walked over to the woman. Who pulled her into a tight embrace and held her for a long moment. “You are even more amazing than I could’ve ever imagined. I am so proud of you witchlett. Now go live your life and have a good time. I love you and I’ll see you here at the end.”

“I’m glad I finally got to meet someone in my family that would’ve actually loved me. Thank you.” Agatha said as she let the woman go. Rio walked over to Agatha and took her hand before Violet placed her hands on the girls shoulders and took them home.

“Wait! I didn’t get to say goodbye to Rosaline.” Rio said sadly.

“She knows you had to leave. If I had kept you any longer you two might have been stuck. I was really pushing it.” Violet said honestly.

“Gaia wouldn’t have let that happen.” Agatha said with a scoff.

“Probably not, but I don’t want to test her patience.” Violet said honestly. “Now, have a good rest of your day. I’ve got more bodies to collect.”

“You as well.” Agatha and Rio said in unison before Violet disappeared.

“I’m going to call the realtor and purchase that property. Then I’m going to call Tony and Pepper and ask them who they used to build their cabin.” Agatha said as she let Rio’s hand go and headed toward her office.

“Sounds good. Do you want company? I can grab a book and hang out on the couch in there.” Rio offered.

“Sounds wonderful, want to grab the pizza and a couple sodas for us as well? I also have to call the financial advisor.” Agatha said as she magicked her phone into her hand.

“Of course, I’ll be right with you once I get everything.” Rio said with a smile before she gave Agatha a soft kiss on the cheek. Agatha went into her office and called the financial advisor first, the phone rang once before someone picked up.

“Thank you for Calling Wicca and Co Financial advisors, who do I have the pleasure of speaking with today?” A woman asked.

“Agatha Harkness.” Agatha answered into the phone.

“One moment Ms. Harkness, let me transfer you to your advisor.” The woman said politely before the phone rang once and she was transferred over to another line.
