“To the bookstore?” Rio asked.

“To the bookstore. Let’s go make a portal home.” Agatha suggested as they got in the car. Ten minutes later they were parked behind the bookstore and getting out of the car. Rio unlocked the door and they headed inside.

“I’m going to set up this closet as the portal. Which door do you want me to use in the house?” Rio asked.

“My office door?” Agatha asked.

“That works alright let me set it up real quick and then I’ll teach you how to use it.” Rio said as she grabbed the door handle and created the portal with her intention and then opened the door to see Agatha’s living room swirling in the green. She then shut the door and opened it again to see the storage closet.

“Alright grab the door and imagine you are opening it into our living room.” Rio explained. Agatha grabbed the door handle and imagined opening the door into her living room and then opened the door to see her living room swirling in a green portal door.

“Good job babe! Step through!” Rio encouraged and Agatha did then she turned around and walked back into the book store.

“That was surprisingly easy.” Agatha told Rio.

“For you maybe. It took me three weeks to be able to get the portal to open for me the first time I learned. Momma had to do it for me for a long time.” Rio explained.

“Sorry my love.” Agatha said as she walked over to Rio and placed a soft kiss on her lips.

“It’s fine. Close the portal and we will drive home. Unless you want a car here tomorrow just in case we need to leave?” Rio asked.

“Probably should leave a car here eventually but no we can drive home tonight. I don’t think I’ll need to go anywhere.” Agatha explained. “Plus the portal is here so we can always get a car at any point.”

“True. Alright let’s head home and cuddle on the couch until we get tired. I have an interview tomorrow with Sage.” Rio said softly before she kissed Agatha again.

“Sounds like a wonderful idea.” Agatha said after the kiss. “Maybe we can fool around some more.”

“Maybe.” Rio said softly before she headed toward the back door and they made their way back to the car after arming the security system and locking the door.

Chapter End Notes

Next chapter is a 6 month time jump.

Chapter 37

Six months later Agatha was in the middle of setting up for a case when her phone rang. She grabbed it and answered. “Agatha Harkness, how may I assist you?” Agatha asked into the phone.

“Hello Miss Harkness, it’s the chief down at the fire station in Salem. We are ready to burn down the house. Would you like to be there for it?” The chief asked.

“Yes I would.” Agatha said into the phone.

“I heard why we are burning the home down from a friend. I wanna schedule this. How about Saturday Morning?” The man offered to Agatha.

“Saturday is perfect. Do you have a time you think your team will be starting?” Agatha asked.

“10 a.m. ma’am.”

“I’ll be there at 9:45 just to make sure I get a good seat.” Agatha told the man.

“Sounds good. See you then.” The man said into the phone.

“Thank you.” Agatha said appreciatively before hanging up.

‘They wanna burn it down Saturday.’ Agatha thought softly to Rio.

‘Let me see if Sage or Rowen wants to work on Saturday.’ Rio thought back before going quiet.

“I better get this case wrapped up soon because I’m not missing this.” Agatha said out loud before she walked over to her office door and opened it. “Tricia. Call Pepper for me please. See if she’s got time for me.”

“Yes Ms. Harkness.” Tricia said before she pressed a couple buttons on her phone and it rang.

“Timothy, is Mrs. Potts available to speak with Ms. Harkness?” Tricia asked into the phone and then there was a long pause. “Thank you.” Tricia said into the phone before hanging up.

“Yes you can go on up and speak to her.” Tricia said to Agatha who smiled at her appreciatively.

“Thank you. I’ll be back down soon.” Agatha said before walking off toward the elevator. Agatha stepped onto the elevator and hit the button for Peppers floor and then waited. She stepped off the elevator and Timothy nodded at her before she walked into Peppers office.

“I’d stand but someone has other plans.” Pepper said as she spun around. Her pregnant belly showing through her suit.

“Little lady giving you hell today?” Agatha asked as she walked over to Pepper.

“Morgan is just as stubborn as her parents unfortunately and she’s decided to take a nap right on my hip. What did you want to speak about?”

“They are finally ready to burn the place down. Saturday 10 a.m.” Agatha said with a sigh as she sat down.

“Great! Fantastic even. I’m glad.” Pepper said with a bright smile, she was ecstatic about the fact that Agatha was about to close this chapter on her life for good.

“How are you feeling? Need anything from me?” Agatha asked.

“Nope, go win your case tomorrow then go watch that place get turned to nothing but a distant memory.” Pepper said honestly.

“I meant do you need any potions or help standing up.” Agatha clarified.

“Maybe help standing up. I need to pee.” Pepper said honestly.

“No problem. Let’s get you up.” Agatha said as she walked over to Pepper and helped her out of the office chair. “I can’t believe you and Jen are both having girls.” Agatha said with a soft chuckle.

“I knew Morgan was going to be a girl. Lilia made sure of that by telling us to try every day the month after Evanora’s trial. And honestly did you expect two women to create a boy?”

“It’s happened millions of times before. Wanda and Lily’s first kid is supposed to be according to Lilia.” Agatha clarified as she guided Pepper over to her private bathroom.

“Oh. I just assumed no Y chromosome no boy.” Pepper said in a confused tone.

“I’ll explain that one later. Want me to wait for you to finish?” Agatha asked.

“Nah, enjoy your weekend. Call me if you need anything.” Pepper said as she walked into the room.

“You as well! See you later.” Agatha said before she walked out of Peppers office. She made her way back down to her own office and took a deep breath before stepping off the elevator.

‘Rowen is going to work. But you owe them a mini chocolate cake.’ Rio said in an amused tone.

‘I think I can handle that.’ Agatha responded.

‘Good because they are adamant about that. Their exact words were ‘only if Agatha makes me a chocolate cake’ you really gotta stop spoiling my staff.’ Rio said with a chuckle in her mind.

‘Never. I like them. Plus I only bake when I’m happy.’

‘Yeah, yeah, yeah, and I make you happy I know. I love you too.’ Rio answered.

‘I gotta finish up a few things at work. I’ll see you at home. Love you.’ Agatha told her before she made her way into her office.

“The contractor called while you were up talking to Pepper. It sounded important. I’d call him back when you get a chance.” Tricia said to Agatha as she walked up to the desk.

“I’ll do that now. Thank you.” Agatha said as she walked into her office. She sat down and dialed the contractors number. The phone rang 3 times before he picked up.

“Agatha! Good news! The houses will be completed next week! We are two weeks ahead of schedule. The boys have already started putting the green house up!” The man said excitedly into the phone.

“Fantastic! Thank you so much for the update. I think we should keep this hush hush though. Let Rio think we can’t move in until next month. I want to surprise her.” Agatha told him.

“Of course, that’s why I called your office. I wasn’t sure if she was with you today or not.” The contractor said into the phone.

“Perfect. Thank you so much. Give me a call when everything is finished. I appreciate all the hard work your team has put in, in the last few months.” Agatha said with a smile.

“I appreciate how much you are paying us.” He said honestly, Agatha was spending a pretty penny on these houses but she knew they’d be worth it. Tony and Pepper personally recommended this company.

“I’ll stop by after work to see how everything is going, thank you.” Agatha told the man.

“See you soon.” He said before hanging up.

“Thank the goddesses.” Agatha said with a smile.

“Really there is no need for all that sweetheart.” Gaia said with a chuckle as she popped into Agatha’s office.

“So you had nothing to do with team productivity and things being delivered on time?” Agatha asked her mother.

“I didn’t say that either…” Gaia said looking anywhere but at Agatha.

“Momma…” Agatha softly scolded.

“Hey! I want grandbabies!” Gaia said with a huff.

“Impatient. Almost as impatient as Rita!” Agatha said with a scoff.

“Look. I know you want to propose…. We’ll actually propose. Now let me see the ring that’s been hidden in your desk for the last 3 months!” Gaia said as she walked over to Agatha.

“Horrible, absolutely the worst. Fine, only because I’ve been dying to show you.” Agatha said as she slid the top drawer open and pulled out a black ring box. She opened it to look at the marquise cut emerald set in a black gold band that seemed to twist so that it held the top and bottom of the stone. It was simple but it screamed Rio.

“Stunning! She’s going to love it.” Gaia said with a bright smile as she looked at the ring.

“I hope so.” Agatha said nervously.

“Baby. She’d say yes if you proposed with a ring pop. Stop stressing.” Gaia reassured. “Now you have a job to do. I have a universe to maintain. I love you. Have a good rest of your day. By the way the houses are looking great.” Gaia said before she disappeared, which caused Agatha to roll her eyes.

“Stop acting like Violet.” Agatha said softly before she went back to work. Her phone buzzed a moment later.

Momma Gaia 11:45 a.m: I’d stay all day if I didn’t act like Violet. Love you!

Agatha rolled her eyes and sighed loudly as she started working on getting this case sorted out. She had court tomorrow and wanted everything to be perfect before she took the weekend off.

Forty-five minutes later Tricia came into her office and placed a take out container on her desk. “Grilled chicken salad with a raspberry vinaigrette and a large water from the cafe downstairs.” Tricia told her.

“Thank you, did you order lunch as well?” Agatha asked.

“Yes ma’am.” Tricia told her.

“Okay. I’m hoping to get everything sorted out for court tomorrow so I can take Friday off. I have to bake a chocolate cake for Rowen. They want one because Rio asked them to work so she could be with me while they burn the house down.” Agatha told Tricia.

“I’m sure your whole coven will want to be there as well.” Tricia told Agatha reassuringly.

“I’m not letting Jen come. She’s too pregnant to be in a car for that long let alone breathe in those fumes.” Agatha clarified.

“True, what did the contractor need?” Tricia asked, being slightly nosy. Agatha smiled and looked up at her from her seat.

“The house should be done soon. I’m going to take Rio over there and propose once it’s finished.” Agatha told Tricia with a bright smile as she slid the ring over to Tricia to look at.

“Stunning. She will love it.” Tricia said with a smile as she looked at the ring.

“I hope so.” Agatha said as she tucked it into her pocket before she went back to work. Her day seemed to drag on but eventually 5 p.m. rolled around and she was able to leave the office.

‘Gotta go check on the house before I meet you at the bookstore my love.’ Agatha told Rio.

‘Of course take your time. Hopefully everything is okay.’ Rio reassured softly.

‘I think so.’ Agatha reassured before she made her way down to her car and drove to the property the houses were being built on. Twenty minutes later she was pulling up to the property and smiled brightly at the houses. The contractors truck was sitting in the driveway when she pulled up and got out of the car. He got out of his truck at the same time.

“Agatha! So the houses are done actually, but the green house is going to take some time, a week tops. So if you want you can start moving in tomorrow.” He explained as he walked up to her and handed her the keys.

“Rio will be over the moon about that.” Agatha said with a smile as she took the keys from him.

“The red ones are for the house next door.” He explained.

“I appreciate the color coding. Thank you.” Agatha told him.

“Well come on! I want you to see the place.” He said as he walked toward the house. Agatha followed him and unlocked the door before heading inside. The main floor had a large open concept floor plan. The kitchen was huge and it was right off a large dining room. There was a massive family room that connected to her office. Then she made her way upstairs and found 4 bedrooms, a large library for Rio and a large playroom above the garage.

She walked into the massive bedroom and into the large walk in closet and smiled brightly at how big everything was. She was over the moon with how the house turned out. She then made her way back downstairs to where the contractor was waiting.

“Well? Are you happy with it?” He asked.

“Ecstatic! I love it. Your crew did a wonderful job!” Agatha complimented.

“Perfect, let’s go check the second house out.” He suggested as he turned and opened the other door.

“I’ll bring Wanda over later and let her look at it. It’s her place anyway. But thank you. I’ll call you if I ever need anything done in the future.” Agatha said with a smile.

“Thank you for your business Agatha it’s much appreciated.” He said with a smile.

“I think I’ll stick around for a minute: I have something I want to do before I head out.” Agatha told him.

“It’s your house ma’am, have a good day.” He said before he walked out the door.

‘I have a surprise for you my love.’ Agatha whispered softly in Rio’s mind.

‘Oh and what is that?’ Rio asked.

‘I’ll be there soon to pick you up after your shift so I can show you.’ Agatha told Rio.

‘I’ll be waiting.’ Rio told her. Agatha decided that she would establish a portal door to their house they were currently living in to make it easier to move. Then she locked up and headed to the bookstore. Ten minutes later she was parked in back and headed into the store.

“What are you hiding from me Agatha?” Rio asked as she wrapped her arms around her from behind after she made it into the store.

“I’m not hiding anything, I said I had a surprise for you. Lock up and I’ll take you to it.” Agatha told Rio who huffed and smiled knowing it was probably something good.

“Fine. I’ll let you keep me in the dark a little longer.” Rio told Agatha as she locked the store up and they headed back out to Agatha’s car. Agatha started it and headed toward the property. Five minutes into the drive Rio looked over at Agatha.

“I thought it wasn’t going to be done until next month?” Rio asked.

“They finished today.” Agatha told her as she pulled onto the street the property was on.

“Really?!” Rio said excitedly.

“Yep! I already set up a portal door so we could start moving the second we get inside.” Agatha told her with a smile.

“You set up your own portal door?” Rio asked with a smile.

“Yes but you should double check it, now come on my love. Let’s go look at our first home.” Agatha said with a smile as she parked the car and handed Rio the keys. Rio took the keys and bolted out the car before rushing into the house excitedly. Agatha smiled brightly as she watched Rio from the driver seat. She got out and slowly walked into the house and let Rio zip from room to room looking around.

“It’s beautiful! I love it!” Rio said as she kept looking around. Agatha let her for a long moment.

“Come with me, I want to show you something.” Agatha said with a smile as she took Rio’s hand and guided her upstairs to her library. She opened the door and let Rio go in first, Rio walked in and her jaw hit the floor at the size of the library. Agatha took this moment to kneel down behind Rio and pull the ring out of her pocket. Right as Rio turned around Agatha opened the box.

“Rio, I have loved you with my entire being for the last 6 months. I know your magic already asked and mine already said yes, but Rio Rene Vidal Will You Marry Me?” Agatha asked. Rio’s hand flew up to her mouth as she felt tears spring to her eyes.

“Yes! Yes! A million times yes! In every universe yes!” Rio said as Agatha took the ring out of the box and slid it onto Rio’s ring finger. Her other ring morphing around the ring and glowing brightly as the two merged into one stunning ring. The silver with purple clouds seeming to cross the ring making it an infinity symbol on Rio’s finger.

“I love you.” Agatha said with a smile as she stood up and Rio practically tackled her with a hug.

“I love you!” Rio said excitedly as she kissed Agatha all over her face before landing on her lips. Rio tried to deepen the kiss and Agatha was more than willing to let her but she pulled away before it got too deep.

“Really, in your library?” Agatha teased.

“You’ve already tainted the bookstore.” Rio said with a shrug.

“Let’s head home. I established a door, let’s see if it worked.” Agatha offered as she grabbed Rio’s hand and guided her downstairs to the closet she had used to establish a door to their other home. She opened it and showed Rio who smiled and whistled lowly.

“Impressive my love. On your first try too. I’d be jealous if I wasn’t about to be your wife.” Rio said with a smile.

“Safe to say you already are in every sense of the word except for legally.” Agatha clarified before she stepped through the door. She made it through unscathed and Rio followed suit.

“Does that mean Wanda’s place is done as well?” Rio asked as she followed Agatha.

“Yep, it’s ready for her and Lily. I can call them and we can give them the keys or we can wait and celebrate our engagement.” Agatha offered.

“I’m posting a photo tomorrow on the stores Instagram page and my private one.” Rio told her.

“I have court tomorrow.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“So you need to be rested. Okay. Fair. Let’s figure out dinner my love.” Rio said with a smile before she shut the door and dragged Agatha toward the kitchen.

“How about some marry me chicken?” Agatha asked with a smirk.

“That sounds amazing. I’ll be right back. I have to go to the cabin real quick and grab something from my old bedroom.” Rio told Agatha.

“What’s that my love?” Agatha asked.

“It’s a surprise. I’ll be quick, unless Momma’s there. But I’ll be right back.” Rio reassured.

“I’ll start cooking. Love you.” Agatha said softly before she pulled Rio in for a kiss. Rio kissed her softly before she let Agatha go and bolted off toward the bedroom.

Agatha started cooking dinner and ten minutes later Rio came back into the kitchen holding both hands behind her back. “What do you have Rio?” Agatha asked softly as she turned to her.

“Something that I’ve been holding onto for a few months.” Rio said as she walked over to Agatha and brought her hand around to show Agatha a purple ring box. She opened it and presented it to Agatha with a nervous smile.

Nestled in the purple velvet was a silver band with leaves made from white sapphires curling around an oval amethyst. “I was going to propose to you after the house was burned down at family dinner on Saturday but you beat me to it.” Rio said with a small laugh.

“It’s gorgeous Rio.” Agatha told her with tears in her eyes as she looked her in the eyes. Agatha held her left hand up for Rio and Rio quickly slipped the ring out of the box and onto her finger. The black and green band started to glow and morph on her finger. It’s shape changed, the band thinned before settling against the ring.

“Perfect.” Rio said with a smile as she brought both rings up to her lips and softly kissed them.

“Did Rita see your ring?” Agatha asked.

“No, she wasn’t home yet.” Rio reassured.

“That explains why there’s not an angry Latino woman on my kitchen.” Agatha said with a small laugh.

“She wouldn’t be mad.” Rio reassured.

“Mad that I didn’t have a photographer there.” Agatha clarified. “I gotta finish dinner, let me go.” Agatha said as she pulled away and went back to cooking. A panicked look spread across Rio’s face and for a long moment she actually looked scared.

“That’s what Lilia’s memory spell is for.” Rio said with wide eyes, remembering that was an option. Agatha went back to cooking.

Fifteen minutes later Agatha had a thought. “Better call her.” Agatha told Rio as she got the chicken back in the pan after making the cream sauce.

“I’ll do that..” Rio started to say but then her phone started to ring on the countertop. She quickly grabbed it and answered putting it on speaker.

“Hey Aunt Lilia.” Rio said into the phone while Agatha listened and continued cooking.

“Hey? Hey! That’s how you answer the phone?” Lilia scolds.

“How am I supposed to answer the phone?” Rio asked as she looked over at Agatha with a confused look.

“Am I off by a day again? Didn’t something happen like an hour ago?” Lilia asked in a confused tone.

“You are never off by a day.” Rio told Lilia with a smirk.

“Then why aren’t you telling me what I want to hear?” Lilia said in an exasperated tone.

“Because it’s fun, and you don’t want to slip up just incase you seen the wrong vision.” Rio said with a chuckle.

“Listen here you little shit!” Lilia scolded.

“I’m listening.” Rio said in a sassy tone.

“If you don’t tell me, I’ll call Rita this instant!” Lilia said in a frustrated tone, forcing Rio to sigh before she looked over at Agatha.

“I proposed to Rio tonight.” Agatha told Lilia.

“I was on speaker?! Rio, we need to have a talk about phone etiquette.” Lilia scolded.

“I know your on speaker as well Lilia, I can hear it. The echo, that is.” Rio explained, before continuing. “And I know you have Wednesday wine nights with momma…” Rio trailed off.

“Damn it Lilia!” Rita scolded the woman.

“I was hoping she forgot.” Lilia whisper yelled back at Rita.

“What do you want to hear?” Rio asked.

“Tell momma everything!” Rita said excitedly into the phone.

“Well tonight after work Agatha came and picked me up to show me a surprise. The surprise was that the houses are done! So she took me upstairs, showed me my new library. Then got down on one knee and proposed when I turned around. Our rings kind of merged together though. We can send you a photo after dinner. Agatha just finished cooking.” Rio explained to her Mother and Aunt.

“Oooo what are you having?” Rita asked.

“Marry me chicken with rice and steamed broccoli.” Agatha explained as she set a plate of food in front of Rio.

“Okay this looks fantastic. Sorry momma, sorry Lilia. I love you, Bye.” Rio said before disconnecting the phone.

“You know they are going to call you right back.” Agatha said flatly as she made her own plate of food.

“Don’t care, they can wait. I’m starving.” Rio said as she dug into her food. Her phone started to ring a moment later.

“I’m glad you still like my cooking.” Agatha said with a smile as she walked over and sat down next to Rio and started eating. A moment later Agatha’s phone started to ring. She magicked it up herself and looked at the caller ID to see that it was Daniel.

“You dirty. Fine.” Agatha said in an irritated tone directed at Rita and Lilia before sighing and answering the phone. “Hey Papa, how are you doing?” Agatha asked into the phone.

“Púrpura! Rita tells me you have some news to share?” Daniel said to Agatha, using the nickname he gave her four months ago.

“Papa! Leave Agatha alone.” Rio whined.

“Pepita! I just wanted to check in on my future daughter in law, is that a crime?” Daniel said to his daughter.

‘Low blow using my father against you.’ Rio thought in an irritated tone.

‘Straight kidney shots, really.’ Agatha answered.

“I am well Daniel. Was just about to sit down and eat dinner when you called. Do you want some? You’re more than welcome to come have a plate.” Agatha told the man, returning the low blow from Lilia and Rita with equal kindness.

“What is it?” He whispers into the phone.

“Marry me chicken, rice and broccoli.”Agatha answered.

“Be there in two minutes.” Daniel said before he hung up.

“You know they are both going to be upset.” Rio said with an eye roll before she continued to eat. A moment later Daniel walked into the kitchen and grabbed himself a plate and then proceeded to make himself one.

“You better call your Mother and Lilia back before they have aneurysms.” Daniel told Rio before he grabbed a fork and started eating while standing next to the sink.

“I’m surprised they didn’t follow you.” Rio told her father as she watched the man eat.

“They think I’m getting more wine from the kitchen.” Daniel told his daughter.

“You climbed out a window for my cooking?” Agatha asked knowing there wasn’t an exit door on that side of the cabin.

“Yes. Yes I did.” Daniel said unashamed as he took another bite.

“Oh. Okay. I’ll just call Momma right back and let her know you are here.” Rio told her father.

“Or you could be a great daughter and not.” Daniel said with a grimace.

“Rita having you call me was a low blow.” Agatha told him.

“It was, I know. Sorry púrpura. I didn’t want to, she made me.” Daniel explained. Agatha just shrugged and went back to eating her meal. Rio finished her plate and then called her mother back, it rang once before Rita answered.

“Really Rio?” Rita scolded.

“Low blow having Papa call Agatha Momma. You know she never ignores him.” Rio scolded.

“To be fair… you would’ve made her hang up on me.” Rita clarified.

“She’s not wrong.” Agatha agreed.

“It’s fine, where is Papa anyway?” Rio asked looking at her father pointedly.

“Agatha bribed him with dinner so he’s not even here anymore.” Lilia told Rita in an exasperated tone.

“Rio! You knew where he was.” Rita scolded.

“Hi honey.” Daniel said meekly.

“I’ll accept my loss gracefully. Well played Agatha. Only fair that you exploited his weakness after I did the same to you.” Rita said in surrender.

“If you want to see the ring that bad just come over.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“Really?!” Lilia and Rita ask in unison.

“Yes, really.” Rio said with a groan and then the phone was disconnected..a few moments later Lilia and Rita stumble through the bedroom door into the living room. Both women rolled their eyes and then a moment later Rita was standing next to her husband and Lilia was next to Rio.

“Sell out.” Rita scolded her husband who just shoved a bite of food into her mouth to shut her up and prove it was worth selling out for.

“Fuck. That’s good. Fine, I can’t be mad at you for that.” Rita said after she finished chewing.

“I should’ve made more.” Agatha said with a sigh before she went back to eating.

“We will be fine. Now show us the rings!” Lilia said excitedly and Rio rolled her eyes as she stuck her hand out for her mother and Lilia to gawk at.

“Hope that spell will make the ring grow and shrink because it seems like it’s morphed around your engagement ring.” Rita mused as she looked at the ring. “I don’t want to touch it but I do.”

“Things I didn’t think of until now.” Agatha said with a sigh. “Go ahead. I’ll mentally prepare myself. Not sure what kind of reaction I’m going to have.” Agatha said with a sigh.

Rita reached out and tentatively touched the ring while eyeing Agatha who didn’t even seem to flinch.

“It’s fine. Apparently you are not a threat to our bond. I assume Lilia and Daniel will be the same.” Agatha told the group, then the three adults rushed over to Rio and started gushing over the ring and complimenting Agatha’s taste in unison. Once Agatha was finished eating she got up and headed over to the sink with hers and Rio’s plate before she turned around and watched the family.

“Have they seen mine?” Agatha asked.

“Yours?” Lilia asked in a confused tone.

“I used the vanishing spell on the box. So no. They haven’t seen it.” Rio explained as Lilia and Rita turned around to look at Agatha’s left hand that was now presented to her. Lilia and Rita both instantly took Agatha’s hand and started complimenting the ring. After a barrage of compliments both women finally settled down.

“Are you two done?” Daniel asked.

“Yes. I think we are. Now we have a wedding to plan!” Rita said excitedly.

“Woah, cool your jets there turbo.” Daniel told Rita.

“Excuse me? She’s the only daughter I have. I’m helping.” Rita told Daniel, who grabbed her by the arms softly and turned her toward him.

“Only if they ask. And I have not heard a single ‘Momma, will you help plan my wedding.’ Yet. So cool your jets. I love you. But I have been your life partner for over fifty years. Chill.” Daniel told Rita softly, she then begun to grumble lightly before shaking her head yes.

“Fine.”

“Alright. Thank you for dinner girls. I’m taking them home now. Come on Lilia. You can get wine drunk on the couch with Rita while looking at bridal magazines or something.” Daniel said as he wrapped an arm around each womens shoulders and guided them back to the portal door.

“I’m not wearing a white dress!” Rio yelled before her family disappeared bank though the portal.

“Neither am I. Ew.” Agatha said with a scrunched face.

“But.” Rio started to say sadly then changed her mind.

“I was thinking a light lavender, like the color of the sundress I wore on our first date.” Agatha suggested.

“Oh, okay I do like the sound of that.” Rio said with a smile.

“Problems for a later date. We still have so much more to do before we get that far. Like move.” Agatha explained as she started taking care of the leftovers.

“That is a bigger priority. I wonder if the moving company Tony and Pepper used for your mother’s house would be opposed to using a portal door.”

“I doubt they would be. But it won’t hurt to ask. I’ll ask after court tomorrow. I’m taking Friday off so if they don’t object I can be home all day while they move. Gotta make Rowen their chocolate cake.”

“Stop spoiling them.” Rio huffed out softly. Not really meaning her words.

“I like Sage and Rowen. They are good kids. They just need to get their heads out of their asses.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“It’s like watching the longest slow burn in the history of slow burns!” Rio lamented.

“Do you think Lilia did this on purpose? Sent you these two? Because goddesses above they are so dense.” Agatha said as she finished cleaning up the kitchen.

“Probably. She’s always loved playing match maker.” Rio said with a shrug. “Now come on let’s go cuddle and watch our show before bed.”

“Sounds perfect my love.” Agatha said as she took Rio’s hand and guided her to the living room where they settled on the couch and cuddled into each other.

~Thursday~

Agatha and Rio woke up and showered together before getting dressed. Agatha put on a deep purple suit, with a light lavender button up underneath, along with a black tie. Rio was dressed in a pair of comfortable jeans and a soft black band tee. They both made their way out into the kitchen where Agatha started making breakfast while Rio checked her emails to see if she had any online orders overnight.

Ten minutes later Lily and Wanda walked in the door. “Good morning Ladies.” Wanda said cheerfully before she walked over to the counter and leaned against it while Lily took a seat at the counter with Rio.

“Good morning. How are you two doing today?” Agatha asked.

“Good morning. Tired. I’ve been working late trying to get my team on track. I might have to fire someone soon.” Lily said as she rubbed her temples.

“I’m surprised you haven’t yet. Tony gave you permission to clean house.” Agatha said as she finished making breakfast then waved her hand and breakfast was in the table. “Let’s eat, I have court today. So I have to leave early but I wanted to talk to you two.“ Agatha explained as she walked over to the table. Everyone followed suit and sat down in their chairs.

“About the engagement rings or something else?” Wanda asked as she looked over at her best friend pointedly.

“I forget that she’s observant when she wants to be.” Rio said with a groan as she started eating breakfast.

“Yes those, but also these.” Agatha said with a flourish as she presented the red house keys to Wanda.

“They are done?!” Wanda said in an excited tone.

“Just finished last night. I took Rio to look at our place and proposed in the library.” Agatha explained.

“That doesn’t explain the stunning ring on your finger.” Lily said pointing to the ring on Agatha’s hand.

“I was planning on proposing after they burn the house down on Saturday at family dinner. I had the ring in my dresser in the cabin.” Rio explained.

“Agatha beat you to it.” Wanda said with a smirk.

“Unfortunately.”

“Wait they are burning the house down Saturday?” Wanda asked.

“Yeah the chief called me yesterday. Saturday 10 a.m. be here by 8 a.m. Don’t tell Jen and Alice. I don’t want Jen breathing in all those fumes.” Agatha told them.

“We will be here. I’ll make sure of it.” Lily said with a smile.

“Thank you Lily.” Agatha said appreciatively.

“I’m going to talk to Pepper today about moving services and we are going to start moving stuff tomorrow hopefully.” Agatha said with a smile.

“Is the green house up yet?” Lily asked excitedly.

“They are still working on that, should be finished by next week but the houses are ready.” Agatha explained as she went back to eating.

“Sounds good. Rio and I are going to live in that thing.” Lily said with a chuckle.

“That or my library. I can’t wait to get all my books in there! It’s massive.” Rio said with a smile.

“Alright we can daydream at work. Eat your breakfast please.” Agatha requested, and all the women went back to eating. Ten minutes later they were done eating breakfast and all of them were helping clean up before they headed out the door.

Lily’s phone started ringing and she pulled it out of her pocket to look at it. With a sigh she answered it.

“Yes?” Lily asked into the phone, then there was a long pause. “I’ll be there as soon as possible. Don’t blow up my lab.” Another long pause. “Put him in a conference room. I’ll deal with it when I arrive. Bye.” Lily said before she hung up.

“I have to go deal with this. I’m sorry. I love you.” Lily said to the group, before she gave Wanda a kiss and rushed out the door.

“Bye! Love you!” Wanda said as Lily ran out the door. “Oh he’s totally getting fired today.”

“Same guy that’s been giving her trouble?” Agatha asked as she finished cleaning the kitchen.

“Yeah. This is his final one she might just write him up and instantly fire him. He’s been nothing but neglectful; accident after neglectful accident. Fortunately he hasn’t hurt anyone yet. But that might have changed.” Wanda said with a sigh.

“Okay. Well let’s go. I have court. Then I have to talk to Pepper after. I’m not even going into the office, just straight to the court house. Now get out of my house.” Agatha told Wanda as she shoved her toward the door.

“Okay! I’m going! I’m gunna check the house out tonight with Lily, want to meet us there?” Wanda asked.

“Text the group chat. We will figure something out.” Agatha said before she hugged her best friend then grabbed her briefcase. Before realizing her car was at the other house. “I actually have to use a portal door today. Bye Wanda!” Agatha said with a smile.

“Bye! I’ll text you guys later.” Wanda said as she rushed out the door and shut it. Rio grabbed Agatha and gave her a soft kiss on the lips.

“I love you. Have a good day and good luck.” Rio said before she grabbed the closet door that she had established as the bookstore door after she moved out of her apartment.

“I love you too, have a good day.” Agatha said before she went over to the spare bedroom door and opened it to the new house before heading into the new house and out the door to her car.

Twenty minutes later Agatha was pulling up in front of the courthouse and parked before heading in. She knew she had today in the bag, she wasn’t worried but she was just ready for this case to be over with. This one kept dragging on for her. She got out of the car and headed into the courthouse.

She made her way into the courtroom and waited for her client to arrive. She pulled her phone out and looked at the group chat just in case Lily or Wanda had texted.

Lily 8:40 a.m: I fired him.

Wanda 8:45 a.m: thank the goddesses.

Agatha 8:52 a.m: are we meeting at the houses around 6?

Agatha sent the text and then silenced her phone and tucked it into her briefcase. Her client walked into the courtroom and took his seat a moment later before the opposition walked into the room. Agatha took a deep calming breath and steeled herself before the judge and jury walked into the courtroom.

A few hours later the jury had finished their contemplation and they came out and read the verdict. Agatha had won another case and with a bright smile and a breath of relief she turned to look over at her client.

“Thank you Ms.Harkness.” The man said to her.

“No problem. Stay away from people like him. All they do is suck you dry.” Agatha said with an irritated tone before she started packing up her stuff. Once she was finished she headed out of the courtroom and toward the exit.

Once she was in her car and headed back to the office, she pulled her phone out and called Pepper. It rang once before Pepper picked up. “Congratulations on another win!” Pepper said proudly into the phone.

“Thanks Pepper. Got time for lunch?” Agatha asked.

“Of course. Got something you wanna talk about?” Pepper asked.

“I proposed to Rio last night.”

“You better get a photo of the ring from her before you get into the office.” Pepper demanded softly.

“Yes ma’am. I’ll call her right now. Bye.” Agatha said into the phone.

“Bye.”

Agatha called Rio and she picked up on the second ring. “Everything alright my love?” Rio asked.

“Pepper is politely demanding a photo of your ring.” Agatha told Rio.

“Look at Instagram when you get a chance.” Rio said softly.

“Are we keeping our last names or hyphenating?” Agatha asked.

“I think Harkness-Vidal has a nice ring to it.” Rio said with a smile.

“Our poor children.” Agatha teased.

“I think they will survive.” Rio reassured. “I love you, check the group chat when you get to work.”

“I will. I love you too.” Agatha said with a smile. “Have a good day my love.”

“You as well. Wait! Did you win your case?” Rio asked.

“Of course I did.” Agatha told her.

“Okay, have a good day.” Rio said with a smile before they hung up. Agatha smiled softly at the thought of Rio putting her last name first.

“Vidal-Harkness doesn’t sound too bad either” she mused to herself as she continued to drive. Ten minutes later she pulled into the parking lot. She parked and headed into the building. She pulled her phone out and sent Tricia a text letting her know that she was having lunch with Pepper before she headed up to Pepper’s office.

Timothy nodded politely as she walked by. Agatha pulled her phone out and pulled up Vidal Books Instagram, the last photo was of Rio’s left hand resting on hers and Agatha’s spell books with the caption. “The love of my life proposed last night.” With Agatha tagged, she liked the post and then headed into the office.

“Tell me everything!” Pepper said standing up excitedly. Agatha smiled softly at Pepper before she handed her the phone. Pepper took it quickly and looked at the ring. “That is gorgeous, did the rings merge together?” Pepper asked.

“Yes they did, I got a call from the contractor yesterday after I talked to you and the house is finished so I took her to see it after work and proposed to her in the library. Then we went back to our place and I started cooking dinner. She planned on proposing after Evanora’s house was burned down at family dinner on Saturday.” Agatha explained as she held her hand out for Pepper to look at.

“Gorgeous, and it suits you so well.” Pepper complimented before continuing. “But I’m not touching your hand.”

“Good idea.” Agatha said with a smile as Pepper handed Agatha her phone back. Timothy walked in a moment later and set down two take out containers, plastic wear, and two drinks before silently walking out.

“Thank you!” Agatha said before the door shut.

“I may have had a pregnancy induced hormonal rage fit this morning and he’s afraid to speak to me.” Pepper said meekly.

“Yeah not looking forward to that in the future. I’ll talk to Jen about hormone balancing potions. She’s been quite reasonable.” Agatha explained.

“Will you? Tony is terrified of me sometimes. I’d appreciate it.” Pepper said before she opened her food and started eating.

“Only if you send me the moving company you used for Evanora’s items so I can ask if they’d be okay with helping move things through a magical portal.” Agatha explained.

“I can send you that right now.” Pepper said as she grabbed her phone and searched for a second before typing and hitting send. Agatha’s phone pinged a moment later and she smiled softly at Pepper before she opened her own container and started eating.

“Oh I’m taking tomorrow off. I want to start moving, and I have to bake Rowen a cake. They said they wanted one as payment for having to work Saturday.” Agatha explained.

“Only if I get a dessert cup.”

“Of course. Gotta take care of Morgan.” Agatha said with a smile as she took a bite of her food.

“Thank you. I look forward to some amazing chocolate cake.” Pepper said with a smile. Agatha and her settled into a comfortable silence as they ate their lunch.

“Thank you for lunch Pepper, try to be nice to Timothy. Take it out on Tony, he did this to you.” Agatha said with a smirk as she stood up and headed toward the door.

“Tony is already afraid in his own home.” Pepper said with a laugh.

“Good, he should be.” Agatha said with a laugh as she walked out the door as soon as it shut she turned and looked at Timothy. “If she becomes too unreasonable or too much call me. I can handle her at her worst.” Agatha reassured the young man who looked sad.

“Thank you.” He said softly, Agatha smiled softly at him and headed back down to her office to get things ready for next week before she left for the weekend. She made her way to the elevator and pressed the down button. She made her way to her office after stepping off the elevator and Tricia stood up to greet her.

“Gossip is that the new bookstore owner in town posted on their Instagram that they were engaged.” Tricia said with a smile.

“I proposed last night.” Agatha said with a smile. “But she also had a ring for me.” Agatha said as she put her left hand out for Tricia to look at.

“Stunning! You both have immaculate taste and know each other so well.” Tricia complimented.

“Thank you, I have a few things I need to finish before tonight. Taking tomorrow and the weekend off, to get things sorted out.” Agatha told her.

“Sounds good. Thank you.” Tricia said with a smile. Agatha made her way into her office and started working. Around 3:30 p.m. she realized that she hadn’t checked the group chat.

Lily 10:05 a.m: 6 works for me. But I’m not having a great day.

Wanda 10:06 a.m: I’m sorry babe.

Rio 10:06 a.m: I’m sorry Lily, but he deserved to be fired. Don’t let it bother you much.

Lily 10:07 a.m: I fired two people, I feel bad is all.

Rio 10:08 a.m: ope. Okay. Well we will take care of that tonight.

Agatha 3:40 p.m: Anything I can do to help?

Lily 3:41 p.m: no :(

“Oh, she’s really upset.” Agatha said softly before she pulled Wanda’s contact up and hit call. It literally rang once before Wanda answered.

“I know, she’s upset. She’s been texting me all day.” Wanda said with a sigh.

“You get the spring rolls, I’ll get the snacks. We can have a picnic on the floor in the living room of your new house.” Agatha offered.

“Crab Rangoons, spring rolls, actual food. You get the soda and chocolate.” Wanda told her.

“Can do. I’m leaving work at 4:30 so I can set up the living room.” Agatha told Wanda.

“Got it, thank you! I love you and I appreciate you.” Wanda said before she hung up. Agatha finished her work for the day and collected her things before she walked out of her office.

“I have something I have to attend to, have a good rest of your day Tricia.” Agatha said to her secretary.

“You as well Ma’am.” Tricia said politely as Agatha walked past. Agatha made her way to the elevator and down to the lobby before she used her connection to talk to Rio.

‘I’m going to get a few things set up at the new house for tonight. Wanda’s getting Chinese, I’m getting sodas and chocolate and setting up the living room so we can all cuddle in a pile so Lily can feel better.’ Agatha told her.

‘Sounds great. Do you need help? Can have Sage watch the store until close. Then pop back in and lock up after.’ Rio offered.

‘Meet me in our living room in 20?’ Agatha asked

‘Of course.’ Rio answered

‘Thank you.’ Agatha said appreciatively. Before she got in her car and headed to the store to buy what she needed. Once she was finished shopping she headed to the property with their houses on it and got out to see the men building the green house still. Agatha made her way into the house and set everything on the counter before walking over to the portal door.

She opened it to see Rio collecting things in the living room. And putting them in a big pile. Agatha stepped through and smiled at Rio. “Do you think we can shove the guest bed mattress through the door?” Rio asked.

“Possibly. But I do have an air mattress.” Agatha said as she walked over to the hall closet and grabbed the large box out of it.

“Perfect. Let’s get it set up in the corner and all of us can pile on that and eat dinner and be in a big cuddle puddle.” Rio said with a smile.

“Lily loves her platonic cuddles. So I think that’s a great idea.” Agatha said with a smile.

“I’ll go collect some more blankets.” Rio said as Agatha dragged the king sized air mattress into the other house and got it out of the box. She set it up and let it inflate while she started moving stuff into the house. Once she was done she pulled her phone out and called the movers Pepper recommended. It rang a couple times before someone answered.

“Thank you for calling Galactic Movers, how may I assist you today?” A woman asked.

“I have a question.” Agatha said into the phone.

“Ask away ma’am.”

“I’m a witch and I have established a portal from my old house to my new place. Would your movers be willing to move things through a portal?” Agatha asked.

“Yes we can do that, do you have a friend who referred you?” The woman asked.

“Pepper Potts and Tony Stark.” Agatha told the woman.

“Do you also want the priority package?” The woman asked.

“Yes. If we could get everything moved tomorrow for me I’d greatly appreciate it. I actually have two homes that need moved but only one tomorrow.” Agatha explained.

“What time would you like a team to arrive?”

“9 a.m. if possible.” Agatha requested.

“That is entirely doable. The last home we did for them took 6 hours with our team. Is cost an issue?”

“Not at all.” Agatha told the woman.

“Perfect can I have your email to send you the quote?” The woman asked.

“[email protected]” Agatha told the woman.

“Thank you, fill out the paper work and accept the quote and a team will be at the house first thing in the morning.” The woman told Agatha.

“Thank you. I’ll fill it out now.” Agatha told the woman.

“Seeing as no moving truck is needed it will be less expensive than usual. So we can save you some money.” The woman told Agatha.

“Thank you so much! Have a good night.” Agatha told the woman.

“You as well.” The woman answered before hanging up.

“Okay, the movers are willing to move things through the portal door.” Agatha told Rio.

“Great. I don’t want to use magic to teleport everything.” Rio said with a sigh as she plopped down on the couch. Agatha smiled at her and sat down next to her before opening her email and filling everything out. She paid the fee right then and there and then looked at the time.

“You gotta go lock up and I gotta go greet Lily and Wanda. I’ll see you in a minute.” Agatha said with a smile before she kissed Rio softly.

“I’m going. I’m going.” Rio said with a sigh as she got up and headed toward the door with the portal for the bookstore. Agatha got up and started making the air mattress up and getting everything taken care of. She heard Wanda’s car pull in the driveway after she finished and she headed outside to get her.

“We set up a cuddle space in here because I haven’t established a portal in your house yet. Come on in.” Agatha yelled.

“Perfect, I’ll text her and tell her to come right into the house.” Wanda said as she carried everything into the house. She set the brown bags on the countertop. Wanda then pulled her phone out and sent a text to Lily.

“I called the movers they are willing to move the houses through the portal door. So once we are moved in I’ll establish a door at your place for your house and have them start moving your stuff.” Agatha explained.

“I appreciate that, but are you ever going to let me pay for anything?” Wanda asked.

“Nope, it’s funnier to me that I’m buying you this with her money.” Agatha told her.

“The only reason I agreed to this.” Wanda said with a sigh before Lily opened the front door. She looked over at Wanda and Agatha with tear filled eyes.

“Oh, that bad?” Agatha asked softly. Lily shook her head yes and then broke down. Wanda scooped the smaller woman into her arms and guided her over to the mattress in the living area before they sat down.

Rio rushed in through the portal door a moment later and looked over at the women. “Oh, that bad.” Rio said softly.

“Yeah.” Agatha whispered. “Come on let’s go take care of her.” Agatha told Rio as she took her hand and they all climbed into the bed and pulled Lily into a cuddle puddle. Wanda was leaning against the wall with Lily in her arms, Rio plopped down and threw her legs over Lily’s before Agatha sat next to her and threw her arm over Wanda’s.

“We are right here.” Rio reassured as she took Lily’s hand, Lily almost instantly stopped crying when she realized she was surrounded.

“Not the tactical cuddle puddle!” Lily whined before sniffling.

“Yes. The tactical cuddle puddle.” Agatha said softly before hugging Lily tightly.

“Rude you trapped me!” Lily scolded.

“Shhh just accept your fate.” Wanda whispered.

“Unfair.” Lily complained.

“Plenty fair. It’s your turn to feel loved.” Agatha reassured. “Now we are going to cuddle and then Wanda got Chinese.” Agatha told the woman. Lily sighed and just let it happen.

Thirty minutes later Lily started to wiggle. “Okay I’m hungry. I didn’t eat lunch because I was so upset.” Lily said in a frustrated tone. Agatha waved her hand and instantly the food was on the air mattress and unpacked and warmed to perfection.

The women all started eating their dinner while cuddled up with Lily, and once they were finished the food was packed up and put in the fridge with a little extra magic.

“Do you want to go check out your new house or do you want to cuddle some more?” Agatha asked.

“Let’s go check it out.” Lily said with a smile.

Chapter 38

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Friday morning and afternoon came and went with ease, the movers had the house completely boxed up and moved into the new home by 4:30. Fortunately they let Agatha finish baking and decorating the cake before they started packing the kitchen up. As soon as she was finished, Agatha got the cake into the box and delivered it to the bookstore personally to Rowen. Then right after the movers left she magicked a cake parfait to Pepper.

Her phone rang the second the parfait hit Peppers desk. “Yes Pepper?” Agatha asked as she answered the phone.

“Morgan says “I love you Agatha.” And I agree with her.” Pepper said as she took a bite of the parfait.

“Love you too Pepper. Now be nice to Timothy.” Agatha told her.

“I’ve been nice today!” Pepper said in an exasperated tone.

“I know, but he looked scared yesterday.” Agatha explained. “The movers are done. So we will be spending our first night in the new house tonight. Then we get to go watch the hellhole burn down tomorrow.” Agatha explained.

“Maybe you should go get portals established in Wanda’s house so the movers can start moving things tonight. Then have them stay the night with you two so you can leave right away in the morning.” Pepper suggested.

“I gotta call Wanda and ask her.”

“Well get to it! I’m gunna go eat the rest of this.” Pepper said excitedly.

“Bye Pepper.” Agatha said into the phone.

“Bye! Thank you again!” Pepper answered before hanging up. Agatha pulled her phone away and called Wanda. The phone rang once before Wanda picked up.

“What’s up?” Wanda asked.

“Wanna stay at the new house tonight and I can have the movers start moving your stuff tonight and by morning it will be done or do you want to do it Sunday?” Agatha asked.

“We can stay there tonight to make leaving easier in the morning but Lily will want to be present for moving all of her things. You know how she is.” Wanda explained.

“Yeah I do. That’s fine we can set up portal doors tomorrow night when we get back. Rio is going to have to make a new one to the cabin.” Agatha explained.

‘Where am I going tonight?’ Rio asked.

‘Come home then we will go to the new house. I’m still here. On the phone with Wanda at the moment. Talking about them staying the night in the new house with us and we all leave from there in the morning.’

“Did I lose you?” Wanda asked.

“No Rio was talking to me in my mind. Sorry. What did you say?” Agatha asked.

“I said that’s fine. Where’s your car?” Wanda asked.

“At the new house.” Agatha answered her.

“So Lily and I will walk over and we can take the portal to the new house after work. I’m almost home so I’ll start packing a bag. Do you two want help unpacking?”

“I had the movers put everything in specific rooms so every thing is where it belongs, just needs unpacked. Which a little magic will help with that.” Agatha explained as she walked around the empty house. There was nothing left.

“We can help unpack. Don’t need a flare up. You are walking around your place lost aren’t you?” Wanda jabbed.

“Of course I am! It’s so empty. I have nothing to sit on.” Agatha told Wanda.

“I know I can see you in the window.” Wanda joked.

“Go pack a bag. I want to go sit on my couch.” Agatha scolded before hanging up.

Wanda 5:45 p.m: Rude!

‘Off the phone?’ Rio asked.

‘Yes my love. I think I’m going to grab a kitchen chair so I have something to sit on.’ Agatha answered.

‘Go wait at the other house? Come here for 15 minutes? Go over to Wanda’s and be annoying to her for once?’ Rio offered.

‘That last suggestion is a great idea my love.’ Agatha said as she walked out the front door and charged over to Wanda’s house. She swung the door open loudly.

“What the fuck?!” Wanda yelled.

“My turn to barge into your house loudly!” Agatha yelled back. Which caused Wanda to burst out laughing.

“That works!” Wanda finally said from her bedroom. A few minutes later Lily walked through the still open door.

“Why is the front door open?” Lily asked loudly into the house.

“Because I decided to pull a Wanda!” Agatha hollered from the living room.

“That… actually makes sense. No furniture at your house?” Lily asked as she walked into the living room.

“None.” Agatha answered.

“Okay, what’s Wanda doing?” Lily asked.

“I was packing a bag for us so we could stay at Agatha’s place tonight. That way we could all just leave from there in the morning seeing as her car is there.” Wanda explained.

“Let me see the outfit you packed me.” Lily said as she tried to look in the bag.

“I didn’t pack you one. I know better. You go get yourself clothing for tomorrow.” Wanda said as she handed Lily the bag.

“You are learning.” Lily complimented before heading upstairs to pack some clothing into the bag.

“Someone else has trained you.” Agatha said smugly in a sing-song tone.

“Shut up.” Wanda said flatly, she wasn’t even in the mood to argue.

“Don’t worry, a little boy will have you trained here soon enough as well.” Agatha teased.

“Don’t remind me. Lily wants kids soon. I get why, but still. I haven’t even looked for an engagement ring yet.” Wanda whispered.

“We can go shopping later if you want help.” Agatha offered.

“No, you just got engaged. I’m going to let you enjoy that for a minute.” Wanda explained.

“No proposing at my wedding.” Agatha told Wanda leaving no room for argument.

“I can’t wait that long! I just don’t know what kind of ring she’d like.” Wanda explained.

“Ask her? See if she’s got something specific in mind? Or you two could go together? No shame in letting your partner pick out their own ring, especially Lily.” Agatha explained.

“Especially me, what?” Lily asked walking down the stairs. Wanda glared at Agatha for a long moment before she looked over at Lily.

“Agatha was suggesting I let you pick out your own engagement ring when we get that far.” Wanda admitted honestly.

“I have like seven links I can send you right now of what I like if it would make it easier on you? I didn’t know you wanted to propose so I’ve just been letting you set the pace. I’m not in a rush though. Or we can go together if you want. But I wouldn’t mind this one thing being a surprise.” Lily explained.

“Yes, please send me the links. I won’t buy any specific one but I need ideas.” Wanda requested as Agatha got up off the couch and walked over to them.

“Come on, Rio’s probably waiting for us.” Agatha said before walking out the door. Wanda and Lily followed her out the door before Wanda turned and locked the door. Then they made their way next door.

‘Just got home.’ Rio said as they walked up the steps. Agatha opened the door and smiled at Rio who was leaning against the closet door she just came out of.

“Hello my love, ready to spend our first night in our new home?” Agatha asked.

“Yes. I’m even more ready to see that house burn to the ground tomorrow.” Rio said with a smile as they walked over to the portal door to the new house. Rio opened it for the women and they all filed into the house.

Moving boxes were stacked up in the kitchen and living room. Agatha sighed because she knew she’d have to unpack everything but thankfully Rio’s books were upstairs already.

“They are efficient.” Rio said as she looked around the house.

“Extremely. It was impressive to watch really.” Agatha said as Wanda and Lily walked over to the couch and sat down. Agatha looked at Rio and sighed. “We probably should head upstairs and unpack the bedrooms so we actually have a place to sleep tonight.”

“Oh we can help, we just didn’t know where you wanted to start.” Lily said as she stood up.

“You don’t have to. But it would be greatly appreciated.” Rio told them.

“I’m gunna start with our bedroom, then move to the guest room. If I use magic it’s going to take a lot of energy but I think I can manage it.” Agatha explained.

“Or how about we don’t do magical burn out this week.” Wanda said in a slightly panicked tone as she stood up.

“I’ll be fine.” Agatha told Wanda, who walked over and grabbed her by her shoulders and looked her dead in the eyes.

“No.” Wanda said pointedly. Agatha sighed and rolled her eyes.

“Fine.” Agatha huffed out as she wiggled free and headed for the stairs. Wanda was hot on Agatha’s heels, leaving Rio and Lily in the living room.

“Do you feel like you missed something? Because I feel like I missed something.” Lily asked Rio.

“We definitely did.” Rio told Lily before she started heading toward the stairs. “Babe! What was that about?” Rio yelled as she walked up the stairs with Lily.

“That was about the fact that the last time someone used too much magic in one day we had to deal with flare ups.” Wanda scolded loudly as she followed Agatha.

“Your hair was only green temporarily!” Agatha yelled back as she made her way toward the bedroom. Wanda was following closely along with Lily and Rio.

“How long is temporarily?” Rio asked in a mirth filled tone. Lily was trying to hold in a scoff of laughter.

“A week! I had to explain to my ex that ‘no I’m not having a mental breakdown, my bestfriend just decided that she wanted to push herself. And I’m suffering the repercussions of that.’ He broke up with me because he couldn’t stand the electric green hair.” Wanda explained.

“He sucked! You’re welcome!” Agatha yelled as the rest of the women filed into the bedroom. Agatha was manually unpacking a box onto the bed.

“Arguably the best thing that ever happened to you if he was your last boyfriend.” Lily chimed in.

“He was.” Agatha said with a sigh as she took the clothing that was still on hangers and walked into the closet and hung them up.

“Why electric green?” Rio asked.

“Who knows, magical flare ups are so weird sometimes. I’m just glad I didn’t end up with animal ears or a tail. For Agatha with her magical flare ups it can manifest in weird ways. I mean it rarely happens to her because she’s so powerful. I don’t even know if it would happen again. But I’m not risking it!” Wanda yelled the last part toward the closet her best friend was in.

“I’m sorry I turned your hair green on accident. I’m not sorry he dumped you.” Agatha said as she walked back out into the bedroom.

“How hard did you push yourself?” Rio asked.

“Too hard. Honestly much harder than I would by putting everything away.” Agatha explained.

“What did you do? I can’t even imagine a thing that would cause you to use that much magical energy.” Lily asked.

“It was when I established the protection spells at work in my office, the entrance’s at Stark Law and at the courthouse. All in one day. The spells worked just fine and are fully established, my punishment was flare ups for a few days. My hair was basically a bad perm from the 80’s, Wanda got too close at one point and ended up with green hair.” Agatha explained.

“Among several other issues.” Wanda clarified in an irritated tone.

“Agatha will never have a magical flare up like that again Wanda. She’s much too powerful for that nonsense now.” Gaia said popping into the bedroom. Causing Wanda jump and clutch her chest in shock, Lily also jumped in surprise. Agatha and Rio seemed unfazed by Gaia’s arrival.

“Jeeze! A warning next time!” Wanda said in a shocked tone.

“I forget that you two aren’t in tune with my arrival’s like Rio and Agatha are.”

“Yes Goddess! Some of us aren’t deity’s in training.” Wanda said with a laugh before she calmed down.

“What do you mean I don’t have to worry about magical flare ups?” Agatha asked.

“Give it a shot, if you have a flare up, Momma will be right here to keep it under control.”

“How ambitious am I allowed to be?” Agatha asked.

“Go big or go home baby. Let’s see how strong you are.” Gaia reassured. Then Agatha took a deep breath and centered herself, she started speaking an incantation under her breath before purple magic flared to life in the house and everything started to move and shift. Boxes started to open and things begun to unpack. Once Agatha was done with her incantation she opened her eyes to see things unpacking and putting themselves away.

“I hope you know I’m going to be asking you where everything is for the next week and a half.” Rio said in awe of the sheer feat of magic Agatha was displaying.

“Holy shit.” Wanda said in a shocked tone as she watched boxes unpack and fold up before floating down the hall and into the entry way.

Gaia clapped her hands together giddily as she watched the whole house start to unpack itself. A giggle bubbled at the pride Gaia was feeling for Agatha. “Astonishing! Magnificent witchlett! And look, not a single flare up!” Gaia said proudly.

“And I don’t even feel tired. Honestly that felt so easy.” Agatha said with a smile.

“Easy!? Easy! Easy this woman says! Like she didn’t just accomplish something impossible to most witches!” Wanda said in disbelief.

“Honestly I don’t know why you are shocked Wanda.” Rio said in a slightly amused tone.

“You’ve grown so much in the last 6 months! I can’t wait to see how powerful you’ll be by the time you take your place as a goddess.” Gaia complemented.

“Let’s not get ahead of ourselves. I’m keeping her as long as possible.” Rio told Gaia.

“Yes. Yes. She will always be yours Rio. Don’t you worry. Now! While the spell works, why don’t we discuss dinner?” Gaia said with a smile.

“What do you want Momma?” Agatha asked Gaia.

“I’m not picky, anything you cook will be amazing.” Gaia complimented.

“I vote we order something then.” Lily said with a sly smile knowing Gaia would object to that.

“Not a bad idea Lily.” Agatha agreed with a knowing smile.

“Wait. That’s not what I meant.” Gaia said sadly.

“Well if someone told me what she wanted I’d gladly make it.” Agatha told Gaia before she walked out of the bedroom.

“Fine. If you are going to force me to ask. Can you please make Chicken Alfredo?” Gaia asked following Agatha out of the bedroom with Rio, Lily, and Wanda following behind quickly.

“Does that sound good girls?” Agatha asked the women following behind them.

“Yeah, that sounds good.” Rio agreed.

“I’m not cooking, so I’m not complaining.” Lily said as she followed the women.

“I’ll eat whatever you put in front of me.” Wanda answered.

“Now I just have to see if I have the ingredients for it.” Agatha said to the group.

“If you are missing anything, I think Gaia can handle that.” Rio joked as they all made their way down to the kitchen.

“I should’ve ordered more bar stools. The island has enough room for all of you to sit at it while I cook, but I only ever had room for two.” Agatha said with a sigh as she willed a pot out of the cupboard and started digging in the fridge for items.

“Looks like I need more chicken, and heavy cream.” Agatha said as she put stuff in the countertop. A moment later a pack of chicken and a quart of heavy cream appeared on the countertop. “Thank you Momma.” Agatha said appreciatively.

“It’s fine. No need to cause a ruckus for me.” Agatha told Gaia, who was taking a large bite of the pasta.

“Plus, I think the Salem Seven… six? Six. Are still terrified of you. So they won’t pull anything tomorrow, I hope.” Wanda mentions before taking a bite of her food.

“I’ll send them a little reminder to leave my child alone tomorrow, right now.” Gaia said with a smile before she waved her free hand. The other was still holding a fork, that had another bite of food on it.

“What did you just do?” Lily asked before she took a drink of wine.

“Send them each a card with a little reminder to leave Agatha alone, if they bother her tomorrow I will know.” Gaia told the group of women, then continued eating.

“Thank you, that’s very reassuring. I’m just glad I will never have to see that hellhole ever again after tomorrow.” Agatha told Gaia.

“Tomorrow should be fairly therapeutic for you two.” Gaia explained while pointing at Wanda and Agatha.

“Why me?” Wanda asked.

“You’ll see tomorrow.” Gaia told Wanda.

“That’s not ominous, not at all.” Lily said with an eye roll.

“I forgot how sassy I made you.” Gaia sassed back to Lily. Who jokingly scowled at Gaia before she went back to eating. The rest of the women at the table decided they wanted to eat before their food got cold.

I’m so very proud of you and the witch you are becoming.” Gaia complimented Agatha softly, not saying it loud enough for Wanda and Lily to hear over the running water.

“I never got to see the ring Rio gave you. May I?” Gaia asked while holding her hands out for Agatha to place her hand in. Agatha placed her left hand in Gaia’s. “Oh it’s stunning! Rio you did a fantastic job.”

“Thank you, I’m just disappointed someone beat me to the punch.” Rio teased Agatha.

“You will live.” Agatha responded with a soft smile.

“I love you girls. But it’s time for me to go and you four to go to bed. Or at least start winding down. Have a good night.” Gaia announced after she softly squeezed Agatha’s hand.

“Goodnight Gaia.” Wanda and Lily said in unison.

“Night Momma. I’ll call if I need you.” Agatha promised.

“Goodnight Gaia. Thanks for the compliment.” Rio said before Gaia disappeared. Wanda and Lily finished cleaning the kitchen and putting dishes away before they turned around and looked at Agatha and Rio.

“What?” Agatha asked the two women.

“Magical check in? How you feeling?” Wanda asked.

“Like I could teleport to Boston and back several times and still have magic left to spare.” Agatha explained.

“Okay good, because if I wake up with funky colored hair tomorrow. I’m fist fighting you.” Wanda told Agatha.

“I could change it now if you want? How about pink this time?” Agatha joked while wiggling her fingers in Wanda’s direction.

“Quit antagonizing each other.” Rio scolded them softly, knowing they could and would actually fight about this.

“It’s all in good fun. Plus we have 16 acres we could fight on now.” Wanda said with a smirk.

“Nope, nipping that in the butt right now. Behave.” Lily said as she took Wanda’s hand and kept her rooted in place.

“You two are absolutely no fun.” Wanda said sadly.

“I think we are plenty fun, and if you want me to keep being fun. You won’t start a fight with Agatha.” Lily scolded softly, causing Agatha and Rio to go wide eyed.

“No fair, using our sex life against me. Rude.” Wanda grumbled as she turned and walked toward the living room and plopped herself down on the couch.

“No problem. Let’s go cuddle and watch tv or something. “Here you can pick what we are watching.” Agatha offered. Wanda pulled up ‘nailed it.’ And pressed play.

“God this show is so chaotic.” Rio said before she rolled her eyes and they started watching the baking competition.

A few shows later the women could feel themselves getting tired. Agatha was trying to hold back yawns. “Alright, time for bed.” Agatha told the three women.

Wanda shut off the tv and they all got up and headed upstairs after making sure the door was locked and everything was put away. Agatha hugged Wanda in the hall way outside the guest bedroom while Rio hugged Lily. Then they switched with each other, before heading off to bed.

~Saturday Morning~

Agatha got up first and started making breakfast for them. The smell of coffee and bacon rousing the rest of the house from their slumber. Rio, Wanda and Lily all came downstairs fully dressed and ready for the day by 7:45. Agatha smiled brightly at the women.

“Good morning sleepy heads. I made breakfast sandwich’s and to go coffees.” Agatha said with a bright smile.

“Do we have lawn chairs to sit in while we watch the hell hole burn down?” Wanda asked.

“No. But if we leave now we can stop and grab some.” Agatha told Wanda.

“Let me just go run to the cabin and grab some out of the closet. I think we have four.” Rio offered

“If you go to the cabin your mom’s going to want to come and we don’t have time for all that.” Agatha explained.

“True. Alright stopping at the store it is.” Rio said as she grabbed her coffee cup and a sandwich. Lily, and Wanda grabbed theirs as well and they headed out the door. They all piled into the car and got rolling toward their destination.

One quick stop to grab chairs and an hour and a half drive later they pulled up to the house. Two fire trucks and an ambulance were sitting in front of the house and a police barrier was put up to keep people who weren’t meant to be there out. Fortunately the fire chief was standing there talking to the officer when they arrived and they were waved through.

Agatha parked the car and they all got out and grabbed the chairs and set them up where they could watch the house burn. The chief walked over to Agatha and smiled at her. “We are going to start the fire here soon, but we are going to run a couple training sessions first. I hope that’s okay?”

“The whole reason I donated the place was for training. Take all the time you need. We’ve got all day.” Agatha told him.

“Thank you for understanding.” He said politely before he turned around and yelled for the crew. “Alright, let’s get started!”

The next hour was purely training of putting out small house fires for the crew before they got to the main event. The chief grabbed his microphone and spoke clearly. “Alright lady’s and gents. Time for the main event. Contain the fire. That is your one job. Starting in Three! Two! One!” Then there was a loud woosh and the windows of the home shook as the fire spread through the house.

“What on earth did they do?” Wanda asked in a confused tone.

“Left the gas valve open and let it leak into the house before shutting it off and igniting a spark box.” Rio explained.

“How do you know that?” Lily asked.

“I could hear the crew talking about it. Immaculate hearing remember?” Rio offered.

“Your kids are going to hate you. They will never get away with anything.” Wanda teased.

“I can turn it off. I just choose not to. Sometimes my plants tell me things as well, most plants in general just talk constantly.”

“I’m glad I finally learned how to tune them out.” Agatha said with an eye roll.

“It took me years, it took you a month. Be grateful.” Rio said with a smile before she leaned over and kissed Agatha on the cheek. Then they all turned to watch as the house started to become engulfed in flames.

Soon the entire home was burning brightly, and Agatha’s smile that spread across her face was one even Wanda had never seen. It was a genuine smile of pure unadulterated joy. Rio looked over at Agatha and noticed the smile as well, but also it seemed like all the tension she was carrying in her body was disappearing as the home burned down.

A few hours later the home was nothing but a pile of ash and cinders. Agatha looked more relaxed than any of the women in the group had ever seen. It was like all the burdens she was carrying finally lifted off her shoulders. “That was the best bonfire I’ve ever been to.” Agatha joked as she stood up and folded her chair. The rest of them stood up and folded their chairs before walking over to put them in the trunk of the car.

“Now I see what Gaia was talking about.” Wanda whispered to herself. She felt like she could finally relax, seeing Agatha like this. The house as a pile of ash behind them was an added bonus to the moment.

“What was that?” Lily asked.

“Later. Let’s head home.” Wanda said as she opened the back door of the car and got in.

“Let me drive babe.” Rio said as she held her hand out for Agatha to hand her the keys. Agatha didn’t even argue, she just handed her the keys. Which even shocked Rio because Agatha always insisted on driving. Once they got into the car and Rio started driving Agatha leaned her head against the window and sighed softly. Every woman in the car had the same thought as they pulled out of the cul-de-sac ’It’s finally over.’

Chapter End Notes

Notice I’ve finally given you guys an end goal?! I could’ve ended it here but I feel like y'all would revolt if I didn’t give y’all the wedding.

Chapter 39

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

9 months later

On a beautiful spring day, Agatha and Rio stood in the clearing in front of the cabin and vowed their undying and eternal love for each other. Surrounded by their friends and family, their union was blessed by the goddess Gaia herself.

Agatha was wearing a lavender wedding dress with deep purple lace embroidery, Rio was in a dark green wedding dress with ivy leaves embroidered along her side and hip. Both women looked absolutely stunning. The wedding was small, simple, and intimate.

“I the goddess Gaia, am here today to unite two souls in holy matrimony!” Gaia spoke clearly for everyone to hear. Lilia, Rita, Daniel, Jen, Alice, their daughter Alexandria, Tony, Pepper, their daughter Morgan, Lily, Wanda, Pietro, Tricia, Sage, Rowen, Violet and Rosaline were all in attendance.

“Agatha, do you promise to cherish, love and care for Rio every day for the rest of eternity?” Gaia asked.

“I do.” Agatha said with a soft smile, her eyes full of love and tenderness as they peered into Rio’s.

“Rio, do you promise to cherish, love, and care for Agatha every day for the rest of eternity?” Gaia asked.

“I do.” Rio said full of conviction and love, she felt her heart swell in her chest at the realization she was Agatha’s and Agatha was hers forever more.

“Now, the hand fasting ceremony.” Gaia said as she presented green and purple ribbons to the two women. Gaia instructed them to hold each others left hands before she started the ceremony.

“With this ribbon, I bind your souls together.” Gaia spoke as she tied the ribbons around their hands. “I bless this union, this marriage, and these two souls uniting into one!” Gaia spoke clearly before the ribbons flashed bright green and purple and settled on Agatha’s and Rio’s wrists as bracelets.

Agatha and Rio smiled brightly at each other before pulling each other into an embrace. Rio’s hand coming up to Agatha’s face.

“You may kiss the bride!” Gaia announced, Agatha didn’t hesitate for a second, she pulled Rio into a soft passionate kiss. “I present to you, Mrs & Mrs. Harkness-Vidal!” Gaia announced after they broke the kiss.
