“I love you.” Rio said softly as she pulled away slightly.

“I love you.” Agatha responded before she pulled away and took Rio’s hand in hers. They started walking down the aisle and headed toward the reception tent they had set up. Once everyone was seated, conversations started flowing. Agatha and Rio were dragged off by the one photographer to take photos before they had their reception.

An hour later they were done taking photos and able to mingle with their friends and family. Agatha and Rio were walking from table to table mingling with their friends. Pepper and Tony playing with Morgan as they sat at the table and talked with Tricia, Lilia, Rita and Daniel.

“You two look absolutely stunning!” Tony complimented them.

“Thank you.” Rio and Agatha said in unison.

“How’s my niece behaving?” Agatha asked as she held her hands out for Morgan who giggled softly as she was handed to Agatha.

“Perfect little angel as always.” Pepper answered, as Agatha cooed at the child and held her in her arms for a moment before handing her back to her parents.

“Of course, she’s made out of cake and other sweets.” Rio joked, knowing the last few months of Pepper’s pregnancy had Agatha baking up a storm.

“She appreciated every bite.” Pepper answered as she looked at the child in her husband’s arms.

“So did the rest of the office.” Tricia commented, knowing Agatha’s baking was the only thing that kept half of them employed and the other half alive. Pepper softly glared at Tricia but let it go, knowing she was right.

“When will you two be giving me my first grandbaby?” Rita asked as she looked over at the adorable child in her father’s arms.

“Momma! We literally just got married an hour ago.” Rio scolded her mother.

“You’ve got a whole two week honey moon!” Rita told Rio.

“And we are moving on. Pepper, keep Gaia away from Rita please.” Agatha requested before they moved onto a different table.

“I can’t promise that!” Pepper hollered to them as they walked away. They made their way over to the table Wanda, Lily, Jen, Alice, their daughter Alexandria, Pietro, Sage and Rowen were sitting at.

“Finally. I thought I was going to die before you two got married.” Pietro joked.

“Oh really? When are you gunna settle down zippy?” Rio joked.

“Uh. I… I think I’m needed somewhere else.” Pietro said before leaving the table.

“Chickenshit!” Agatha and Wanda yelled.

“The wedding was beautiful! Thank you for inviting us.” Rowen told them.

“Thank you, I’m glad you two could make it.”

‘Time for the intervention?’ Rio asked in her mind.

‘Sure.’ Agatha answered.

“So when were you two going to tell us you’ve been dating?” Agatha asked Rowen and Sage. Both of them paused and looked at each other with wide eyes.

“Uh. What?” Sage asked, her voice coming out as a high pitched squeak.

“No point in hiding it anymore babe.” Rowen told their partner. Sage looked at them with a pleading look.

“We’ve known for months. We just figured we’d let you two decide when you wanted to tell us but it’s been 5 months.” Rio explained.

“How did you know?” Sage asked.

“We aren’t blind, and you forget who my Aunt is. She set this whole thing up I’m sure. She knew you two were meant to be together before I even hired you.” Rio said honestly before Lilia walked over to the table.

“Now Rio, you put too much stock into such things.” Lilia teased, knowing that was exactly what she did.

“No, I know you. You did this on purpose.” Rio scolded softly.

“I second that, Lilia you like playing match maker.” Agatha mentioned.

“Well, you can’t prove anything.” Lilia said with a shrug before walking away from the table, but not before winking at Rio.

“You aren’t mad we hid it?” Rowen asked Rio, afraid their boss would be angry with them.

“Mad? No. You two sucked at hiding it though.” Rio clarified.

“Really sucked.” Wanda added.

“Like, really really sucked.” Lily tacked on, adding insult to injury.

“Wait, you knew?!” Sage asked Wanda.

“I’m a therapist. I know literally all the signs of a new and developing relationship. Also I have eyeballs.” Wanda clarified.

“Literally the only people you were hiding your relationship from was each other. Because we all knew.” Lily mentioned.

“I figured it out after the first visit to the book store after Alexandria was born.” Jen mentioned.

“Speaking of which. Gimmie.” Agatha said as she held her arms out for her other niece. Jen softly chuckled before handing the sleeping six month old to Agatha.

“She’s so cute.” Agatha said softly as she looked down at the adorable half Asian half black baby in her arms.

“Honestly. She’s even cuter than I expected. I was an ugly baby.” Alice to the group.

“You know what you must do for me now Jen, right?” Agatha asked her friend who was already on her phone

“Oh, I’m texting Lorna right now.” Jen said as she typed and hit send.

“Hey! Jennifer, No!” Alice scolded.

“You opened this can of worms.” Agatha reminded. “And you are an adorable little miracle. I’m so glad I touched your mommies’ rings. You little blessing.” Agatha said softly as she brushed some black hair off Alexandria’s brow.

“Yes, actually. Thank you for that. Even if she’s an only child, she’ll have plenty of friends to play with.” Jen said with a soft smile as she looked at the infant in Agatha’s arms. Agatha looked so maternal, she couldn’t help herself.

“Oh my gods and goddesses, why is everyone so pushy about babies today?” Agatha asked before she smiled softly at Alexandria fussing in her arms. “Oh, seems like someone realized I wasn’t her mom. Back to your parents you go.” Agatha said as she handed her back to Jen.

“Because you’ll be a fantastic mom one day.” Alice said without flinching, not realizing the impact those words even had. Then she continued her assault with her next compliment. “You are so fantastic with Alexandria and Morgan, I have no doubt about it.”

‘Get me away from my friends before I start crying.’ Agatha pleaded in Rio’s mind.

“Let’s go talk to Violet and Rosaline before they have to leave. Violet’s getting antsy.” Rio said as she softly before turning to the group. “We will be back around in a bit.”

Rio dragged Agatha over to the table where Gaia, Violet and Rosaline were sitting at. “I can tell you are getting antsy Vi, go. I’ll watch over Rose.” Gaia said as they walked up.

“I was waiting for the girls, I didn’t want to be rude.” Violet scolded Gaia before looking up at Agatha and Rio. “Hi! You two look absolutely fantastic!”

“Go Violet. We will see you soon. You’ve got a job to do.” Rio reassured. Then Violet was gone.

“You know that tug you feel when you pull on your bond?” Rosaline asked.

“Yeah?” Agatha asked.

“Like that but worse. I was worried she’d split in half for a second there. She never ignores it that long.” Rosaline explained.

“We would have understood.” Rio reassured.

“We told her that. She’s just stubborn.” Gaia said as she stood up and pulled both women into a hug.

“Oh we know.” Rio said with a laugh.

“So what’s this I hear about grandbabies?” Gaia teased.

“Go hold Morgan or Alexandria if you want a baby fix. I’m not getting pregnant yet. Let me enjoy being married for a couple months.” Agatha told her mother.

“But…”

“Momma, remember you’ve got all of eternity. You can wait a couple months. I promise, they will be worth the wait.” Agatha told Gaia.

“I already know that, but they are so ready to be your child.” Gaia told Agatha with a sad sigh.

“Nope, don’t tell me anything. I don’t need to know about tiny souls anxiously waiting for me to have them. No guilt tripping.” Agatha told her mother.

“Fine! Where are you two going on your honey moon?” Gaia asked, changing the subject.

“Hawaii, all inclusive resort for the first week, then we are going to stop at Disneyland in California before we head home to relax and get our marriage stuff sorted out.” Rio answered.

“Sounds relaxing and fun. When does your flight leave?” Rosaline asked.

“Tomorrow afternoon.” Agatha answered.

“I’ll personally take care of your plants while you two are gone Rio.” Gaia offered.

“I’d appreciate that. I was just going to text Lily and tell her what plants needed watered what days. But you will just know.” Rio told Gaia.

“No need to stress while on your honey moon.” Gaia reassured as Violet popped back into their space.

“Jeeze. Even when they are already dead some people are just impatient.” Violet said before looking at the two women. “Sorry lovelies. I’m back now. Let’s get this celebration started.”

“Yes let’s!” Agatha said and with a snap of her fingers, wine glasses were filled and plates of food appeared. Rio and Agatha walked over to their own private little table and sat down to eat while everyone else did the same.

“Truly one of the most impressive things I’ve see you do.” Rio complimented.

“What’s that my love?” Agatha asked Rio as she sat down next to her wife.

“All of this. Manifest everything from nothing.” Rio told Agatha.

“It’s gotten easier and easier. Soon I’ll be able to create things we’ve never imaged I’m sure, as long as I keep practicing.” Agatha explained.

“No, not like that. I meant manifesting all this love from nothing. Every person here loves you for you, just the way you are. You never had that and you just went out and made it for yourself. It’s the most impressive thing I’ve ever seen my love.” Rio corrected herself before softly kissing Agatha on the cheek.

“Oh, so you are gunna make me cry today?” Agatha asked with tear filled eyes and a watery tone.

“Only because I’m in such awe of how amazing you are my love.” Rio complimented before she placed her hand on Agatha’s cheek and gave her a small kiss.

“I love you so much.” Agatha told Rio softly, her voice cracking as she grabbed the hand on her cheek and turned her head to kiss her palm softly. A couple tears spilled out and Agatha quickly wiped them away.

“I love you more.” Rio answered before they started eating their meal. Once they were finished the two women were placed in front of a small cake to cut for each other. They lovingly cut the cake together before they fed each other small bites. They were so kind and loving as they fed each other, their first dessert as a married couple.

An hour later they were all gathered around a large bon fire and the real celebration began. Some of them sitting comfortably in chairs drinking wine and spirits as Agatha and Rio danced together around the fire. Music played loudly as others joined. Wanda and Lily were dancing and laughing loudly as they followed Agatha and Rio around the circle. Soon Rita and Daniel joined in on the festivities.

Eventually every couple was spinning and laughing joyfully as they danced together. Gaia gladly took Morgan from Pepper so she could dance and Lilia was holding Alexandria. The two women sitting together talking softly while the children slept in their arms. Tricia sat next to them and helped with the girls whenever they needed to get up.

They danced late into the evening and finally collapsed into chairs after the sun had gone down and the fire had dwindled down to embers.

“One of the best weddings I’ve ever been to!” Tony said as he walked over to Agatha and Rio.

“Thank you! I’m glad you enjoyed yourself Tony.” Agatha told the man. Pepper was collecting their daughter from Gaia and Lilia. She walked over a moment later and smiled at the two.

“Enjoy your honey moon! Thank you for the fantastic evening.” Pepper told the two.

“Thank you for hopefully placating my mother’s baby fever.” Agatha told Pepper.

“I think Morgan and Alexandria might have made it worse. You better give that woman a grandchild soon.” Pepper whispered.

“Do you really want me going on maternity leave in the next year?” Agatha asked.

“No…. But you and Rio will make the cutest babies so I will accept that I will lose you temporarily. Plus our girls need friends.” Pepper told her.

“I’m taking you two to the portal door and sending you home.” Rio told the two.

“That’s fine, I’m exhausted. Thank you for the lovely evening.” Pepper said as Rio stood up and guided them over to the portal door. She opened the door for them and they walked through it before Rio shut it and headed back over to Agatha.

It was Agatha’s favorite place. She felt so calm here. A soft glow of magical fairy lights illuminated the soft bed of blankets.

Last chapter will be a four year time skip! Thanks for reading guys!

Chapter 40

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

Four years later.

“Nicky! Put that down!” Agatha softly scolded her two and a half year old son as he carried a relatively large plant compared to him through the green house.

‘It’s helping him. He’s fine.’ Rio whispered softly in Agatha’s mind.

‘I know that but they won’t help the twins if they want to move big plants let’s set a good example.’ Agatha requested softly.

“Nicky baby. Let’s put that down. Okay? It’s a little heavy for you.” Rio asked her son who let her take the plant from him.

“Mommy, I wanted to help Momma!” Nicky said with a huff.

“I know, but stressing Momma out won’t help her baby. Why don’t we go play with the twins.” Agatha told her son as she bent over and took his hand. Her pregnant belly making it difficult but she managed.

“When will sis be here Momma?” Nicky asked Agatha.

“Soon just a couple more weeks baby.” Agatha told Nicky.

“Okay.” Nicky said with a smile as he guided his mother over to the set of two year old twins sitting next to Wanda. Their soft brown hair and green eyes shining brightly as their mother told them a story.

“Nicky!” The twins yelled loudly at the older toddler and Agatha walked over.

“Billy! Tommy!” Nicky yelled as he let go of Agatha’s hand and toddled over to them.

“How you holding up?” Wanda asked as she stood up to check on Agatha. They were in the corner of the green house Lily and Rio set up as a recreation area in the winter. So they could enjoy a bit of warmth.

“Fine. She’s on my bladder again though so I have to teleport into the house.” Agatha told Wanda.

“Well go! I’ve got him.” Wanda encouraged, then Agatha was gone in a flash. Lily and Rio looked over at Wanda with the boys and realized Agatha was gone.

‘You alright my love?’ Rio asked.

‘Fine, someone is just dancing on my bladder.’ Agatha told Rio.

‘Okay. I’m one call away.’ Rio reassured before she went back to her gardening. Lily and Rio had established their own mini garden that Agatha spent most of her free time turning into healthy meals for their families.

“Jen and Alice are coming over today right?” Wanda asked Rio and Lily from across the green house.

“Yes!” Rio yelled back. A moment later Agatha popped back into the greenhouse to see the three boys playing with their toy cars on the play-mat.

“Alex?” Nicky asked softly, he was excited but afraid to get his hopes up.

“Yes bub. Aunt Jen and Alice are bringing Alexandria over to play. They should be here soon. Want me to call them?” Wanda asked as she magicked her phone into her hand.

“Yeah!” All three boys yelled in unison. Wanda smiled softly at the three of them and opened the phone and called Jen. It rang a few times before Alice answered Jen’s phone.

“Someone is being just as stubborn as her mothers’.” Alice told Wanda.

“Put me on speaker phone.” Wanda requested as she put her own phone on speaker. Alice did the same and a shriek of toddler could be heard in the background before Alice walked over to them and spoke.

“Alexandrea, your Aunt Wanda called you.” Alice told the four and a half year old who seemed to calm down.

“What?!” Alexandria said excitedly.

“Your cousins wanna see you sweet pea! Don’t you boys?” Wanda asked the three boys.

“Alex! Alex! Alex!” The boys chanted excitedly, Alex was almost a tiny cult leader.

“Tommy, Billy, and Nicky wanna see you Alexandria.” Wanda told the girl, who seemed like she was throwing a tantrum when she called.

“Okay!” Alexandria said excitedly.

“Which means you have to put socks and shoes on Witchlett.” Jen said softly.

“Socks hurt!” Alexandria yelled at her mother. Wanda could almost hear the eye roll that went with the sigh Jen let out in that moment.

“Cut the elastic band. See if they still hurt.” Wanda told Alice, who set the phone down and grabbed a pair of scissors to cut the elastic band in the socks and then brought them back over to Jen and Alexandria.

“Let’s try these on one more time baby. If they hurt you don’t have to wear socks. But you can take the shoes and socks off when we get to Aunt Agatha’s okay?” Jen asked her daughter softly.

“Okay.” Alexandria said with a sniffle. Wanda heard some rustling on the other end and then Jen spoke again.

“That okay? Do the socks hurt still?” Jen asked.

“No Mommy! They don’t!” The little girl giggled.

“Alright let’s get your shoes on and head to Aunties house!” Jen said excitedly.

“Thank you Wanda. See you soon.” Alice said into the phone before hanging up.

“Sensory issues.” Wanda said to herself before she looked at her twin boys and nephew playing together.

“What about sensory issues?” Lily asked as she walked over to her wife.

“Alexandria is having sensory issues. Her socks hurt. The elastic was too tight on them.” Wanda explained.

“Who knew out of all of us that you’d be so great at this?” Lily said with a smile as she stood up on her tiptoes and gave Wanda a kiss on the cheek before pressing her hand to her chest affectionately.

“Agatha is a way better mom.” Wanda said with a chuckle.

“But we knew she’d be good at this. You were a surprise.” Lily said as she patted Wanda on the chest softly before kissing her again.

“Is this another back handed compliment?” Wanda asked with a chuckle.

“No, just the truth. I’m glad you are so good at this. It makes wanting more easy, even if our two are a handful already.” Lily reassured.

“Really? You want more? Do you not remember bath time last night?” Wanda teased remembering Lily coming out of the bathroom looking like a drowned rat after bathing the twins.

“Yes, even after last night. Maybe if I get pregnant we will have a girl.” Lily said with a smile.

“Maybe.. but let’s wait until they are at least three or four.” Wanda offered.

“Yeah, I’d like them potty trained first.” Lily told her wife.

“Agreed.” Wanda told Lily. Then a moment later the green house door swung open and Jen, Alice and Alexandria walked in and shut the door quickly to prevent the cold air from getting into the green house.

“We are here! Finally!” Jen announced before she walked over to Wanda. “How did you fucking know it was the elastic?” Jen whisper yelled at her.

“I’m a therapist. You think I don’t have clients with sensory issues?” Wanda asked her friend.

“Uh. I didn’t think about it like that. How do we fix this?” Jen asked her friend as Lily walked over to the four children.

“No more cute ankle socks for Alexandria, get her the socks that have ribbing like old man socks. They will be much nicer on her feet. Sorry.” Wanda apologized to her friend.

“If it prevents a melt down like that I’ll gladly let her wear whatever is comfortable. My temper mixed with Alice’s resulted in a tantrum I couldn’t have imagined!” Jen explained.

“Maybe get her tested? As your friend. She’s perfect and we don’t need labels. As an objective therapist. She might have high functioning autism or just is growing too fast for her clothing.” Wanda offered.

“Thanks. I appreciate the honesty.” Jen said with a sigh. “We will look into getting her tested.”

“Don’t stress too much about it. She’s hitting milestones. Worst case senerio you have a gifted kid like Morgan.”

“Pepper and Tony have their hands full with her. She managed to deconstruct one of Tony’s drones last week that he was working on and reassembled it perfectly.” Jen commented.

“Sharp as a tack that one. She’s going to surpass her father soon. I swear.” Agatha said as she walked over to the two women.

“Is Pepper bringing her over for the play date today?” Jen asked.

“They will be here shortly. I just called Pepper and let her know that Alexandria was here. Morgan didn’t want to be the only girl here.” Agatha explained before she walked over to Alice and the kids.

“Perfect the kids can play. I can get wine drunk with Pepper, your wives can garden and Agatha and you can play with the kids.” Jen said with a smirk.

“Wait! Why can’t I get wine drunk?” Wanda asked with a huff.

“You’re going to leave your pregnant sister alone with five children?” Jen teased.

“Alice will help. I hope.” Wanda offered as Alice walked over to the group with a twin clinging to each leg.

“I’ll help with what?” Alice asked slightly winded.

“Agatha and I with the kids while Rio and Lily garden and Pepper and Jen get wine drunk.” Wanda offered.

“I can definitely help with the kids. Isn’t that right boys?” Alice asked as the twins wrapped around her legs giggled.

“Yeah! Aunt Alice! Go!” Billy yelled excitedly.

“One second I’m talking to your Mom!” Alice said as her legs started moving of her own accord and the boys giggled some more. “I guess I have no control here! Bye!” Alice said as she walked off with the twins. Letting them think they had control over their Aunt.

“She entertains them almost as much as you do.” Jen complimented Wanda.

“Thanks! I’m just glad Lily’s father is happy about two grandsons.” Wanda said with a chuckle as she remembered how overjoyed the man was about twin boys.

“He’s one proud Papa.” Jen said with a smile as she watched Alice stomp around the green house with the twins. Agatha was sitting in a chair as Nicky and Alexandria played together.

Pepper and Morgan rushed into the green house in a flurry. Quickly shutting the door as she set down the five year old and let her take her own scarf, hat and coat off.

“Morgan!” Alexandria yelled excitedly as she ran over and hugged her best friend.

“Alexandria!” Morgan squealed excitedly as she hugged her best friend.

“Hey Pepper! Thanks for coming. You want red or white wine?” Agatha asked her.

“Bourbon.” Pepper said as she sat down next to Agatha. Agatha raised both eyebrows but didn’t argue with Pepper and just magicked a strong glass of high quality bourbon into Peppers hand.

“Oh, okay. That rough of a day?” Agatha asked Pepper who just looked over at Agatha with a very tired look before she took a drink.

“Thank you. Morgan has figured out nuclear physics. Fortunately Jarvis has protocols to prevent the progeny from killing half the continent.” Pepper said with a sigh.

“Only child?” Agatha asked.

“I’m not risking bringing a second Tony Stark Jr into this world.” Pepper said before she took a long drink.

“Fair.” Agatha said.

“I’m sorry Mommy, I didn’t mean to upset you.” Morgan said to her mother.

“Baby you didn’t upset me. You just don’t realize how dangerously intelligent you are. Let’s keep the nuclear physics to paper instead of attempting to practice its principles. Okay?” Pepper requested.

“Yes Mommy!” Morgan said with a bright smile before she ran off to play with Alexandria. Pepper took another long drink of her bourbon. Agatha refilled the glass the second she pulled it away from her lips.

“I should’ve married you.” Pepper said as she took another drink.

“Back off Potts!” Rio yelled from across the greenhouse.

“How did she hear that?” Pepper asked in a confused tone.

“The plants. They are little narcs. Watch.” Agatha said before she tried to stand up and struggled slightly.

“Sit down! I’ll come help you up in a second.” Rio scolded before she started rushing over to Agatha.

“See.” Agatha said with a sigh as Rio walked over and helped her stand. “I can get up on my own darling.”

“Hell no, we aren’t playing that game. Little lady needs to stop scaring us before I have a heart attack.” Rio told Agatha before she gave her a soft kiss.

“You know you can’t dote on me constantly.” Agatha said with a sigh.

“I can, and will.” Rio told Agatha before she continued. “Where were you headed my love?” Rio asked.

“No where, I was proving a point to Pepper.” Agatha told Rio as she stretched her back out a little before sitting back down. Nicky walked over to Agatha and climbed into her lap. Rio went back to gardening with Lily after she was satisfied her wife wasn’t moving anytime soon.

“Momma, I love you.” Nicky said sweetly as he kissed Agatha on the cheek.

“Momma loves you too baby. Did you want something?”

“Nope. Just Momma!” Nicky said as he cuddled into Agatha’s side.

“He’s literally the sweetest little boy on the planet and I am so jealous.” Pepper whispered to Agatha.

“Another blessing from my mother.” Agatha said as she kissed her son on the head. Alice walked back over with the twins a moment later and they got off her legs. Alice sat down and let out a winded sigh.

“They are getting heavy.” Alice said to the other two women.

Morgan and Alexandria were playing with dolls on the mat as the twins walked over to them and sat down next to them. The children began talking and playing together. Nicky cuddled closer to Agatha and placed his hand on her pregnant belly.

“I take nap with sis.” Nicky said sleepily.

“You don’t want to play with your cousins?” Agatha asked him.

“No, nap.” Nicky whispered as his eyes drooped.

“They will be right here when you wake up baby. Rest.” Pepper reassured, before she looked at Agatha. “This bourbon tastes like a sleep over.” Which caused Agatha to chuckle at the woman.

“You two are always welcome here.” Agatha told Pepper as she adjusted Nicky so he was more comfortable in her lap.

“Thank you.” Pepper said as she finished her drink.

“I’ll make you another one in a little bit. I should probably get up and make dinner soon.” Agatha said as she looked at her watch.

“You relax woman, one of us can cook.” Alice said with a smile as she looked over at Agatha who was holding Nicky in her arms.

“I’ll handle dinner tonight.” Lily said as she walked over to the women. “You relax. I want my niece here in one piece.” Lily scolded Agatha.

“Goddesses Above you women are bossy!” Agatha joked.

“We know.” Pepper, Lily, Alice, Jen, and Wanda said in unison.

“What do the gremlins want for dinner?” Lily asked the group of children.

“Mac n cheese!” The twins yelled at their mother.

“Does that sound good Morgan? Alexandria?” Lily asked the two older girls.

“Yeah! With broccoli?” Morgan asked.

“Broccoli!” Alexandria said excitedly.

“Only at Aunties house do we willingly eat vegetables.” Pepper said with an eye roll.

“They taste better Mom!” Morgan said with an equally sassy eye roll.

“Tony is so doomed in the future. Two Pepper’s under one roof is going to be an experience.” Jen said to Pepper before she looked at Agatha. “Where’s my wine witch?”

“Red or white?” Agatha asked.

“Surprise me.” Jen said with a shrug, then there was a glass of white wine in Jen’s hand.

“Anyone else drinking?” Agatha asked.

“No, I’ve got the gremlins.” Wanda answered

“I’m driving home.” Alice said with a soft smile.

“No sleep over?” Alexandria said with a pout directed at Alice.

“Sweetie, that’s not my choice to make. Aunt Agatha and Aunt Rio are already having Aunt Pepper stay the night.”

“You three can stay the night as well, I don’t care.” Agatha said with a sigh as her daughter started moving in her stomach. Nicky grumbled in her lap as he felt his little sister start to move.

“Momma sis is kicking me.” Nicky grumbled sleepily.

“She does that to me all the time baby. Talk to her.”

“Sis, be nice to Momma.” Nicky whispered against Agatha’s stomach, he received a soft kick to his hand in response. A giggle left Nicky as he felt his sister kick him.

“She’s hungry baby. So let momma get up so I can go get a snack and go potty.” Agatha said as she tried to help her son down.

“Okay Momma.” Nicky said as she climbed out of her lap.

“Lily, help me up.” Agatha requested, Lily quickly walked over and helped Agatha up.

“You’re going to start cooking the second you get done in the bathroom aren’t you?” Lily asked.

“Probably.” Agatha told her.

“Who wants to go inside and play games in the living room while Aunt Agatha and I make dinner?” Lily asked the kids.

“We do!” The twins and Nicky said in unison.

“We will go with you!” Alexandria said with a bright smile as she stood up. Morgan followed suit as she stood up and took Alexandria’s hand. Billy and Tommy held hands and then grabbed Nicky’s before they joined together in a circle. Agatha walked over to Morgan and Alexandria and took their hands and teleported all of the children into the house.

“I really wish I could do that.” Alice said with a sigh as she stood up and headed toward the green house door with Lily and Wanda. The three women headed inside leaving Pepper, Jen and Rio in the greenhouse.

“I’m glad our daughters trust her.” Jen said to Pepper with a chuckle.

“They are the safest children on the planet when they are with her I’m not worried.” Pepper told Jen.

“I know. Hey! Rio, you almost done?” Jen asked the woman who was still doing something on the other side of the green house.

“Just finished! Let’s head inside.” Rio said with a smile. The two women stood up and headed out of the green house and into the house.

Once everyone was inside the women were seated on the couch chatting happily as Agatha and Lily cooked dinner. Lily was working on making macaroni and cheese and steamed broccoli for the kids while Agatha cooked off some chicken breast and made a salad for the women.

Twenty minutes later dinner was done and the table was set. Several candles were lit at the dining room table to encourage the children to eat while their mothers helped them. Billy and Tommy were each being fed individually by Lily and Wanda between bites of their own food. Alexandria and Morgan were eating by themselves while Rio fed Nicky. Agatha quickly ate her meal and traded off with her wife. Once the children were done eating they ran off to play in the living room some more while their mothers finished their meals.

“No one told me all my grandchildren would be here tonight!” Gaia scolded as she appeared in the dining room.

“Grandma!” The children yelled excitedly as they all got up and clambered over to Gaia. The woman kneeled down and scooped them into a hug.

“Hello witchlets! Have you been good for your mothers’?” Gaia asked the gaggle of children. A chorus of affirmatives came from the group of children as they excitedly hugged Gaia.

“Hello Momma, what do we owe the surprise visit?” Agatha asked Gaia as she tried to stand up. She had to use the table to help herself stand but she finally was able to get on her feet and walk over to the goddess.

“I wanted to see my grand babies.” Gaia said with a shrug.

“I don’t believe you.” Agatha said as Gaia stood up straight and pulled her daughter into a soft hug. “Why are you really here.” Agatha whispered softly.

“I wanted to check on you. I hear someone’s being extra stubborn.” Gaia said as she softly placed her hand on Agatha’s stomach.

“And where ever did you hear that from?” Agatha asked.

“The source. She’s very opinionated… I wonder where she could have gotten that from.” Gaia teased before she looked over at Rio. The kids were still wrapped around Gaia’s legs and Nicky had taken to clinging to Agatha’s.

“Hey! Look at your daughter! She’s the stubborn one.” Rio said with a scoff.

“You both are equally stubborn.” Lily pointed out.

“That’s what happens when you mix two independent, hard headed workaholics together. You get an equally stubborn daughter. Look at Morgan and Alexandria.” Pepper said as she looked over at the women and children.

“Momma, up!” Nicky whisper yelled at Agatha. Gaia bent over and picked Nicky up for Agatha.

“Nicholas, now Momma can’t be picking you up right now. Sis is coming soon, so we have to be careful. We don’t want her showing up early.” Gaia explained to her grandson.

“I want Sis here now.” Nicky said with a pout.

“We all do, but she’s not ready yet. She will be very soon. But she’s got to grow a little more.” Gaia told Nicky.

“Okay, Grandma.” Nicky said twisting in her arms so that he could reach out to Agatha. Agatha stepped closer and let Nicky grab her face softly. “I love you Momma.” Nicky said softly before he gave her a kiss on the cheek.

“I love you too baby, why don’t you go play with your cousins while Momma, Mommy and your aunts talk to grandma?” Agatha’s asked her son who let go of her face and smiled brightly. He quickly turned around in Gaia’s arms and hugged her around the neck before she put him down. The children ran off to play.

“I’m slightly worried she’s not going to make it.” Agatha whispered quiet enough that only Gaia could hear.

“She will make it. She just had a rough start. Green witch babies never like winter births. And unfortunately, that’s what she is. Now. I’ve blessed her many times, she’s safe. Just cranky. Once she’s here you’ll just have to spend a decent amount of time in the green house. Until spring arrives that is.” Gaia explained as she guided Agatha back over to the table and sat her daughter down.

“Is there any chance she could be any other kind of witch because Agatha has a whole coven rolled into her magical abilities wise?” Pepper asked.

“I never thought to look at her’s or Nicky’s. But anything is possible. They could be combination witches like their mothers. We shall see. All I know is this little one right here is just very unhappy with the cold.” Gaia explained as she sat down.

“All these scares because someone is a little drama queen about not being in the green? Oh you little shit. You are my child.” Rio said with a sigh before she softly placed a hand on Agatha’s stomach. A green glow emanated from Rio’s hand and then something shifted. The child growing inside Agatha reached out and punched her mother’s hand softly.

“Is that better little one?” Agatha asked the child growing in her stomach.

“She is much happier, Rio you’ve got a new job to do.” Gaia told her daughter in law.

“Gladly. Anything to make the woman I love more comfortable.” Rio said with a smile.

“You know her due date don’t you?” Agatha asked her mother who looked at her with wide eyes and then glanced back at the children behind her.

“Would you look at that the children need me.” Gaia said as she stood up and tried to rush over to the children. Agatha quickly reached out and grabbed her mother’s hand to stop her.

“Sit down. They are fine.” Agatha told her mother.

“I’m just going to text Lilia real quick and see if she knows.” Wanda said with a smirk as she pulled her phone out. It disappeared a moment later.

“No need to bother Lilia!” Gaia said slightly panicked.

“What aren’t you telling us?” Jen prodded.

“I’d love to know as well.” Lily inquired.

“I think it’s sooner than the doctors projected and she doesn’t want Rio to stress herself into an early grave.” Pepper joked. Then something changed in Gaia’s demeanor.

“I’m having this baby tonight aren’t I?” Agatha asked her mother with a sigh.

“No, not tonight. But she will be a little early. You’ve only got two weeks left. So she’s fully formed, just small. I’d personally love for her to stay put the whole time, but again, someone is stubborn like her mothers’.” Gaia pointed out.

“Thank you. I would also like her to stay put for another two weeks.” Rio told Gaia before she leaned over and placed a glowing green hand on Agatha’s stomach again. This time leaving it there in hopes of appeasing her daughter.

“We shall see. That is helping change the timeline of her birth already though. So keep it up.

“You will not be doing that constantly for the next two weeks. I am already getting too hot.” Agatha told Rio.

“No, but like twenty minutes three times a day isn’t a bad start. Plus my magic may be deeply intertwined with yours but it would still be tiring to do it all day every day for two weeks.” Rio told Agatha.

“Is it sad I’m tempted to stay for the next two weeks?” Gaia asked.

“Momma, no. You have a universe to run. Plus I’m going to need you after she’s born. Not before.” Agatha explained.

“Plus, she’s got all of us already bothering her constantly.” Jen mentioned.

“Literally, someone is always in her bubble.” Wanda mentioned, directing her stare Lily and Rio.

“What? We just want to make sure she’s okay.” Lily told the group.

“I can be as close to my wife as I want.” Rio said flatly.

“It’s sweet how much they care, really.” Agatha mentioned.

“But…” Wanda said sadly.

“Just tell them to get out of the way when you want to be around her. That’s what I do.” Jen told Wanda.

“I do too. Sometimes I just walk over and grab Agatha by the arm and just take her somewhere else. So they aren’t hovering as much.” Alice mentioned.

“I’m guilty of hovering at work. So I have nothing to say. I just know how difficult someone has been so I worry.” Pepper said guilty.

“You are all ridiculous I hope you know that.” Agatha said with a sigh. Pregnancy brain had definitely taken its toll because she hadn’t even noticed that they were handing her off to each other constantly.

“We just want to make sure she’s healthy and so are you.” Gaia told her daughter.

“I appreciate that. Rio, I’m getting too warm. Sorry, my love.” Agatha said as she took Rio’s glowing hand off her stomach.

“That’s fine. Now let’s go hang out in the living room for a while. Before we start getting kids ready for bed.” Rio told the women.

“I’m getting myself another drink.” Pepper said as she got up and walked into the kitchen to get herself some more bourbon.

“I’m good, one glass of wine was plenty for me.” Jen said as she made her way over to the group of children with her wife. Alice sat down on the floor next to the girls who were drawing together on a large pad of paper, while the boys continued to play with each other and their toy cars.

“Who wants to watch Bluey?” Rio asked the children as she turned the tv on.

“Me!” All the children yelled in unison. The women settled down on the couches and cuddled up with their partners. Gaia was seated next to Agatha with Rio on the opposite side of her.

“Let’s just relax for the night. We can worry about this later.” Agatha said as she hit play. Her life was perfect, a home filled with laughter and joy, friends that loved her like sisters, family that loved her so deeply it brought her to tears, and a little boy so excited to be a big brother that it warmed her heart. Every single person in her life was so worth all the torment she had been through. She leaned softly against Rio as she settled comfortably into the couch.

“I love you.” Rio whispered softly as she kissed Agatha’s temple.

“I love you.” Agatha responded as she lifted Rio’s hand to her lips and kissed the back of it softly. A soft smile graced Agatha’s lips as she realized everything was exactly as it should be.

~10 Days Later~

In the wee hours of the morning Agatha’s water broke. She woke Rio softly before she went to take a shower. Rio hovered nervously in the bathroom as Agatha finished showering.

“I really don’t like how casual you’re being about this right now.” Rio said as she bit her thumbnail nervously.

“My water broke an hour ago, my contractions aren’t close together. I wanted to get the amniotic fluid off me, and most importantly, my mother hasn’t shown up yet.” Agatha said as she turned off the water and got out of the shower.

“That’s because you’re naked and she respects your privacy.” Rio scolded.

“No, because she was present during Nicky’s birth and she’s seen it all. She’s not here, I’m not worried. Did you call Pepper?” Agatha asked.

“She’s on her way. Wanda is in the living room. Alice and Jen are here already with Alexandria. Lily is collecting the twins and bringing them over here.” Rio explained.

“Who’s taking care of the kids?”

“Alice, Pepper, Jen, Lilia and Lily are going to watch the kids. Wanda, Gaia, and My Mother and I are going with you to the hospital.” Rio explained.

“Good.” Agatha said then waved her hand and got dressed. “Let’s go my love.” Agatha requested. Rio quickly followed Agatha out of the bathroom and into their bedroom. Once they made it downstairs the group of women in the living room had expanded. Gaia was standing by the front door holding two bags. Rita was next to her holding a set of car keys and the car seat. Pepper was in the kitchen making coffee. Lilia was sitting on the couch with Morgan and Alexandria tucked into her sides as they drifted in and out of sleep. Wanda was talking with Alice and Jen.

“Nicky is still sleeping, if Lily isn’t over here in an hour one of you go get Nicky up and the other go over and see if Lily needs help with the boys. Call me if you have any problems.” Wanda instructed.

“We’ve got this. Chill. It’s fine.” Alice reassured.

“Yeah, not like we haven’t raised our own. Now go.” Jen said while shoving Wanda toward the door. Agatha walked over to her Mother, Sister, and Mother-In-law with Rio following close behind.

“I’m just carrying things. I’ll meet you at the hospital when you arrive.” Gaia reassured.

“Oh I’m driving my own car, don’t need all of us stuck at the hospital the whole time. Plus the car seat has to be installed.” Wanda explained.

“Which you can do when we get there and Agatha’s in the room. Right?” Rio asked.

“Of course, now let’s go.” Wanda said with a smile. The women headed out the door after a chorus of goodbyes and good lucks were said to Agatha.

Once Agatha and Rio were in the car with Rita they headed toward the hospital. “Are you going to tell me my granddaughters name yet?” Rita pried from the back seat.

“You know the rule. Just like with Nicky, not until it’s on the birth certificate.” Rio reminded her mother.

“I hate that rule.” Rita grumbled out as her daughter drove them to the hospital.

“You’ll live.” Agatha told Rita before another contraction rolled through her. She breathed through it and then relaxed. “How far apart are we now?” Agatha asked her mother in law.

“Fifteen minutes apart. Someone’s in a rush.” Rita said as she reset the stopwatch on her phone. Rio pulled up to the front entrance of the labor and delivery ward and parked.

“Right now she is. Let’s get you into the hospital. Momma can you park the car?” Rio asked as she unbuckled.

“Got it.” Rita said as she got out of the back seat. Rio got out and rushed around to the other side of the car to help Agatha out and into the building. Gaia was standing next to the trunk of the car after Rita was parked. Rita popped the trunk open and Gaia grabbed the bags out before they headed into the hospital.

“Let’s go meet our granddaughter.” Gaia said with a bright smile on her face as Rita followed her into the hospital.

~6 hours later~

A loud cry rang through out the hospital room. Wanda was holding Agatha’s right hand, Rio was holding her left, both their rings touching. Rio trying to sooth Agatha as much as she could with their connection as she brought their daughter into this world. Gaia was sitting behind Agatha allowing the woman to brace against her. Rita was on standby, ready to switch with Wanda or Rio if they needed her to step in for them.

“Oh good, she’s loud.” Agatha said with a sigh as she let go of her wife’s and best friend’s hand. She reached out for her daughter and was instantly handed the crying infant.

“Don’t cut the cord.” Rio instructed the doctor that seemed to be ready to cut it.

“Whatever you say.” The doctor said before setting the forceps and scissors down.

“Rio, time to switch with me sweetie.” Gaia said as she got off the bed but held Agatha up with one hand easily. Rio climbed into bed and settled behind Agatha.

“You did great my love.” Rio said softly before pressing a kiss to the side of Agatha’s head before she looked down at the infant in her arms. Curly black hair and a soft pink face with closed eyes was the view Rio was presented with.

“Oh goddesses…. I’m in trouble.” Rio said softly as she looked down at her daughter.

“Why’s that my love?” Agatha asked as she looked at her daughter, a soft smile gracing her face at the realization she might have her own mini me this time around.

“If those eyes are blue, I’m never going to be able to say no to her.” Rio said softly as she reached around and softly brushed her daughter’s hair out of her face. Gaia made a soft noise like she had been caught doing something she shouldn’t.

“I’m gunna go grab Nicky, I’ll be right back.” Gaia said before disappearing from the room.

“Seems like you are screwed Rio. Gaia definitely made sure that baby had blue eyes.” Wanda said as she walked over to the bed so she could get a good look at her niece. “Oh no. We are all doomed.” Wanda whispered softly before melting at the sight of the infant in Agatha’s arms. Agatha started nursing the infant right away.

“Once she is finished. I gotta check her vitals and get a weight and my partner needs momma’s vitals as well.” The nurse told the two women. A few minutes later the baby stopped nursing and Agatha softly patted her back to get the tiniest of burps from her.

“Rio, get up and carry her where ever the nurse wants to go. I want you to hold her before anyone else.” Agatha told Rio, Rio quickly got up and took her daughter from Agatha and then carried her over to where the nurse took her vitals, weight, and measurements. While the other nurse attended to Agatha.

The infant was swaddled up in a blanket and handed back to Rio who quickly brought her daughter and the placenta back over to Agatha. “Here you go my love.” Rio whispered softly.

“I need to get up and pee, I need food, I need clothing before our entire coven is packed into this room along with the children.” Agatha said with a sigh as she looked down at her now sleeping daughter.

“Momma do you want to hold your grand baby while I help Agatha?” Rio asked her mother, Rita perked up and quickly held her arms for Agatha to place the infant in. The second Rita had the child she was speaking softly to her.

Rio helped Agatha out of bed and into the bathroom where she helped her get changed and take care of things. Once Agatha was finished in the bathroom Rio guided her back to the now clean bed. Wanda was holding the baby in her arms and cooing to her softly.

“She’s perfect. Lily and I are so screwed aren’t we sweetie? Going to spoil you so much. Especially since you look just like your Momma.” Wanda said as she wrinkled her nose at the child in her arms.

“Alright give me back my daughter.” Agatha said with a huff as she climbed back into the bed and got comfortable. Wanda walked over and placed the child into Agatha’s arms before Gaia popped back into the room with Nicky.

“Mommy! Momma! Is she here!?” Nicky asked excitedly as he ran over to the edge of the bed.

“Yes baby. She’s finally here. Wanna meet her?” Rio asked her son.

“Yeah!” Nicky said excitedly. Rio bent down and took her son’s shoes off and helped him onto the bed. Nicky climbed closer to Agatha and looked at the infant in her arms.

“Nicky, meet your little sister. Violet Adelaide.” Agatha told her son.

“Hello Violet.” Nicky whispered quietly.

“Violet?” Gaia asked slightly insulted.

“First goddess to arrive gets dibs.” Violet joked as she appeared in the room and elbowed Gaia in the ribs softly.

“No, that’s not why. Her name is Violet because you were the only reason Agatha didn’t have a mental break during Evanora’s trial because you took her powers away. Sorry Gaia.” Rio said to Gaia and Violet.

“It’s fine, the next one can be named after me.” Gaia joked, knowing they probably wouldn’t have a third child.

“I think I’m done after two. Rio can carry one if we decide to have a third.” Agatha said before she looked down at Nicky who was marveling at his sleeping sister in his mother’s arms.

“Two is plenty.” Rio said with a grimace before she looked down at her son.

“Chickenshit.” Wanda jabbed.

“Sorry I gotta go, she’s beautiful. But duty calls!” Violet said before she clipped out of the room. Gaia rolled her eyes at Death’s antics.

“We will re-evaluate this subject in a year or so.” Agatha said with a sigh before she looked at Nicky. “Do you wanna hold her?”

“Can I momma?” Nicky whispered softly.

“Yeah one second, Rio take her for a second.” Agatha requested, Rio took the child. “Come here baby, sit between Momma’s legs.” Agatha instructed her son. Nicky climbed into her lap. Rio then placed Violet in Nicky’s lap. Supporting her head as he looked down at his little sister.

“She’s so small.” Nicky whispered softly.

“Yeah baby, you were this small as well.” Rio told him.

“I was this small? Wow.” Nicky said in disbelief. “Hello Violet. I’m Nicky.” Nicky then whispered quietly as he looked down at his little sister who was wide awake and looking at her brother.

“Those are definitely blue eyes.” Rita said as she leaned over and looked at her grandchildren.

“Alright, sorry to interrupt Rita, but I’m starving.” Agatha told the woman.

“Momma has that solution ready to go! But first let’s get Nicky and Violet out of your lap so you can eat.” Gaia told her daughter. Rio took Violet from Agatha while Wanda scooped Nicky up into her arms. The little hospital table was rolled in front of Agatha before two burgers and french fries from Agatha’s favorite diner and a large root beer float next to it.

“I love you Momma, thank you.” Agatha said appreciatively as she dug into the food in front of her.

“You’re welcome sweetheart. Now, can grandma hold her granddaughter?” Gaia requested.

“Yes, you can.” Rio said as she walked over and handed the sleeping baby to Gaia.

“Violet Adelaide Vidal-Harkness. I bless you with all the love a goddess can give. You are even more perfect than I expected.” Gaia said as she softly soothed her thumb over Violet’s brow.

“I’m going to go fetch Daniel. You enjoy your baby time before we get back.” Rita said before she walked over to Rio and gave her a hug before she gave one to Agatha as well. “You did fantastic. Thank you so much for another perfect grandchild.” Rita whispered before kissing Agatha’s temple.

“Thank you for being so supportive and helpful. I appreciate it.” Agatha said as she hugged Rita back before the woman let her go and headed out of the hospital room.

“Do you want everyone here or are you wanting to have them meet her at home?” Rio asked Agatha.

“Might as well have them meet her here. But can I take a nap first? I’m very tired.” Agatha said with a yawn after she finished eating her second burger. Half the float was gone and most of the french fries were also gone.

“You can take a nap, I’ll handle the children. Rest my love.” Rio reassured. Agatha quickly finished eating her food and magicked the mess away before she leaned the bed back into a more comfortable position.

“Nicky come snuggle with Momma.” Agatha requested. Nicky was quickly hoisted back up onto the bed and Agatha snuggled up with her son before she started to drift off to sleep.

“I love you Momma” Nicky whispered softly before he placed his tiny hand on her face.

“I love you more Nicky.” Agatha mumbled sleepily as she drifted off.

Violet was nestled onto Rio’s arms comfortably as Gaia and Wanda started getting things out of bags to dress the child properly. Nicky and Agatha were both passed out, and Wanda was smiling softly at the baby girl in the bassinet while Rio and Gaia got things around.

The three women quickly got Violet into a diaper and a set of clothing before swaddling her up comfortably. “There you go witchlett.” Rio whispered softly before she scooped her daughter up into her arms and cradling her protectively.

A moment later there was a soft knock on the door before it opened. Daniel and Rita walked into the room quietly so they didn’t disturb the women inside. Nicky sat up groggily before he looked over at his grandparents. Daniel held a finger up to his lips to tell him to be quiet. He paused before he looked back at his mother sleeping next to him. Nicky raised his arms up as if to ask his grandfather to pick him up.

Daniel walked over to Nicky and picked him up off the bed. Nicky excitedly hugged his grandfather before Daniel squeezed Nicky tightly. “Papa. Sis is here.” Nicky whispered quietly to Daniel.

“I heard, but I can say hello to you first. Can I not?” Daniel asked Nicky.

“You can. But she’s very cute and small.” Nicky said pointing to his mother who was holding the small infant in her arms. Rio smiled brightly at her father as he walked over. Violet was sleeping peacefully in Rio’s arms as he and Nicky looked down at the baby.

“Look at all that hair! Goodness she’s going to be Agatha’s mini me. Rita my dear you were not joking.” Daniel said in an excited whisper as he looked down at the adorable baby in his daughter’s arms.

“I’m doomed and I know it.” Rio said as she smiled softly at the infant in her arms. She was already a push over when it came to Agatha and anything the woman wanted. A mini version of her wife was a death sentence she’d gladly take.

“Everyone will be here shortly, should we wake her?” Rita asked.

“No need, I started to wake up when Daniel took Nicky.” Agatha said as she sat up. “Someone give me a child.” Agatha demanded as she put her arms out. Violet was placed into her arms a moment later before Rio gave her a soft kiss.

“Sorry, Lily is losing her marbles at the thought of a mini you. Jen, Alice, Pepper and Lilia are trying to keep the four kids in check now that their tiny leader has left.” Wanda told the group before sighing loudly as she put her phone back in her pocket.

“It’s fine. Someone go get them.” Agatha told the group of women.

“I’ll get them. Be right back.” Gaia said with a smile before she walked out of the room and headed toward the lobby.

“Are they already in the hospital?” Agatha asked in a confused tone.

“Yes. In the lobby.” Wanda said with a sigh.

“You brought toys right?” Agatha asked her best friend.

“Lily has them in her play-mat bag so we can just lay it out in the corner.” Wanda explained.

“I love your wife.” Agatha said with a smile before she looked down at Violet. The child was starting to stir. So she decided to start nursing her again. A knock resounded through the room before women started peaking in the door.

“Come on in. I’m nursing her but I hear my nieces and nephews are being antsy.” Agatha said with a smile. Lilia,Lily, Alice, Jen, Pepper, Gaia and the children filed into the room. Lily rushed over to the corner and set the bag down and opened it, letting all the toys scatter about the mat.

“Papa! Down!” Nicky said excitedly. Daniel let Nicky down and he rushed over to the corner to play with his cousins. Morgan, Alexandria, Tommy, and Billy all rushed behind him to play with him.

“Everything went smoothly I assume?” Lilia asked as they walked over to the bed.

“I don’t think it could’ve gone smoother if we tried. But we can thank Gaia for that.” Rio said with a smile at her mother in law.

“You’re welcome.” Gaia said as she leaned against a wall.

“Thank you Momma, I appreciate it.” Agatha said as Violet let go of her nipple. Agatha adjusted the child and her shirt before she burped her softly. “Who wants to hold her first?” Agatha asked.

“Dibs!” Lilia and Daniel say in unison, they both turned to glare at each other for a moment before playing a game of rock, paper, scissors that Lilia won.

“That never works for you Daniel.” Rita said with a chuckle.

“Yeah but it’s fun. I may win one day. When she takes pity on me.” Daniel said with a shrug as Lilia walked over to Agatha and took the child from the woman.

“Oh, she’s perfect.” Lilia said with tears welling up in her eyes. “What is her name?” Lilia asked.

“Violet Adelaide Vidal-Harkness.”

“Well hello Violet, what a delight to meet you.” Lilia said with a smile before she handed the child off to Daniel. “I won’t hog her, everyone wants to meet you.”

“Thank you. Hello Violet. Papa loves you so much already. You are about to be the most spoiled little girl on the planet.”

“With in reason!” Agatha scolded.

“Did you guys hear something?” Daniel asked the women.

“Watch it or I’m withholding baked goods.” Agatha scolded.

“Oh, Momma’s threatening me, I better not spoil you too much.” Daniel said before he placed a soft kiss to the infants head. “Who would like to hold her?”

“Me! Give me my niece!” Lily said as she rushed over to the man. Agatha and Daniel chuckled at Lily before she was given the baby.

“Oh no, she’s so cute!” Lily whispered as she melted, her heart felt so full.

“The cutest, and her eyes are blue.” Rio whispered which caused Lily to look up at her in shock.

“Oh no, not a mini Agatha.” Lily lamented, knowing they were all doomed the second she pouted.

“Quit hogging! Visiting hours will be over soon.” Jen said as she walked over to Lily.

“Fine! If I must share!” Lily complained as she handed Violet off to Jen.

“Thank you.” Jen said as she took the infant into her arms and then made a noise that none of the women in the room beside Alice had ever heard before. It was soft and barely audible but it was surprising to everyone in the room beside her wife.

“What noise was that.” Rio asked.

“That was the ‘that’s so cute I can’t contain it.’ Noise. She makes it often at home. Especially when Alexandria is doing something particularly adorable.” Alice said as she stood on her tip toes so she could get a better look. “And now I see why.”

“She’s so cute. Oh my goddesses. I’m so glad we kept Alexandria’s baby clothes. She’s gunna be so cute in all of it.” Jen said excitedly.

“And all of Morgan’s. I was waiting to see how smart she would be before I got rid of anything. I’m not making another super genius.” Pepper said honestly.

“We will gladly take all the baby girl clothing.” Rio said with a smile, knowing that their daughter is about to be the pinkest girliest little girl on the planet. She remembered some of the outfits Morgan and Alexandria wore.

“Alice do you want to hold her?” Jen asked.

“I can wait, Pepper can hold her if she wants.”

“Of course I want to hold her!” Pepper said excitedly as she walked over to the two women and took Violet from Jen. The second she had the child in her arms she made her way back over to Agatha and sat down on the bed next to her.

“Thank you.” Agatha whispered as she reached out and brushed a black curl away from Violets forehead.

“She’s perfect, just like her mother. You did fantastic.” Pepper said with a bright smile as she looked down at the child before she handed her back to Agatha.

“Thank you. But I’m not perfect.” Agatha told Pepper, which caused every woman plus Daniel in the room to grumble and want to argue with her.

“We aren’t starting this so don’t argue. You are perfect my love. Because you are perfect for us. Without you our lives would be incomplete.” Rio told Agatha as she walked over to her wife and softly ran her fingers through her hair before she pressed a soft kiss to her head. “And you are perfect for me.”

A loud and resounding ‘awe’ came from every adult in the room. Then Violet begun to cry softly in her mother’s arms.

“Shhh witchlett, let’s check your diaper and feed you again if you need. Then Momma can probably eat again as well.” Rio soothed as she took her daughter from Agatha and took her over to the bassinet to change her.

“Alright, let’s get you ladies and the children home. So my daughter can rest and take care of my grand daughter.” Gaia instructed.

“Grandma, are you coming home with us?” Nicky asked Gaia.

“For a little while but I wanna be here with Momma just in case she needs anything.” Gaia explained.

“Daniel and I will stay until you get back. Then we will switch and help Lily and Wanda with Nicky.” Rita offered to Gaia.

“That would be a great help.” Wanda said appreciatively before she looked over at Agatha. “I love you, call if you need me.”

“Love you too, I’ll call Pietro once you all leave.” Agatha told her.

“Good idea. Maybe he can come help burn some of the kid’s energy off once he’s done saying hello.” Lily said as she collected the kids. Wanda walked over and helped her wife collect the kids. Ten minutes later the women wrangled the children and got them out of the hospital room. After Nicky got to say goodbye to his Mothers’ and new little sister.

Rio pulled her phone out and texted Pietro before she settled in the chair next to the bed. Rita and Daniel were hovering slightly but still giving Agatha space.

“I am starving again.” Agatha said right as the door to the hospital room opened slowly.

“I hear my one and only niece is now in the world?” Pietro asked.

“Come meet Violet Adelaide Vidal-Harkness.” Agatha told her brother, Pietro rushed into the room and was next to Agatha a moment later.

“Oh. no. She looks just like you.” Pietro said in a jokingly disappointed tone.

“Oh were you hoping for another Nicky?” Agatha jabbed as Pietro sat down on the edge of the bed. Agatha leaned over and placed the sleeping infant in his arms.

“Woah. This feels different.” Pietro said mostly to himself than anyone else.

“What feels different?” Rio asked.

“Like I’d burn the world down if anyone ever hurt her.” Pietro explained.

“You didn’t feel that way with Nicky?” Agatha teased.

“No I did, but I was also excited to be the cool uncle and hand him the matches. With her, it’s different. I think her looking exactly like you is doing the heavy lifting. Always had a soft spot for my favorite sister.” Pietro said with a soft smile, he looked at her with just as much love and admiration that he did Nicky.

“They are both perfect.” Rio chimed in.

“No arguments here. I agree. Do you need anything to eat?” Pietro told Rio then asked Agatha.

“Gaia is coming back after you leave. You got time to play with your nephews? And possibly Morgan and Alexandria?”

“Xavier gave me tomorrow off then told me if I was needed he had a sub on standby. He’s big on family leave. So I’ll head on out. Love you Aggie. She’s perfect. Seriously.” Pietro told her before handing her back to Agatha.

“Thank you. Love you too.” Agatha told her brother as she took her daughter back and leaned against the raised back of the bed. Pietro and Gaia almost collided with each other when he went to leave.

“Sorry, goddess.” Pietro said softly before zipping past her.

“In a rush to go play with the boys?” Gaia asked.

“Probably.” Rio said with a shrug.

“Our turn to leave as well. Love you both so much.” Rita said as she waked over and hugged Rio, before she leaned down and hugged Agatha. “And you, I expect you to keep up with the mini heart attacks you’ve been giving your Mommy. She deserves them after everything she put me through.” Rita joked as she brushed the soft black curls on Violets head. A soft groan left Violet after Rita pulled her hand away.

“Please no. She can’t raise hell while looking exactly like her mother. I will implode.” Rio begged while looking between Rita and Gaia.

“It’s all in how you raise them.” Gaia said with a shrug as she watched Rita walk out of the room.

“Love you girls.” Daniel said before ducking out the door as well leaving Gaia, Agatha and Rio alone with Violet.

“Can I bring Rosaline?” Death asked as she popped back into the room.

“Yes. I’ll get her.” Gaia told Death before she clipped out then back into the room with Rosaline standing next to her.

“I hear there’s a witchlett named after my wife?” Rosaline asked.

“Over here, but she needs a diaper change.” Agatha said as she handed her daughter off to Rio. Rio quickly changed Violet’s diaper before reswaddling the infant and bringing her over for Rosaline to see.

“She’s adorable.” Rosaline said as she looked at the child. Violet leaned over to look at the infant with her name as well. She took a long look at the baby before she smiled softly.

“Hello Violet. Nice to meet you.” Violet said with a soft chuckle.

“I’m just glad she’s here. Now. You have work to do. I can feel you getting antsy.” Rio told Death.

“Hospitals have a tendency to be full of dead people. Sorry. Gaia? Will you send Rosaline home when she’s done?” Violet asked as she shifted into her Death form.

“Of course, have fun at work.” Gaia answered but Violet was gone. Gaia rolled her eyes at Violets antics.

“As much as I’d like to hold her, I will get baby fever and Violet will kill me for bringing home lost baby animal souls. When Nicky was born I brought home so many. So I shall refrain. Send me home before my wife figuratively kills me.” Rosaline requested.

“Can do, have a great night.” Gaia said with a wave and then Rosaline was gone.

“Momma I’m hungry again. Sorry.” Agatha told Gaia.

“What do you want sweetheart?”

“A big ass salad, with chicken strips.” Agatha told Gaia then a moment later the table was pushed back in front of Agatha and a large salad with chicken strips, ranch dressing, and a large cup of water was place in front of her.

“Thank you!” Agatha said appreciatively as she picked up the fork and started to eat.

“You’re welcome. Now, Rio are you hungry? Give me my grand baby and I’ll conjure you up some food as well.”

“I am, can I have a burger?” Rio answered as she handed her daughter off to Gaia. She walked over to the chair next to the bed and sat down. Gaia magicked a brown pepper bag into Rio’s lap. Then started softly rocking Violet in her arms.

“What color were her eyes supposed to be?” Agatha asked after she finished her salad. Rio was half way through her burger and fries.

“Blue. That wasn’t something I personally did. But I was hoping Rio wouldn’t figure it out so fast. But it is what it is.” Gaia said with a shrug.

“Well she would’ve been perfect no matter what color her eyes were.” Agatha said with a smile before she put her hands out for Gaia to give her daughter back to her. Gaia magicked the table out of the way then handed Violet back to her mother.

“Hello little one. Momma is so happy you are finally here.” Agatha whispered softly before kissing her on the head.

“I’m glad she’s healthy, got all her fingers and toes, and it was a relatively smooth labor.” Rio said as she finished her food and put everything back in the bag.

“We all are.” Agatha said with a smile before she laid the baby down between her legs and relaxed into the bed. “I’m exhausted.” Agatha said with a sigh as she closed her eyes.

“You rest my love. I’ve got her.” Rio whispered as she got up then pressed a kiss against her temple. She then leaned over and scooped Violet up and carried her back over to the chair and sat down.

Rio rocked her daughter in the chair as she listened to Agatha’s breathing deepen until she knew her wife was asleep. Gaia walked over to Agatha and placed a kiss on her brow before turning to Rio.

“How do you feel?” Gaia whispered.

“Alive. Like I’m actually living my life.” Rio said with tear filled eyes.

“Good. Keep living it, they may test you. Mind you, all children do. But I’m glad you finally feel like you are living.” Gaia said as she crouched down and stroked Violets black curls.

“When I met Agatha, it felt like I had taken my first breath. Now, I’ve got two beautiful children, a wife who loves me, and a place for my bones to rest. I never thought I’d feel like this.” Rio explained, her voice barely audible as she looked down at the child in her arms. “You and your brother are the greatest things I’ve ever had the privilege of being a part of creating.” Rio told Violet before she softly kissed her forehead again.

“Life is exactly as it should be sweetheart.” Gaia reassured.

“Yeah, it is, and it’s absolutely perfect.” Rio said with a smile as she held her daughter close and looked over at her sleeping wife. Life was perfect and she was so happy she got to experience it.

Chapter End Notes

~The End~

Thank you everyone for coming with me on this magical and amazing Journey! I hope you all loved it as much as I loved writing it!

I start my new job tomorrow! Hopefully I love it! We shall see! I’m glad I got it done!
